title: Unrwal
review: The Pushkar Lake is a beautiful area, when the sunset goes down there is a lot to see and do. Really beautiful experience

title: Good Excursion
review: Although crowded, but its one of the few placed to visit in Pushkar. The location is good and the views are decent to look at.

title: Picturesque
review: Loved the place booming with usual Rajasthani feel and colours. The place holds high value in mythological stories . You should avoid the people who ask you to offer prayers because they will start from 30 rs and will ask to donate 2100 or 5100 which is a sheer waste of time and will actually piss you off .

title: Peaceful place!
review: Beautiful and peaceful place!

title: Nice vibes
review: Spent the sunsets by the lake, the vibe is to good to be missed. Go to the sunset point and enjoy the atmosphere.

title: Hindu History
review: Very happy to have visited this lake with our tour group. We visited early evening and it was nice and peaceful. Not many people at all. We had a good guide.

title: It’s a polluted retention pond where foreigners are routinely harassed
review: Let’s see. Holy place? I think not. Looking for someone to try to sell you a pin, an offering, take your photo, touch you without your permission? This is just what you’re looking for. My shoes were stolen within 60 seconds that it took me to look inside a temple that didn’t have anything in it. Young boys would ask for money and would try to grab my bag if I said no to them. ‘Priests’ put their hands on me. Young foreigners strut around in short shorts and tank tops.

title: Magic
review: When you walk round the lake you have to be barefoot. From every angle the are looks different so it is good to tour round on the edge of the waters. Stop at one end for sunset, ambiance and young people practicing their street arts equally local people playing music etc ambiance.

title: Holy place
review: Before going for prayer at Brahma Temple one prefer to take bath in Pushkar lake and offer pooja . Pandit’s are available at Ghats.

title: still beautiful
review: I am coming here for 30 years. The lake and the village around are still beautiful, if sitting on one of the many ghats. The water is dirty, the ghats are dirty, since we have to walk barefoot I would appreciate some cleaning.

title: Stay away from Pandits.
review: Highly commercialize. Stay away from pandits, who will lure you that pay just 11/- and you end up paying near about 500/-. nobody forces you, but they make you pay.

title: Water water everywhere and cows too!
review: Well, this place is of great importance from religious point of view “worlds only brahma temple” and without a doubt is serene and peaceful, the evening Aarti is a must. Watch out for cows and dung near the ghats and adjoining streets.

title: Very Holy and short size lake.
review: This lakes now is filled with water, was once dry and barren. Children used to play cricket there.

title: Spiritual way
review: Must visit for any tourist . Early sunrise on pushkar lake a soothing effect on your body and soul . Spend some time, closing eyes feel the magic of pushkar lake. Avoid pundits and pooja, if u r not that spiritual , enjoy the nature . Best place only on sunrise.

title: Lovely historic lake
review: Small lake in the centre of town, with significant historical and cultural importance. It is where the Hindu God Brahma came to earth and created the lake. Search the story separately. It is a lovely evening spot to sit and watch the sun set. Frequented by many young Western tourists (read hippies) who come here for the ambience. Lots of ghats (bathing areas that go down to the water).

title: Small Lake but definitely worth visiting!
review: The lake is very sacred and holy place to visit. Historically built and leaves a positive impact on mind when visited! Must Visit!

title: The reason to be in Pushkar for non- Hindu
review: Well presented lake with a number of ghats around it. Very photogenic when the sun is setting in the evening.

title: Serenity
review: Serenity and beauty especially in the evening. One should definitely visit. Its not crowded much therefore one can sit and watch the beauty.

title: pushkar lake - majestic
review: I visited Pushkar Lake on 17th February 2019.   It is  a serence place with  several devotees  thronging  day in and day out.  Because of its historical and mythological attributes,  it is a must visit place  for every body.

title: Cross off your bucket list
review: If you too were taken in by the romantic stories about this place, think again.

title: very nice place with mythological importance
review: As per the mythology lake was formed by pushp (flower) and Kar (hand). there are approx. 1000 temples around the lake.

title: Glorious setting - and very holy
review: Pushkar lake is glorious - a stunning location,very peaceful and very holy. It was a wonderful place to imbue the spirituality of Pushkar - although you do need to be aware of the scammers who will try to convince you to take a flower to throw in the lake - they usually want something in return. Be careful that you don't photograph worshipers as they bathe!

title: Interesting experience
review: We went to pushkar lake in the early afternoon at the moment we past the entrance one man gave us flowers to throw into the lake and after that came another 2 man's and took us separately for a short ceremony.

title: must visit Pushkar attraction
review: pushkar lake has religious significance,has many ghats & the evening Aarti is a divine experience.do find time for the aarti as its essence stays with you forever.also besides the lake are many eateries serving great falafels,burgers,juices,indian & continental cuisine.

title: Seree view during sunset
review: the Pushkar lake has a stunning view during sunset and the ghats are clean as compared to before. One can sit here for hours listening to locals playing music, birds flying and seeing the sun  go down.

title: Evening Moods of Pushkar Lake
review: I have been to Pushkar Rajasthan more than 8 times and each trip my stay  lasted at least 9 days.  My fascination with the Pushkar Lake, a revered prayer location for the Hindus especially those worshiping the Lord Brahma, is insatiable.  The evening lights around the lake, the desert sunset every evening are totally different day to day & I could stay for hours waiting for the sunset & thereafter.

title: Divine
review: I have visited ghats of Pushkar several times. And every time I feel so positive about this place especially the sun aet point where all the culture from east and west amalgamate to say a good bye to the setting sun. I am from New Delhi and want to visit this place every year.

title: Relaxing and interesting place
review: I have visited Pushkar during 3 days and the lake is definitely the main attraction. You can look at people doing their ablutions at sunrise and sunset. It’s very I retesting but make sure to stay discreet, take off your shoes and respect the people. Walking around (without your shoes) is a great way to discover what the lake has to offer.

title: A spiritual place
review: This lake is near to the famous brahamaji temple, and have various ghats , it has over 100s of temple around it which is just amazing,

title: just look out for the Cow Pooh
review: A walk around the lake is a must if you go here. Just be careful as you have to take your shoes off to walk over the bridge. There is a lot of pooh as the cows have right of way so watch where you are walking. The market goes part way around the lake as well. Pushkar is clearly a place where a lot of westerners visited and then stayed. (Think Kensington Market in the 1970's and you have it about right shopping wise. The perfume is joss sticks, incense and cow pooh all mixed up. Clearly a place for old Hippy's. You can get a blessing for your ancestor's or lost loved ones on the lake. It is quiet a spiritual ceremony and very moving.

title: NO SHOES!
review: Everyone will tell you to take your shoes off and don’t put them on the ground,

title: beautiful ghat
review: holy lake and Hindu people faith on this lake and local people do worship at lake and peaceful and relaxing place

title: Holy for Indians - A wrought for tourists
review: We visited one evening as the sun was going down, and were careful not to wear shoes anywhere near the lake and it's surrounding areas (disrespectful). The ground is littered with excrement so its not the most pleasant experience and 'holy' men will work aggressively in teams to bring tourists to the lake-side, demanding ridiculous donations (I'm talking USD$500) for blessings. It's awful to say, but I advise tourists who don't want to pay for these blessings to avoid conversation with locals and especially do not take any petals or flowers from them. The ghats were no more beautiful than countless others I have seen in Rajasthan and from a cultural point of view its worthwhile to do some reading before visiting so you can appreciate the area a little more. Go with an open-mind (hopefully it will be more enjoyable for you) but I have to say it was undoubtedly the worst experience I had in India.

title: Pushkar ...visit to Holy Temple and Camel ride
review: Pushkar is a town bordering the Thar Desert, in the northeastern Indian state of Rajasthan. It's set on Pushkar Lake, a sacred Hindu site with 52 ghats (stone staircases) where pilgrims bathe. The town has hundreds of temples, including 14th-century Jagatpita Brahma Mandir, dedicated to the god of creation, which has a distinctive red spire and walls inlaid with pilgrims’ silver coins.

title: Lake full of tempes and deep religious significance
review: Pushkar lake is a renowned place of religious significance for Hindus. Attracts lots of pilgrims in addition to tourists in view of its uniqueness. The lake has several ghats around its periphery with facilities for pilgrims to take the holy dip and offer prayers to ancestors. The approach towards the lake it through narrow streets with shops on either side. There is lots of scnctity around this place.

title: Beautiful
review: Having visited several years ago I was delighted to see how much cleaner Pushkar is now

title: Beautiful setting
review: Very holy lake in a peaceful setting and its lovely to just sit and take in the sights and watch the people..

title: Neat & Clean Lake.
review: We offered pooja at the Pushkar Lake. The place was calm & quite without all the Hustle & Bustle of a normal pilgrimage place.

title: quiet lake
review: The lake looks serene, there were pilgrims offering pooja, the water has no debris and it was a beautiful experience for us.  We offered our donations and gently declined other options offered by the "holy" men.

title: Holiday
review: A holy place specially for Lord Brahma. We, 4 of us did our prayers and felt very peaceful and loved this amazing site (one of the holiest place). Awesome!

title: Priests' blessing at the lake
review: The lake and the ghats are lovely but avoid the "priests" who conduct a blessing ceremony. It's just a load of mumbo-jumbo to entice tourists to give a large donation for - apparently- conservation. They tell you what you should give and are very offended if you don't!

title: Beware gat priests and blessing ceremonies
review: The town and the lake are attractive with interesting markets, restaurants etc. However, be aware that priests will entice you to trust them by taking you through an individual or couples blessing ceremony that ends with them putting enormous pressure on you to donate large sums of money to their charity and to themselves. We felt very uncomfortable with this hard sell approach. We are happy to support charities but this is simply a scam.

title: Trip review to Pushkar Lake
review: On 30th December,2018 we started our journey from Jaipur. The trip was a memorable and pleasurable one.The driver was Rehaan Khan.He was a experienced and friendly person. At first we visited the pushkar lake.We had a Camel safari which was very enjoyable. Then we visited the pushkar lake and the pushkar Mandir. It was a nice experience.Then we visited the Ajmer Shariff.It was a memorable experience.On the way we visited the Anna lake. Overall it was a memorable trip.

title: Beautiful place
review: Visited the lake and experienced the peace of mind at this spiritual place.. and of course a lot of fun too..

title: Great place
review: Great place and great video must go if your are in pushkar avoid the pristine there they all wont to ripp you off

title: Nice
review: Get some history before you reach there or get a guide who can describe the mythology behind this. Otherwise a common lake.

title: Properly maintained and clean place
review: The approach to the entrance is a little walk from the parking, but it is properly maintained and clean.

title: Holy Lake
review: Be aware of the touts that roam around trying to extract money from you. Don't listening to them as they will play with your religious sentiments and emotions.

title: Visit to the ghats
review: The lake is large and picturesque. A place of pilgrimage the ghats were busy in the morning. Photography of women bathing is prohibited, but many were taking photos. Worth walking through the town to visit.

title: Very serene and lots of people partaking of the waters
review: This is a very holy sight for many Indians and whilst the litter spoils some of that atmosphere it still has a special atmosphere.

title: Pushkar Lake .
review: Pushkar Lake is just walking distance from the Brahma temple.  We visited the lake during the evening "Aarthi". The lake is clean and serene. There are several Ghats and there is Aarthi performed at almost every Ghaat. Pushkar lake is clean and serene and inspiring. You could spend a little time enjoying the calmness at the lake.

title: Holy lake
review: Nice and clean ghats well maintained, you will loose money if you are sentimental. Pusher lake itself is worshipped as Bramha the creator.

title: Greedy people
review: very very very greedy maharajs who perform small pooja for money.Do not perform any sort of pooja on Pushkar lake as they all have only one goal and that is MONEY MONEY MONEY.And if we deny to give them money what they ask for then they get angry.They asked for Rs.2100 but we agreed for Rs.500 and suddenly their behaviour changed & got angry and said that we will not get reciept as they give reciept only above Rs 1000, please dont get involved with these maharajs.....

title: Day trip Jaipur to Pushkar
review: This place of district Rajasthan gives you feeling of real Rajasthan with camels all around,Rajasthani food ( Daal Bati Churma,Papad ki Sabji, Gatte Ki Sabji with Bajra and Makke ki roti prepared by housewives with their love. This trip was a day trip with friends so couldn’t explore much , but yes their food has made our trip worth doing day trip to Pushkar from Jaipur.

title: AVOID!!! Very greedy priests will lie to you
review: Priest will try to force you into a ceremony and ask several thousand rupees,  after, for “good karma”..

title: The central feature of the town
review: Wonderful for people watching and great views.  You have to take your shoes off around the lake despite the cow and bird droppings but accept it as part of the culture.  Do not accept a flower from anyone - they'll drag you into a con when they'll spout some mumbo-jumbo, bless you, offer you a wish and then try to fleece you for 1000 rupees.

title: Lake of tranquility !
review: Day or night the lake is beautiful. It's a divine lake for the people. To take a bath in the lake is sacred. Ghats are there all around the lake of Pushkar having 400 Temples . Pujaris are their to perform worships for you. Don't wear chappals or shoes when you enter the lake.

title: A street theatre
review: We viewed this area both by day, visiting a Holy man, and during the evening when the lights twinkle and the area is transformed from daytime bathing to nighttime activities.  There were acrobats, women with hula hoops and much to see from a waterside restaurant.  Obviously, a must see when in Pushkar.

title: Religious Visit
review: Do Visit for learn about Hindu mythology  and  cuoture. Visit Brahma temple which Is one of it's kind. It's not a tourist place so you must go only if you are curious to explore religious places.

title: Tranquility and a holy admosphere
review: We had a very nice stay at the U turn hotel with the view over the lake. It is always nice to witness a different culture and at Pushkar lake you will definatelly experience that. The sunset and the sunrise is abselutelly stunning.

title: one of the beautiful places at India
review: can be busy in the sunsethour, although an quite & relaxed place to enjoy your life w/ still less trash onside.

title: holly shine place
review: holly shine place must vist in Pushkar. very good place to offer worship to God n ancestors. Must vist place.

title: Sunset....
review: Beautiful sunset visible from the lakeside. A couple of cafes and shops keep this place abuzz. Many people enjoy the evenings here.  When in Pushkar, evenings can be spent here. Beware of touts.

title: Money making
review: Such a nice place and lake however it's money making for blessings... I say this because the Brahmans told me that they will bless me by me throwing some flowers into the holy lake based on donations. So I did and after the Brahman was done, another man came from behind me who was the donations manager and basically forced me to tell them how much I was donating even though there were plenty of donation boxes around. I then told both of them that I was only able to donate 200rupees and I needed change of 500rupees... The man therefore took 300 instead of 200 which I had said and said that I needed to give 300 for some holy luck of some sort... I was disappointed that they didn't accept what I was able to offer which therefore made my experience a monkey making business lake

title: Peaceful and tranquil
review: Lovely spot to visit in Pushkar.  Go early to get good photographs.  Having a tour guide will help you learn more about culture and story.

title: Pushkar lake
review: Pushkar lake is commercial lake for people around. Different God's different ghat.diffrent priests gets to earn.

title: Small,Chaotic but Vibrant Village
review: I had been to Pushkar with my Family and stayed over night on a freezing December evening.The place best reminds me of a town that does not want to develop but people there want to make tons on of money come what may.Lot of foreign tourist marred the place and they looked to  have accepted the town the way it is. So what to expect there ? The lake of course will give you a sense of calmness and make you realise how important it is for Indian spirituality . The temple which is one of its kind in the world will make you feel very special just by visiting it ..

title: Anasagar Lake!
review: Gorgeous view , great for walks, a subway in the vicinity. Maharana Pratap statue also , a must visit to understand the history of the place.

title: Lake with historic and mythological beliefs
review: The water looks very dirty. Though one is expected to bath in it, we could not think about it and just got a splash ( with hesitation). Beware of local pandits who may offer you their services but in turn may fleece you

title: Peaceful - if you avoid ‘pushy priests’
review: Some lovely views across the lake , the rooftop cafes are excellent to get great photos. Nice to walk down to the Ghats, ( bathing areas) but by respectful , shoes off and no photos.

title: Spiritual at its core
review: Pushkar - the place of thousand temples and five thousand brahmins, existing around where Lord Brahma dropped one of his lotus petals, creating the Pushkar lake. Place divine in its spirituality, contentment and calmness.

title: Pushkar Magic
review: Instagram friendly location. Great at all times of the day and night. You have to take your shoes off if you walk down to the stairs that lead to the lake.

title: My beloved Pushkar
review: Pushkarlake is a very holy place with more than 500 temples around the lake. From the morning to evening every ashram has its program (rituals and holy actions). So I want to talk about the special sound of the Pushkarlake. The whole day somebody will sing or chant sacred texts or songs. So its not only a beauty for the eyes but also for the ears.

title: Spiritual but Beware of THUGS
review: As legend goes, this is one of the holiest places for Hindus.

title: Beautiful place but I would avoid the camel fair
review: We loved the little town and the views of the lake at day or night.  Although we were fortunate enough to see one moving Hindu ceremony, we would not visit again in during the Pushkar Camel Festival (there really are no camels).  People were arriving at the lake at 3:45 in the morning and the noise was overbearing by 4:30 AM.  There were just too many people and scam artists.  However, I head that the town is great and a quaint and peaceful town all other times of the year.

title: Visit recommended, good place
review: Lake is small but offers good view at sunset.

title: Small and beautiful...mythical place
review: Small beautiful lake surrounded by small temples on all sides. True mythical Hindu site. They say it's the lake that's the real "diety" in Pushkar

title: Holy lake with a nice view
review: It is very nice to be there. One can enjoy the scenic beauty as well as can explore the facts / stories about the lake.

title: Lots to see
review: The lakeside area is easy to walk and to take in the history. Thoroughly enjoyed a day here and would recommend a visit here and in the busy streets around. Great little places to eat that offer lake views.

title: Room with a view
review: Patio of our hotel overlooked the Ghan ghat and the lake. Arrived in evening and enjoyed the lights but the daytime views were much nicer

title: Sunset Serenne setting
review: The lakeside or the roof top of our hotel was an amazing place to experience sunset with music dancing and feeling of happiness on the lake.  The lake was clean and great to walk around with several spots for quiet meditation.  Avoid the pseudo priests wanting to help you pray, they just want your money. No shoes but p,aces to leave safely.

title: Unkept place
review: Visited this place enroute to the famous Lord Brahma temple of Pushkar and was really disappointed to see the way things were handled at this place. Place was over crowded with very little arrangements for crowd control or public services provided. Toilets were hard to find and we're not well kept. More arrangements for keeping clothes and shoes can be planned. The water was quite dirty compelling you to rethink on your decision to have a holy dip.

title: Be Aware of thugs ... Looters
review: The Holi PUSHKAR small town  is a beautiful PEACEFUL place beside a holy lake. But please be care ful

title: Great peaceful place
review: Enjoyed our afternoon by the lake. Quite, beautiful, with amazing views of the city. I wish We could see a sunset here but maybe next time!

title: Just be there once!
review: I always wanted to visit Pushkar. The first place I visited was the very famous Pushkar lake. Not only the lake has a history and mythological background to it, but it is very clean and peaceful. I would say that everyone who gets a chance should go there, take a walk around a lake, admire the structures and feel happy.

title: Divine and Peaceful
review: One can never get enough of it. So contemplating experience. The lake is main attraction of the place and it’s beauty can’t be put into words. It’s an experience within, only to be felt.

title: Expected much more
review: I was preparing this trip to Pushkar hoping to see the beauty of the Lake, but unfortunately it is very dirty, and there are so many people around that you can hardly enjoy your visit!  I heard from some people that some years ago the situation was different.  It is a pity when the thing get worse.. it is such an important holy place!

title: Offers great view
review: The view of the lake is good.is a small lake surrounded by temples.offers great pictures of the mountains.

title: Nice lake and surrounding area to walk
review: We had a nice stroll around the lake and enjoyed the serenity. Afterwards, we went up to the street and checked out the market and bazaar. We checked out some of the many vendors selling souvenirs, gifts, fabric, jewelry and more. There were many cafes and eateries (some with lake views), to relax and take it all in.

title: December visit
review: Stay alert from different priests as some of them would try to con in terms of rituals to pitra.

title: Sacred lake which has lost its beauty
review: The Pushkar lake is a sacred lake to visit but beware of touts & scams. You will be surrounded with people calling themselves Brahmin and will intimidate into donating money after perform the rituals, chanting and so-called blessing of your loved ones.

title: Walking view
review: Just walk around, read a book in their stairs and enjoy the peace around all the lake! For the sunset they play music live. Absolutely beautifull

title: hindu blessing
review: after walking through the busy market we stopped by the side of the lake where a priest gave us a blessing. magical.

title: Nice place to sit and just take in the vibe of Pushkar
review: It's beautiful, especially because you get to see and meet so many interesting people there- the Pandas, The hippies, the rich tourist, the little Indian kids scamsters, the religious devotees, the sellers, the couples out on dates.

title: Ok ok
review: No comments !!

title: A lot of Pollution
review: It looks very nice from a far but the air quality here was very bad, with the heat & the dust very difficult to breathe. It's a place  of pilgrimage for many but it wasn't a very clean place & so crowded I was glad to leave as it was getting dark.

title: Average lake with many western tourists
review: This is a small lake, and has multiple ghats around it for religious ceremonies. We visited this place for sunset, and there were many westerners of the "hippie" variety that were doing performances that the local indians were enjoying; completely the reverse of what I had expected :). There were a  lot of western tourists here that had taken over most of the cafe's for a view of the sunset. The ghats were nowhere near as busy as in Varanasi, but we did see a few hindu's dipping into the lake.

title: Wonderful experience
review: Walking barefoot by Pushkar’s lake at sunrise has been one of my favorite experience in India so far.

title: Religious place
review: It is a small lake with many ghats all around it. There are many entries to the lake. We enjoyed the evening aarti at sunset time. You can enjoy the sun here in the winters. Footwear is not allowed in the area.

title: Beautiful but "almost" authentic
review: This lake is sacred, beautifull, you definitely have to see it if you stay in Pushkar. But like in every place there are tourist, there are scammers. Don't accept the flowers from the Brahmans around the lake, they will be friendly with you but trying to get some money from you (some is around R2000)

title: Intriguing
review: It’s down past the markets and is a big visit during camel fair .

title: Beautiful lake
review: Beautiful lake in middle of the the historic  city. Very busy in November when the religious festival is on but interesting to see be prepared for the chaois  and crowds and a few religious rules

title: BEWARE -
review: Well watch out because you will be urged to sit and do the chant and open your wallet and donate large sums of money - supposedly to the local poor

title: relaxing place
review: very nice lake by walking main bazar.Today was special day for Hindus so millions of indian families male female & childrens took bath today since 4am till mid day.

title: Life is changing
review: I was here 28 years ago and I couldn’t recognize Pushkar again ! It changed in a bad way unbelievable! So many tourist shops and so dirty!

title: worth a visit
review: when i Pushkar of course. try the early morning or before sunset when the light is good. Many worshipers come then.

title: Lake surrounding with temples
review: Pushkar lake is very famous among the pilgrims visting pushkar. They take a holy bath on the ghats and visits temples

title: Family visit
review: Visited the holy pushkar lake on 10th november for a dip in the lake and offer prayers to lord Shiva. The Kartik month as per hindu calender is considered the most auspicious for the dip. Offered prayers at the 108 shivlings established at the Mahadev Ghat. Also saw the idol of lord Shiva which is similar to the one established in Pashupatinath temple in Nepal. Enjoyed the serene view of the lake. Enjoyed the famous sweet delicacy of pushkar the Maalpuha.

title: My Place in India
review: I love Pushkar....is such an spiritual place with so beautiful people. The food is amazing all vegetarian and full of options, flavours and spices. Children’s, cows, camels, monkeys and a lot of beautiful Rajasthani people make the place so happy and colourful. I love the smiles. I Love Pushkar. Also for shopping is a perfect place full of factories and shops that you get crazy and want to buy everything.

title: Dire need of Maintenance
review: Sadly had a really low satisfaction from the level of expectation that I set for this place. There were many self declared guides that keep on engaging with you when you are walking towards this place. These people talk to you with a self declared price starting from 70 INR to self negotiated price of 25 INR. Really avoided these people as per the reviews that I had gone through before visiting the place. Did not venture out for any "pooja" ceremony. The lake is really in utter Shamble. Lake really needs to be cleaned for the accumulated algae, the steps are very slippery and you need to be very careful to avoid any mis-happening. I saw on lady slipping and falling in lake a few distance away. I went to this place with a plan to go for a holy dip in the lake, but after seeing the quality of water I could not really go for that. It seems that the management of this place is not at all bothered to maintain it. Very good place but poorly maintained.

title: SACRED LAKE
review: the country of pushkar and developed around this sacred lake, I recommend the visit in the late afternoon / sunset

title: The Scenic View of Pushkar Lake
review: Puskar is in Ajmer, half an hour from the city. Need to pass through a small ghat and there's a beautiful and amazing Pushkar village. Its like a mini Ganga of Banaras. People with faith and adventure comes there and spend time in Pushkar. A place where you can eat sweets, especially Lassi and Malpuva. You can do shopping of traditional clothes. There are Camel safari in the desert. at the end of November there is a fair which is mesmerising and mind boggling.

title: Disappointing and cynical
review: We was looking forward to visiting Pushkar as it is an extremely religious and spiritual place so was expecting a fulfilling experience. What we got though was an entrance tax to the town which felt like we were paying a mafia, Brahmin that have forgotten their faith in the pursuit of trying to con people out of large amounts of money and beggars that feel entitled to a hand out. We got here just as the camel fair was due to start and although this is a massive attraction after the hassle we got around the lake we just couldn't be bothered to go and have a look.

title: Peace of mind.... 😊
review: The pushkar lake is something which has to be seen to know what is the meaning of peace of mind ...

title: Magical Memories
review: My friend and I are not religious people, more spiritual, tough there's some meditation and yoga along the way. Our visit to the  temples that line the lake at Pushkar was far too short - we plan to return next year! Meantime, we had a very knowledgeable local guide (reviewed elsewhere as Vedic Walk). More importantly, he introduced us to a priest at the waterside who guided us through a personal Puja ceremony. If you don't know: Puja is the act of showing reverence to a god, a spirit, or another aspect of the divine through invocations, prayers, songs, and rituals. Which we did in our own ways, made blessings, gave some flowers and incense etc to the Lake and - whether you believe in gods or not, the simple ceremony was an acknowledgement of the wonder all around us, especially in Pushkar. I've become a devotee of the elephant god Ganeshi! Why? I have no idea, but it feels good.

title: Holylake but beware of frauds
review: The lake is good , I was there during Pushkar mela . it is good to read about the historical importance and go . you will find people who would tell you about rituals and huge offerings. stay away from them ... it is good to visit it as a tourist attraction

title: Beautiful lake and amazing fireworks a restaurant
review: Amazing fireworks over the lake at sunset viewed from a rooftop restaurant. Maybe the fireworks were to celebrate the camel fair?

title: Crowded yet peaceful
review: It is one of the place in Pushkar where you can seat with your friends for hours, enjoy crowd and yet do not feel bored. Nicely maintained.

title: Epic Energy, A Truly Magical Place
review: Words can’t properly convey my feelings about this special place. Watching the sunrise and sunset on the lake is one of my favorite things to do.

title: Watch out for flower boys
review: Watch out for people offering you flowers, it's a big scam. They will aggressively force you to join a ceremony once you throw it in the water and after that won't make you leave before you pay them a lot of money. Or they say they curse your family It is a nice place to shop, if you ignore the flower boys nice to walk around the lake (though they are quite strict with shouting where you can and cannot walk with shoes). Pushkar is good for shopping and chilling in restaurants for the rest. Nice to be in a small place, not too busy or polluted.

title: Great Lake but avoid donations after the rituals
review: Great Lake to visit and know the Legend behind it's formation. But one cannot be convinced regarding it's overflow in case of a deluge (guide/pandit cannot explain it's outlets properly). Also, after the rituals are completed, one is led into parting with donations (saying credit card swiping facility available)

title: local priest are not well they people are money minded
review: Local priest force to take a flower and worship at Pushkar lake if you not so they misbehave with so be aware to visit Pushkar lake

title: Serenity
review: We visited at sunset.   Walked through a nice market passing 5 or 6 entrances to the lake ... then entered at a lovely quiet spot.  Walked all the way around and exited at sunset point just as the sun set.  You have to walk barefoot. Very peaceful.  At sunset point they were playing drums and other musical instruments.   We were a bit wary of visiting here as lots of people get harassed and conned .... We had been warned ... just don't accept flowers offerings or prayers ... keep walking!  We were approached once and declined and then enjoyed the lake in peace.

title: Must Visit
review: We visited around noon before going to Brahma Temple. One has to cross the Pushkar Bazaar to reach the lake. Plenty of things to buy from the market. Don't take your shoes at the start of the market. You can remove footwear just near the lake. Lake has a religious vibe to it and like all all holy places in an over populated country can be crowded at times. Its also an imp place to pray for your ancestors.

title: Prayer time at the Lake
review: To go to the Lake at prayer time (around 6:00pm) is a moving experience.  To see the candles floating in the water, the people praying or doing yoga and listening to the chanting makes Pushkar and its reputation for spirituality come alive.

title: Water spot at Rajasthan and significant due to Brahma temple
review: After visiting Brahma temple we made a point to go by lake. Entrance and overall view good, but need improvement on cleanliness!

title: The Holy Visit
review: Visit to the pushkar lake at the time of pooja was great. The evening pooja is good time to visit ghaat and the lake.

title: A sacred experience!
review: It is said that, Pushkar is founded by God Brahma by dropping a lotus flower in Pushkar Lake.  This temple is around 2000 years old. However, it is not true that it is the only Bramha temple in India. There are few more across the country. But surely it is one of the oldest! T

title: Historical value
review: When we will start stopping the construction near the ghats as lake is not visible until you cross all the shops and reach there.

title: Evening well spent.
review: Serene and relaxing place. It is a big attraction to tourists. Not a big lake, but calm and clean. There are coffee shops around. One can sit by the lake, look at the sunset and relax. Some musicians were playing drums, and foreigners were dancing near the lake. All were immersed within. Trying to connect with unknown. I found it peaceful. Had a cup of coffee. Enjoyed the place. Car takes you right up to the lake.

title: Relaxing and divine experience
review: This lake at Pushkar is a sacred one. it is clean and the calm. We were lucky to see the evening arti at the lake. There was not much of crowd so we could view the entire arti very well.There are many bathing ghats around the lake. Beware of touts who try to sell something

title: Best lake but dirty area
review: The lake is great and big as well. Worthful to see but the outside of the lake is very dirty and maximum unmanaged cows around there.

title: A Wonderful Calming Experience
review: We went here as part of a tour and were provided with a Brahmin priest as a guide. He also took us through a blessing ritual which added to the magic of the place.

title: The lake
review: A place give us feel like , the God's lived here. I do pray here & did worship by holy man who refreshed my mind thoughts. When will came in the side of lake you automatically become a devotte ( devotional) to do something karma or deeds for there.

title: Beware of Brahmins
review: Please beware of the so called “bramins” a kind of spiritual guides of the temple and of the lake area. They will start approaching you offering to help you making Hindu preyers but they will soon start asking mandatory “charity” donations with minimum amount of 100/150 USD

title: Sacred Lake
review: Devotees come to bathe in this lake so you are not allowed to take photos and it's a bit rude to stare even. It's an interesting place but the surroundings are not very clean and tidy.

title: Sight Seeing
review: Pushkar Lake is a sacred lake of the Hindus. The Hindu scriptures describe it as "Tirtha-Raj" – the king of pilgrimage sites related to a water-body and relate it to the mythology of the creator-god Brahma, whose most prominent temple stands in Pushkar. The Pushkar Lake finds mention on coins as early as the 4th century BC.

title: Fantastic
review: The holiest of holy water, be careful with people giving you flowers and pooja as they want something from you but apart of this is a fantastic place to visit! Watching the crowd and the cows in the stairs is quite epic! A must see in Pushkar

title: Beware the Brahman SCAM
review: First the good, Pushkar is a fascinating place with lots of temples, a market where you can  buy most things especially silver jewelry, some cheap cafes and a holy lake.

title: Worth a look...
review: On the way to Pushkar the driver warned us tine & time again for unscrupulous people & how right was he.

title: Holy place,  cursed by people
review: Looking at photos on web,  we had bit high expectations about this place. But we were bit disappointed when visited. It's such a beautiful place,  IF people keep it clean. We didn't even feel like touching the green turned water. Lot of bad smell around that diffuses the holyness. Government can put some measure to keep it clean...

title: Photo stop
review: It’s just for photo stop. It’s on the way to brahma temple. You can see savitri temple which is located on top of hill from here.

title: Seren and calm
review: Pushkar Lake exhumes tranquility and peacefulness Looking at the Temples and speaking with the locals was great.  Clear water and good scenery...

title: Beware of people giving you flowers!
review: Do not accept flowers from people to be thrown into the lake. If you are a couple the 'bramins' will separate you, take you to the lake, do some kind of religious mumbo jumbo prayer and ask you to donate. If you are not from India you will be asked to donate literally thousands of rupees (like a thousand rupees for each family member). If you try to negotiate you will be pressured by tens of those scrupulous bramins asking you to donate happily. Even if you accept the flower, toss it into the lake and move on, DO NOT DONATE!! Also check Google review for ragunath temple.

title: amaazing
review: pushkar lake is so beautiful place to go there is a great posative enrgy it is a holly lake i love this place lot off

title: Breathtakingly beautiful before sunset
review: A sacred place somewhat spoiled by noisy, self-absorbed tourists. As other reviews have mentioned, there are also local people to be wary of (Avoid buying flowers etc).

title: They first want your money
review: The place is nice but it is polluted by people who try to oblige you to take part in fake ceremony to get some money from you. If you say you are not interested, the are aggressive and want to expell you from the banks.

title: Careful!
review: Is beautiful to see and I would recommend to open your mind and do the ritual, but CAREFUL! the man that does the ritual with you will ask you for 2000 rupees, that's literally a joke! It is a donation, that means money is not compulsory, although the ritual is pretty interesting, so if you want to give a donation can give happily 200, do not feel intimidated...this is gonna be your everyday in India.

title: Holy chaos!
review: The energy in this place is divine. You will feel it as soon as you come down the stairs and see the lake. Locals will try to lure you into donating money and impose themselves to guide you around, try not to fall for it, otherwise you will be about $20 short. Overall it is nice experience.

title: Beware and do not accept anything
review: People will consistently give you flowers or offer to become a guide on the way to the river. Do not accept anything. At the river steps they will also try to scam you buy forcing you to take a plate with flowers, rice, sugar and some colored powder. They will proceed to reassure you that there is no fee and that they are Brahmans and that they will give you blessing and ask for a donation. Funny thing is they have a rate

title: Great lake to visit during the evening time.
review: The Aarti during the evening are a great to watch with so many people performing Aarti in various places.

title: Best view of pushkar lake
review: Pushkar Karni camp was the best desert camp in pushkar .as we are two so decide to stay at pushkar so we booked Gulab niwas hotel .the hotel has a great view from pool side .the room at gulab niwas are good .food was nice .next day we decide to stay in desert and online we find karni desert camp and they suggest to take camel ride to the camp.so will start 4 pm from mela ground .that was five different experience of our tour .near by sunset time we reached camp they serve us some biscuits with tee.the tent was clean and nice .they serve thali in dinner and you have many choices to eat .the view from the camp give you touch of village.nest day morning we visit pushkar lake  .so we do Puja on ghat. On the ghat you will find many things where I can feel can't write. This was my best puja of my lifeand I think this Puja will give goods for me and my family.

title: Holy place the Pushkar lake
review: Pushkar lake is very holy and important to the Bharams cast. It is also beautiful and peaceful. Sunset is very good timing to stay over and chill out. There some sticky persons that “welcome” you with flower to giveing your hands, that is their first connection to hassle you. So smile don’t reach your hands to them and walk freely.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: Very shabbily maintained place. With mythological background, you may like to visit this place. There are quite a lot of priests who would get you to complete rituals.

title: very pretty
review: the lake is very pretty by the sun down. a must visit if you are in Pushkar india. We had an unplanned trip to Ajmer and the surrounds in the village is so nice with people being very humble

title: Be weary, don't accept the flowers unless you feel like donating
review: The lake is nice, the surroundings are also nice. There's a large market on the outside ring of the lake. It's all very very tourist orientated and depending on the experience you're looking for you'll either love it or hate it. Don't come here expecting to find the 'real' India. They use religion as a way of getting money out of you and almost everything else is a ploy for money too. Don't take any flowers from folk, they say its free but it won't be I promise by the end of it all.

title: JAI PUSHKAR RAJ KI
review: firstly it is the guru of all the tirth in the world

title: Vacation in Nature to Seek Blessings
review: This place is one of the best places to visit in Rajasthan.... Especially during moonson. First of all its great to see the cleanliness of area.

title: Crowded
review: Had to stop as it is on the way but very busy and just too many beggars & food vendors. It is huge so good for the city

title: Good Place
review: Good place it was really quite and old heritage type. We have spent quite and silence moment together. Must visit

title: Pushkar Lake
review: Pushkar Lake also known as Brahm Sarovar is surrounded by 52 Ghats for Bathing, its believed that Lord Brahma him self created this Lake.

title: A must place to visit
review: A small holy lake. Very important for the hindi religion. Surrounded by a large Bazar market with food stalls, clothes stalls and shoes and bags. Lots of jewelry. Things are not expensive. People are very nice. Always there is a festival in pushkar. Camel fair, color festival or another. Find the best time to come

title: Visit is a must
review: But a must is to have a local guide to guide you through the India stury and culture arround the lake and the different temples

title: Solidarity!
review: Irrespective of which caste, creed or culture you are from, this is a must visit place. People are simple but a lot of inclination towards faith. You will get to offer prayers here, the prayer thaali is for INR 11 and a Pundit will guide you for the prayers. I was lucky enough as I got to cascade the flowers from the main area where several pundits do their prayers everyday. At the end, it gives you the peace of mind and a solace in the heart.

title: Best spot to sit back and admire the Aravalis
review: The centre of Pushkar, the eponymous lake is an artificial one, and lined by stepped ghats all around. Thronged by devotees, curious foreigners and conmen alike, finding a quiet spot for oneself is nothing short of a miracle. Watching the sunset over the Aravali hills is spellbinding. Must visit for the golden experience

title: Lacking a bit in atmosphere
review: I was a bit disappointed with Pushkar lake and felt it lacked atmosphere. Avoid being harassed by men wanting you to do Puja and put flowers in the lake as it may cost you. Best to sit on far side opposite market area as it is quieter and you can watch the passing parade. Aarti is around 7pm and nice to listen to the chanting.

title: Awesome Serenity & Holy
review: I have visited this lake fourth time & every time it gives me a different peace & touch of holiness like I don want to move away from here.

title: Awful experience
review: The place is dirty and full of people harassing you for money to perform rituals. When me and my wife said no, we were harassed to the point that we ended up leaving because we didn't felt safe. State government has to something about this.

title: good clean lake
review: it was good to be there in evening because weather was great and shops are close by to buy local things like gulkand, malpua & stones.

title: what's your perspective?
review: If you are here to spend some peaceful time like reading a book or so, then its a good place to visit coz you will find a peaceful corner. If you are here to score stuff (if you know what i mean) then i suggest you better bring it with you coz its filthy expensive out here. still if you wanna buy from here then ask any chai wala at the ghat and he will provide you.( pay cash on delivery ). the streets are a piece of art. booze is kinda banned here so BYOB.

title: Not to be missed.
review: We visited this place in the evening, many people were there. It was a peaceful place, people were on a pilgrimage. It was larger than we thought. The lake was full of fish. Many happy people bathing as it was a holy place to them. It is unmissable.

title: Beware of Touts !!
review: We went there with high expectations. Right at the entrance of the city where you have to pay the city tax, there are hordes of touts, they sweet talk you by saying that they will only charge 50 INR and the rest is up to us. On the banks of the lake they made us do a pooja again telling us that the offerings are up to us. But once the Pooja was half way through they forced us to make huge donations. Which we refused. The priest literally stood up mid pooja and abused us. Spoilt our complete experience. Actually it is the only place where Lord Brahma can be worshipped.

title: Tourist trap , full of scam - do not go
review: This place by far the worst experience in India. We went there at a group of 3 women. We got harassed since we stepped out the car. We just wanted to see the lake but got approached by so-called “holy man” asking us to donate money with dried flower. When we turned him down he asked us to get out of the place. We were with our driver but he’s shouting to the point that we had to leave.

title: One time visit
review: Visit during the Aarti time ..... nice scenic view all around with the aravalis covering the sides .... on way to lake lots of small shops to shop ..., silver Jwellery is worth a buy .....

title: Sorry
review: I had high expectations of this place but was dissapointed by the pressure from the men at the gath. I hád to give an (and pay for) offer, and when I said I wouldn’t, The man got angry... I had a floweroffer in my hand that I got from the priest, but had to leave that on the steps and was not alowed to walk down to the lake!

title: Don’t take flower !!!! Holy scam!!!
review: Be aware of someone give you flower , the boy at the drink stall where the tuktuk driver dropped us off.

title: A Lake with historic significance and an awesome atmosphere
review: Saw the evening ceremony being done by the Pandits from the other side of the lake. Was able to soak in all the views and chants which was a great and peaceful experience. Would definitely recommend to all visiting Pushkar.

title: Nice view
review: I was happy to see the lake, beautiful view and surrounded by very nice buildings too. The only sad point is that priests just take random foreign tourists to make them supposedly free prayers and then ask very agressively for money, even lie to us, which always makes a bad impression.

title: Doctor
review: A place for piligrimage. The lake running the whole length of the holy city, with many temples . Near the Gau ghat is Halwayeo ki gali, where you get the best ' malpuye ' crisp deep fried thin pancakes in sugar syrup.

title: Cheater on the loose
review: When i was here. Expected solitude. I wanna experience the place. The place is great trust me. I was there early hours of the morning.

title: Good place for photography, not for prayers!
review: I had heard a lot about this lake and it's importance due to "Only Brahma Temple" nearby.  However, there are more than one in India. We were here only for photography and not prayers.

title: Very peaceful and sacred place
review: It's really a very peaceful and holy place. Tourists from different parts of the world come here. The holy lake is filled with natural mountain water and its the beauty of the place...

title: Powerful
review: When I was brought to pushkar lake I actually got a vibration in my body.  I am sure if you are reading this you know that Bramha is the creator.  Magical

title: Beware of the scam artists asking to donate money
review: The lake itself has nothing wrong with it; i mean it’s not spectacular in any way, it’s quiet and you can watch locals bathing; that’s about it.

title: Nice Place to take Photos
review: First, we need to pray. Yes. Next if you there during the sunrise or sun set, do not forget to take the pictures! Wonderful place to take the photos.

title: Lake surrounded by multiple spiritual buildings & nature
review: Wasn’t sure what to expect in Pushkar and was blown away with the man made lake & so many spiritual buildings some of which you can wander in & out freely..others didn’t permit entrance. Known as spiritual Mecca that people flock too at certain times of the year..so can swell up to 2 million which I think would make it difficult to navigate the cobble streets...streets lined with stalls & shops...so prices increased as we were tourists...

title: Piety at its best
review: Heard so much about the lake.

title: Temples are most visited bcz they are have show  prachin sabhyata of india
review: Feel very awsum on this place bcz yaha ki mitti yaha ki prachin sabhyata yaha ki camel riding n designg n rangoli n kund n old temples wow fact seen sabyata poranik

title: Ahh.. Awesome place to visit in whole Pushkar
review: This is the most peaceful and calm place to visit. There are 52 ghats which combines as Pushkar lake. Do visit once when you are in Pushkar.

title: Not maintained
review: Ghats Not maintained at all. Dirty water. Just would go as you are around the only lord Brahma temple.

title: Spiritual, but beware tourist traps
review: We had a 2hr guided tour of the lake, which I have to say was probably the most interesting and informative of all the guided tours we had in India. He explained the structure and belief system of Hinduism in such a way that we understood. Pushkar lake is surrounded by bathing ghats and is a pilgrimage for Hindus and Sikhs. Around the Brahma temple there are lots of stalls and market areas that are purely set up for tourists and as soon as they see a tourist the price goes up five times what you could get in Jodhpur or Jaipur. I really enjoyed this small city and found it to be very spiritual and a nice contrast to the mad cities we had been to previously.

title: Spent an amazing evening near Pushkar Lake
review: There are multiple ghats in Pushkar Lake but experience in Sun Set ghat was amazing. You can reach there by auto or 5-10 minutes of work. There are multiple cafes available nearby. Treat to eyes when you the color of the water during sunset.

title: Big lake but to visit in right weather only
review: We went in peak summer so it was mostly dried up .. i assume it looks better after monsoon .. anyways i liked the mood of Pushkar City its a good place to relax for sure

title: A connect with the Devine
review: A visit to Pushkar lake is a spiritual experience. Devotees can perform puja at the lake side. A visit to the nearby Brahma temple and Savitri temples is a must.

title: Beautiful lake
review: We have great time in pushkar they peopleare very helpful friendly cheep good for business and in budget

title: So peaceful
review: Pushkar lake is so calm and serene. It's really hot during the day to enjoy the lake. We went to the lake around 5:30pm and sat there till 9pm..puahlar aarti happens at around sunset. It's not elaborate like Ganga aarti but it's nice to experience the energies around. There are 52 ghats and you can walk around all the ghats like a parikrama. We went out from gau ghat and the roads there are very happening. They are very small roads but very lively. We did another parikrama of the lake from the road. We saw the entrance to all the ghats. At the lake, especially at the main brahma gha, People are behind you get pooja done and tell we should donate etc... I know donation for the poor is good but their expectation was high. I only did what I could and left from there. There is a sunset view from jaipur ghat. There are a few restaurants as well that offer food and the sunset view. Over all pushkar is a must visit place. It's so nice to sit by the lake and just read and just walk around. You will find different kinds of people.. Some singing, some playing instruments, some chanting.

title: Visit to pushkar temple
review: The pushkar temple is divine and serene.

title: great time in pushkar
review: we have great time in Pushkar the people are very helpful friendly cheep good for business and make is nice.

title: Lake of Rajasthan
review: Considering it is a Holy place and City, the lake is filthy. There was grime and dead fish. The entire lake area and temple

title: Completely spoiled by conmen.
review: We tried to visit the lake through a number of the entrances found around the outside of it. As you walk down the hill towards the ghats and lakeside there are a number (dozens) of donations boxes, which probably tells you all you need to know.

title: Nice lake, poorly behaving fake priests
review: Even before we reached this lake, we had boys of this fake priest community who seem to rule this lake pressuring us to perform certain rituals and telling us the curses that lie ahead if we didn't. Did not fall into this trap but they keep pestering ys. They fool lot of people and prey on the weakness of who those who have someone pass away.

title: Antic feel
review: The lake and its surrounding looks like a  thousand year old place and as if time has stopped there. The water of the lake is crystal clear and thousands of people go there daily. A must visit place.

title: Holy Lake
review: Beautiful lake surrounded with ghat main street and hills beware with local priest rest everything is ok

title: Decent enough to kill time
review: not much to do in pushkar in any case.  So head to the pushkar lake and it's manu ghats with cafes lined up all along for good grub.  Evenings are pleasant and soothing around the lake.

title: feels like already in haridwar
review: I went there earlier as well but i was not able to see the arti. this time i saw that and i was like i am in haridwar. arti is amazing.mann ko shanti mil jati hai...this is how it feels.awesome.

title: Definitely worth a visit.
review: If you're in town, you just can't avoid spending a sunset or an evening here.

title: Good to sit by the banks
review: We went there by Sunset, sat there and waited to see the maha Aarti that happens! it was a great sight and feeling.

title: Religious Place !!
review: Ghats are Shabby. but if you will look it from distance then it seems beautiful. with back drop of Mountains.

title: serenity calling
review: one can just sit there and forget all the worries. the place looks divine at night and the cool breeze adds to the experience.

title: Great city & a must visit place
review: We use to visit city very often by our own car from Jaipur. As it is the closest leisure cum pilgrimage destination from Jaipur.

title: It's what you believe in your Sanskriti
review: I got chance to visit and also taken dip in holy lake or kind water at Gau Ghat. It's a place of trust in God and in Hindu shastras. Also visited one and only God Bramaha Ji temple.

title: Religious trip
review: When we visited this lake, water was very less. The bed of the lake was muddy and so foul smell was coming.

title: Beware........
review: The drivers tell you that they will give a free guide to you or a complimentary guide..... Please say no...... They are pujari people who give all different types of puja info with their rate card. They take you to their commissioned shops to buy puja th ali etc. Its very difficult to avoid them but if you are firm, they leave you as hopeless customers and do say that also......

title: Awesome sunrise and sunset
review: This place is considered sacred one by Hindus and all the town activities are surrounded this lake. During sunrise you can spot locals bathing and praying and sunset you will see tourist on the left side of the lake playing and enjoying it. Just double precaution for the guys or ladies giving you flowers to bless the lake. They will charge you for this!

title: great to sit and meditate but holy men just want money
review: The holy men who won't go away but just want to get money off you by giving you blessings ruin this perfectly great place to sit and meditate at.  Its a right shame, they spoil it.

title: Culturally important place
review: Don't think that I would bathe in this water. Important sacred waters used by Hindus daily. Interesting but not somewhere to revisit!

title: Pushkar Lake
review: Obviously well worth a visit if you’re in pushkar. Classic destination for all travelers to India.

title: Holy men scammers
review: Avoid the 'holy men' and I would also avoid the guides. The holy men perform some ritual and ask you to promise to pay money, then pressure you to pay at the window. They tell you to go to the cash machine to withdraw more money or donate your foreign currency. Absolutely disgusting practice. Avoid the guides too as they encourage you to go to the holy men.

title: Pushka lake
review: We visited Pushka Lake by Tuktuk. We were confronted by a flower scammer as we found out later. The supposed to be Holy men separated my husband and I. After they completed the pray. We were scammed 3500 rupees, they even asked for Australian cash. I was angry with myself being so gullible and not assertive enough to say No to them. My only advise to all tourists is not to visit Pushka Lake as the holy scammers have completely spoilt it.

title: Pure beauty
review: I was on a trip with ma friends . Really enjoyed every day here . Pushkar lake is absolutely a beauty to go . Cleanliness is an issue there but a place to go. A pure  beauty.

title: beautiful
review: a calm and beautiful place with a lovely coll breeze blowing off the lake . Just be careful about the guys offering a pujar it is not free and donations are expensive best thing to do is buy some red cotton and tie it around your wrist then they tend to leave well alone

title: Beautiful divine place
review: A must visit place for everyone.The evening view is the best thing.To take a dip in holy lake is soothing.Explore various ghats built around the lake.

title: Tranquility at its best
review: Not sure if its the vibe and Aura around the place that makes this lake so peaceful and soothing to all the senses!! One can spend hours just walking and chilling on the ghats of this place, making it really a wonderful feeling :)

title: holy lake
review: The lake is very fine-looking. I didn't have the experience of people bothering me. Spiritual place, wandering around, great ambiance.

title: Great place to visit
review: 1. Has a long history with religio significance.

title: Brahm lake
review: Pushkar lake is of huge religious significance for hindus. It is believed that the lake was created by lord brahma. It has huge significance for pitra puja. Pushkar is the only place which has a dedicated temple for lord brahma. A must visit once in a lifetime.

title: Mesmerizing Lake!
review: There is a mystic charm to this lake. In the evenings, its so peaceful to spend your time sitting on the ghats.

title: Holy Lake
review: Its one of the Spiritual space in Pushkar, must to visit and a best time is early morning hours during sunrise. Suggestion, Management or concerned authority should put kind attention on cleaning lake and make it more beautiful.

title: Beautiful...
review: Historically most of the famous Hindu temples are built near lakes or source of water as this is a sign of prosperity... A beautiful lake which needs serious attanetion for maintenance.

title: Mini banaras
review: Pushkar lake has 52 ghat and and approx 500 temple.

title: Pooja mafia at pushkar sarover
review: Pushkar sarover is a very historical and holy lake built by Lord brahmaji but local guide and so called pujari/panda are cheating tourist on the name of pooja at different ghat specially at Brahma ghat. Initally they told that they will charge nothing, you give as you wish. But end of the pooja they forced you to give donations starts from 5100/- to 15000/- for three days prasad at ghat. When i told them i am ready to give 1000/- as donation but he refused and starts curse (black mailing) me. He harreshed me a lot and finally i comppelled to deposit 2500/- as donations. Reciept enclosed.

title: Blissful serene pilgrim
review: The pushkar holy lake when sit at near to lake climate are so breeze & Charming birds chirping to early morning it too pleasant surrounding aravali hills view was sublime and fish pigeon fly in the sky create an mesmerising memories of Pushkar Rajasthan i will visited again in future thanks to all society to maintain culture auspicious holy pushkar

title: Skip it.
review: Pushkar was seriously not worth the effort. The surrounding sand dunes look like our local rubbish tip (except our tip is contained) and the aggressive 'holy men' who want to give you a blessing on the steps of the lake simply ruined the entire day for us. As soon as we refused to hand over $100+ our guru got aggressive and we were soon surrounded by his equally aggressive mates. Fakes one and all. Luckily our guide got us out of there quickly. If you must stop there, avoid the camel rides through the never ending rubbish tip and avoid the so called priests (read conmen).

title: An important lake for the Hindu faith
review: After a stroll through the hustle and bustle of the Pushkar street bizarre we arrived at the lake. Part of the group were offered to join a Hindu ceremony that is held nightly. Although said to be free there was a firm requirement to pay a donation and anything less than 100 rupees was frowned upon. The others just opted to go to the water front and take pictures as the sun was setting. We did need to take our shoes off to do this and was disappointed that evening to find the area was not as clean and tidy as I would of hoped considering how sacred this place is to local people.

title: Very Sad
review: This was a truly disappointing visit. Considering it is a Holy place and City, the lake is filthy. There was grime and dead fish. The entire lake area and temple, where non vegetarian food and alcohol is not available, is strewn with dirt. It’s a beautiful, unique place. If not the government of the local area, at least the local people can have it cleaned up. Eco systems are such that even if we just let the lake be, it will clean itself up. But by throwing pooja flowers we are just contributing to making it dirty. Very very sad indeed.

title: Beautiful lake
review: The Pushkar lake looks good and clean. In a vast desert it is amazing to see such large water body. But the thing that disturb one's inner conscience is the greedy attitude of the pandits. First they ask to take pooja thali for rs.10, then during the pooja ask you to make promise to pay more and if you don't, they start abusing you.

title: Reflections!
review: In the early morning when the lake is like glass and the only people around are a view Sadus and pilgrims going down for a bathe, that is the time to see Pushkar lake.

title: spiritual  lake of india
review: first time we few people went there, surprised after see the lake , lake like big water dam, lots of ghats , birds fair going lakhs of kobuttar  bird & others, cow mata,  like ice water  come down the water catching with tag , & sink , enjoyed all, al the mind presser ,tension, go out  km. from me , great. , the most holy place.

title: Watch the sunset.
review: Man made lake but non the less quite attractive, especially at sunset when many people gather. A bit hippy-ish, but this is also one of Pushkar’s attractions, if you are that way inclined. A very holy city, good market and overall attractive as it settles in a valley surrounded by hills.

title: Nice place to take some meditation walk in the morning and evening!
review: Pushkar Lake may not too beautiful for sightseeing but a good place for you to walk around in the morning and afternoon. Take off your shoes and don’t take any flowers from any guy since you are there to visit, not to pray, and say No if they have asked you for flowers or anything else. Good place and don’t sit there too long in the evening because of mosquitoes (but it depends on you, it’s not a big deal after all).

title: Nice place to visit surrounded by lake.
review: only brahma temple in world is here, a huge one. just beware of pandits here, they will start asking for money. simply say no to any stranger here and keep walking.

title: Surreal place
review: Pushkar is a Hindu temple town famous for its camel festival. However, it was a revelation for us. It’s quite a cool place and attracts a lot of Israelites and other European nationalities.

title: Good Design but Poor maintenance
review: Design of the Lake is very good but poor maintenance make the people feel bad.  People doing rituals throwaway the flowers in the lake and cleaning is not done.

title: Beautful lake but mismanagemnt because of local goverment.
review: lake water not clear and local priest behave very bad they dont know how tontalk to tourist. Goverment to to strict action for mainatin a lake.

title: Paradise Lost
review: This holy lake has sadly been spoilt by the ubiquity of disingenuous scammers. You can access it from any number of points, then circumnavigate once down at the ghats. However, it would seem that no matter where you enter from, some guy with flowers/bracelets follows you and tries to force these into your hands. We even had one man tell us we couldn't access the lake without a bracelet, and when we politely declined and continued walking he verbally abused us and forcably clutched our arms; he only let go when we shouted for help. Something needs to be done about this, because it marred our experience and it would seem that we're not alone. This is a real pity, as we expected so much more from Pushkar.

title: Holy lake
review: Pushkar lake is considered holy...whatever you feel about that, it is very lovely.  The cow dung, the aggressive gurus, the commercialism can get you a bit jaded. But the town and the lake are an experience not to be missed.

title: The most sacred lake of Western India
review: It is one of the best spot in Pushkar for its serenity & sacredness. Its quite near to very iconic Brahma-temple. Nothing specific activities but u can sit at the Ghat & take a relaxing half-an-hour breath. Beware of some fraud guides who will take atleast 100 rupees by showing nothing. U can offer puja there as many priests are there to help u. A must visit place if u r in Jaipur or Pushkar.

title: surrounded by touts
review: the lake itself is so amazing but it is surrounded by some scammers.they ask to drop some rose leaves and in return they ask you loads of money and if you dont do that they grab you.also they have got big community.so if you are going to the lake please avaoid who ever is asking you to take the flower and put it in the lake.the best way to avoid them is telling them that you have already done that.

title: Hate to be so negative, but....
review: I'd always heard of legendary Pushkar, and we decided to take a day trip there. Unfortunately, we didn't do our homework and got suckered into the oldest scam in the book: when you visit the temple, DO NOT ACCEPT any flowers from the local Brahmin, or you will find yourself steered into an expensive "blessing" procedure that you'll have a hard time getting away from financially unscathed.

title: Beautiful lake which is holy to the Indians, beware of false gurus
review: The lake is beautiful all around and has a lively market with lots of temples on one side, a bridge and quiet temples on the other. At the market their are also a lot of beggars and you are asked to pay for pictures taken of Gurus.

title: great place to people watch
review: As it was the start of a religious festival which coincided with the camel fair. The colours were fabulous and watching the worshippers going through their rituals was fascinating. Be wary of rogue priests encouraging you to part with money to have prayers said, only pay what you can always pay 1 rupee more such as 51 rupees not 50 as this is a cultural custom.

title: Review by an Indian for the non Indian guests
review: This is a very well-known place to reach the Indian old culture and heritage. The lake is surrounded by the Araaballi hills and many big small temples, markets , ghats etc etc etc. The reason i like to emphasis here is the more known the place is its more crowded as well. From the parking to the Main Brambha temple its quite a walk which is surrounded by many big small shops, restaurants. Chose / buy wisely from the shops. there is plenty option to bargain any items in sell. There are too many so called Brambhin who will ask for guide requirement. That is just not required. The story it has to offer is there in its nature, in its path and surrounding. Which is still holding a very old ancient Indian culture which is not visible in now a days Indian City. So grasp it as it is – no guide can offer you the same. What I observe is they are just minting money and making odd odd stuff with the guests. That is the main reason I am writing this.

title: The lake is vast and deep enough to take away all your stress
review: Best experienced either early in the morning just before sunrise to feel the calmness or at sunset. This lake has lots of stories to tell. So don't forget to interact with the locals while sitting beside the lake. Be careful when you get into the lake as it is very deep.

title: Part of Webjet tour
review: We went to see the holy lake but after walking through the vibrant market streets were not game to walk around the holy lake. We were a bit disappointed that the “holy men” seemed more interested in the money than the holiness of the lake. They were not very pleased when we declined to walk  and didn’t pay the donation.

title: PUSHKAR LAKE
review: A pleasant place to spend some time if you can avoid the aggressive flower seller's who were rude when we didn't buy flowers.

title: Still Very Very Good
review: I vividly remember, way back in the year 1982, I while just completed my graduation, swam here at the Pushkar Lake. I remember the lake was then full of big fishes.  It was in the month of January and it was quite cold.  This year in the month of January we once again visited Pushkar Lake and noticed that the cold days have gone. Since we had been at RTDC hotel Sarovar, we had fair chances to visit the lake several times.  This time I did not find any reason to swim, nor did I find the vintage ambiance.  A bit modern structure used to fence the lake, I think, is responsible for die away the old beauty.  .

title: Loved it - Peaceful and Romantic
review: Just Wonderful .. take the time to walk around many times.  Relaxing and ever changing.  Dont forget to see the men heading to the lake to was in the afternoon.

title: Nice view
review: This is the highlight of a visit in Pushkar and well worth a couple of hours strolling around this “holy” pond. The various ghats are quite spectacular, but you are in principle not allowed to take pictures there. Of course you shouldn’t expect anything even remotely remembering clean water but you’re not expected to jump in it either! Besides the buildings used by pilgrims the town is full of small touristic shops serving the many visitors, including a good number of hippies and a surprisingly large and visible Israeli community.

title: Lovely but watch out for scammers!
review: I loved Pushkar and I definitely recommend it to anyone travelling Rajasthan. Just lookout for anyone trying to give you the flowers for a blessing as they will try and demand ridiculous amounts of money for doing nothing.. even random guys who are not holy men will approach you on the street and try to offer then to you.

title: Nice setting. Dirty water
review: Holy place for Brahmins. Rake your shoes off to walk the that's. No fooling around to upset the locals. Tourist heaven

title: Beautiful... But be careful
review: The place is beautiful.... However When we reached near the lake and where looking for a parking space we were bullied into hiring a guide for 50INR.

title: Small holy, lake
review: Beautiful lake  surrounded by Ghats and temples, where people come and bath in the holy water. Magical light and reflection from dawn to dusk. You have to take your shoes off in places.

title: Pushkar lake
review: After a huge crowd n that typical halla hula one peaceful place is pushkar lake... it is hardly 200 mts from main brahma temple... holy lake pilgrims take holy dip in the lake but v just enjoyed the beauty of place n get some memorable clicks.. one should lake

title: Beautiful, calm lake
review: The lake is very beautiful. I didn't have the experience of people bothering me. Spiritual place, wandering around, great atmosphere.

title: Very nice place to visit in evening
review: town of Pushkar in Ajmer district of the Rajasthan state of western India. Pushkar Lake is a sacred lake of the Hindus

title: Beware of 'contributions' it will cost £20 each
review: I don't want to put a complete downer on this, but you do come away with a feeling that you have been had. Your guide will take you here and indicate that they will ask for a contribution during the blessing. Problem is that its £20 per person and you are sort of committed by the time they ask for it. so, my advise is to respectful tell the guide that youre not interested.

title: Quite big and looks beautiful
review: Its beautiful and nice. Indian mythology had a special place for this lake and termed as "Adi Thirtha". The holy dip in the lake said to cleanse the sins committed and dip during  'Karthika Masam' is revered. Karthika masam usually comes around November.

title: Pretty lake
review: Amazed by the lake, and close the temple. I had the opportunity to see a celebration, so hear the people singing their prayers was amazing.

title: Beware !
review: Went for a day trip from Jaipur and we were really looking forward to seeing Pushkar. We were met by a guide who took us to the large Brahma Temple. We should have realised how the day was going to pan out when we were asked to pay a shop holder money for looking after our shoes and camera !!! (Fleecing number one !0 After that we were told to visit shops. When we said we did not come for shopping but to see the lake etc we were taken to see a Brahman. After a lot of quick talking and so called blessing we were taken to a booth and told to pay 11,000 rupees. At this point we turned a bit vocal and said this was not religion and not how things are done and that we would not be bullied into paying. Our guide came and eventually we gave a few rupees and left and asked the guide to take us back to our driver who could see we were not happy.

title: Beautiful sunset the day after Holi.
review: We sat and watched the sun go down after a day of walking around eating. Really beautiful and quite peaceful for India's standards.
