My girlfriend got a henna from a nice lady walking around offering the art in a tip basis only. Loads of people juggling and dancing and doing other performance arts. Nice vibe and easy to find!

title: Very Nice Place
review: Very nice place ...we had visited dec'2017 with family . Sweets were awesome , specially kachuri and Malpoa . Everyone should try .

title: Energetic place
review: This small city is absolutely recommended for visiting. After big megapolis i enjoyed peace and quiet. Area around lake is not clear but look deeper.

title: Nice place to relax
review: The Pushkar lake is a calm place to go and relax while watching the ordinary life of locals. You can not go down to the Ghats wearing shoes and also photography is prohibited (but everyone takes pictures anyway). Take a walk around through the cows, pigeons and people swimming in the lake.

title: You can find a peaceful place here!
review: Ignore the "holy" men, and anyone on the street who tries to talk to you (or give you flowers). Just take off your shoes and socks (you can carry them), and walk down on the ghats, and walk around the lake until they stop following you. It won't take long before you find a peaceful place to relax.

title: Serene lake
review: We took a guide along with us to know more about the story related to the lake . It was an enlightment for us . It's a very peaceful and beautiful lake .

title: Holy Lake
review: It is of significant religious meaning to Hindus and is used for bathing in. It's a natural spring lake surrounded by concrete buildings. I'll leave it at that.

title: Peaceful
review: It's near Brahma temple and peaceful. You can enjoy Local food here with some street shopping nearby.

title: Pretty Pushkar marred by touts and dirt
review: This little lake is quite pretty surrounded on all sides by holy ghats but marred by garbage. There is a lot of hassle to get 'blessed ' by a Hindu priest - do it so you can get your Pushkar passport ( red and yellow string around your wrist) this stops others hassling quite so much . They try to get much more than you want to give so it feels a  very suspect process  .

title: Nothing Great
review: It's an overhyped place. It's a lake surrounded by cafés, ghats, a big hotel etc. from where you can view sun going down. You cannot view the complete sunset as the buildings obstruct it. Lots of cafe around the place. Frequented by Iranians who also sing and dance during the sunset which turns the mood.

title: Relaxing stroll around the lake
review: Won't take long and it really is a nice stroll for travellers. Yes people get freaked out when a seemingly generous person who supposedly offers you a flower for free suddenly expects much from you, but just politely refuse them (only had to a couple times) and the rest is nice and enjoyable.

title: Holy Lake
review: It's a religious place. People visiting should know that it holds Hindu religious sanctity and should respect it.

title: Very Interesting
review: Just remember you have to remove your shoes if walking around ghats. Don't accept  any flowers from anyone...it's a SCAM!!! Just politely  refuse and walk away!

title: Large lake in the middle of town
review: Good place to visit once. Not clean though. Good market if you like street shopping with some good cafes like La Pizzeria.

title: Calm and cozy place
review: Pushkar lake is very calm and cozy place as you will see alot of temples on the ghats of the lake and at the evening time you can enjoy the drum show on the end side of the lake and its really amazing

title: Cleaniness required
review: The puskar lake is very dirty .people used to wash clothes and create all dirt everywhere.please i request to make it clean because this is a holy place

title: Holy lake
review: Lake connection with Hindu religion so well maintained by local people and government covers with red stone ghat.

title: Good Place
review: The lake is very religious place. Photography not permitted in this area. The nearby market is good.

title: Pushkar lake with ghats is historical
review: Nice to visit to see the culture and learn the history, good to visit with a guide.  Walking through the town to get there has some shopping for souvineers and be sure to try the traditional sweet dessert that they make along the way, a deep fried sweet that was delicious!

title: Pushy aggressive people
review: Holy my eye, argumentative and rude to the point they scared me even though I was with my husband. They get in your face about flowers(Do not for the love of god take one) and donations to the point you can't even just have a look at the lake. Go to a rooftop cafe and view it from there with some chai instead. Not a peaceful place at all.

title: Holy  and beautiful
review: This lake is such a beautiful serene place to visit. The locals come to bath every morning. People , cows, cats and dogs all come to the lake. well worth a visit.

title: Almost beaten up for refusing puja with fake priests
review: You ll want to visit the lake which is an important place for Hindus. About 10 criminals dressed up as babas will await you at the entrance of the lake. We saw how they put flowers in foreign and Indian peoples hands saying it was for free. They would escort them down the lake and perform a very short ritual. They charge a lot of rupees. I refused to go with one and just wanted to sit on the stairs. Suddenly 10 thugs came standing around me and really pressuring me for going away saying I had no respect for their religion. I said I had no interest in their businesses and just wanted to sit at the lake. One guy became really agressive and followed me the whole day in Pushkar making threats and shouting at me.  I heard this is already going on for years. Maybe you should not go to Pushkar anyway. It’s 1 big scam.

title: Be Careful !!!!
review: I'm going to be careful about the Brahmins doing the rituals. The guide will take you to the Brahman ceremony. When we reach the area to the lake. You will find Brahman clothe you sit and invite you to do rituals. Starting from the prayer as blessing. Then he will pray, then let us pray. After that he forced us to donate 10,000 rupees. My family went to 4 people. If you have to pay 10,000 rupees, multiply 4, you have to pay him 40,000  rupees . We did not donate. Now I can not stand the extortion behavior of these people. The noise was loud and went away from there. The mood and the intention to come to India to much 8 days to find good people and beautiful things. This place is offline. Be warned tourists to come here with caution.

title: Peaceful and Inviting to See People and Cows
review: The guide took me to the Lake, where I was introduced to a Holy man.

title: Holy lake
review: The last I visited pushkar was in August 2010, and the lake didn't have water and seemed dirty. This time, in January 2018, it was well filled with water and seemed much cleaner. Maintenance has definitely improved

title: Beautiful!!
review: Beautiful lake, awesome view! A must place to visit if you are in pushkar!

title: Enjoyed...
review: I visited Pushkar with my family. So we want to stay here for some time. So much peaceful place. There also many ghats. But it was very dirty place and water of lake was also dirty.

title: holly lake
review: the place to be

title: Holy lake, holy temples, holy cows...Overall very holy experience!
review: The lake, the streets and the city of Pushkar are a truly Indian experience. The lake is beautiful. The ghats are nice and clean.

title: Nice place
review: The Pushkar Lake is a nice place to get to know the Indian culture a little bit more. Unfortunately a bit too touristic, but fine.

title: November trip
review: A very nice place to have hangout with friends or family . Very nice place . Good ambience  overall a very nice place

title: Spent Hours Here
review: Pushkar lake is the most happening place in pushkar. one can spend hours sitting on the ghats here, watching people perform religious rites and  dipping in the water . Something or the other si always happening here. Its a big circle with ghats and temples and each ghat has its own name. Shoes are not allowed on the ghats.

title: Dirtly lake
review: Dirty lake because local people not aware they not promote and they only want money from tourist very bad behave by local people.

title: peaceful place
review: peaceful place relax for mind and sour surround with many ghats and market sunset from pushkar lake is great

title: Lovely
review: What I really loved about this place is that it’s so calm so relaxing and energising ! The birds are also friendly and if you hold grain in your hands they come and actually sit and feast on your palm!

title: Pleasant, calm and unmissable place in Pushkar
review: With Aravallis on one side and Pushkar town surrounding it on other three sides, the Lake has a seamless bond with the religious activities of the town, thereby imparting it a spiritual dimension! A must visit site if you are in Ajmer as it is hardly 15 kms from the city (easily accessible through RSRTC Buses).

title: Nice spiritual lake!
review: Came very early and feel the spiritual side of the Hindu religion. Always respect the feelings of our hosts... and their way of living. This religion is 500 or more years older then christianity! And this place is THE pilgrim-spot. If you are interested in Hinduism: YOU HAVE TO COME TO THIS PLACE!

title: Dirty and too much hassle
review: If you decide to go for a walk around the lake be warned...you will get hassled to death. People were demanding money off us and telling us we were being disrespectful for not giving money at a place of worship. You have to take your shoes off to walk around it. The floor is vile and we all stood in animal waste. Beautiful. The lake is also very dirty. It's a good place to get some landscape photos though.

title: Hassle because of local pandit
review: Local pandit they creat very dusty atmosphere and they demanding for money if you not give so they great inosence very hard to walking to lake area because of local pandit.

title: Noisy! Scams! Violent holy men!
review: This place is noisy 24 hours a day. The loud speakers go constantly with music and chanting. It is mainly extreme unwashed, hippy tourists here. No good restaurants. The so called holy men of the temples are violent and forceful. Lake is pretty but a place best to avoid. Much nicer places in India

title: Enjoy the Lassi
review: It highly hyped place. Water in the lake is dirty. One can find some dead fishes floating over the polluted water. On the way to Lake you will find a descent market.

title: Pushkar lake
review: Created by Brahma ji himself.It is said that one bath here makes everybody from all past sins.Located besides Brahma temple .

title: Beautiful but some people get really annoying
review: The picture of this lake made me go to Pushkar. I visited this place in the early morning and again in the sunset time. In the morning you can encounter very religious and calm sceneries like people taking a bath and praying. However, before sunset, as I was strolling alone waiting for the sunset, I met some very annoying Indian men who almost threatened me to pay for some petals saying it is a part of donation and another one who claimed that he is a youtube uploader so he wants to take selfie with me. I know these things happen a lot here but I want solo female travelers to be careful and ready for these kind of craps here. I was not expecting these so I got realy tired from walking around the lake at evening time. Still this is a beautiful and religious place you have to visit so just be careful :)

title: A very soothing feeling
review: It was long awaited visit to pushkar. Went to the lake and performed puja there with my better half. Time was evening so got to see the aarti with my family. It was a wonderful experience.

title: Full of fraudsters
review: AGAIN: DO NOT TAKE THE FLOWER PETALS FROM THE MEN AT THE LAKE OR AROUND TOWN.

title: Beautiful and Spiritual, Very Peaceful
review: This is one of the best places in Pushkar. It's beautiful and peaceful. I sat here for a couple of hours and could feel the positivity. I would recommend this place to everyone, it is a must visit place. You can go and sit near the lake in the evening.

title: Simply beautiful
review: This place gave us one of the best sunsets we have seen thus far! The streets of Pushkar can be found al around the lake. The two mountains in the back ground make for a true spectacle. We never got tired of seeing the sun go down on the lake!

title: Holy lake
review: Pushkar lake surrounded with many ghats and feel very peaceful when evening time we set on ghat of pushkar lake

title: BEAUTIFUL LAKE
review: The Pushkar Lake is surrounded by many important Hindu temples and 52 Ghats where pilgrims descend to take bathe in its sacred waters. Pushkar has become a place of Hindu pilgrimage because of this holy lake and legend of Lord Brahma.

title: Surprisingly neat and clean
review: Pushkar lake or sarovar is located right in the heart of Pushkar town.Water level was good  in December and it was clean and well maintained.Although there were lots of cows roaming around but still credit should be given to the local authorities for maintaining the place.

title: Beautiful
review: Loved the place. It has beautiful view of the sunset. Best time to go is to view the sunset. The cafe outside our also nice

title: peace and tranquility
review: take off your shoes after entering from one of 52 ghats and do the parikrama ( complete round) of the lake and catch sunset from jaipur ghat aka sunset ghat and attend aarti (prayers) at either brahma or gau ghat, do savour the malpuas and hot milk ( near gau ghat are best options) and just get rejuvenated

title: A relaxing point to see sunsets. Be careful of the many frauderes!
review: I’ve been in many small towns that surrounds lakes but this one has a little ‘twist’. It is an holy lake to the Indians so if you’ll sit on a good spot at midday (preferred with a cold drink in your hand), you’ll notice hundreds of Indians doing the ‘fuja’ - a religious ceremony, and each of them (mostly women) dress colorfully in the dominant shades of red-pink-orange. It is a classic demonstration of the difference between the cultures that westerns get to see (I’m one of them). In my opinion, it isn’t my first pick to the cultural display that India can offer you (if that is what you’re especially looking for), but it is a nice one.

title: Loved it
review: We spent an extra night here in pushkar and thoroughly enjoyed it was a real experience the people were lovely transport was good we felt safe and comfortable all the time highly recommend a visit

title: In search of the TRUTH
review: Pushkar Lake  nice place to visit, but if possible take yourself away from the crowd , sit relax and  try to connect with  yourself  and  GOD, because here the signals are perfect.

title: Heaven on earth
review: The place has one of the best sunset and sunrises I have ever seen with such tranquillity. There is nothing that can take away the charm of the bustling market and cafes around the place.  I didn't take a dive in the holy lake but views it offered were magnificent.

title: Vibrantly alive and spiritual
review: Read Mary Oliver's poem Varanasi

title: Beware of "Brahmins"
review: The lake itself was beautiful but we did not get a chance to explore on our own. Instead we were handed flowers and told that a Brahmin would perform a puja for a small donation. In the middle of the puja the Brahmin demanded $100 USD from each family member as a donation. When we told him we did not bring that amount of money or expect to donate so much in one place, he told us they take credit cards and that we are tourists and have a lot of money to give them. The so called Brahmin demanding money from us and sings about minimum donations made the whole place seem commercialized rather than spiritual and ruined the whole trip to Pushkar.

title: Good place with history
review: Nice place to visit .. but roads are naarow so vechicals can't go near by..

title: Beautiful
review: It's the best place I found in Pushkar. It's just outside Brahma temple.The place is calm and serene . Lots of pigeons are there . You can devote an hour here.

title: A must see in pushkar - cautious of scam
review: DON’T ACCEPT FLOWERS FROM ANYONE

title: Great place to spend numerous number of evenings...
review: Very good and calm place...quite popular with foreigners....must visit in Pushkar for spending evening again and again....

title: Great
review: Great very big Lake this is famous for God related things .

title: Small but beautiful place
review: We have visited this place 4-5 time as this closed to jaipur and every year we have plans to be there. This is good place to come again and again, actually this is combo with a lack, beautiful temple of Bramha ji and some beautiful resorts to stay few days.

title: Beautiful sacred lake
review: People performing rituals and cleansing in preparation for prayers at the Bhrama Temple is a common sight. The idea of cleansing oneself is developed once you step into the lake site.

title: Serene
review: Reached in evening. With lights it was looking too good . Mountains & water. Just touched feet & hands .

title: Place to take a break from your hectic travel
review: The market area is very similar to Hampi or curlies. Same flea market feel. It’s is located by the banks of Pushkar lake. Many cafes around. Lake is beautiful whereas you are not allowed to walk down the stairs towards the lake with your shoes on. You have the option of getting good hotels around Pushkar with a quality stay in reasonable prices. And I am not referring to home stay which I didn’t try. Honestly could have been cheaper but the good hotels are inexpensive too unlike Darjeeling (where the hotels are of lowest quality with extravagant prices). So Pushkar is way better if you have been traveling for long and want to take a break after visiting Jaipur Ajmer and Udaipur. No place to skate though!! You get to over hear people like any other places in India. Some like it some may call you a poser. So ignore that. Do what you are there for. If you happen to find a spot, just shred it.

title: Visit to Pushkar
review: Visited Pushkar. Terribly disappointed.

title: Marred by scammers
review: we were really looking forward to visiting Pushkar. it was spoiled by persistent men young and old insisting on Pooja and then demanding big money . We resisted the first dayand then got sucked in by someone who very nicely told us that once we had the appropriate string bracelet on our hand we would be left alone . Unfortunately the guy then got nasty when we refused to pay 2000 rupees ,i ended up shouting at it and it became very unpleasant for us . My daughter was put off going back to the lake which is filthy and has lots of dog ,cow ,pigeon and human poo on the ghats .this is a hygiene hazard without your shoes so be careful if you have no shoes .

title: Holy lake... Wonderful atmosphere
review: The holy lake is a must visit for Hindus and tourist to better understand Hindus faith. The town around the lake is crowed with Western tourists and Indians as well. There are some important rules to be respected: no shoes where forbidden (especially near the lake), no smoking, no alcohol. Have a walk around the lake at sunset: lights and sounds are lovely.

title: Underwhelming
review: Lake and surrounds were filthy, with dead fish and rubbish floating everywhere, spoiling the intent of the holy lake.

title: Witnessing the Culture
review: This lake is the heart of Pushkar. Almost all of the Pushkar is spread around this higher water body. Be it the market or any good restaurant, everything is situated near the lake. The Brahma temple is at walking distance. One can spend a good sunset by the lake. Although it is considered a sacred place for Hindus, anyone despite of their religion can visit this lake, given that they might have to over some rules such as keep your feet bare while walking on certain parts of lakeside.

title: Obvious Spirituality
review: This place has something magic and spiritual on it's own, no need for a Puja ceremony to feel that, just walk around the lake and observe, go to the sunset point for one of the most fantastic sunsets

title: Nice to see but avoid the 'holy men'
review: Pleasant enough view but you will be approached by so-called 'holy men'. Avoid them like the plague. They will attempt to separate you from your friends and family for a 'blessing' then try to extort thousands of rupees from you for 'charity'. Be polite but firm no matter how persistent they are. They will move on to another target eventually.

title: Peaceful
review: Tourism and deforestation in the surroundings have taken a heavy toll on the lake, adversely affecting its water quality, reducing the water levels and destroying the fish population. As part of conservation measures, the government is undertaking de-silting, de-weeding, water treatment, and afforestation as well as mass awareness programme.

title: Holy pond to walk around
review: Take off your shoes and go for a stroll. This holy lake has some superb temples to check out and great cafes to visit.

title: Experience the religious cultural heritage of this great Nation
review: A walk around Pushkar Lake will give any outsider a deeper perspective into the divinity latent in Indians. Be it the benevolence shown to animals and birds or the austerity with which the rituals are performed, everything about this place has the essence of India. The ghats are a bit dirty due to the cattle and one has to carry ones shoes in hand. The holy men are to be avoided and invites or directions to do x or y puja should be brushed aside. Some of these so called holy men can be rude to foreigners as was visible. This place is renowned for its hippy culture so outsiders tend to be a bit relaxed. The way some were being insulted for sporting footwear and for laughing amongst themselves was not healthy. Advise all to follow the instructions on the boards put up by the dist. administration to avoid inconvenience and ruin the fun. Do spend some time at the Sunset point.

title: 52 Ghats
review: The 52 Ghats are set around the lake, try to visit in the evening when Brahmins gather for their Puja ceremony.  Remove shoes when visiting

title: Holy water
review: As you knw we indian take holy dip but there ll be rope near steps so hold and take a holy dip as there is alge deposit on stairs nd even if you want there are small tanks where you can take dip

title: Pilgrimage t a holy place
review: The story goes that Brahma the Creator dropped a lotus and a lake appeared for its survival- waters of life for something to survive and hence Hindus from all over visit this Lake and bathes in its water to cleanse their soul- as important as the Ganges.

title: Spiritual Journey
review: Every soul that dips his/her feet in Pushkar Lake finds true peace once their soul has left the body. Don't forget tovisit this place if you're here.

title: Small sarovar
review: Its small lake full with pigeons and cows.everybody comes here for offering to lord brahma.very tough in summer

title: Nice n calm !!
review: Lake was quiet n calm but water was not very clean - needs lots of maintenance and up keeping!! Lots of cows and dogs around but overall a very calm n soothing place !!

title: Holy City
review: The city of Pushkar is located around the Holy Brahmsarovar. This city has the only Brahma temple in the world.

title: Make it a quiet place for yourself
review: Yes a quiet and sacred place if you concentrate on a slow walk around the lake. Avoid the scams and the flower sellers. Beautiful sunset from lake level. Enjoy.

title: Sunset spoilt by exhortation attempt
review: Upon my first night at Pushka a visit to the lake was spoilt by being pestered by a lavishly dressed ‘priest’ and his assistant, both of whom are keen to insist on a prayer ceremony which turns out to be an extortion attempt (by asking the visitor to pledge say £30 per family member - or something similarly ridiculous); there’s no reason to believe the money goes anywhere other than their pockets!

title: Interesting walk around!
review: There is a good circular walk around the lake, during which you will encounter small temples, animals and good views. At the near end you can watch worshippers take ritual baths whilst at the far end you can enjoy a really good vegetable curry in a café/ restaurant.

title: Busy at Festival Time
review: Was able to view lake when when pilgrims visiting at festival time. No photos were allowed. Good to see this holy place

title: Good place but avoid guide
review: We rented Ola cab for 4 hours from Ajmer and reached in about 40 minutes. As we got down at Pushkar lake parking, one guide offered his services for Rs100/- . We did not want any guide but it took some time before he stopped following us. On mid way, we were approached by another guide and at the lake also another person. The person at lake looked sobre and he convinced us that we should atleast offer some small prayer for well being of family. After small prayer, he wanted us to donate in trust for feeding the needy. When we offered Rs 100/-, they did not want to give any receipt. In short, avoid the guides.The lake is otherwise beautiful and peaceful. There are 52 ghats and one can go any ghat on his own. Overall good place

title: Relaxing place but also a Holy place so respect is needed
review: We liked Pushkar Lake very much. It was a calm oasis from the crowds as long as you go to the end away from the main entrance.

title: Dirty and full of touts
review: This was my 5th visit to Pushkar and though there was water in the pond, the overall cleanliness is very poor. Touts abound and you have to be always wary of them while visiting the Pond

title: Nothing Special
review: So this was a solo trip to Pushkar and after getting umpteen no of suggestion to visit Pushkar lake, i had my expectations really high. Went there just before the sunset so that I could catch a good view. To be honest, it is a more of a pond rather than a lake, the water isn't really clean and there is nothing much to see. You can just sit at the Lake View cafe and enjoy the sunset and may be talk to a few travelers that you might find sitting there.

title: Nice surroundings and amazing how the lake is so full despite scanty rains.
review: Visited the place and spent an hour enjoying view of the birds flying, ducklings swimming and hearing the chirping surrounding the place. Suddenly a so-called Brahman ( by looks and the way he chanted 'mantras' he did not appear to be one) came and spoiled our mood by asking us to offer respects to our fore-fathers and demanded money in the guise of offering "prasad".  So enjoy the surroundings and do not give-in such unscrupulous elements hanging around the lake.

title: Serene and beautiful at nights
review: The lake is surrounded by numerous ghats. The best views are at early morning, or vsit the deep daan at evening.

title: Sacred for some
review: The lake has significant religious meaning for the local population and they bathe in it, again for religious purposes, but the constant hassling for donations and touts all looking to separate the tourist and his money, make for a very draining and tiresome experience. I found it nigh on impossible to sit by the lake and absorb/observe some of the culture without someone approaching and looking for some money. The only opportunity for observation came at sunrise when there weren't many people there.

title: Beautiful
review: The Pushkar lake is beautiful. Went and sprinkled some water on our head. Since our experience in Haridwar, I no longer approach any pandit near any ghat. If we do, we get swindled. So stayed away from them.

title: Calm!
review: Despite of it being an important Hindu site, pushkar lake was very clean. It's ghats were also extremely clean, which was a pleasant surprise.

title: Pushkar was my favourite place in India
review: After the caos of Delhi, Agra and Jaipur Pushkar was quite calm and peaceful.  Therefore I appreciated the simplicity of the Brahma Temple and the Brahman ceremony at the lake.  Many weeks later I am still wearing the string of good luck and feeling its benefits.

title: Nothing compared to the lakes of Udaipur
review: Totally commercialised religious place where pooja is an industry. Nothing scenic about the lake. Avoidable place Pushkar and everything in it.

title: Do not miss the Maha Aarti at 6.15 p.m. in the evening
review: We went to Pushkar lake in the morning and did the pooja. The pandits ask for alot of donation, but do not give the same, unless you feel you should. Do visit in the evening also if you have time.

title: Give Pushkar a miss
review: We went to Pushkar as part of an organised tour to visit the Camel Fair. The brochures and blogs said up to 50,000 camels, horses and cattle over a two week period. Rubbish, very few camels and if you we t to photograph one, its owner was in your face demanding money. On day two we got involved in a crush with people following a religious procession. It happened so quickly that our group of 15 were separated from each other and we had to fight to stay on our feet and not fall and get crushed. By the time we all got our of the crush, six people had been robbed, one woman actually pushed backwards and robbed while trying to remain upright. The police were worse than useless - not watching the crowd - just playing with their phones!! My advice - stay away from the camel fair - it is a tourist con!!!

title: Beautiful place, don’t believe fake guides
review: The lake itself is a divine place and beautiful to look at day and night with the mountains and temples around it. The only annoying thing are the fake guides and priests who will offer you flowers and rituals. The flower guys are very aggressive and some will insult you if you don’t take their “free” flowers and engage in a ritual before they ask for money.

title: Lovely location spoiled by pushy flower sellers and 'Holy men'
review: Location is very picturesque however difficult to enjoy when being pestered. You just have to try and ignore and keep saying no.

title: Religious place
review: Pushkar lake is quiet religious place.  It is famous for "Pind Daan".  Lake is dedicated to lord Brahma. Creator of world according to Hindu belief.

title: Nice
review: We went here on our tour. Very nice and holy place for lots. Nice to sit in shade and take it all in.

title: Nice divine experience
review: Its a must visit in Pushkar. With around 50+ gates to the lake this lake offers an exciting experience especially during dawn and dusk. For photographers its a delight during prayer time, you are not allowed to take photos of people when they take bath else fine.Bit crowded, plan properly and enjoy

title: Good view, Purohits chit
review: Pushkar lake is an Excellent place to visit for view of lake and Savitri temple rope way. The Purohits ask to do Sankalp to donate . The puja done by the Purohits seems fake. Only 3 mantras , Gayatri, Gurur brahma and sarva mangale mangalya he will chant and his main interest is to do Sankalp to donate so that the jajman will not escape from donating. I felt to have been cheated . View is excellent. If go after checking internet no need to have a guide.

title: Beware of flower givers
review: Do not accept flower from the people on the street and if you do get conned into going down to the lake with them only give them 50-100 Rupees the rip off bastards  ask you for $100, they have been getting away with this in the 22 years I've been visiting pushkar.

title: Highlight of Pushkar trip
review: Go here in the evenings or early morning for the peace and quiet that this location offers!

title: Too Crowded
review: This place has a history and visited it for the same reasons. However it wasnt the right time to have visited it, as we were there during the Pushkar Mela and the place was damn crowded and dirty.

title: A gem but for the fake holy men
review: Having been to Varanasi, we expected more pilgrims and a general feel of spirituality. Shopping however is brilliant if you want Aladdin trousers and silk played brackets. Watch out for fake Holy men who pester you and will demand money for a blessing - the genuine ones ignore you but you can sit quietly with them. Sunset Cafe has best view in the evening but an early morning visit to the ghats is magical.

title: Peaceful and beautiful, always
review: This is by far my favourite place to come and people watch in Pushkar. It's always so peaceful and you can see the locals at the ghats. From the lake, you can also see the mountains and Savitri temple. Make sure you watch the night aarti by the river.

title: RELIGIOUS SCAM
review: Don't accept flowers in the hand from anyone. They lead you down to the waters edge and use their religion under false pretenses to scam you out of money. I couldn't believe how blatant and disrespectful it was. Don't give them anything

title: Beautiful but spoiled by locals
review: Pushkar as the name suggest is peaceful and you have very limited places to explore here. Pushkar lake is one of those places. Its beautiful and peaceful however only during the night else its over crowded.

title: massive pilgrim attraction
review: The lake was the centre of the pilgrimage for those attending the  important religious side of the camel festival. We are not hindu but were made welcome and encouraged to watch the ceremonies which were interesting and beautifully reflected in the lake.

title: Very poorly maintained and Unhygenic
review: I can't believe what government and tourism department is doing. Pushkar lake is such a historic and religious place where people come to bath but this place is so shabby, dirty and unhygenic that no one would like to even touch the water. This lake generates so much revenue and attracts so many foriegn toursit, I wonder what image of Indians and Hinduism would they take back?

title: Needs saving for future generations.
review: Its such a shame that this sacred Hindu holy lake  is so poorly  maintained.  The water quality is not fit for the pilgrims who come to bathe and the touts and religious scammers are scaring away the tourists who bring in good  money to the whole area.  Our guide told us we could walk along the edge of the lake if we removed our shoes, but no one wanted to walk through the animal and human excrement that littered the concrete foreshore.

title: Best with a local guide
review: We went during camel fair with a local guide, which turned out to be the best thing we could have done.  Lala, our guide, is the son of a local priest.  We entered quite a ways from the temple side of the lake and had a quiet "non-tourist" view of all the action... and an explanation of how/why the lake came to be and how it is used in many ways we were unaware of.  We were not asked for donations or approached by touts or hawkers.  Most likely because we were with Lala.  On our non-populated side, I did not notice any issues with cleanliness.  I can't find him under tour guide to write a separate review, so lala_pushkar at yahoo is his e-mail.  It's a small town and he's a popular guy.  Later at Sunset cafe on Pushkar lake, we were eating dinner and he stopped to chat with nearly every table...then pulled up a chair to ask how the rest of our day was.  The local insights made our trip.

title: Charming but aware...
review: We were there for the sunset and it’s very suggestive... Don’t believe at guys on the stairs that invite you for the ritual on the water...

title: Beautiful Natural lake on the hilltop
review: Pushkar lake is a Holy place. it has many "ghats" build by different eminent people over time. the lake is surrounded by hills and the view is real good. The only temple of Lord Bramha is also situated there.

title: A divine place
review: The Pushkar lake is surrounded by ghats on all the sides. People generally visit it for Shraddh Pooja. There are different ghats for people coming from different regions. We performed some Pooja at the Varaha ghat. The ghats are quite clean and each one had some place for performing religious rites.

title: Beautiful lake
review: The lake has significance in hindu mythology. It looks beautiful; however like all religious places, this too has dirt. Priests performing some small pujas and asking for large donations. If you pay less than Rs.1000 then you won't get a receipt. So called guide asking for money (though only Rs. 50) for giving a 2 minute history. These are some of the things one should be aware of.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful Lake. You come here in the morning, noon, evening or night. You will find beauty everywhere. Loved this place.

title: Cheap and best place for holidays
review: I was with my friends in November Pushkar is a really nice place for holiday with family as well as friends.you can enjoy night life also and day life by visiting sight seens of pushkar.at the same time you can enjoy a nice combination of indian and foreign culture in pushkar because of so many tourists.world famous the Brahma Temple is also here to make a spiritual moment.plzz try to visit pushkar.shopping is also good thing to do here I bought nice mandala tapestries,cushion covers,bags,wall hanging,from a good shop in main market name:-"shiva shop" Shiva is a really good person with a small shop small prices and good quality products.

title: Small and full of culture.
review: During the season it us heavily crowded, makes for nice experience to sit on the ghats and enjoy the lights and different people passing. The only landmark you need to know in Pushkar, everything is around it.

title: Beautiful lake setting ruined by false spirituality of some touts
review: Like many places I've visited in India, my experience of this holy lake was turned sour by people trying to make a few quid out of tourists.

title: Beware of touts and "religious men"
review: Beautiful lake that offers small sections of peace and quiet. A good spot for people watching if you can avoid the touts and so called religious men.

title: Pushkar Snan (bath)
review: Pushkar is a small town in the Ajmer District in Rajasthan. It is about 12 km from Ajmer railway station and is one of the five holy lakes (pilgrimage site) of Hindus. From railway station to pushkar the bus fare is about 20-30 rupees. During kartik purnima bathing in the Pushkar lake is considered as most auspicious. This time I got chance to visit Pushkar by the grace of God. The lake is very beautiful. after reaching at Pushkar I did bath in the lake and then visited God Brahma temple. This is only one temple of God Bhahma in the world. The place is very beautiful and full of divine atmosphere. For staying, Maheswari samaj (Dharmasala) near holi chock is a good option with swatik food facility (food without onion and garlic). One must visit such place at least once in lifetime. "Om BrahmaNe Namah".

title: Nice but dirty
review: It's a nice place and their holy place. I just wonder why they put trashes there and seems they don't care that hply places should be respected and not throwing trashes everywhere

title: Stunning setting of town with old buildings surrounding lake
review: The has a great community feel with locals bathing in lake, priest offering blessings, cows roaming, very pretty setting with buildings surrounding the lake and the market in the streets that weave around the lake, easy spend half a day exploring here.

title: Darshan and visit at Pushkar lake
review: The place was calm and less crowd as we visited little late in evening. Nice to sit besides the lake for some time as you listen to the story from the local pandits or brahmins. Donation is optional if you wish for which receipt is given too.

title: Beware the 'false' religious touts
review: Do not accept flowers and offers of temple explanations. These prelude a 'false' religious ceremony by the lake. The pressure to donate is extreme and you are threatened with religious retaliation if you do not donate around £50 (4000 rupees) It is an applauling scam playing on vulnerability and tourist respect for the local religion. The threats and bullying should be stopped by the real local religious leaders. They threatened our families as well. It is a beautiful lake but avoid any form of guided tour.

title: Very holy Hindu site
review: Belief is that if you ashes are disbursed in the Lake you will receive immediate salvation.

title: Sacred
review: Pilgrim spot so be sensitive with photos but if you are hear on a festival day the place goes off. People generally nice.  Nice sunset show.

title: The holy lake
review: Very close to Bramha Temple. So many ghats narrow bylanes full of small vendors selling various items , ideal pilgrimage site

title: A Major Attraction of Pushkar
review: Pushkar lake is one of the main attraction of Pushkar. This lake has historical as well as a mythical background.

title: Loved interacting with the Indians around the lake
review: Remember you need to take off your shoes when you walk down the steps to the lake.  If you are not comfortable going barefoot in public areas, take socks with you.

title: beautiful evening
review: i was went at pushkar lake in last week in October with my family members. all "ghats" are very clean and beautiful. ghats  looking ultimate with colour lighting.

title: Scenic Lake with Peace
review: Very stunning view and peaceful holy place. Its very close to ancient Brahma temple and walk through the crowed market area. A beautiful view during sunset. Must visit if you are in Pushkar.

title: Nice ,  except aggresive locals
review: I have been to Pushkar 35times, and it is a very easy going, spiritual , athmosphere..but I find the last years the sadus can be aggressive with their blessings, (they can shout at you if you don't give enough money !), And my people also got scolded for making photos at the lake, while my guides always say, that is not a problem..

title: Bustle and tranquility
review: After making ones way through the bustle of Pushkar town, where people, cows, motorbikes, cars and barrows vie for a piece of the street, it is a pleasure to relax looking at the tranquil lake.

title: Holy atmosphere
review: We were there during the fair. I have never seen so many people taking a bath at the early mornings. Great mystic energy. But really very crowded. You don't have to walk...the crowd wil carry you.

title: no jet ski or banana boat hire here
review: Grab a special lassi from the sunset cafe and watch the colours of the sunset engulf your eyeballs with pleasure.

title: Ok place
review: Ok, nice n quiet except the touts chasing you. The waters appear clean and there is nice lighting around

title: Like at home!
review: Yes, I would certainly recommend Suri Guest House! Very good atmosphere, everywhere perfectly clean, lovely people, very tasty food! After an extremely long travelling I choosed Pushkar as a place to rest, and I am very happy, that I intuitively booked just this place, this guest house, because I felt there like at home. Suri and Survi helped me with everything that I needed – bicykle renting, buying bus ticket, etc.... When you are alone in India, you are very happy to find such kind of accomodation so safe and pleasant, where you can really relax, enjoy and share! Thank you very much and many blessings!

title: Nice place
review: A good lake with 52 chats and serene atmosphere. One can perform Pooja and also get blessings of God if one is religious.

title: 1 day in Pushkar
review: My boyfriend and I were in jodhpur when our host was saying how awesome pushkar is. Em I give this place a three out of five.  It’s one long block,  that is super commercial, not really something we were into. The lake was nice other then some nice guys walking us into a kali crap. Making us feel bad on how much we were donating was such a scam. We were a little pissed and gave us a wrong impression about pushkar. The next day we woke up  for a early morning hike up to a temple. This  was the best part of pushkar. A awesome morning hike. Over all pushkar was very commercial and our least favorite spot we visited.  One day was just enough for us. I would say it’s a fun place to go with friends, we saw some people partying while we were heading to our hike at 5:30 am so it can be a fun place to party.

title: Holy lake
review: One of the finest holy lake. Very well maintained and going round the lake is very enchanting. Aarti of Brahma Sarovar happens daily in morning and at evening time just after the sunset.

title: Beautiful Lake in Center of Town
review: This is a nice area to walk around and see local life. People don't like it if you are taking photos so keep your camera in your bag. It's particularly beautiful for early morning walks to enjoy life on the ghats.

title: Peaceful site
review: Very beautiful, peaceful holly place especially after the visit of the Brahma temple and walk through The crowed market. Nice sunset.

title: Serene lake
review: The place is serenade , nice and very religious for Hindu . There was a big crowd of people dipping in the holy water for sanctifying their body in the morning . Worth to watch a sunrise !

title: Simply stunning
review: The best place to view Lake Pichola is to get out on a boat. If you can be there at sunset with the sun setting on the City Palace it is simply spectacular ....

title: Nice lake
review: Lake is very nice many ghat its a major attraction of the pushkar town so i can suggest a people if going to pushkar go pushlar lake area

title: Nice ghats
review: The place is good .

title: A holy experience
review: The very sight of Pushkar Lake fills devotion in your heart.   It is very much inviting and religious experience for a Hindu.  According to legend, it us believed to be created by Brahma by taking the waters of four holy places of Hindus-Badrinath, Dwaraka, Jagannath and Rameshwaram representing four corners of India, i.e. North, West, East and South respectively. The story says that while Brahma was searching for a place to do a yagna when the lotus he was holding fell from his hand and it landed in Pushkar. He performed the yagna. But when Savutri, his wife failed to join him, he married a local damsel named Gayatri and finished the formalities. But Savitri on her arrival understood things and enraged on finding Gayatri cursed Brahma saying that Pushkar would be the only place he would be worshipped. You can't find another place worshipping Brahma. The ghats nearby are so enchanting and busy with sadhus, devotees and tourists. Don't fall in the game of agents or sadhus. Just pray and return.

title: A calming place with its own unique story
review: There is a lot of mythology and lore behind how the Pushkar lake came about and I would recommend reading about it before the visit. I would also recommend that you avoid a guide because while the guide may do a good job of telling you the story, like all guides in Rajasthan, they will charge you a pittance but will ultimately take you to a place where a lot of selling is done to extract money from you

title: Clean waters and picturesque
review: This is a big lake right in the centre of the town . Good to see it neat and clean and with proper facilities . It's quite peaceful to sit here and enjoy the tranquil surroundings. Best season to come here is in winters

title: Well managed
review: I went to lake a little late so missed the eve aarti. then again i went there for morning puja. despite being ekadashi it was well managed.

title: A mysterious place
review: You can feel the place after a while when you sit on its banks. The lake is itself a place to behold. Very peaceful.

title: Excellent Pilgrimage place
review: This lake is close to Brahma Temple. Priests are available for performing Shraadh Puja (prayer) for dead relatives and also  prayer for family welfare. One has divine and tranquil feeling visiting Brahma Kund which is part of lake.

title: A big lake , but not much clean.
review: Lake is quite big and people take dip in holy lake. But lake is not clean has too much algae. take chains with you which taking a dip in lake.

title: divine
review: its holy place people take dip in the lake lake is quit big , go sit on the side of lake for some time

title: Magical moment  at the sunrise and sunset point on the lake
review: Just sitting here being a witness to all that is happening around and soak the atmosphere is relaxing.

title: holy waters
review: the lake is clean. you do puja in the lake not in the temple. there is a separate area demarcated for puja so that the water is not contaminated. no support like rods to hold on to.. only ropes. and the steps are a bit slippery. so unless an expert in swimming do not venture inside. I felt energised after just washing face and feet with these waters. some makeshift arrangements are there for ladies for dress change.

title: Tranquil Place
review: The lake and the temples provide a perfect location for the holiness of this place. However the local government should maintain cleanliness of this place particularly the road around the lake. The stray cows and dogs should be removed; they just mess up the place. Nice restaurants with a variety of national and international cuisine.

title: Pretty at sunset
review: Pushkar Lake retains some of its original beauty but sadly all the negative effects of tourism are too evident. You need to be careful of everything all the time, so not very relaxing. A brief visit was enough for us.

title: Good sights
review: Went to shoot sunset  and return quickly but the serene lake made me stay back and watch the aarti proceedings too! A beautiful place to be at.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: We visited the Brahma Temple, the only one in the world in the town of Pushkar in the Ajmer District. Our tour guide for Pushkar, Mukesh - a local explained to us the history of the Brahma Temple. He then showed us to Pushkar Lake which is a short walk from the Brahma Temple. He taught us how to dip our hands in the water and to touch our head with it, and each dip in the water to touch our eyes, ears and heart. And to pray for  whatever we ask for, followed by the throwing of the rose flowers into the water.  It was very enlightening to experience this and just being at Pushkar Lake has a calming effect. This is definitely worth a visit to Pushkar!!!

title: Just visit the lake
review: Just visit the lake but dont fall for the puja and all.. place is good no doubt but as there are things which are common in holy places, try to keep urself away from those.

title: Nice
review: This lake semed to us to be more pious and religously significant to us than the ghats of varanasi. We loved Pushkar and never felt threatened or unsafe walking the streets alone in the evening. A real nice town

title: Clean - Pushkar Lake
review: We visited the Brahma Temple this year although the temple was not very clean, the lake was very clean. We were pleasantly surprised. Worth a visit.

title: Puja with dilip pushkar guru
review: He has alot power full mantra to chant and if you do this ceremony with him will not you rorce with money.

title: Good experience - Less Crowded
review: I have been there with my female friend and it was quite good experience. Just avoid to carry heavy bag and shoes while go there. Relaxing clothes and sandles are preferred. Lake was good but when we have visited water was little dirty. Apart from it you will get some sitting spots inside shri brahma temple and it is good experience sitting there quietly.

title: Peaceful and Beautiful.
review: I've visited to many lakes and water bodies around the country including the Varanasi Ghats, but there has never been a place so peaceful like Pushkar.

title: spiritual experience
review: Our kind guide in Pushkar, Govinda, taught me everything I know about Brahma on a gath by the lake.

title: Nice place to spend the sunset
review: We went during sunset to check out the ghaats, and wow, it was amazing! After sunset, sit and enjoy the aartis from the surrounding temples.

title: Panoramic
review: It's a holy place around which most of the Pushkar is situated. The lake is big and has a nice view. The Bramha Temple is at walking distance from here. Surrounded by local market. Exhibits rich heritage of hindu culture. It's the place where people come to perform rituals to pray for the souls of their lost ones to get Peace in afterlife.

title: Is bast plece
review: We have enjoyed this town we feel  like  home  this place  we will  definitely come to pushkar Ilke we recommend  may all friends

title: Overrated
review: This holy lake in the middle of pushkar was a big anti-climax. It's ok but you can't go too near without being hassled about holy flowers, the scenery around it is not that nice - just plain buildings, so it wasn't a relaxing place to sit. Best place to see it is from rooftop of a restaurant. If you're in pushkar then go see it but don't make a trip to pushkar for the lake or temples - not worth it!

title: Pushkar lake is holy lake
review: Pushkar lake is known as a very holy lake in hindu religion in it 52 ghat queen meri also built a ghat

title: well known holy lake
review: The tirthraj pushkar having this holy lake and the only temple in the world of lord brahma has very important place in hindu religion. I truly enjoyed my visit there.

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: Just walk around the lake, around 6pm, during sunset. A blissful moment. Don't let people offer you flowers to put in the lake, you're in for a "fake tourist religious ceremony" ending with a few less rupees than you started with. Apart from that, I highly recommend you join a group of drummers, a little before sunset, bordering the lake. You'll hear them from afar. Great experience.

title: Most worshiped Lake in Hindus.
review: This lake is considered to be the oldest lake in human civilisation, as per old stories it is the most worshiped lake for Hindus, the lake is surrounded by Aravali hills all around, must visit place in pushkar.

title: Must visit place at Pushkar
review: Cover with many Ghat (Bath Place) very beautiful lake in the center of Pushkar have many Hotel on the cost of this lake two very famous temple of hindu is also there one and only Bharma Dev And Gaytri Mata Temple is there

title: Beware of People Who Want Your Money
review: Very peaceful and nice lake but couldn't even enjoy the view for a few minutes without people coming up to us and trying to sell us stuff or trying to get us to throw flowers into the lake. Very uncomfortable.

title: Serene & Pious
review: It is said that this is the only place where you will find Lord Brahma's temple. I visited Pushkar Lake and also Brahma temple.

title: amazing oasis in the city
review: the sight of pushkar lake is amazing but the overall management of the place is still not up to mark. Cleanliness of the lake and its various ghats should be the top priority.

title: One of the highlights
review: The Pushkar lake was the top priority to cover while we were staying in Pushkar. There are a lot of ghats covering the lake from all sides. You have a nearby market to shop, eat and relax.

title: A must visit place for atleast once in a lifetime
review: The lake itself is not really worth going to but the historical and religious importance of it makes it a must go to place.

title: Two nights enough
review: A nice place to stop and chill on a busy holiday but the lake is dirty and you have to remove your shoes to walk around through bird and cow pop. If you've been to the Taj and got shoe covers keep them to go to the lake. The market has some good souvenirs and there are nice places to eat but 2 days would be plenty.

title: Pushkar Sarovar
review: The Aarti and the Parikrama are essential, a dip is also recommended. No shoes and no photography is allowed, and for good reason.

title: Good but depends on the time
review: Need to visit this place when there is no rush, other wise you can't enjoy the walk around the ghats.

title: spoiled visit
review: All around Pushkar people welcome you and offer you some petals of the holy flower which will bring you good luck if you throw them into Pushkar lake.

title: Center pushkar
review: A lake very close to brahma temple. Lake was very peacefull many people was there for their spreatual prayer.

title: Crowded Divine place
review: Pushkar lake is a place surrounded by some holy religious temple & lots of people who come to there for religious purposes. When I visited this lake area it was overall interesting experience for us.

title: beautiful lake
review: AWESOME multi-cuisine  food and good shopping area.beware of the local guides and pundits who force you for POOJA

title: Nice place, but too much sellers and scammers
review: The lake is nice, but I expected more.

title: Temple & Market area surrounding the lake
review: One of the most revered water bodies in the country but was quite sad to see it so poorly maintained.

title: Blessed place
review: Situated on the bank of this sacred lake is the only temple dedicated to Lord Brahma in the world. This is a deep spiritual place where thousands of people visit daily. Nearly is temple of Mata Savitri on a hill, where one can reach through Udai khatola. One can also enjoy camel ride.

title: Mr. Sattu is the driver/guide you want for Pushkar.
review: So what to say, this gentleman was amazing. He took me to every corner of Pushkar and even towards more quieter spots where tourists don't tend to come through, which also meant I wasn't hassled by people trying to sell me items.

title: Awesome
review: this place is awesome one of if not the most holiest cities in India Pushkar has the only temple in the world devoted to Lord Brahma

title: Nice but touristic
review: Nice lake but touristic. Just go to a rooftop restaurant and the joy the view. That is the best to do.

title: holy place  feel  blessed
review: a  lake  with surroundings many tample.  and  many  priest there .market is very cheap then other place. all over good

title: Visit But Be Warned!!
review: This is the only place we have visited so far where our guide gave us strict warning/advice re beggars and hawkers. You will be offered flowers, do not take and of engage in conversation, another trick is to offer a newspaper and the flower appears from it after you take, once any of these happen you will be hassled for money.

title: Pretty but not much to see
review: The lake is beautiful, as is the view over onto the mountains. But there are obviously lots of people (mainly men) bathing here and it made me feel uncomfortable to be around that as a woman. There are quieter sections of the lake which are nice to sit and meditate or just enjoy the surroundings, but they're not instantly obvious.

title: Must visit
review: Pushkar Sarovar is located in the town of Pushkar in Ajmer district of the Rajasthan state. Pushkar Lake is surrounded by 52 bathing ghats (a series of steps leading to the lake), where pilgrims throng in large numbers to take a sacred bath, especially around Kartik Poornima (October–November) when the Pushkar Fair is held. A dip in the sacred lake is believed to cleanse sins and cure skin diseases. The lake view is breathtaking and romantic. Pls dnt pay attention to any guide who will say he will guide you to Pushkar lake and other places in 30/-Rs to 50/-Rs and if you hire them they will take you to the purohit for pooja. Bcoz after pooja you will be forced to give 2100 for prashad of pooja. And if you dnt pay they become aggressive so better not to pay attention. There would be many people around the lake and would try to con you on anything...beware of them.

title: Sibling get together
review: Surrounded by hills and man made steps you can come and take a dip in the holy water of Pushkar Lake but the water is not clean. You will have to take a shower later. Shower area is not available near the lake. You will come across a lot of pundits who would want you to do puja but it is up to you to agree as it will cost some money. The place can be crowded please take care of you belongings. Nothing much to do hear but you can sit down and have some quite moment for yourself.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Loved the place..its clean ..strict rules state no shoes and no eateables allowed, which is good in a way..you can sit for hours on the ghat..so peaceful

title: Avoid
review: A beautiful lake ruined by false holy men, who ask you if you want to drop a flower in and say a prayer for your family and them demand unreasonable amounts of money e.g. 100 us dollars. We said no and he got aggressive but we stood our ground and quickly walked away. He didn't follow as he knew it was a scam. I would just avoid it or go late evening when there are less scammers/ just ignore them. These people are not holy and are a disgrace to what should be a holy city

title: Be careful of getting duped
review: This lake is beautiful and well maintained, but be careful about the people who act friendly and offer to pray but in the end, expect money from you. There is a big group of people and they approach you by giving a flower to put in the lake, but then come with a plate is flowers and start the prayer.

title: Beware of pushy men wanting donation
review: The lake is a cool experience but you will be approached to do a ceremony for luck in which they are VERY pushy for a monetary donation... I hate that! Just tell everyone you have already done the ceremony and enjoy the lake!

title: Lake
review: If you are in pushkar must visit at pushkar lake it is very close to Brahma Mandir.  Must take a bath here.

title: Watch out for scams
review: A man in the street near the lake gave us some flowers and insisted that we followed him.  When we got there we were all 'blessed' by a 'holy man' for a few minutes and then asked us to pay 2000 rupees for good fortune for each family member, when we said no they became very hostile and annoyed.

title: Visit the ghats
review: The ghats and the lake give an amazing view at the time of sunrise. The sunrise is beautiful to see with the birds and the reflection the sun and the nearby small hills in the lake. The sounds from the nearby temples makes it even more mesmerizing.

title: Beautiful but beware!!!
review: Literally dropped off in pushkar and within moments being handed rose petals and told there is a lake festival and we must go! Wanting to go later as full of bags, completly ambushed into going via the lake, where we were made to sit separately and the ritual done ( no festival at all) then told to donate and expect a minute if £10 per person... Or not.  We did not work at that, not enjoyable as totally forced into situation with our big bags hot and sweaty, we gave a small donation just to leave.  Returned on another time alone now with our wrist bands and refusing to take petals off anyone and much more pleasant.  Be sure to leave your she's at the top of the steps.  Lovely lake and lovely view shame experience was hindered slightly.

title: Beware of Cons
review: There would be many people around the lake and would try to con you on anything...beware of them.

title: A Mystic water!!
review: Pushkar lake is even more significant than the temple. One should sit on the shores of the lake and listen to its significance.  Really one can feel mystic power in the water.

title: Pls dnt hire any guide or pandit
review: Pls dnt hire any purohit for pooja. Bcoz after pooja you will be forced to give 2100 for prashad of pooja.

title: "Most important Teerth"
review: Its my first time in Pushkar and i also do pooja at Pushkar Lake and their i came to know its one of the most important teerths for Hindus. Enjoying holy dip in lake and really felt blessed.

title: Beautiful & peaceful
review: Well built and maintained lake! One of the very few religious places, which is maintained clean. Was lèss crowded and very peaceful. Have a holy dip to get tge creator Brahma's blessings!

title: Lake with religious significance
review: The lake is located near Brahma temple and is a part of rituals followed before visiting the temple. Pandit normally conducts puja near lake and then organize visit to temple.

title: Holy Dip
review: Pushkar lake is located close to Pushkar temple in Pushkar, Rajasthan.  Pushkar lake is a holy lake and a dip in the waters of this lake is considered auspicious.  Devotees usually take a dip in the lake and then visit the temple to worship Lord Brahma. The lake is kind of ok but there is room to improve its maintenance.  There are several pandits available along the bank of the lake to help you offer prayers - usually prayers to ancestors' soul peace.  Be careful to not get cheated by Brahmas demanding a lot here.

title: Holy Dip
review: We have visited the place again this month to perform some pooja. The atmosphere is very pure and peaceful.We had done pooja near the ghat and took holy dip at the lake. Excellent place to visit.

title: Scam on the way to Udaipur
review: Complete waste of time and money. Everyone in India is pushing for tips but these Brahma demanding money for your family and put you in a very uncomfortable position where you have to give money. Be prepared to donate at least $100/person if you believe Holy man can be disappointed and displeased at the donation you're comfortable giving. The view and the architecture was not impressive at all, you'd be better off spending extra time in Jaipur.

title: Nice place with number of Ghats
review: The Pushkar lake is surrounded by 52 ghats and gives a divine feeling when you visit. The time i visited was not of rush hour. so it was quiet.

title: AVOID. Don't come here
review: Like all in India locals are really good at taking your money because of their religion , this is a scam and the place is not that pretty. Again DONT COME HERE, safe yourself money, time and energy

title: Care full with "rituels"
review: Same like many peoples said, if someone  gives you flowers and then ask you to follow him, DO NOT DO. They'll say  that it's almost an obligation to give a donation to feel free and walk around the lake (or the town). They are crook and use their convictions to rip peoples off...a sham.

title: Tour to plsced
review: Avoid

title: Pushkar Lake.
review: Be ready to be very assertive with the scammers trying to push you to donate to "charity" claiming it takes over 1,000 rupees to feed one person for a day and other such BS.  Once past this nuisance, the lake is wonderful and the families and real people visiting and bathing in the lake were very welcoming.  Great experience.  Remember to check your pockets before bathing in the lake so you don't accidentally bless your passport with holy water like I did.  Will probably be one of my favorite memories from my trip.

title: Beautiful and romantic
review: AmaZing for sunset and sunrise, when we reached the lake we both said this was our favourite place we'd been to in India so far.

title: The center of attraction
review: Pushkar is situated in a beautiful valley at the spurs of the mountain range Aravali. On the rocks Hindus built temples. Almost each of them offers beautiful views of the city and lake. Now, the lake, not rocks is the main and most notable in Pushkar. All life in the city is connected with the lake. It is surrounded by houses and many sacred temples, along its shore are built the bathing Ghats for pilgrims, here are  concentrated hotels, guesthouses, cafes and all trade. And everything here is beautiful – not the water in the lake, which "blooms" and sometimes is really dirty, but the picture of attracting  of Pushkar's the small world to its center which is undoubtedly the lake.

title: Lake are good but managment at lake side pandit they are fraud.
review: Pandit they managed the lake side management they are fraud but lake is so beautiful and sunset view from lake so beautiful...

title: Beautiful ghat surrounding
review: Holy pushkar lake covered with surrounding of beautiful 52 ghat , lake is stunning ans filled with holy clear water

title: Cool
review: Lake was very close to brahma temple. Many people come there to do pooja. Evening time was amazing to see a artists.

title: shanti place
review: It's very shanti and came place. but there are some cheaters who ask money after puja. so beware of them.

title: The sacred lake of the Hindus
review: Pushkar is built around the lake, has a very interesting history and is very attractive. Around the sacred lake takes place bustling the life. Pushkar Lake is one of the most sacred pilgrimage destinations for the Hindus in India. There are ten important ghats. The Lake is very close to Brahma Temple, a lot of people is around there, animals ..... Easy to reach. Many restaurants with Indian and non Indian foods. It is interesting and exciting, must be visited.

title: Superb lake
review: Very peaceful lake to spend time. Best time to visit here at evening.  Many local people and foreigner visit here to spend quality time.

title: Magical place - beware of Babas
review: A beautiful place to be seen from all angles. There are so many ways to enter the lake and walk around it, be mindful of locals who try to charge you for entrance to the "best spot" as you can simply access it all from any side street etc.

title: Amazing but watch out
review: Lake is amazing I washed there many times and very special to go around midnight there's no one there! So safe and so amazing to have it all for yourself. DO NOT JOIN A CEREMONY ON THE LAKE !!! 99% it's fake they have a team of about 20 people and the make it look very authentic in a way that you say there's no way it's a fraud !!  There's no one that goes there and suppose to approach you or tell you he doesn't want money and there's a ceremony on the lake. Real holy person doesn't go and ask random people at the lake to join a ceremony even if it looks super authentic. And if you fall  for them ( I did) somehow (they are good at what they do) remember you do not have to give them anything they will never do anything just raise your voice and they leave. That's what I did  ..I got up and really raised my voice suddenly you see 7 to 8 people getting up from different places and leaving !!

title: beautiful lake but too much commercialize
review: Pushkar lake is so beautiful but this lake was to commercialize and local pandit not helpful and supportive for tourist

title: Holy lake
review: Lake was very closest to Brahma temple must visit at this beautiful lake. Some pandits always available here to do pumas.

title: clean property
review: the lake is very pretty. people said that this lake was made by god brahma and very close to brahma temple. many restaurants available there with indian and foreigner foods options.

title: Very Peaceful Place!!!
review: Must see Pushkar Raj.This is unique hindu religious site to visit. Here you find great peace. Sunset view is just amazing. And evening worship was also a great pleasure and peace.

title: Where the Gods live ...Beautiful Pushkar
review: Sunrise over the sacred lake of Pushkar ...where a sense of peace washes over you and the positive energy enters your soul .Pushkar is where one can go and escape the chaotic energy of India .Spectacular sunrises greet you every day .Here the locals are genuine and friendly .Daily festivals and rituals enchant and one can wander around the lake contemplating their amazing visit to India .Every day Pushkar lake offers wonderous scenarios unlike anywhere else in India .I stayed in this sacred place for 5 weeks ...healing my body and soul from the journey I had experienced in India .A sense of wonder at the history that surrounds the lake delights ones vision every day .Cows, dogs,monkeys,birds,humans all live together embracing the calm waters of the lake . Evening walks show you a peace that is not found anywhere else and the energy of the Gods makes Pushkar Lake a must see whilst in India .Do not rush through this sacred place .Take time out to reflect on where your journey is heading...where you have been and soak in the present .I left my heart in Pushkar .My favourite place in India .A place I will always return to as it is of another world...far removed from any place I have ever been .

title: Beautiful lake with 52 ghats
review: Lake is so beautiful but the lake side many Pandit they cheat the tourist and traveler and misbehave with tourist.

title: Brahma Sarovar  (Lake)
review: A beautiful HOLI sarover in the heart of pushkar. Lot of Local and foreigner  tourist roming around Sarovar. Pilgrim take bath for remove negative energy. Sunset also views at evening on sunset point.

title: Spritual place
review: Pushkar raj... name says it all ..all positive vibes as you reach to this small village...food culture bazar tradition...awsum

title: Marvelous Scenery of Pushkar Lake on Feb.
review: In feb I have seen Pushkar and going there especially Pushkar Lake and The Lord Brahmah Temple which is one Temple of Brhma ji on the World. Pushkar is the Spritual Capital of Rajasthan. There are many temples in the boundry of Pushkar. Pushkar lake is one of the big lake of Pure water in Rajasthan.

title: Sacred River
review: It is one of sacred lake in Pushkar district of Rajasthan and has 52 ghats around it.It has a good views with relaxing atmosphere.

title: One of the sacred lakes of the Hindi religion
review: Due to our tour in the Golden triange, my friend and I visited Pushkar on March 29, 2017. This is a sacred lake of the Hindus. Also is of the five most sacred pilgrimage destinations. It is believed that when the lotus petals fell from the hands of the Hindu God of Creation, Lord Brahma, the Pushkar Lake was created.

title: Holy lake
review: Lake is really beautiful we reached there at evening. Aarti time is really awesome many peoples reached there to enjoy.

title: Short trip to pushkar and the lake
review: I went to visit the small city.

title: Beautiful, but surrounded by a flower-blessing scam
review: A very cool attraction, with impressively grand architecture, although there is a large colusion amongst young locals to give you a free flower and then follow up by insisting on a donation.  They basically put it in your hand, and in our experience became agitated when we denied.  It's a little silly.

title: Evening time view and ambiance a lake side so nice.
review: i visit pushkar lake evening time that time some culture activity help at gawaliar ghat side area lake is so beautiful ghat is very nice and maintain by local administration. sun set at evening time is stunning.

title: Clean Ghats
review: Pushkar Lake has many ghats and is very clean. The priests do not take money to do ceremonies as any donation you want to give is put in a donation box and a receipt is given to you.

title: Good sunset
review: We enjoyed the sunset there but got a bit annoyed when some people tried to ask if we wanted to smoke.

title: Puskar lake
review: Merveillous, spirit place, we Love,, rest time, temples place,, beautiful small city, good to stay one week,

title: Beautiful ! But beware of 'blessing' scam.
review: The lake itself is beautiful and I loved my experience in Pushkar overall. I would definitely advise going here to do some shopping, enjoy chai with the locals and eat amazing food in one of the calmer cities of India. HOWEVER the only thing to watch out for is men handing you flowers and sitting you down to give your flower blessing to the lake.

title: Worst local crowd
review: As beautiful and divine the place is as worst and unsecured the local crowd and shopkeepers are.

title: "Pushkar"
review: Very peaceful place in India. During Sunset it's a great wonderful environment. People do worship on the lake....

title: Superb place in pushkar
review: very close to my resort hardly 5 minute walking distance clean and beautiful lake with many ghat and evening -time time best to visit this place.

title: must visit once
review: The lake looked serene and peaceful and very exotic. Several restaurants around the lake. Many people try to scam you so be aware.

title: Sacred Dip
review: This lake is located besides Pushkar Brahma Temple. The water of this lake is considered to be very auspicious.  Devotees usually take a dip in the water of this lake and then visit the Brahma Temple. On the bank of the lake, you can see several pandits along with Devotees helping them offer prayers.  There is lot of scope to improve the maintenance of the lake.

title: Lake to Spend Time with Love One
review: Lake to Spend Time with Love One at peaceful time must visit. You can get some snacks from outside. Don't through any garbadge, Polly packs, Make India clean.

title: Historical and very Religious aspect to Pushkar
review: A great and interesting experience but you do need a guide to explain the history and magic of the lake and surrounds.

title: Lost its glow
review: I can well imagine that the Pushkar Lake must have been fantastic years ago. Today it is quite polluted and I cannot imagine anyone going into the water voluntarily.  The streets around the lake are lined with little shops, many selling tourist souvenirs. Seems the the "hippie" era is still alive and well here.

title: Has several ghats
review: This lake is a large lake located close to Brahma temple.  This lake is said to be made by Lord Brahma himself and it is considered very sacred.  There are several ghats on this lake.  Devotees can descend downstairs and take bath in the lake at any of these ghats.  There is an aarti performed at the lake in the evening.

title: No I don't want any good luck flowers....
review: The lake is very pretty on a hot day. Beware of the usual pushers...have some good luck flowers throw them in the lake that will be 10000 rupees...yawn....didn't fall for it...need to say no with zest though.

title: big Hindu religious tourist point
review: many Hindu tourist come to pushkar lake and covered with many ghats and local people at temple side not sportive but as a destination pushkar lake so beautiful.

title: Peaceful
review: So peaceful and relaxing place, please respect the rules of the place as it's a sacred lake for Hindu faith.

title: Very clean and holy at the mid center of pushkar
review: Pushkar lake is very clean and surrounded with 52 beautiful ghat where hindu religious peopel do worship and take holy dip at the lake side and sunset view from the ghat area is very nice & ghat side sunset restaurent is good option for light food.

title: Clean and Peaceful
review: We travelled quite a bit from jaipur in the sun just to visit this lake and it was worth.. This place gives a different feeling altogether.. We sat on the lakeside for quite along and enjoyed its serenity.. People were taking bath in the lake and doing puja.. The temples are also quite nice.. But we enjoyed most is the lake..

title: Nice & Clean
review: The Sarowar as it is called in a big lake. It is a beautiful plave to vist in the evening to watch sunset.

title: Nice place to walk
review: Puskhar is built around the lake, one of the attractions of the city. At the end of the lake you can find live music in the night.

title: holy lake
review: very close to brahma temple. crowdy palace. easy to reach. many restaurents with indian non indian foods

title: Holy lake
review: Holy lake located very close to Brahma temple. Water was very clean. Many people always there. Evening aarti must watch.

title: beware manipulation here
