review: don't get pressured into "donating" towards a religious cause you have no desire to support. men here, and around the lake will offer offer you flowers and guide you towards the lake where you will be hounded for a large donation in return for the privilege of praying.

title: Sacred Lake of Pushkar
review: Key attraction of Pushkar is Pushkar lake, different ghats to explore.  Totally peaceful atmosphere. Perfect palace to practice meditation.

title: Interesting place
review: This is a religious place. Surrounded by ghats (series of steps leading down to a body of water, particularly a holy river) it is a place of pilgrimage. Very nice view of the city also. You have to take off your shoes to walk.

title: The beautifull lake
review: This lake is the holy place in thr pushkar... it is located at the centre in the pushkar..

title: Pushkar lake is the best
review: It is a best place in pushkar ... And having a awesome view...

title: Not great !
review: The lake is dirty and a lot of holy activities keep the tourists engaging during evening time.

title: Magical Lake.
review: This is a wonderful lake and a great location to experience some magic. Some people come to this location to bath in the holy water while others come for a blessing. Even if you don't believe in the blessing it is a bit of fun.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Loved this religious palace surrounded by many ghats. Evening Aarti time was amazing  We saw many foreigners are spending there time here.

title: Holy Lake
review: Pushkar lake side ghat and evening time sunset is stunning I like to sit on pushcart lake ghat it's very amazing and relax for mind.

title: Full of fakes
review: We were warned in the guide books and various forums beforehand about the amount of fake priests etc wandering around trying to get a few rupees from unsuspecting tourists. It's apparent from the moment you set foot in the perimeter. The surrounding markets are full of more genuine and friendly locals but if I were you, I'd give the actual lake a wide birth.

title: Religious
review: Pushkar lake is a great and holy place but should remember it's a place of business for many . There are guides which start 51 rupees then u Aarti thaali of 21 and then comes the main vilan pandit who asks for donation of 1100 or 2100 or 5100 be vary of it do it as per will .Reach before 6.30 pm before Arti .....

title: Just dont speak with the Priests
review: Pretend if you can that you cannot understand what the priests are talking. Else they will charge you in the name of God. Just good to visit for few minutes as nothing much is there, you may enjoy when the Pushkar Mela, Festival is ongoing. Plenty of Eastern Europeans, just loitering around there for nothing. Go find, what they do there.

title: This is the place for Inner Peace
review: I went here agin & again while my trip to pushkar. In fact its so peace here that you will not even feel to talk to ur nearby person no matter who so ever it it. In my entire journey of 03 days, I went everytime here & felt my soul. Even writing this review is feeling like to go once more here. I must say that this place has some real connection with God & real peace.

title: Holy & Peaceful view. Beware of touts!!
review: The lake is surrounded completely by more than 80 ghats each with significant name and meaning. Photography strictly prohibited here in day time usually crowded by devotees taking dip and doing pooja. Beware of ppl offering free pooja by lake and insists you to take as it is must in Pushkar. Later they lure you for money in name of guru dakshna. Westerners are asked for more money and they behave rude at end. Best time to stroll around and take amazing pics are early mornings. Visit for sunrise when it has less crowd.

title: Average trip
review: Journey is better thn the destination....so true about this lake. The lake and temple are although very beautiful but the crowd , mismanagmnt , no basic arrngmnt and facilities for the visitors make the experience end with a bad memory. Governmnt should pay more attntion towrds it

title: Holy palace
review: It was very peaceful journey Lake was located at center of pushkar.  There are many Ponds for every cast.  Best time to visit here in early in the morning.

title: The lake lends its name to the coty
review: We came to find out that the city of Pushkar is named after the lake. It is very scenic and the pundits at the lake were also knowledgable. This is a sacred Hindu place and is of significance since this is where Brahma (the creator) is said to have performed a yagna!

title: Very peaceful
review: Pushkar lake is one of the best lake in india nice views and clean water one of the most religious place in india.

title: Serene, peaceful and holy place
review: This is my favorite place in India, and probably the world. Surrounded by the Holy ghats and a really important place for pilgrims, this is the place in which bhrama the creator was created, and so according to hindu mythology is where it all began. It definitely feels like a special place, and despite the busy markets around and the bustling town full of motorbikes, tourists, international traders, pilgrims, beggars, locals and everything in between, the lake itself is so respected and sacred that it remains totally peaceful all the time. People come from all over India to bathe in its waters and the full moon puja over the lake is beautiful. Highly recommended!

title: Best palace
review: It was my first time to see lake where I found peaceful evening with many fragrance. There are may foreigner was spending there time. But worst part of lake is local people was demanding money and they are forcing.

title: Watch out for the 'priests'
review: Pushkar lake is beautiful and an active religious place for Hindus. However, be aware of the 'priests' that will complete the flower prayer ceremony with you, then ask you for a donation. They pressure you into giving way too much for a donation, and keep asking for more.

title: Beware of the fake priests
review: This is s beautiful holy lake. However, you will be accosted constantly for money. My advice is not to take photos when people say "take photo of me" they will demand money. You will also be offered flowers and sweets to place in the lake. They give these to you then get aggressive for money, often demanding 500INR minimum! Avoid taking anything!

title: Great Lake, be careful of the 'donations' after being blessed
review: Amazing lake to walk around, so beautiful and special.

title: Located besides Brahma Temple
review: Pushkar Lake is located besides the Brahma temple in Pushkar. The ghat on this lake is used by devotees to take bath with the lake water before visiting the temple.  The dip in this lake is said to be auspicious. There are several prayers held on the ghat.  The lake can be better maintained.

title: Spritual water
review: The lake of pushkar is nearby brmha temple,a lot of people came here and take away God's blessings.nice place to see

title: If you are in the area do not forget to visit it
review: Very nice place to visit... it is probably one of the most authentic, and "connecting" things you can see.

title: LOVELY
review: When we went to Pushkar lake a priest did a small ritual which was lovely. Its a holy city so be careful not to offend with your dress. Pushkar is the only city we visit in our tour that we were not harassed by people selling on stalls. Lovely experience

title: holy lake
review: this is a holy lake and many indian deotte holy dip atthe pushkar lake surroung of lake side 52 ghat and all ghat belong to different differnt caste .

title: Very peaceful and relaxing place
review: Very peaceful place and water is clean and  it's a biggest religious destination for Hindu myothlogy people and I like pushkar lake are a lot

title: Went for a dip:)
review: Met an Indian man who convinced my girlfriend and I to dip our full body in the lake several times for good luck:) , was the usual scams of take a flower and give a donation but we didn't fall for it

title: Beautiful Pushkar Lake
review: Pushkar Lake  devotee to Hindu mythology people pushkar Lake covered with 52 ghat and evening time Aarti is mind blowing.

title: Must visit place in Ajmer
review: Only place for Brahma's worship, intresting place to know and to visit, It was a peaceful feeling while sitting near the lake and watching the people worshipping.

title: Great for sunsets
review: Puskar is built around the lake,and is a tourist led town,with narrow streets,and all the usual tourist shops,be aware of the motorcycles that wiz along seemingly unaware of pedestrians!Also be aware that the area is a holy place so respect their beliefs.But gather around the lake at sunset and just enjoy,then walk back through the town and see all the hippies trying to look cool?

title: Shame it is spoiled by scams!
review: This place is beautiful and steeped in history, but beware of the locals trying to 'bless you' in the lake as this is a scam to extort money from you.

title: no comprehende
review: Dont really grab the concept here, its an holy place for Hindus, so why has an holy place for Hindus become a market for selling all sorts of tat, this is about as holy as a car boot sale. This is what religion is all about,$$$$$$$$. The lake itself, a petal dropped from a  lotus flower from the creator, Brahma, to form  a lake in the desert , uhm. Whatever, its an extremely chilled out place to be, and l was very happy to  be here and recouperate. More than 3 days would put in the " lve got all Nick Turners stuff,man.", brackett. Its for them that like mellow out.

title: Nice
review: Good atmosphere here good vibes good energy . Here good cafe Meeting point and good view and louts cafe good .holy lake

title: Nice place, but tarnished by the scams.
review: First, if you are planning of visiting here, please go to the Brahma temple first and receive your blessed flowers etc, apparently that is the correct way! This should also help you avoid many 'holy men' who circle the lake offering blessings to everyone. They are very persistent and try to get you to make a hefty donation.

title: Amazing sunset
review: Pushkar lake was an ideal break from the chaos that is the golden triangle. Everything  makes Pushkar a relaxed place to visit and relaxing by the lake and taking in the sunset was a highlight for us when there.

title: Good place
review: One can reach this place via taxi or bus.this place is situated at about18 km from Ajmer.this place is near to Brahma temple.this is very good place but take care when going to lake because floor in lake is sleepery

title: Stunning lake
review: A quaint little town just 20/30 minutes drive from Ajmer. The lake is beautiful - I'd recommend taking a cable car up to the Brahma temple and watching the sunset there. There is quite a big Israeli influence there and a lot of restaurants do western food in case you don't fancy Indian. I found that a lot of the people are genuine and very hospitable. Would highly recommend.

title: Meh... I'd say you can skip it
review: Pushkar is small and has a lot of expat, hippy tourists just hanging and smoking out. The only thing it has more of is cows.

title: Mesmorizing Sun Set views.
review: Strolling along the ghats of the pushkar lake in the evening,  is somthing one should never miss in Pushkar.

title: Religious and historic place being abused
review: We were warned by our taxi driver NOT to take on any of the local guides. The driver said it was a rip off. It certainly was. One guide said he would simply explain the history of the place for Rs 20 (there were four of us) and told us offerings cannot be done at the temple. We took him on as we definitely wanted to know a bit more about the history. After giving the short rundown, he tried to convince us to offer a prayer at the lakeside. We refused which he did not take too well. Basically they get a tip for every tourist they convince to sit down with the priests. This is really a rip-off. Do some reading on the place and just walk through. The guides add no value. The walk around the market area and the temple were still fun and very interesting.

title: Very relaxing and spiritual place!
review: The lake is a very nice place to spend some time, observe local people wash their troubles and look at the gates. A must place in Pushkar

title: Underwhelming
review: Yep this has to be one of the most disappointing sites in Rajasthan.  Seriously the lake is tiny but the worst thing about it is all the con artist performing the "Pusher passport scam.  This is where they give you a flower take you down to the lake get you to recite some incantation in Hindu....saying you promise to give them money....then they ask you for a donation and it's not a small amount either...oh this is demanded with menaces with a whole load of their thugs right by you.   The worst part of this is that the police know all about this but do nothing about it.

title: very attractive for photos and dip
review: its very nice to visit during early morning time , take best photos and take care of persons who wants to do pooja or prayers and asking for money , take care of them rest all nice to visit

title: Great view! Westerners are constantly bothered..
review: It's a spectacular place to see and enjoy the view. Difficult to walk around or approach the lake - there are people constantly trying to sell you flowers and convince you to participate in the rituals, no chance to sit alone, rules and restrictions, less chill than for example ghats in Rishikesh.

title: Very pretty lake. Beware of guides though who do not allow you to go the temple
review: The entry to the temple town is stopped by guides saying they will show you around for as less Rs.50. They take to the lake first which is very large and beautiful. However ones main aim is to visit the Brahma temple and then the lake. Beware of these boys giving you a prasad thali and then asking you to offer the same with some pandit who then makes you go thorugh a shortcut Shradha kind of routine. In the end asking you to donate 1100 and above. They emotionally blackmail you into committing some amount.

title: Rather disappointing
review: It was a dull day and the water was grey and dirty. I can appreciate it's not our religion and we can't understand the holiness of it all. We were constantly hassled for money, to buy things and make donations and it was very wearing, which probably affected our attitude.

title: Lovely clean place
review: Pushkar is a lovely place to visit with one night stay. All around lake, the lake itself and the township is very clean. Spend some time in the evening at the sunset point.

title: Totally fleeced by self proclaimed priests
review: We had been here with family. The guides and the brahmins here work as a team. It all started with a 11 rs pooja thali we purchased for paying our respects to the divine lake. Next events happened in a drill... A brahmin wearing white comes. Takes ur thali males u sit on the banks and proceeds to say all mantras. All this happens so quickly u hardly have time to think we had never requested for one... It all ends with the brahmin demanding we pay thousands of rupees for brahmin bhojan... The demands then turned to threats.... Bitter lesson.

title: Tourist traps
review: the whole area is a turist trap with souvenirs and people who just want money. Stay away from people who will give you flowers for the lake.

title: Just ok
review: Lot of guides roam around with Nexus with local priests  and local shops .. they will create that environment that you will get forced to do puja and give donations and fee for priest service.

title: Lots of cows and hippies wandering around...
review: While Pushkar lake may hold a special place for local Indian residents, the main populants during my visit seemed to be cows and dirty hippies roaming about. It's a topical place for tour guides to take their guests, but not very memorable.

title: Nice place but as usual bad rituals...
review: I always found Pushkar a nice place to visit and Pushkar lake the best of them. I sincerely feel peace whenever i am there. But as usual, local pandits, their God fearing rituals and practices are something that  i don't like. Why can't it be more professional and really cultural? Why is it always about money and not the actual worship?...people, places and everything eventually than loses meaning and that's what i don't like. Overall if you don't want to be their prey and just visit the lake and Pushkar for your spiritual insights, go for it.

title: City of Hippies
review: The city lacks cleanliness. However there are few small cafes offering mouth-watering food, which you can try. Otherwise no such attraction apart from the Lake. Which again has no hygiene. Cows and their favorite thing is all over.

title: nice place to relax in the evening
review: If you wish to sit back ad relax and watch the sun go down...this is the place. nice music being played in the background by some visitor or a local. you can watch ducks and other birds here.

title: Underwhelming
review: Probably the best part of Pushkar but I found the whole town disappointing. You can easily circumnavigate the whole lake in an hour or so walking from one ghat to the next - carry your shoes with you. There seems to be quite a carnival atmosphere by the Sunset Cafe late afternoon and into the evenings.

title: sacred but not pristine.
review: a lake situated in center of the city named on this lake. you got there and took a holy dip in it then it is considered that its similar to taking a dip in ganga.

title: Serene and clean
review: The lake is just 1 km from the marwar bus stand. One can easily walk through the narrow lanes to reach this lake. There are plenty of ghats around the lake where one can just sit and relax/ do parikrama/ bathe/ perform pooja etc. Few of the important ghats are the Brahma ghat, Gau ghat and the Sunset point ghat.  Lake is fairly clean and slippers are not allowed. Afternoon is too hot but evenings are preity cool.

title: Pleasant - But Beware of Scammers
review: The lake is very pretty, as are the various buildings and ghats that surround it.  It is definitely worth taking a walk around the lake to see it from all sides.  The far side (where the bridge is) is far less busy whereas the "downtown" side is a bit chaotic with tourists and locals clogging up the main shopping street(s).  Still interesting though.

title: Evening stroll
review: Nice and calm ambiance for a evening stroll. Loved the whole experience. They have developed entire stretch on the west side for evening walkers with palm trees. Do try eateries adjoining the area.

title: The tears of Lord Siva
review: The lake is the main attraction of Pushkar along with the brahma temple and have various ghats much like the ghats of varanasi. One can take a evening stroll around the lake which is also near the Brahma temple.

title: Terrible, spoilt Pushkar! Never again. Not even a toilet there.
review: I regret the time and money I waisted to go to Pushakar, which to me is one of those places, where India has been completely spoilt and is at it´s worst! AVOID!!!!

title: Awesome place to unwind with a touch of spirituality
review: Pushkar is special. It is supposed to be the place where Mother Earth was created. It has the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world. Lord Brahma is not a person but an energy who we popularly call as Divine Intelligence or Creativity. As you can see in the pictures below the lake looks particularly beautiful during full moon. We did the prayers along with some donation at the lake and then proceeded to visit the Brahma temple.

title: Best place of pushkar
review: Holy lake and nice at evening time and also the various ritual ceremonies were also do there and silent place around

title: Amazingly beautiful
review: A well kept holy lake surrounded by ghats i.e. stairs all around and dotted with numerous temples. A couple of hills in the background made the whole scene bit surreal on the evening I visited. I would suggest not to engage with any priests offering to do rituals for you; save your time, money and peace of mind. The Pushkar lake is one of the four holy lakes mentioned in Hindu religion, other three being Brahmsarovar, Bindu sarovar and Mansarovar.

title: A sacred lake surround by white building
review: A pleasant lake surrounded by lots white building, looks very nice and comfort. But you should take off your shoes to go in. But the floor is full of bird dirt. They claimed no photo inside but even local people making selfie here.

title: Nice but CHEATERS EVERYWHERE! BEWARE!
review: We just wanted to see the lake... the place was called Varagh Ghat. Random people will tell you welcome and ask you to sit in front of the lake and giving you some hindu prayers. After that they charge you a lot of money... You cant just go away because you are surrounded by their people. CHEATERS!

title: Dirty lake
review: It's ok but dirty and uncared for which is a shame.

title: Very religious
review: Their are several  ghats  (access  stairways ) down to the water ,used by different  religions,beliefs, some are clean and well maintained and others are rather fetid, as removal of footwear is compulsory be carefully where  you tread.

title: Awesome
review: Please travel to this place.even though it could be a long drive from Jaipur,this lake and visit to nearby temples is a day long visit. Plan in advance. There are people who may force u to do pooja and seek donation. Pls be careful. But otherwise this is unique religious site to visit.

title: Nice scenery
review: Very nice scenery where you get a good feel of the people and their religion. Went to a few areas where it wasn't very higenic (lots of animal poop around) but really enjoyed the whole experience. Nice view of the sunset as well with great people watching.

title: Pushkar Lake, Lord Brahma's Insignis!
review: We visited after sun down, and the lights had come on. The lake looked serene and peaceful and very exotic because of probably the story we were told about how it came be and also because of the twinkling lights reflected in the water.

title: Beautiful
review: Stunning views all day long. The ghats are a great place to chill. Lovely cafes all along for great views of the surrounding city and lake.

title: Pushkar Lke
review: Several restaurants around the lake.  It's nice if you have time to walk around the lake, you see many places of interest.

title: Sort-of-Spiritual
review: We visited Pushkar after hearing about the "spirituality" of this town and how important it was to many religions.  It was interesting, and worthy of a day visit.  Many people bathing in the "ghats" around the lake to experience the holy water.   The lake is surrounded by a bustling market street of restaurant and craft shops.  Fortunately for us, it was not too crowded when we visited.  The sunset at Savitri temple made the visit to Pushkar worthwhile for us.

title: A very Sacred Spot
review: The lake with it's flow of visiting pilgrims, cows sitting around and holy men makes a stay in Pushkar feel this is India as it always was.

title: Calm and Serene place to relax in evening
review: After full day exploring thousands of photography opportunity - I goto the lake after my dinner and sit there to relax. The feeling is so calming that you immediately detach yourself from the world. Listen to the Sadhus conversation who sleep and live on the Ghats and mist on our thoughts starts clearing.

title: Mesmerising
review: Great experience! very calm unlike what I heard before. You can perform various rituals here and the priests dont exract too much money

title: Hustled at Sunset
review: The pilgrimage site attracts a fair number of Hindu devotees and entry points to the lake are via temple gates. In the afternoon, guys on the street hand you flowers to try to get you down to the lake for a "blessing", if you do expect to pay.

title: Visit only if interested in religious service/ worship
review: Too much crowded place. If you are not into gods and temples then you can avoid this. Otherwise ok.

title: Much visited holi town in Rajasthan
review: Pushkar in Rajasthan state is a holi town for local Hindus who frequent there for performing rituals at the sarovar or lake and worship Lord Brahma  ,the only one temple in India dedicated to Him.The town is very old ,has numerous lanes and shops, restaurants..This town has many budget hotel's.Unusually large no of foreign tourists visit this town for reason best known to them.

title: good for a 2 hour visit, don't expect much
review: Well, Pushkar is some 150km from Jaipur, and about 30 km from Ajmer sharif. The road from Jaipur to Pushkar is a fantastic drive. It's a delight to be on that road. The lake is big, but the entrance to the lake and the steps could have been cleaner. The priests who get hold of you and start of chanting of verses in sanskrit would ask you questions in between to actually learn how much you earn and how strong is your religious belief is, to make you donate to some fund. But otherwise, it is a serene hindu pilgrimage worth a visit. Not very congested. parking available, I drove down from Jaipur. No good restaurant nearby, try Taj gateaway en-route for lunch.

title: A colourful experience
review: Walking out and viewing the ghats for the first time was an amazing experience. We walked right around the lake to try and take in every vista. Pushkar itself is a small colourful town and was our favourite location visited on our Golden Triangle tour.

title: Ok
review: This lake was the reason we travelled to Pushkar. There were occasional prayers over the speakerphone in background which was somewhat atmospheric otherwise a pretty quiet place. Otherwise don't expect too much here.

title: Ms
review: Everest  hotel  gives  you good value for money.

title: beware of scammers
review: Stay away from market side ghats as they gonna try to scam u saying its karma and you need to "donate" couple of hundreds rs. go to sunset point to see the sunset.

title: Beautiful, but full of con artists
review: Don't take any flowers from anyone.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Pushkar lake is so peaceful.

title: Visited for holi
review: Trust me it is one of the best destinations for holi in India. Worth every minute. Reason- ELECTRONIC MUSIC THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON THE STREETS, ALCOHOL FREE AREA ; so you refrain yourself from non sense, great hippie crowd with lots of energy.

title: Awosome view from sunset point!
review: Its peaceful place. i have visited this place in last year November.

title: Best at night
review: I walked around the lake under the light of an almost full moon and that was a total delight, It was so peaceful, hardly anyone around. During the day, there are obviously many more people around and people pestering you about one thing or another. Actually, dawn is also a delightful time to visit. There are many little temples around the lake that are worth a visit.

title: Pushkar..The Land of Bhrama.
review: The Land Of Bhrama...Pushkar...where in Phusp means 'Flower' and Kar means 'Karma'...Nice place Very Famous And Tourist attraction....please check for Camel Ride and Desert Safari in Pushkar. Pushkar Lake... and market full variety stuff and the Rajasthani cousin just need to taste

title: Charming
review: Pushkar Lake is a holy place. There is a certain sense of calmness there despite the number of locals and tourists.

title: Serene
review: Neat and clean. Walk around the lake. I was amazed to see cleanness. Take a walk in the evening. Mind blowing experience.

title: Beautiful, but beware "priests"
review: The lake is really gorgeous and shimmers majestically in the sunlight.

title: The best place to remove presure
review: Pushkar city and the lake are located in the Rajasthan desert, and at first time I didn't understand what I'm doing here, but according of hindu tradition each one has to come once in his life to dive in this lake, that's why around the lake which quit small there are ramp to dive just by walking. at his north side there is a bridge that each one has to remove the shoes before you march on the bridge. at the evening you may sit around the lake a start "briza" nice wind which remove the heat and let you disconnect from your mind or from your body.

title: Must visit
review: Beautiful place with excellent surroundings very nice in evening you feel blessed and warm after seeing evening Puja

title: Favourite spot so far on our India tour
review: Pushkar lake is so peaceful. As an English person, you can sit and watch people all day from the steps of the ghats. It's truly fascinating to absorb the culture here.

title: Religious place
review: Beware of beggars and Local Guides will start with Rs20/- and end with Rs200/-.

title: Must visit.
review: Something like Varanasi , spiritualism is in the air around the lake . It gives divine pleasure when you visit it during dawn or dusk . pandas /Pandits and there touts are on their job . Try to avoid them if you can but you have to be very smart for that. the place is only for the people with spiritual bent of mind .

title: Beautiful lake
review: The lake is lovely, but watch out for the people giving you flowers, you get ushered in and talked to by a Brahmin and before you know it they want money, and get very agitated when you refuse. Other than that a lovely place.

title: Beware from the touts of camel carts
review: The camel cart at pushkar is the biggest scam, the idle camel will walk at no sand dunes and small area covered, only the touts hyped the tour by saying about one hindi TV soap.... Which is nothing but waste of time and money, but who'll only travel jaipur and Ajmer pushkar can do that....

title: The scamming ruins this beautiful, holy attraction
review: The scams around this lake is disgusting and hard to avoid! If you just go to look at the lake you will find yourself in a very unpleasant situation. It is such a shame ! Please be aware

title: Very Sacred Hindu Place - Pushkar
review: Pushkar is also known as the King of all Pilgrim places of Hindus. Amongst the followers of Vedic religion, the place holds most important place because it has the only Brahma temple. Spiritualism is in the air. But beware, the place is much hyped also. The local guides will tell lot of stories about which there is no documentation or record anywhere and are hard to believe. Narcotic drugs are easily available here and tourists from Russia & other east European countries flock here for easy availability of drugs.

title: A beautiful lake could have been kept better
review: This was my first visit but my in laws told me that the lake is much cleaner than what it was 10-15 years ago. Thanks to the effort of the government and the custodians of The  lake.  Very peaceful a place and we performed some pooja also. Here is a word of caution. The priests there will try to sell You stories about some ancestors and make You donate large sum of money like 5000-10000 rupees especially if They sense that you are from outside of India.

title: needs to be clean
review: spent decent time close to the lake. Displaying it to be a holy place, it was not clean.

title: Beautiful tranquil lake
review: There are great spots to meditate on the lake, it's worth walking around for. There are places that that you may get pressured into rituals and as it's a holy lake make sure shoes are off on the lakeside.

title: Very nice and calm!!
review: It is indeed a must visit place. Its not far from Ajmer. Its located near to Lord Brahma's temple. Devotees usually take bath in the holy lake. Cabs from Ajmer to Pushkar are easily available. Sunset and sunrise is spectacular.

title: Religious and Scenic!
review: best to visit at sunset point during sunset to see nice views, an amazing lake and gives a taste of local culture!!

title: Beautiful but becareful of scams
review: The lake is beautiful with many different access points.  One of the best places to enter is near sunrise restaurant. The other areas will have people trying to show you a prayer by the lake and ask for a small donation. We heard from people they were asking for 200-400rupees. The area is free.

title: Lots of hype, less on substance!
review: Visited Pushkar lake with family during our visit to Jaipur with great expectations as it's considered a sacred place with an inspiring history to it however I was seriously disappointed after seeing the place. The entire Pushkar lake is taken over by Priests whom the only motive is to extract as much money as they can, by pushing the tourists to offer donation, buying Pooja Thalis etc. etc. Lake is nice and does offer a soothing & calm experience but requires a lot of work to be carried out to clean it before one can think of taking a bathe in it. Overall a great place from Hindu religion standpoint however made into an average experience as everyone is looking out to make/loot money from the tourists. My advice would be to visit the place if you want however refrain from liasing with any Priest/Guide.

title: Interesting Lake
review: This is considered a holy lake and walking around it is through several gates where you have to observe religious rituals. The views however are amazing and the sunset view is fascinating.

title: Serene location
review: If you want to experience some inner peace visit pushkar lake near brahma mandir.

title: Good to spend a pleasant evening
review: Soothing and relaxing. The lake is at the centre of the city and non religious people can go to get a taste of the local culture.

title: Many Ghats in this lake
review: As per the curse on Lord Bramha as no offering can be made to Him at the temple, all flower offerings are done in one of the Ghats in Puskhar lake. This lake is about 500 m from the main temple.

title: Underwhelming
review: Heard so much about this place - was already aware of the hassle of pushkar passport scams so avoided any flowers offered to me - be careful though some are literally placed into your hand.

title: Just beautiful
review: Sitting on the steps of the ghat and enjoying the most beautiful sunsets ever. Just that will make your trip worthwhile

title: The least holy place I've ever been
review: After hearing about the holiness of Pushkar lake and the pilgrimages people make to bathe in the ghats, I was sorely disappointed to see that it was swamped with fake Brahman priests, banana pancakes and store after store selling souvenirs and hippy pants. While the lake was beautiful, I could hardly enjoy it watching the "Brahman priests" take tourists down to the lake and demand they pay them money for "blessings". Furthermore you can't walk around the lake peacefully as people constantly yell at you to take your shoes off as it is a holy place, meanwhile 1 metre away, people try to sell you drugs. And apart from being a completely inauthentic experience of a place, there is generally not much to really do there. So if you want to see a holy place in India, maybe stay away from Pushkar.

title: Worth a visit, but avoid the blessings
review: The town itself is very much a backpacker place with lots of clothing stores etc.

title: The toilet tourist trap
review: Not too bad if you fancy walking around in urine and excrement in your socks, although admittedly, most of it is dry...This spot is nice and scenic and the ghats are a nice place to sit and watch the goings on, although there is a ridiculously large amount of people offering their blessings and Indian men standing around in their underpants

title: Sacred lake
review: Pushkar lake is located just few steps walk away from the Brahma Temple.  This is a sacred lake and it's believed to be auspicious to take bath in this lake. Devotees usually take bath in this lake before visiting the Brahma Temple. Visitors can be seen along with Pandits on the bank of the lake offering prayers.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: Pushkar Lake in Pushkar, Ajmer. Wonderful place and very peaceful. This place is near by the Temple of Lord Brahma. There is a history in connection with this places that can be found in the Internet.

title: Theertharaj
review: Pushkar Lake is called Theertharaj. Raja of all therrthas. Must take a dip here. Let your sins dissolve and emerge with blessings of Lord Brahma.

title: Pushkar lake.. must visit at pushkar...
review: Pushkar is one of the famous tourist destination cum hindu religious sacred place located around 12 km from Ajmer. We can reach this place by online cabs like uber. it's more like a hilly area hence the travel expenses will be a bit more compared to the city. We have to walk a short distance to reach the lake, where we will find many travel guides who can explain the history and significance of the place. English speak guides are also available. It's the only place in the world where brahma temple is located. The importance of this lake is that people make.their offerings in the lake and not in the temple. Altogether it's a must visit place for the travellers in Rajasthan.

title: Inserting
review: We spent hours sitting and watching the worshippers,had dinner not far away during amazing sunset . We went down at Brahmah gat  . Colorful and interesting. Beware of "fake" Sado who push in your hand flowers and offering yo take you for a "pho ja" and later demanding a "donation"

title: Spiritual and calming place...photogenic too
review: Pushkar lake is not very clean but you feel very serene, calm and peaceful when you go there. Do not miss the evening lake aarti if possible. We felt blessed to experience it.

title: DEVINE!!!
review: DEVINE place you will feel blessed and amazed after being here

title: peaceful
review: we were here in last Diwali... in diwali it was crowed in morning as lots of people  came for pooja  and in evening it was so peaceful they do maha aarti in diwali evening. there are so many cafe around the lake where you can set and enjoy the view of lake

title: "View😍"
review: As i love water so dis was like a heaven for me..view of the lake is unforgettable..it touches my heart..specially in night when i sat there for sometime wid feets in water of the lake dat was the best part..place is soooo peacefull in night..!!

title: Awesome
review: Nice place to be. Did not expect this kind of ambience there. Went on here say basis. 1st time. One thing ,the approach to the lake can be made more better.

title: Weirdly interesting lake !
review: We went to Pushkar for NYE'16 and directly reached the lake during Sunset.

title: Check it out
review: The lake had some people bathing in it when we went there. We sat and had a cup of coffee and people watched. You can't take photos down on the Ghat.

title: good view around lake
review: The pushkar lake is one of its kind having 52 ghats and is surrounded by numerous temples which is good. It has good view

title: Must visit once
review: This is definitely one holy place one must visit irrespective of their religious beliefs.

title: Felt Peace of mind
review: I am kind of person who don't take pictures usually but i couldn't  resist myself taking pushkar lake or GHAT pictures .it is magical ...now i got it why they says mini banaras to it...but i felt that they should not compare it ...pushkar lake has its own beauty ...Bellisima

title: Beautiful !
review: The Pushkar lake is basically a religious place where the believers get mental satisfaction of having visited it and perhaps take a dip in it. It is not all that clean to risk taking a bath. The efforts are on to keep it clean and that is laudable. One can perform puja in the lake near the banks where the Brahma temple is situated. They have the priests who help you do this. They do not fleece you much if you are on your guard. The Lake has good view and nice place to sit if you visit from RTDC heritage hotel site. The restaurants on the banks are quite good too.

title: Spiritual lake neve miss it
review: Pushker lake is natural water body which really mean fir spirituality and lord brahma temple it's worth going place if you are in india pond is clean and any one can take spiritual bath here in all it was great experience to see this one of the oldest Hindu place.

title: Nice
review: Walk arround the lake is very very nice especially in the morning or even better in the late after noon. I recommand to take some socks with you because you have to take of your shoes to walk near the lake all arround. Many temple to see and in the evening, about 6 pm, there is some praying seremonie. Don't go after some guide or "holy man" who explain you the rituals and pray with you!

title: be aware of pandits and cheater. The pkace is very good
review: The place has it heritage and worth visiting. But please be aware of Pandits and local who may cheat you in the name of religon

title: Beautiful Lake!
review: The lake in itself is beautiful - scenic and peaceful.

title: Peaceful
review: Holy city.  A reverent atmosphere which grows on you. Peaceful and relaxing, but plenty going on. A lively town. Many good eateries and places to stay.

title: A serene experience, particularly if you take the blessing from the priests.
review: A serene location dedicated to the god Brahma.  But as most Hindus attend the lake, which has strong religious significance, it can be crowded. You must not take photos of those undertaking blessing or those participating in their daily bathing ritual. There are many tourist police present to enforce the rules regarding photography and decency.

title: Watch out for the scams
review: Our group of 7 was encouraged to visit a ceremony at the lake. On arrival a number of locals lead us to the lake where they performed a short flower/prayer ceremony They then asked for an extortionistic donation" payable to them rather than the official donation boxes. Soured our experience. Lots of hustlers around the lake.

title: Pushkar Sarovar
review: Birth place of Gayatri

title: Traditional City
review: Very nice city to hang around. You are introduced in the traditional religious life of India. The city provides all infrastructure that you will need, which can be kind of an inconvenience as it disturbs the local customs

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to relax and watch the sunset on the lake with the mountainview

title: stunning view
review: Puskar lake offers a stunning view. Also you can enjoy sweets there near the shops and it tastes magical.

title: Holy Lake, but be careful on the slippery steps
review: The holy lake which is called the fifth dham by Hindu's is such as wonderful place. Serene, peaceful, spiritual. We did pooja on the Jaipur ghat with one Panditji. And then did parikrama of the lake. I slipped and fell on entering the water as the steps are slippery. Several warnings of slippery steps have been mentioned and you can see many people slip and fall. Be careful and grab one of the chains when entering the water. Evening aarti sitting on the steps is a magical experience.

title: Ok place
review: If you are serious devotee then visit this place. This place is not so clean around. Dont fall prey for any of the puja rituals performed here.

title: Sublime and Sacred
review: Pushkar lake is very sacred and a wonderful place to visit. Pushkar town itself is soaked in its spiritual vibes. I love sitting by the lake and meditating and imbibing the atmosphere. I could also experience the lake from my hotel so enjoyed early morning and sunset

title: Holy Lake and only Brahma Temple
review: This is the only Brahma temple. Take a cable car to the Savitri Temple. You are not allowed to take photographs inside the temple. However by the side of the lake you can take photos and offer pujas. We offered the same as well for my parents and family

title: Lovely place
review: In the Holly place Pushkar the famous places are Pushkar lake, lord brahma Tample where you can feel spiritual. In Pushkar lake peoples take bath to left all bed things and feeling spiritual.

title: Shan't shanti
review: The view of lake is very nice and very peaceful in the morning but just be aware with some people over there Bcause they do forced for ceremony and I don't like that but lake and temples are beautiful..

title: Pushkar Lake (Sarovar)
review: The place with numerous banks/ghats looks vast and colossal. The various banks are clean on an average and its a vast lake. Be careful & wary of the priests/touts who offer to perfom puja for you, they might inadvertently include heavy sums of money in their chants and force you to pay later.

title: Very nice and holy place
review: Very nice lake. Many tourist and so many different kind of shops to explore. Worth visiting and can be over on way to Pushkar temple

title: Charming
review: A great place "To sit and stare"! Very relaxing and quiet in the morning and superb views on the sunset over the lake!

title: Calm
review: When you first see the lake and surroundings it sent a shiver down my spine the strange calm  comes over you and as you walk around through the 550 temples it has a very different feel about it

title: Best time on sunset
review: I don't know if it is a regular event or because of the visit of a prime minister, the beautiful decoration with flowers and fire/

title: Most dangerous lake - DON'T GO ON THE STEPS
review: Just had a major accident.  Don't go on the steps - you'll fall.  They are super slippery and extremely dangerous!

title: Peace serenity
review: Nice lake view with mountain touch..good for meditation purpose.. recommended for everyone for a good vacation

title: Excellent
review: Beautiful view...nice stay ....and very quiet....attracted... Shopkeepers are well behaved over all nice experience

title: Dirty smelly
review: Unbelievable murky, smelly..dirty...mucky. period! It has religious relevance yet I could not make myself go near and touch the water. Disappointed.

title: Lake Arti
review: After exploring the market area and Bhrama temple we came here. Experience the local culture and spend an evening watching the arti and sunset here.

title: Special sacred place by the ghats
review: As long as you take off shoes and socks you can wander here. People will be religiously bathing and talking with priests. Be respectful. Sometimes you will be approached for donations. One of these was rather aggressive but we managed to deal with it.

title: Nice spot for a sunset, although a bit dirty and full with touts.
review: Nice spot for a sunset, although a bit dirty and full with touts. We enjoyed every night there, but some of us got into a scheme of a religious ceremony there, beeing led to pay money to the gods. Wear repellent, many mosquitos there

title: good lake
review: this lake is too much famous among hindu devotees so many peoples comes from char dham yatra they take holly bath when yatra completes .on kartik purnima too soo many peoples take holy bath in lake .one thing is certain this lake is very much important for pushkar if local peoples take burden to clean this lake then it will be a very good noble cause for them as well as for our country because so many foriegn tourist visit this holy city.

title: Sacred place
review: It's a sacred place and people give pujas on the bank of Pushkar lake. The lake is a pretty big one and the scenery is quite good.

title: Magnificent view!
review: This is the king of all pilgrimage sites as per Hindus. It is a semi-circular lake and is about 10 metres deep. It is surrounded by literally hundreds of temples and many dozens of bathing ghats.

title: Calm and clean Lake with plenty of fish
review: Pushkar Lake is a surprising gem as it is well maintained and respected by the local people. The lake comes alive at sunset time with cafe's offering nice vegetarian food and many young couples strolling past to enjoy the magic. Take note to respect the local Hindu population and abide by the rules! Dress conservatively by covering your knees and shoulders, don't litter and don't drink any alcohol. Its one of the few places in Rajasthan that is actually chilled, relaxed and peaceful for tourists.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Beautiful small lake, surrounded with steps where people perform their washing rituals. No shoes or cameras allowed! There are nice restaurants/bars around the lake that offer a great view over the lake and Pushkar itself.

title: Lake doesn't look clean.
review: Lake has turned greenish in color. Gives spiritual vibes. You can see little fishes. You can go and just have a look and roam in the market nearby.

title: Stunning, need to be very respectful
review: I visited the holy lake with photographer friends in December. Few people were bathing naked (due to the weather) but you will see "photography not allowed" signs everywhere. It's a stunning lake though, so I understand the desire to photo. The unstated rules seem to be that photos are ok as long as you seek permission first, don't linger too long, and are generally respectful of the surroundings and those praying. Also, don't be a jerk, don't photo people who are naked. We also found that if we payed some of the locals who approached us to teach us blessings with flowers (maximum 200 rupees) then we didn't get much trouble. If you turned them down, then they could be aggressive. Oh, and shoes off! Your shoes cannot even be resting on the ground in the lake area, so have a spare bag to stash them in case you enter the lake in one area and exit in another and want them with you. There are also women-only areas in the lake - be mindful of this. One of the areas is women-only but fathers are allowed, be careful that you don't accidentally mistake this area for a mixed gender place.

title: For sure it is more than a simple lake
review: It was my first sunset near the lake that I've heard the sounds of rhythm that was in a deep harmony with the environment and my emotions. And encounter with a young man from upper cast! was the beginning of serial acts and facts around the meaning of karma....

title: A quiet lake in the midst of a town
review: A lake is located in the midst of Pushkar town. It has great religious significance. People come here from all over India. However one must be beware of Pandits who fleece the gullible tourists and try to extract money out of them by performing unnecessary rituals.

title: Too aggressive babas
review: The view over there could be awsome there by sunset but everybody there offers u aggressively flowrs for free, then sit with u and after their blessing demand for a donation of 500, 1000 ruppees or more. If u refuse they might threaten u but u should just leave the place after giving a small donation. If u got some red and yellow wire from the baba u might use it for next time so people won't bother u. Generally, it was really uncomfortable to stay there or visit again feeling u should always avoid people there. It got 2 stars from me only because of the sunset view. It woould be less otherwise, 0 if I could.

title: Nice but a bit Dirty!
review: The pushkar lake is one of its kind having 52 ghats and is sourrounded by numerous temples which is good, has a lot of religious values and considerd as sacred and a pilgrimage for the hindus.

title: Beautiful holy lake
review: The Pushkar Lake is the lifeline of Pushkar. There are many roof top restaurants offering the beautiful view of the lake. In the evening there is arti which is really beautiful and must attend. You can take a dip into the lake if you want (we didn't). There is a lot of crowd so best yo visit an hour before the arti and then watch the arti from a different ghat/ far away.

title: Beautiful
review: Was one of the highlights of our trip to Pushkar. No photos allowed which actually was very nice. Very serene.

title: Divine and Peaceful!
review: We spend our early morning and evening hours by the lake. The experience was amazing. My sister and I loved the calmness and quietude of the place. Especially the Pushkar Aarti in the evening which is an annual affair. The whole affair was serene. Sitting by the water with hill in the backdrop and pigeons taking flight, everything about this place is memorable.

title: Looked very man made
review: Not the prettiest lake I've ever seen. Not the cleanest either, it was drained a few years ago as everything died in it from pollution but there were fish in it that we could see.

title: Must visit for Hindus :-)
review: Not sure I would recommend the place to everyone, though it is a nice lake to visit and explore the lake and the hundreds of Hindu temples around!

title: Push&Shove to Pushkar Lake
review: Visiting the Pushkar Lake during the Camel Fair is not a good idea!!!!!!!! It will be a push &shove experience for about 1km. from

title: Dirty, beware of scams
review: What is supposed to be a religious site is completely ruined by litter and the scam artists that operate there. Don't believe anyone who offers to do a religious ceremony with you, they will try and charge you an extortionate amount and become aggressive if you refuse.

title: Holy lake but not so clean
review: Pushkar town is build around this lake.There are variuos temples around and the most famous is Brahma temple.There are various shops around it.But the main problem is cleaniness as this area us very dirty and need spl attention.

title: Good guidance for our prayers
review: A very helpful place to offer the prayer. Could pay for donations by credit card. To improve service, the direction signs to the lake must be prominently displayed

title: After 4 Dham Darshan, Dip in Pushkar is a must
review: After completing 4 Dham it is mandatory to take a dip in Pushkar Holy Lake .

title: Kind of the point of Pushkar
review: You really have to go here if you travel to Pushkar. It was very interesting seeing the pilgrims and all of their varied clothing. I was there for the fire ceremony (there is probably a better name for it than that). It was fascinating.

title: Pilgrims come to bathe
review: A holy site visited by Pilgrims to bathe and cleanse themselves from sins.  Tourists may watch but are not allowed to bath or touch the lake.

title: Big and Beautiful ✌
review: It is a huge lake. Visited around noon....  The view of the lake from Maharana Pratap statue is heavenly..

title: Emotional
review: We visited the lake in the evening, it is an amazing place.  At face value it is unremarkable, but it has an aura that touches your heart.

title: Holy lake
review: This lake is located near the temple. It has several ghats.  It's called Brahma tank. Devotees take bath in this lake before paying a visit to the lord in Brahma temple.

title: A sacred site
review: The Pushkar Lake is a sacred site at which Hindu worshippers enter the water, sometimes after shedding clothes, for spiritual cleansing.  I was unable to visit Varanasi so I was privileged to observe this practice at Pushkar.   Because of its sacred nature, photography is strictly forbidden.  Adjacent to the water site are numerous shopping stalls where amazing bargains can be negotiated.

title: Deep in sole........
review: My first Love....ever!  to be seated next to the lake is being in real deep  meditation.I loved it, Pushkar has a good vibes around and you can feel it most at the lake.

title: Jai pushkar sarovar
review: I wud give it rating as 5 due to religious significance of it but 2rating for the way it is maintained

title: Interesting flavour of India
review: I went just after the Pushkar mela. this has its pluses and minuses.The pluses are that there were no crowds yet many of the vendors and shops were still fully stocked and open. one could meander through the streets and comfortably shop for a variety of things from traditional crafts to antiques to old books.

title: You can sit at the Ghat for hours!
review: Just pick a quiet spot, which is a little difficult during the Pushkar Fair and so I have decided to return here during off season. But I was lucky to find it near Brahma Ghat, sat under the Banyan tree! Definitely see the evening aarti and engage with the sadhus sitting in the area.

title: A beautiful holy lake
review: This sacred lake is used by locals and pilgrims to bathe and for ritual washing. Strictly no photos!! A calm, serene place to visit and watch locals going about their business. We didn't feel like we were intruding and the last caps seemed friendly and happy for us to be there.

title: Hyped
review: It was a disappointment and its a very hyped lake. Its not worth a day's visit for sure. If you're religious then its a must.

title: Nice Lake
review: The lighting was very nicely done. Once of the holy places. There is a Pushkraj temple nearby, so u can visit the same as well.

title: Beautiful sunset place
review: Since this is a gathering point for tourist there will of course be people trying to sell stuff or earn some money. However people are friendly and nice.

title: Jan 2016
review: It's the main attraction of pushkar. Some visit it for religious reasons and some for the view with all old buildings surrounding the lake. You will end up visiting since all the market area is located around it

title: Dirty lake.. should maintain the serenity atleast
review: Do not fall into trap of Sadhus or Pandits, they are there only to take money.

title: A must do !
review: A walk around the lake is colourfull, interesting and impressive. Because of the many bathing people photography is strictly forbidden. The buildings however, many shops and restaurants around this area are ok.

title: Holy place and clean too
review: You can spend hours siting on stairs and staring at water and crows/pigeons flying around. There is religious reason to take a bath at this place. You can also walk around this lake, covering all ghats.

title: Pandemonium in Pushkar!
review: My wife and I visited Pushkar during a tour of northern India.  We arrived on the last day of the famous annual camel festival. In addition, there was a supermoon that night (14 November 2016), which had significant religious significance to Hindus. This resulted in hundreds of thousands of pilgrims and people from the region converging on this relatively small town. There were huge crowds of people and horrendous traffic jams.

title: Maha Aatri at Pushkar lake
review: Visited during the camel fair and it is the best time of the year to visit Pushkar bustling with local and foreigner crowd alike. It has a lot to offer from the Camel trading fair to the fun mela, competitions, maha aarti at the lake, never ending spiritual temples and quite getaways in lake facing roof top cafes

title: Holy lake - but be careful not to get fleeced by the priests
review: This lake happens to be one of the holiest lakes in India as mentioned in ancient Indian Hindu mythology. It is believed that God Brahma had created this big lake. Beside the lake there is Brahma temple which is the only temple in India for Lord Brahma & is regularly worshipped. The lake is full of fishes.

title: Must visit during Pushkar Fair
review: The place is live with energy. The water is soothing. The ghaats are abuzz with local crowds. The lake is surrounded by local markets and streets, that offer cheap traditional Indian clothes, jewelry, handicrafts. Local food is also easily available everywhere. A visit to this place is very light on the pocket too.

title: Pushkar lake
review: Nice place to get a Serene trip and stuff is easily available in town. Lot of hotels ranging from rs500-50000. Every cuisine is available in town.

title: Holy lake
review: This is a pilgrimage so is the the lake but if u visit this in hot summers u may find bone pices on the staircase

title: Pushkar Lake a mix of religiousity and obscenity
review: Although Pushkar lake was a good experience and that too just a day before Karthik Purnima but it was more of vulgarity and obscenity. Women specially, were bathing naked with all kids, males and females around which was a shock of my life

title: Serene
review: Whether you are a spiritual traveler or a tourist, a photographer or an adventurer, the ambiance of this place is definitely going to attract you. Watch the evening aarti, take a round of the lake passing by all the 52 ghats, take a dip in the holy lake or simply sit on the stairs  of the ghats and soak in the divinity.

title: huge and beautiful lake
review: traveled on 14-nov-16, very scenic and beautiful. A lot of people visit this place for conducting their poojas for forefathers during pushakar festival.

title: A lovely local town with Holy significance
review: I was in Pushkar for a week's yoga at Pushkar Yoga Garden and made many trips down to the lake area. As in a lot of places in India you have to be careful of people trying to take some Rupees off you (don't allow people to give you flowers or petals as you go to the lake otherwise they cling on to you and want money for example) but this seems slightly less prevalent here compared to what I saw in other cities.It was lovely to sit there and watch the world go by as locals use the lake area for praying, contemplation and so on. If you see this place for what the locals see it then it is a fantastic, restful and interesting place with at the time I was there not too many tourists.

title: average for us
review: we do not recommend to visit lake because its not manageable and priests fight like a hell for money. batter to visit bherma temple and visit market or go alone to visit lake.

title: What a place!!
review: Pushkar lake with its amazing ghats is a peaceful place. One can go to a not so busy ghat and just sit there for a while early morning. With the aarti going on all around you, its an experience!!

title: Pushkar
review: Beautiful place , nice pond where we can take dip . There is Lord Brahma  temple and must see this place.

title: Perfect place far away from the chaos of cities
review: The lake has a serene view which you can enjoy sitting there all the day.. the location of the lake in the center of the city adds to to the sceneric beauty of the whole city..

title: Heart of pushkar.
review: It's a huge rain fed lake surrounded by 11 ghats around.  Be careful while taking the dip as it's steps are very slippery.  Evenings are most beautiful with spectacular sunset followed by  Aarathi pooja.  Very good place to meditate  and introspect.

title: Life of Pushkar
review: Everything about Pushkar revolves around this lake. It's beautiful, peaceful and has historical significance. The evening arti is very beautiful and must visit. All the good cafes and restaurants are situated near it.

title: Beautiful, well maintained and peaceful
review: We visited Pushkar during the Pushkar mela/fair and the city is very crowded during this time. even then the administration ensures the ghat is cleaned.  Sit the roof top restaurants facing the lake and enjoy the breeze and beauty of the city. The evening aarti is also a good glimpse to catch during your stay.

title: Visit to brahma temple!
review: It was a family road trip and we had dinner near the lake. visited the brahma temple.. not clean though the lake..but worth experiencing

title: Holy lake where locals come to bath
review: Locals believe this lake to be Holy. There are 52 streets leading to this lake where the locals take a quick bath.

title: nice view
review: it has good view and people are friendly. it is better to visit at night. don't throw garbage around in the lake or burst crackers into the lake

title: Blissful during evening
review: During the day, the lake is crowded and busy. Nevertheless, it is a must visit in Pushkar. But at evening, this place transforms. It's an enriching experience with the market and cafes around it, which is open till midnight and the sitting by the riverside, listening to enchanting and holy songs by holy men. Do not miss that part!

title: BEWARE OF SCAM
review: This lake is very pretty however BEWARE of scam. Do NOT accept petals from anyone as this singles you out and makes you a target for fraudsters by the lake. They get you to go down to the banks and pray for your family and then demanded extortionate amounts of money claiming you promised them and that it's bad karma not to provide. They really upset people in our group by encouraging them to think of dead relatives and then forcing us to pay "donations".

title: Spiritual place
review: Seeing Pushkar Lake as the sun sets is a magical experience, especially whilst eating at the Sunset Cafe - so glad we did it

title: Don't get it
review: Firstly, let me say I am not a Hindu and this review is not meant for anyone who is. I understand that it is a very holy place and will have special significance for believers.

title: Holy Lake
review: A lovely must-see place with pilgrims and locals bathing in the holy lake. A truly amazing experience. Many different temples, a rich market, fascinating views... Even saw naga sadhus perform their naked rituals. All that said, one has to be aware of many scams that you could possibly encounter.

title: Nice
review: Its a lake, not much to say, its a holy lake and the local people bathe there and pray every evening. Some places that has view of the lake not allow taking pictures

title: Good, if you know what to do
review: First thing to know is that you can do a parikrama around the lake providing some interesting sights of the lake and various temples en route. You can only however do it barefoot. Another useful thing to note is that directly opposite the Bramha temple, on the other side of lake is Jaipur Ghat where you can watch the sun set. Aim to reach there by 5-5.30 and spend a leisurely hour watching the sun go down. There is also a sunset cafe there with a nice menu.

title: Relaxing
review: Take an afternoon while in Pushkar to relax near the water away from the chaos of the streets. Beautiful views and nice photo opportunities. However, please be sure to leave your camera behind during  the festival as it is not allowed while people are bathing.

title: Pushkar fair adventure
review: This is a must visit if you are in Pushkar. Gorgeous breathtaking views all around. It is amazing to see and interact with all the pilgrims and locals here.

title: Fairly average
review: Unless you are a Hindu, this lake is nothing special. On your way to the lake, you will be bombarded with people trying to give you flowers to throw into the lake. Even if they tell you they do not want any money from you, trust me, they do and they can be quite intimidating and aggressive so do yourself a favour and either ignore them or say a firm "no" and they should leave you alone as long as you do not engage in conversation.

title: Holy scam
review: We visited Pushka after two weeks of touring Rajastan. The visit was memorable primarily for all the people trying to scam the tourists. The holy jokers ( similar to used car sales men ) at the lakes - worst hard sell I have ever experienced anywhere in the world. The shop keepers, including those recommended by Lonely Planet, universally tried to short change us after each transaction. Be aware - count your cash, don't trust the holy men- it's a  tourist trap.

title: Amazing and peaceful!
review: Really enjoyed the walk around the lake, and the history around it. We took a few sneaky photos but be careful the police will take your camera if they catch you.

title: Main attraction with a lot to improve on
review: Can be cleaner and maintained much better. If the pundit jis worried a little bit more about hygiene and cleanliness and worry a little less about people wearing shoes to the water.....the lake and ghats would do much better.

title: Total Ripoff
review: This is meant to be a holy city of Bramha . We visited thd temple and this was great . The lake has got Brahim sharks be careful. I mean  They are a total ripoff dragging this holy city down the drain . Do not do any ritual at the lake as all will be lured in paying money . Enjoy the lake but DO NOT PARTAKE IN ANY ACTIVITY AT THE LAKE . Even the guides will lure you here .

title: Maybe too high expectations...
review: Pushkar is nice but not THAT nice to come back - as we definitely will do with Bundi.

title: Nice, but beware.
review: Nice ceremonial hindi place with nice market and temple. Beware of throwing flower in the lake as the brahmin try to charge you 20$ or more for your karma and their lunch.

title: A Sacred Town At The Edge Of A Holy Lake
review: Pushkar is unique and unlike any other place in Rajasthan.

title: Wow
review: What an amazing place. Even tho the town has a ban on alcohol and meat (my two favourite things in life) it was an amazing experience. To see people on a pilgrimage and experiencing the tranquility was an amazing part of my life. I felt so safe and comfortable in this town to walk round on my own without my husband.

title: Beautiful
review: Most visit while in the city extremely beautiful place, make sure to do the prayer with a local Brahman.

title: Famous for sukhshanti, pitrashanti pooja
review: Nice place. The sarovar is very big. they have made different Kund for different Vidhis (pooja). Perform, a quick pooja for sukhshanti and pitrashanti. Please be aware that Pandits will ask you to donate money under different daan. Please check what you exactly want to do. Calm place. Walking distance from Bramha temple.

title: ONE AMONG NICE PLACE FOR A NEW VISITOR
review: After my first visit to the city of ajmer i was curious to visit this place as i knew a lot about tourism of these place which came true in front of me when i got the opportunity to be the visitor of this awesome place where there is a lot of way before you are not entitled to take your car in after there is way for the travelling out there before we reach the holy lake of pushkar and the temple there but there is a huge surprise there as we can see a lot of fishes which are very small in size and huge in quantity in the lake water and on the other hand there area varity of people taking bath there for holy religious sakeand also the temple overall turns out to be one among the finest visit of mine in the city of ajmer

title: Beautiful
review: It has an amazing view. It's a big lake that it is said that every Hindi must go once in their lives. The scenery is amazing with the mountains on the back. Be careful with scams though. They try to make you pay big amounts of money as donations after the water ritual. Just pay what you feel like and try not to get ripped off.

title: Spiritual experience
review: Taking a walk bear feet around the 52 ghats equals a walk taken by Lord Brahma around the lake.Quiet place with its own charm.One can also take a dip into the lake.

title: Morning amble around the lake
review: Once you get past the offers of flowers etc I loved taking a morning stroll around tbe lake experiencing the different ghats. Saddly too many people didn't see or ignored the no photo and no shoes signs though. When you do respect those requests most of the locals greeted you with a greeting and a smile

title: The only Brahma Temple
review: A must visit for all travellers to Pushkar. Its serene and beautiful and the only Lord Brahma Temple.

title: Dont believe the "PRIESTS"
review: Men calling themselves priests are going to approach you. Dont listen to them and dont do what they say. Stick with your friends cause they will want to split you. Then they will ask, actaully FORCE you for donation. An amount for each family member. They ask also for USD or Euros. This place ruined Pushkar for me. Dont fall for this scam. After the rip-off we were to pissed off to stay and didnt want to spend more time here so we just left.

title: Brahma takes credit cards .....
review: We went here during the evening, and saw the temple and the lake. Quite a romantic place with a unique temple.  We were offered 'services' by a priest, which we declined.  He then took us to a donation booth - so I offered them 50 rupees, but sadly this was not enough to be considered.  He said that they took credit cards -  my lucky night !  We were going to go back and see it in the daytime the next day - didn't bother.

title: Nice
review: Nice Place to visit. You will be able to drive down from the property easily. Try out and you will enjoy this in the evening

title: The holy lake for everyone.
review: This lake is a very holy one for the Brahamins.It is a place people are coming from all over India to pray and worship their God. While visit around the lake one should take off shoes. A Brahmin priest will bless you and say some pray for you and your family. In the lake you can see stairs to the water (Gatta)

title: Beautiful and peaceful.
review: What a view!

title: Great views
review: It is a must on Pushkar going to see the sunset to the sacred lake. My favourite place is Sunset Cafe, where you can enjoy the views avoiding the people asking for money all the time.

title: Holy Place
review: Good & Holy City.

title: Beware of Donation Scam at lake
review: We really enjoyed our day trip to Pushkar from Jaipur however you have to be wary of "priests" who are asking (demanding) massive "donations". Tell them to go away. It is not compulsory and they try to bully you into donating. Ruined the whole experience.

title: Day trip
review: Great to see but watch out for the Brahmins by the lake who bully you into giving large donations - worse experience of our India trip - not spiritual !

title: Sooo beautiful...
review: Its a must visit in Pushkar. The lake has 52 ghats. While walking down the market in between you will find entry to its various ghats.Its really nice watching sunset from here.Best is taking first left lane if you are coming from RTDC Sarovar or taking last right lane by hotel Pushkar place if you are coming from Brahma temple.The ghat is clean,lively with options of sipping tea,coffee and enjoying sunset.One thing that I noticed in all 3 visits to Pushkar is that locals are more interested in entertaining foreigners and not local tourists.

title: Visit to Pueshkar Lake
review: Pooja for peace of Acestoral departed soul was highly satisfying , Handicraft Shops and Items near lake and temple are good for window shopping

title: Holy Lake with panoramic view
review: I visited this lake just a while ago, in the twilight hours and it looked calm, and soothing. I felt meditative energy there. It is surrounded by many temples and ghats, besides them is a  bazaar which looked quite popular with the visitors here, specially the foreigners.

title: Really not worth it. OK view but Brahmins try to bully you into a large donation. Market tacky.
review: Stopped here when travelling between Jodhpur and Jaipur. I guess it's a good place to stop for a break but the lake is not worth the visit. It's hard to reach and not a great view. It was also completely ruined by the very high pressure, almost threatening approach taken by the Brahmins to get money from you. The market you pass through is completely tacky, not authentic and over priced. We couldn't visit the temple as it is closed between around 1pm to 3pm so maybe that's better.

title: Beautiful and peaceful
review: This place is magical,  very nice and peaceful. Please, keep it as it is! Don`t forget to take off your shoes. Be brave enough to swim in it. Beware of the cheaters :)

title: Be careful with the pray thing because you will be pushed to pay a lot amount of money.
review: Be careful with the pray thing because you will be pushed to pay a lot amount of money.

title: Good Place
review: You can sit here for long and ponder over the proceedings of the ghat. Many people offer pujas out here.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is located in Pushkar town in Ajmer District of Rajasthan. It is a sacred lake of Hindus. It has 52 bathing Ghats and people in large numbers gather here to take a holy dip during Karthik Poornima. People used to take bath here before worshiping Lord Brahma.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Pushkar lake is highly revered among the local hindu population.The lake has several mythological aspects.But its sad to see it is getting polluted .I wish everybody respects the holiness of this lake.

title: Simply beautiful
review: A lovely place take a stroll around, especially sunrise or sunset. Be aware of the priests asking for donations even though there are donation boxes, I was made to feel bad for not making a large enough donation.

title: Beware of scams
review: While walking there, we were approached and given offering plates by the "priests" here despite our protests that we did not want to go through with a prayer due to religious reasons. They insisted that religion didn't matter and it's simply to request for blessing. We were tired of arguing and decided to get it over with. Our group of 5 was separated individually (they said karma isn't shared and we weren't allowed to pray together - what?!). At the end, we were "asked" to give "donations" in USD for EACH of our family member.

title: Beware of scam
review: Dont take any offers from "priests" here,

title: pushkar sarovar holy palce
review: we enjoy and love this place nice lake view nature and many things to do.  place is full of crowds all time. Water is good. The pujari and other sewadar are well. Trip was booked by pushkaradventuredesertcamp so we didnt need to pay any guide thanks.

title: Beautiful lake nestled in between hills, giving it a divine view.
review: The Pushkar Lake, as the mythological legend goes, was created when the lotus flower fell from Lord Brahma's hand on earth. It is a big lake with several ghats, where one can do a pooja and its an important pilgrimage site for the Hindus. They say, to attain Moksha, one needs to do a pooja here. The pandits here dont charge money for the pooja and one can donate as per their wish at the registered donation office. One should ideally visit the lake first and then go to the temple. There is a beautiful aarti that takes place every morning and evening, after which one is given prasad, which is quite tasty. The entrance to the lake is via a small village scattered with shops. The path is cobbled and one needs to be careful while walking. The lake is situated 500 meters from the temple, so its a short walk. There will be lot of touts who will want to take you to the lake, one should ideally fix the fees with them before proceeding. They explain the story of the lake and why Lord Brahma was cursed. The Lord Brahma temple in Pushkar is the only Brahma temple in India. Being one of the three important Gods as per Hindu mythology and the creator, one should visit this temple. Overall a good visit.

title: Beautiful & Peaceful
review: If you really want to enjoy the beauty and peace ; do come approx 2 hours prior to sunset. Simply sit and feel the wind flowing. You can capture lovely sunset but make sure privacy of others because at certain area [near ghats]; you are not allowed to click pictures.

title: Lake and Peace
review: Went to the lake at the time of sunset and it was so peaceful  it's so so beautiful full with positive energy and feeling India so much. Must visit place in Pushkar . No doubts ! Just stay away from the people who suppose to give you flowers to send to the lake.

title: Indian Tour September 2016
review: The primary reason we came to Pushkar was the lake and the surrounding temples. It is worth a visit but you don't need to spend a lot of time in the town as one day is enough to see all there is. The lake itself is quite picturesque and to see worshippers is moving. What isn't however is the money grabbing tactics of the so called priests who seem to "pray" on unsuspecting visitors. I went down to side of the lake but my wife did not.
