You need to remove your shoes and the ground is pretty filthy with excrement from the numerous cows. It's the first time in India I have had a holy man chant for the amount of money I would give and name sums of $10, $20 and even $1000 dollars.  When I gave my donation, which was not small I was confronted with a " priest" telling me this want much for all of the blessings bestowed on me and my family.  When I said that was all I had he called to an associate who went up to where my wife was sitting and began to pester her for money. My advice is find one of the entrances with a proper donation box which I saw later and put your donation in this, not to the "priest"

title: sunrise at the ghats
review: we awoke early and arrived at the ghats by 6.30am which was just beautiful.  pilgrims and locals bathing in the lake as the sun came up was truly magnificent.  no photography is allowed on the ghats and this is policed very strictly indeed, even though many locals ask for their photos, beware because the local priests get very angry if they catch you taking a photo

title: A beautiful palce
review: The scenic lake of Pushkar is situated in a valley about 10 kms to the northwest of Ajmer. Pushkar Lake is enclosed by hills and desert. Pushkar Lake is one of the most holy place for Hindus. There are about 52 Ghats and 400 temples in Pushkar which are situated on the banks of the Pushkar Lake. It is considered that the famed waters of the Pushkar wash away the sins of whole life.

title: Spiritual
review: You can pick your corner and find a good cafe to go with it...anywhere around the lake...and it has a great vibe, to spend time. The Sunset Cafe offers the best views for sunset...

title: Tranwuil.
review: This is a place I keep coming back to. I love it here. The people are lovely and the area has its own charms. It is an excellent chill-out place and good for the soul.

title: tranquil
review: Pushkar lake, very tranquil, a must is a boat trip around the lake, trust me, you will not be disappointed.

title: Amazing experience of holy lake!
review: This is such a beautiful place,  I am not a holi person but the lake and the atmosphere makes me a real meaning of holi, town is beautifully situated around the lake and the Lord of brahma nice experience to see the temple!

title: A spiritual bliss
review: This temple has a great mythological significance. The moment you enter the area, you feel a great spirituality. There are pigeons all around. But the priests make you do a puja ritual and want money.

title: Lake dominating the town of Pushkar
review: This lake is located close to the Brahma Temple in Pushkar.  It's a serene lake which has several ghats. Devotees take a dip here before visiting the Brahma Temple.  This lake water is believed to be purifying and the lake itself is highly revered by Hindus.

title: Lovely spot
review: You can see why people are attracted to the area. I wouldn't want to go into the water but then I am not from India. Again the buildings are just good to look at and admire

title: Holy Lake
review: In my trip around north india wI stopped in the little town of pushkar,

title: Easy to get ripped off.
review: On our way to the lake a young boy came by and gave us all some flower petals and told us that its to throw in the lake. Once someone spotted us with the petals they offered to bring us down to the lake, so we followed along and got shown to a gate to the lake. Instantly we were all taken by the hands down to the lake and seperated. They then started a "ceremony" where they say a blessing in hindi saying its for good luck and for you family. Half way through they ask for a donation, if you dont donate enough they say no you have to DONATE more. So if you're guilted into it they then tell you that you have to donate that amount for each family member. Then its revealed that what you were saying was a promise to donate that. Almost ruined pushkar for us. If you would like to donate to help the upkeep of the lake there are locked boxes all around the lake put your money in there.

title: Just beautiful
review: This place is beautiful. It's a holy lake for Hindus where people come to take holy dip and is surrounded by temples and scenic mountains..

title: Unhygienic and over hyped
review: Location: walkable from the temple

title: "Sunset is literally WOW "
review: We went to the lake at the time of sunset in the evening and it was like heaven seriously it's so so beautiful full with positive energy and one can feel the peace inside by watching that .

title: Stay away from unholy ghats
review: The new ghat scam? You try to put money in the donation box, but the "priests" yell and say they will show you where the donations go, please remove your shoes. Then you are quickly escorted down the stairs. My husband & I were separated, and he was asked for $500! When  I refused to give anything my "priest" became nasty and grabbed my arm, telling me I was not allowed to walk around without being blessed. I actually had to tell him to take his hands off me. I saw they treated others this way, too, not just me. It was really awful, and the aggressiveness surpassed anything in the guidebooks. Stay away unless you like being manhandled, yelled at, and then being expected to pay for the experience.

title: Nice holy palace
review: I was very happy to see lake. In evening the water of lake very clean. Soap and shampoo not allowed in lake to donot spoil water. Bramha temple was also good palace

title: Nice place
review: You can go here with your family for enjoy and spend a good quality time.all will enjoy and love this place nice lake view nature and many things to do.

title: Not so Great.
review: It's ok ok type lake. Nothing much doable there also the place is full of crowds all time. The hygiene is also not good around the hotel.

title: Amazing mistic place
review: A magik place in the rajastan desert, the lake and the hundreds temples around are  wonderful vision of what happen here. Great moment was the Pushkar Fair 2015 when we was there

title: A Visit To Pushkar
review: Pushkar Lake Is The sacred lake for hindus consisting of 52 bathing ghats and one of the major attraction of tourism in Pushkar.

title: Enthralled by religious waves!
review: A beautiful lake surrounded by hundreds of temples and ghats around, gives you a feeling as if you are encircled by some holistic influx. Chanting all day long by different group of  Bhakts, which create different atmosphere of spirituality. If you have time, you can visit different ghats of same lake to have variant views.

title: Relax
review: It's nice to see all the people washing clothes and swim in the lake from the other (not crowded) side of the lake. Good view

title: Not worth it
review: I don't know why this lake is popular but I didn't find it worthy enough to go. It's a pretty dull place. The lake is bounded. There are shops around. But not much natural beauty I found there.

title: Peace!!
review: Pushkar Lake a.k.a. Brahma Sarovar is a clean, quiet and peaceful lake, and well-maintained by the locals. You will enjoy the peace if you just sit on the stairs around the lake and relax.

title: Well Maintained !
review: Good experience of sunset at the lake, and don't forget sunset cafes at Jaipur Ghat !

title: Mr.Sunil Kumar Bansal
review: A beautiful holy place. We were at the lake at the time of Arti. Though it was not possible to understand the wordings but it was really an experience to be at that place at the time of Arti.Lack of maintenance is painful.

title: It is a must when in Pushkar, just be carefull
review: Smaller sacred lake in the middle of Pushkar. It is little bit dirty so I do recommend bathing. I would give more stars, but I really dont understant why the goverment and police dont get rid of fake gurus there.. Near the lake and and the way to it you will meet many people who would be giving you flowers for lake and then near the lake there are gurus who are focused only on foreign tourists and they will take you to the lake do some magic stuff and then ask for money, if you dont give them, they will threat you with bad karma. Dont give them nothing and dont accept their flowers, tell them you ve done it yesterday or something like that.

title: Walk the lake and soak up the atmosphere
review: A fascinating visit with back streets and lanes to explore and soak up the atmosphere - this is a holy site and shoes should be removed on the lake steps; don't be disrespectful to this.

title: Must take a Holy Dip!!!
review: Pushkar lake is the main and top attraction of Pushkar. Every visitor should take the holy dip in this holy lake.It has many temples around the lake. At evening we can hear lovely and divine music of sankh with bells. The whole atmosphere was divine and holy.

title: Brahmin priests shake-down for cash.
review: I have a dot on my forehead that signifies that I've endured a Brahmin priest shake-down for cash at the Pushkar lake/ghats.

title: 54 Ghats (Worship platforms) sure makes this place as a most sought after destination.
review: With Lord Brama temple near by, lake itself boost so many religions activities along with divine atmosphere during sunset and sunrise. The prayer bells, moving diya with fire bring even the gods down to witness. Food is good n hygienic though vegetarian.

title: Good place to spend the weekend
review: It's the best place in pushkar to spend the day, if you sit on gats you can see the lake, the people, the animal... the true Pushkar.

title: Pushkar Sarovar- The place of Bhagwan Brahma
review: A very place amng the desert,if Pushkar Sarovar. We visited this place recently,and found it well maintained. Water is good. The pujari and other sewadar are well.

title: Pandits are cheat
review: Lake was beautiful but the pandits and guides misguide a lot so be careful. We are asked to pay only rs 50 to guide but we ended up paying rs 3500 because they trapped us

title: Historical Plance
review: It is more of a religious point than anything else. Lots of Ghats and in August really quiet. Nothing much to do here. But you can relax on a garden restaurant with the lake view on any of the restaurants on the bank.

title: The attraction of Pushkar
review: Very beautiful and traditionnal place. Be however careful with people tryng to give you flowers or willing to show you how to release it into the lake as they will try to charge you a lot of money and become agressive when you disagree.

title: Amazing
review: The lake around sunset is just amazing. Lots of musicians and holi people relaxing and chatting. Very mixed and interesting crowd.

title: Disappointing
review: Another place in India ruined by beggers disguised as "holy men" asking for 11000 rupees per family member. Just don't be stupid and don't take the flowers. Nice to look at though

title: Beautiful place in monsoons
review: This is a very beautiful and divine spot in the monsoons when it is surrounded by lush green mountains.

title: beautiful holy lake
review: it is a beautiful holy lake in the center of the city. this lake is surrounded by the ghats and the hindu holy temple. at the night the view of the lake is very beautiful when it contains the candle light in the water.

title: Worth a visit if you are in Pushkar
review: Pushkar is a short hop from Ajmer (well connected by bus)  and worth a visit for the Brahma temple (one of the very few of which the Pushkar one is prominent and old- almost 2000years as per belief) even when the extremely popular cattle market is not on. If you are in Pushkar, you might as well visit the Lake. Although there are lots of touts who would pester you to accompany you to the Lake, we did not see the point in tagging any one along. If you are doing any poojas or kriyas there are priests available at the lake to perform them for you. Other than the street side shopping on the way to lake , nothing much to see in the lake itself -water and the surroundings not very clean. Can safely give the lake a miss if you are in a hurry.

title: Worth Visiting Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is a sacred lake in Pushkar, Rajasthan India. It has religious significance as per Hindu mythology. It is surrounded by 52 bathing ghats (series of steps leading to the lake), where pilgrims take sacred bath, especially around Kartik Poornima (October–November) when the Pushkar Fair is held.

title: Do visit if you are in Pushkar
review: Pushkar lake and pushkar temple is considered to be a holy place.This lake is not very clean and tiday.So you cannot take a dip here but you can sprinkle little water on you head as a shastra and visit the temple.The local government should work on maintaining the lake  as so many tourist visit this place.You will see lot of touts and pujaris here pestering you to perform pujas.Pushkar temple is just 5 min away from here,The only temple of lord Brahma.Actually the location is very nice..surrounded by mountains.I wish it was well maintained. On the way to the lake you will come across many shops selling ethnic bags,shoes,table cloth,purses etc.Best place to shop.just bargain

title: Beautiful
review: As we headed down to the misty lake we could hear community's playing music & even watched the locals take their evening bath! A very comforting cultural space!

title: Beautiful town setting around sacred lake
review: The town of Pushkar is situated around a sacred lake amongst a mountain range, a very calm and picturesque setting. There are often devotional songs wafting up from the lake which adds to the atmosphere. Beware people offering flowers which is invariably a scam to extract money. Make your own way lakeside and go for a stroll around the steps that lead to the lake on all sides. Better still go to a cafe overlooking the lake and enjoy the view.

title: Holy and Divine
review: Pushkar lake is the place where body finds peace. Water is clean and fresh. Ghats are well maintained.

title: A place for the religious pilgrims...
review: A lot of Indians pilgrimage here as it has one of the few if not the only Brahma Temple in the region or India. It has a very strong Hindu influence and with 330m gods there is a lot of temples, noise and activity.

title: Crowded and dirty
review: Well for a scenic walk to the lake is very disappointing coz of the crowd and filth all around. Lots of cows around that contribute to the cow dungs. For religious purpose, some of the pundits are good who don't force you to donate. All donations are through a receipt. But the bazaar around the lake is very vibrant and full of good street food. But you can skip it if you are not that religious.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: excellent place to visit give ur mind peace and coolness. very beautiful. nice ghats and good spritual environment

title: Amazing view and nice weather
review: Recently visited pushkar, weather was fine, people were good and raining made it more pleasant. A must visit place, though road leading to and fro Ajmer is under construction and you might feel some difficulty.

title: Beware the shoe police.
review: A very holy and peaceful place. I spent many happy days sitting on the ghats watching the world drift by.Beware of false holymen who will try to get you to donate to their various causes.   There are some genuine Sadhus who genuinly live off alms.

title: Calm and peacefull
review: This lake is very calm and peacefull. Just few minutes walk and you will reach the lake crossing the market.

title: Just Sit & Relax...
review: Just sit around for a couple of hours. If there is enough dark around and the opposite side of the lake has enough lights, you can get pretty good a bokeh effect on your pictures.

title: Very beautiful
review: I just loved this lake. Beautiful sunset, and good for walking around the lake. We hope to come back soon

title: historic lake
review: the lake situated centre of city and easily reachable, pooja with pandits for family is trend there are rope for bath

title: Where Divinity Rules
review: Pushkar Lake is located in the centre of Pushkar town.  It's a beautiful lake with several ghats. Devotees can be seen taking bath in the lake before going for Darshan to Brahma Temple.  Visitors can also be seen in the company of Brahmans/Priests on the embankment of the Lake offering prayers.  The environment around the lake is divine, calm and peaceful.

title: well worth a visit
review: really interesting town with some great history and much to see and experience; make sure you do a camel trip too!

title: Nice place to see
review: Very calm & peaceful place

title: Land of the scammers
review: Anyone who's been to India knows this is the land of the scammers. Both the old and the new generations are at it. Not a day goes by where locals have not tried to scam me. Pushkar is different, the fake holy men & their fellow scammers are fair more aggressive then most scammers who are more easily shrugged off in other parts of India. These guys are mean, horrible excuses of human beings. If you're going down to lake ignore all advances from locals. My advice, when someone tries to talk to you in India, unless a student or look educated, then tell them right away you have no money and if that's all they're after then they'll clear off. Don't worry to much about being rude to locals who approach you in the street as manners seems to be something only a select few know the meaning of.

title: Pushkar - walk round the holy lake before sunset or sunrise
review: Pushkar in Sanskrit means blue lotus flower, this hindu religious town is situated 14 km from Ajmer and 146 Kms from Jaipur. This place famous for its famous Brahma Temple with a lake and the annual fair (Pushkar Camel Fair) which held in November every year.

title: Peaceful
review: The lake is at the heart of the town. It has a very vibrant history and please ensure you hear the story about the lake from a local guide or a pundit there. Just sitting at its banks of the lake is peaceful. However, having said that, please make sure you do not fall prey to the scams there. The guy will ask you to offer prayers at just Rs 15 but you will end up coughing up a lot more money at the end of the prayer. If you come to pushkar, this place is a must visit. No brainer.

title: Mythological place in Pushkar
review: This a sacred Hindu religious place coexisting peacefully together with a Muslim religious Dargha ,a small distance separating them in Ajmer.Say your prayers and have a dip in the lake.Also visit the only Brahma Temple close by.

title: Historical Religious Place, Amezing Moments!
review: I have dream to visit "Tirth Raj Pushkar" with Family from long time! Finally dream come true & visit "Gau Ghat" and Sunset Point at Pushkar Sarovar. Luckily enough Water was there to Enjoy this Wonderful Moment with Family. Thanks

title: Beautiful, be aware though
review: Pushkar generally is such a beautiful, laid back place. It made such a nice change from the fast pace of Delhi etc. it seems to revolve around the small, beautiful lake. You can easily spend a day exploring and people watching. Definitely stay for the 7pm (summer) or 5:30pm (winter) ceremony at the ghats.

title: Very calm lake
review: Its a big lake with people having religious faith in the lake. Many people take bath here. I was not well so just splashed some water. Green coloured water.

title: Calm and Peace
review: Ever thought of have a peaceful meditation in morning in a place where chanting of mantras flows in morning. Pushkar lake can fill that dream. Surrounded by multiple Ghats its one of the most peaceful point in Rajasthan. The lake and places around gives you a feel of flowing in water. Its very good to take a meditation on steps of Pushkar lake once in life time. Positive energy flows here..The city is crowded bust still the lake maintains its peace. Must do a meditation if you are visiting Pushkar

title: Try the puja at least one
review: I am not a Hindu and I am not aware about certain ceremonies but I was invited by one of the Brahmins to take part of the pray.

title: Very inspirational
review: Lots of interesting pavilions around the lake. Cows and pigeons

title: Spiritual Land
review: World famous Lake. Every where peace. At 7pm, must see Aarti of Lord Brahma.  We feel that we are in spiritual land. Near by is Brahma temple.

title: Beautiful
review: If you are in Pushkar, you can not miss the lake. Wander down to the ghat and enjoy the tranquility, lots of locals do wash there at different times of the day, but it is big enough to have a good walk around and find quieter areas. There are signs for no shoes near the lake- or you can bring some shoe covers with you! Remember your bug spray though as there are lots and lots of mozzies

title: Peaceful
review: If you are looking for some peaceful time, away ftom the city chaos then this is the place.  Its so relaxing to sit by the lake side all by yourself no one to disturb. Cool breeze and silent atmosphere. Although you should beware of pickpocketing and drug dealers that can harm you

title: Peace
review: We traveled to Pushkar from Jaipur and we found that it was a really blissful place compared to the capital city.  It is in this lake that the incidents leading to Gajendra Moksha is said to have been taken place.

title: Serene offseason
review: I went in July! My solo walks around the lake were serene and calming. It was clean and I even took a dip.

title: Mixed feelings
review: Went there today and my experience was not good at all. People trying to scam you all the time, I didn't really have the chance to sit down and enjoy the atmosphere. It is really beautiful to see people flocking there to bath in the holy waters but be aware of the scammers.

title: A holy place
review: Pushkar lake is known for its spirituality It is only place in the world where water is worshiped . As per purans one can offer pinds for the salvation of the dead ancestors. The lake provides ultimate peace & tranquility.

title: Not clean
review: The lake is very auspicious for Hindu religion. Every Hindu used to take a bath in this lake also called the brahm sarovar when it used to be very clean.

title: Very spiritual place
review: The lake is a sacred place to Hindus.  It is nice to walk around and capture the essence of Hindu practices in a calm setting.  The smaller temples and shrines on the left side are nice to walk around and visit.  If a priest says puja for you, don't get caught in the tourist trap of being expected to pay a lot of rupees- 150 or 200 is fine.

title: Serene.
review: The lake is an auspicious place for Hindus and is also a peaceful place for people who want some solo time.

title: Peaceful place
review: Good clean and well maintained lake. Beware of pandas on the ghat, until unless it is required do not entertain them other wise they are going to be expensive deal for your pocket.

title: Nice walk friendly people
review: We had a coffee at the lake view hotel then went down to the lake and walk along it anti clockwise. Was lovely and clean compared to Varanasi. All the people along the lake were friendly and wanted to know where we were from. Showing us their jumps into the water etc. didn't get hassled for anything. Fed the pigeons. Beautiful place.

title: A beautiful lake surrounded by mountains
review: Lake is surraounded by mountains and gives some nice views.  There are 52 ghats in the perimiter . You can hear temple chanting and bells sitting on the bank and feels quite serene and peaceful.

title: Learn the rules before visiting!
review: We were unaware of the protocol before we ventured near the lake and upon our approach had flowers thrust into our hands by aggressive Brahmans demanding money to visit the lake which is a site of pilgrimage.  They strong-armed (literally), berated and insulted us, so we were disinclined to go with them or give them any money.  Consequently, I never returned to the lake and only caught a glimpse of it. Had I been prepared in advance about what to expect I might have been able to navigate the process more easily, know how much money was appropriate to "donate" and who to trust.  I never figured it out (I was not there very long) so I suggest you do some research or at least ask the staff in your hotel about it before going.

title: Spiritual place and a must if in India
review: The sacred lake to Hindus is a must to see if you are in the area. I would highly recommend it you see it with a guide and have a leisurely anti-clockwise walk in the area. The guide can tell you so much history as you walk along. The sunset is enjoyable with a cool drink at the bar at the end. There is now a chairlift on the mountain that also can be assessed to get an overall view of the area. I highly recommend it but one day is sufficient.

title: Good place to visit
review: Its a mythological place. The lake is not so clean so better not to take bath but a good place to visit

title: Religious visit
review: Holy place : calms the mind and purifies the soul . Lord Brahma's abode as per our ancient scriptures. Surrounded by many temples .

title: Beautiful lake
review: Nice and peaceful lake. The view is great esp sunset and sunrise. Very calm and serene and relaxing.

title: Parikrama parth  Realy Good
review: Perm Shanti  Peach Full P lase          Sun Set Cafe is Well situated in bank of the Lake Pushkar, Popularly known as Pushkar Sarovar, Family run Restarunt has started from Year 1975 as a Samll Cafe & Restro now Its becoms one of the Best and Famous Memorable Place in Pushkar Town, The Sun Set Cafe serves Best Food in Town with various Cusien  includes English, French, Italian, Isralian and Indian............................

title: A must See - beware of priests
review: Stay Safe from Charlatans (priests). They will force you to perform rituals and make donation. Just don't talk to priests or simply walk away when asked for money.

title: Land, Lake & Brahman
review: Please read Prateek T's review. It is spot on. All temples in India are free. They will ask you for IR500/1000 but you can choose your donation. By accepting a flower in the street you will directed to the water side, that's where the priest will offer prayers.

title: Very Peacefull,calm and holy lake.
review: As I live In Ajmer . I go to pushkar otfen to relax my mind .The pushkar lake is really very beautifull and speacially at the time of sunset it becomes more beautifull ...

title: Good
review: The place is little unkept. But overall good.there would be teenagers who would ask for 20bucks to show you the temple and lake. Little annoying. But then, that's everywhere.

title: Beware of priests
review: I have b e times to Pushkar and always have a good time but I always seem to get sucked in to very sweet looking Indians that engage in conversation. then they end up talking you into coming down to the river and getting a blessing as they are suddenly priests. A very professional psychological scam. Watch out.

title: Cannot miss if in Pushkar
review: There are a total of 52 ghats around the lake. Its quite peaceful to sit on the banks and listen to the evening arathi. Its considered one of the holy places to take a dip for Hindus. we found the water bit dirty.

title: Amazing Sunset By The Pushkar Lake
review: We couldn't dip into the Pushkar Lake as there was fish that try to bite. Thus, we had to use a bottle to take the water. The sunset near the lake was amazing. There will be ppl who try to push you in doing religious ceremonies, thus please avoid.

title: Beautiful Place, not so the 'priests'
review: Since we arrived in Pushkar we just love the place, and we have been looking around with respect, no pictured, nothing. Is just annoying that every time that we want to enjoy the view of the lake in peace and calm...with respect  someone comes and gives us flowers to offer and drop in the holy lake and if we dont want to do so we are the rude ones. They push you over and over to do so... That is no respect for each other.

title: Most sacred place to visit for Hindus...
review: Visited pushkar lake on the way to Ajmer on a business trip.   One of the most sacred place to visit in India for Hindus. Felt blessed and peaceful.

title: Sunset point!
review: Go to sunset point everyday your in pushkar for sunset, glorious! Play a sitar or some hand drums if your packing heat!

title: Good place with religious significance
review: Did prayers and took the holy bath. Visited Gau ghat, attended the evening aarti. Must place to be visited in Pushkar.

title: Seeing India
review: It was a good spot to go see as we wondered around the city of Pushkar. It wouldn't be on my top 5 things to go see but I am glad I saw it.

title: SUNSET Hotel
review: This hotel is right on the lake.It has lovely gardens, a fabulous restaurant and caring friendly staff including Babo the Manager and Owner.

title: Peaceful Divine
review: This is my favourite place to sit and feel peace. I can connect myself to God and it is a great experience. Sitting at 4 a.m., seeing sunrise and doing meditation are my favourite activities.

title: Holy Lake in Pushkar
review: One of the very important mythological places in India, the is a myth that god Brahma start the creatiobns of Universe after taking Holy Dip in this lake, this is one of the most famous lakes in Rajasthan and worth to visit

title: Sweet Treats At Gau Ghat
review: Had it not been a friend who took us to Pushkar, I would have missed out on knowing this quirky, wonderful, holy town situated on the banks of a lake. There are many entrances to reach the Pushkar lake, we chose 'Gau Ghat Gate' (Gau: Cow). And yes, there were many cows roaming around peacefully :) You could witness many folks taking a dip in the holy water (not polite to click pictures), while others sat on the steps chitchatting. It was only when we came out, I was swept off my feet by the sweetest yummilious treat ever - Malpua (a thin pancake like dessert which is fried in clarified butter). Must try! No, you won't fall sick, and yes, its safe to eat! I haven't found better tasting Malpua anywhere else yet!

title: Holy water
review: Went there for the evening ceremony. Right after sunset  people gathered for the prayer. A recommended event to be in.

title: Temple and Lake are main attraction.
review: When visiting Pushkar, a visit to the Brahma temple and the lake is a must.hough basically a religious place, the overtones here are peaceful. Walks through this quaint ancient town are replete with surprises and the tiny shops store treasures that you could purchase at a bargain for family and friends back home. The best of course are the sunrises and sunsets over the lake, which are magical.

title: nice
review: Did rituals there & felt really peaceful . Very nice place to see . Our driver took us there on the way from Jaipur to Jodhpur

title: Beautiful
review: The atmosphere was lovely down at the ghats. A must do! Some friends told us after we left that they had taken a dip which I would definitely consider doing if we visited again.

title: Not as impressive as Varanasi
review: And many people trying to tie bracelets on your arm or perform a flower ceremony on to demand money afterwards. The gahts are clean and nice... but not as impressive as Varanasi. It is free and nice to walk along.

title: Holy place but beware of fraudsters!!!
review: After seeing the positive review of the place we were very excited to visit the lake and we did enjoy the serenity and history behind the lake.

title: Holy Lake
review: Most sacral place I ever been - place to be by my own with my soul, spectacular sunset view with sounds of bells,lakes surrounded by tamples,gods and goddes I felt in fairy tale. Every day beside the lake you may watching hindu ritual - puja. Many roses' petals in water -wich has a special meaning....Ask anyone to tell you story about Brahma.

title: Holy trip
review: 1 This lake is located in the centre of pushkar and enclosed by various temples and various restaurant which deals in Israeli cuisine.

title: Interesting cultural experience.
review: Be at the lake for sunset.  Watch the cows, monkeys and the pilgrims.   Very interesting place to spend a couple of hours.

title: Still needs to be more cleaned
review: This place has improved and cleaned from the past but administration still needs to work on hygiene.

title: An place for mental nourishment
review: A very sacred place, one of the very important mythological places in India... The only temple of Brahma (The creator) from Hindu mythology.

title: Pretty lake with religious significance for Hindus
review: Saw this attraction as part of a Pushkar city tour. Interesting history & significance. Considering there are people using it for spiritual & communal bathing, I found it to be somewhat dirty. That is putting my own standards on it though, and I'm not Hindu . The general ambience and surrounds are quite lovely. Worth seeing while you're there.

title: Serenity
review: The place is so quite and serene. In the evening a person plays tabla on the lake and its just so peaceful to just sit by the lake. One can also attend the evening aarti

title: Bus tour to pushkar lake
review: Pushkar is a quaint place ,pretty lake and surroundings.good shopping options to buy local handicrafts.be sure to check out a few shops before finalising. We bought a few sarees and t-shirts only to realise that better and cheaper options were available in the nearby shops!!

title: Pure Bliss - Calm and Serene surroundings !!
review: Pushkar lake is a natural lake right in the middle of Pushkar town and has a mythological and religious significance for the Indians.

title: Not very clean
review: Good location but lacks basic ammenities Always opt for  Lean season for going to Puskar for stay . Beware of PANDITJEE

title: "Holy lake &sadhu"
review: A wonderful experience of walking through the narrow Ghats of Pushkar lake..lots and lots of shadu &brahmin who try to make puja (pushkar passport)many of the visitors are foreigners..Be cautious in purchase as the rates are very high and aimed at the tourists.

title: The Tirtha Raj
review: The lake is more famous as Pushkar Lake, but you can also hear locals addressing it as Sarovar or Tirtha Raj. The lake has 52 ghaats, and every ghaat belongs to some royal family or state. No one is allowed to roam around ghaat with shoes.

title: Nice view
review: This is the first thing we went to see in Pushkar. A very nice lake with nice views of other parts of the city and mountains in the background. Beware of people handing out peddles and telling you where to put the–just avoid them and kindly refuse what they are offering. Be careful where you walk since there are some holy spots.

title: "Must see in pushkar"
review: Good to go between 4pm till sunset and see the lake in full activity. You can walk around the whole perimeter which is a good way to get a feel for the size and look of Pushkar town. You aren't allowed shoes, so mentally prepare yourself for burnt feet and walking over pigeon faeces.

title: The beginning of the Universe
review: The Pushkar lake is believed to be the place where Lord Brahma began His creation of the Universe. On a practical note, it is a very meditative and calm place. Make sure to do the "parikrama" around the lake early in the morning at sunrise. If possible, sit and contemplate on the nature of the Self.

title: Tip for Hassle free visit
review: After reading the reviews of tourists being hassled at ghats we walked to an area next to the Hotel  Pushkar Palace (Jaipur Ghat) in front of Hotel Sunset. We sat at the outdoor cafe and enjoyed a cold drink and watched the sun go down. No hassling at all. We were able to take some great photos.

title: Quiet and Clean
review: Although we did not find Pushkar to be a clean town...the area around the Lake in the middle of town was clean. The lake is surrounded by many bathing ghats ....and is peaceful and quiet. It is regularly visited by Indians who come to pray here. Of course shoes are not allowed at any of the ghats. There is a nice restaurant right near this lake that provides decent meals and a lovely place to sit not far from the waters edge. Beware of any scammers trying to solicit funds from you in exchange for a few petals to throw in the water.

title: Pathetic....don't waste your time!
review: As soon as you alight your vehicle and enter the market area near the temple you are herded towards the lake ghat and have flowers shoved in your hand. This is the beginning of your 'spiritual', purse-emptying experience. You will have no choice but to sit with a scamming 'holy man' who will rant for a while and ask you to pledge/donate anything from €10 to €500 after red-dotting your forehead, only to have 3-4 of them accompany you to the donation counter to make sure that you pay! Dodge these scammers and duck into the lake ghats further around the market for FREE and without the scammers!

title: good
review: beautiful lake, superb local market nearby , wish it would have been little more clean,took nice walk around.

title: Tales abound
review: If you want a good story, you can get hold of any 'priest' out in Pushkar and he will give you one. It just looked just another man made lake, and once we heard of how sewerage was all mixed up, ALL sacred thoughts vanished. The steep steps and the 'priests' who fleece you made it a forgettable  visit.

title: one of the unique destinations of the world
review: One must visit the Lord Brahma's Temple and cross the streets of Pushkar to visit the Pushkar lake. The 5 to 7 minutes walk from the temple to the lake through the streets full of local eatery shops is very interesting

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful  at sunset....loose yourself gazing out over the lake. You may be targeted by people wanting to do a blessing. Don't pay over the odds just take 100rps or so with you or they'll try for the while lot.

title: Awesome Place to visit
review: I went with my family to visit the pushkar lake. it was awesome in the night and looks marveleous at the sunrise

title: Nice part of Pushkar
review: The lake is surrounded by  ghats (steps to the lake for worship and wash) and Mandirs (Temples) . We see a lot of local visitors who come to perform puja (ritualistic prayer)  and also lots of long stay western hippy type tourists. Th elake are feel quite tranquil when we leave the small busy and crowded streets of Pushkar.

title: Amazing Lake with Surrounding Ghats
review: This is the first lake in my life I have seen is so clean and surrounded by Ghat (place of worship or taking bath). It was picture perfect and we really enjoyed it

title: My favourite place
review: Having travelled far and wide with many tourists Pushkar is certainly the most surreal, peaceful and highly recommended place I have been. The calm lake and the breath taking sunsets are what draws me to Pushkar.

title: Nice but be careful
review: The lake is as perfect as i had imagined however my experience was slightly ruined by being guilt tripped into making a substancial donation to a homeless church.  As i didnt make a big enough contribution i was 'cursed' and ushered away!!!

title: Special
review: Very picturesque, the lake and surrounding buildings and temples spent sometime sitting by the lake taking in the sights. Traditional musicians playing by the lake and selling their CDs. Always love watching pilgrims performing their rituals which involve bathing in the lake, which is very brave as we was there in December and it was cold!

title: Very large lake
review: This lake has great religious value. It has 51 ghats in total. Ghats  were isolated as we went in off seasoin. But there are some photo points from where good pics can be clicked. Almost all travellers do pooja for their "Pitra"(dead elders) on the ghat.

title: Beautiful place
review: Sunrise is the best time for photos. Don't pay anymore than 500p for a blessing get a guide to show you around set a price before your blessing.

title: You will be happy if Mr Sattu is your driver in Pushkar
review: I was told that Pushkar was a very serene place with no traffic so I imagined that it would be a bit like Venice. I was surprised when our Tuk Tuk driver dropped us off on what can only be called  the commercial side of the Lake, in the spot where  he could go no further, but motorcycles and manpowered carts were still everywhere. Quiet and traffic free it is not.

title: Peaceful and crazy!
review: Depending on when you visit - early morning, expect peaceful serenity, they odd bather or yoga practioner, plus a few holy cows on the waters edge.  Later in the day, the families arrives, the priests get to work, flowers are thrown and prayers said, and noise levels rise dramatically

title: A spiritual place
review: We arrived in Pushkar as dusk was falling with the ghats around the lake illuminated by hundreds and hundreds of small candles on the steps down to the water.

title: On religious beliefs to visit- Don't get trap by pandit here
review: I visited the lake and suddenly one person came and started to tell the history of that lake. Hindu mythology story of the lake and temple. Then taken to us towards pandit who has given some basic pooja instructions and then asked us to donate some money for some pooja which takes place every month or so. He said that pooja(prayers) would not be completed without your "Sankalp" which is donation of Rs.5000/- later asked for Rs.2500/-. On the denial of the same he has taken us to trust board to give the receipt of that donation. The pandit has threatened us that your pooja (Prayers) is incomplete without this prayers and all.

title: Expensive Priests
review: If you want to freak out at Holi festival, you have to go to Pushkar. But book early because it is famous and crowded. Take care of the "priests" at the holy lake because they want a big donation and don't let you go until you have payed (1.000 Rs for every family member + holy material like rice and flowers).

title: Lake surrounded by concrete steps
review: This  small lake is surrounded by concrete steps.  One is supposed to remove their shoes when walking on the steps.  Early morning is the time to see people taking baths and washing clothes.  We walked about 1/3 of the way around the lake; there was nothing to see in the afternoon.

title: great heritage and pilgrimage
review: no doubt pushkar is one of the very rare place in india where there is so much foreign crowd and that too all young but mostly hippies...

title: A dirty pond
review: I had never even seen images of Pushkar lake on the internet before making my first visit to the place. Given the amount of hype and fanfare around Pushkar and the news of 100's of thousands of people taking dip in the holy lake every year made me always think that its going to be a grand place and would be an altogether different experience. However I have to say that it was utter disappointment. Looking at the size of the lake I could only imagine what a mess it would be when so many people take dip in that pond. And like any other religious water body the place was infested with a lot of filth and junk floating all around. Not a great sight at all.

title: Bad experience with pandits
review: The lake has religious importance and value but the pandits over there want to make money taking advantage of your faith and belief in God. Just don't listen to them and in view be firm and rigid that you don't want them in your vicinity. I had an argument with one of the pandit and then only they left me and my family alone. One advice before going to lake read about it and know what it is and what you are supposed to do and do it yourself...let those pandits say anything.

title: Lake of subtlety
review: Pushakr is no doubt one of the most happening place in india and indeed the best to visit of you want to have a quality time. Paradise for foodies and pilgrimage to the devotees it has got all for everyone. Whether its hiking on mountains or watching serene sunset sitting on one of the ghats listening to the thumping of beats of the nagadas haah!! Just one word AMAZING!!! It offers a great food, quality stay and above all that gala time you can't forget in life time...

title: Beware the begging Brahmins
review: Pushkar Lake has been a sacred bathing place since the 5th Century BCE. Legend has it that it, and the two lesser lakes nearby, were formed when lotus petals (from Brahma's weapon of choice) fell to the ground as He slew the demon Vajranash.

title: Must pay 3500 rupees as "donation" after prayers
review: So sad to see the "holy priests" exploit tourists in this city. There are people who approach you as you walk into the city and say you should throw these flowers into the lake and make a wish.

title: visit to Pushkar
review: A wonderful experience of walking through the narrow roads of Pushkar....lots and lots of shops...many of the visitors are foreigners..Be cautious in purchase as the rates are very high and aimed at the tourists.

title: Piceful lake
review: Sit down close the lake to see sunset are best way. You will feel piceful. Local people also like come  to lake sit and talking. The best place is in front of Sunset coffee. If  you walk around  the lake be careful people who come and give you free flowers, they will quid you go to lake and one man will do "Puja(like blessings)" to you but ask you pay high price.

title: Holy Lake in a Holy City
review: Pushkar Lake, known as Pushkar Sarovar is located in the town of Pushkar in Ajmer district of the Rajasthan. Pushkar Lake is a sacred lake of the Hindus.In Pushkar, Pushp means “flower” (blue lotus flower) and Kar means “Hands”. Everybody drops flower in the lake and wishes for their luck.

title: serene but at same time dirty
review: The market lines the streets that lead down to the lake where pilgrims come to pray. You are harassed and forever hassled to pay homage but do not be sucked in when they say by donation as they have credit card facilities to demand more of a donation.The market is excellent with lots of handicrafts places and restaurants. We had dinner at "out Of The Blue' on the rooftop but be prepared to walk up 3 storeys of stairs to reach the top which offered great food and views over the entire lake. Try A banana lassi-a drink made of yoghurt-banana and milk-yummy

title: Pushkar lake
review: A place steeped in history and mythology. Very serene sight. Go to the varsha ghat..and brahma kund..beautiful vistas

title: Must-See if in Pushkar
review: Good to go between 1:30-3pm and see the lake in full activity. You can walk around the whole perimeter which is a good way to get a feel for the size and look of Pushkar town. You aren't allowed shoes, so mentally prepare yourself for burnt feet and walking over pigeon faeces.

title: Avoid
review: This place probably had some atmosphere once but now it´s a shabby shopping mall for the backpacking hippie crowd. Do NOT go to the lake with ANYone unless you want to be bullied into paying a donation later on. We got verbally abused after I offered 200 Rupies instead of 50 Euros. Each. Looking back on it, it´s rather funny. Ablolutely not recommended. On a sidenote, the people at the Sikh temple were rather nice.

title: Clean lake middle of the town
review: The Lake is very beautiful and the surround ghat is very nice and evening time aarti is the best very spirituality feel at pushkar lake

title: A special Sunset lakeside circus
review: I've never reviewed a lake before, but this one is a bit special. In the heat of the day, it's just an unspectacular, polluted waterway, surrounded by the ghats which allow Hindu pilgrims to come to bathe. But as the sun starts to sink in the west, the atmosphere is transformed.

title: Tuk Tuk Driver Mr. Sattu is not only a driver but a real guide for see around Pushkar
review: We have been visiting Pushkar for two years now and Mr Sattu had been our not only tuktuk driver but our most helpful guide. He knows the area very well and since we were there to make photography, he understood exactly what we need and guide us through villages of Pushkar. We hired him almost everyday for make trips around to see villages and highlighted spots. He speaks good English, he is sensitive, polite and best in his job and beyond his job. He is definitely a friend now for us and if you ever visit pushkar, contact him, he will be there for you.

title: Prayer has a Price Tag!
review: The only thing you need to know is how to find the lake. Go there and do your own prayer as you do at home if you like. Search for the story behind it on the internet and there is no guide who will be able to tell you more. The 'students' and 'guides' are all part of a quickly escalating scam. They will start by saying you can donate any amount you wish. Then they will tell you the story. Then show you to a 'priest' who will do a prayer. For the purposes of the prayer he will ask where you are from and your occupation! Then he told my wife and I to make a wish during the prayer. He then said that we need to donate 1160 rupees to feed someone for one day. But because we prayed to three Gods we should donate three days, i.e. about 3500 rupees! Some of my friends from South Africa have been asked to pay 50000 rupees to have an ancestral prayer done and for the ancestors names to be inscribed on a tile! As a Hindu I was very disappointed with the experience and would not recommend it. What you are made to experience in Pushkar is not Hinduism.

title: Must visit
review: This lake has a religious importance for Hindus where you do puja but was surprised to see many foreigners there for Holi and participating in celebrations. Do stay for some days to experience the peaceful environment.

title: Lovely sunset and day hustle
review: Water itself is yellow/green, but it is the view after the sunset that is magical. The life and rituals on the shire during the day are spectacular and shows a lot about India.

title: Beautiful Experience
review: I went to Rajasthan on a study trip with my university class and we stopped at Pushkar Lake to experience a Hindu religious ceremony. We were led into prayer by a man named Yogi, who had us repeat a Hindu mantra after him. He then explained to us the meaning of the mantra in English. We then were given flowers to put into the lake as a symbol of blessing our loved ones. I found the whole experience to be really touching and I thought Yogi was great and so friendly. I struck up a conversation with him after the whole experience, and I found him to be quite kind.

title: Surprisingly quiet - easy to walk around
review: We hadn't heard of Pushkar before we were taken there on our 17 day tour.  What a relief to get away from all the manic places we had visited before.  A lovely 2 night break.

title: Holy place
review: The Pushkar lake ....awesome place. You may sit and relax for hours. Go in Morning or evening.Great views.

title: Beware of fake sadhus
review: Enjoy the lake, but be aware that shoes must be removed at least 10 metres before you reach the water, photography of bathers is forbidden and fake sadhus (priests) will try to give you a flower or offer you a blessing - in return for which they will expect big money!

title: Wish we Could've enjoyed it.
review: The only reason this isn't a 1 point review is because of a handy rooftop patio which allowed us to enjoy the lake from afar.

title: Peaceful Place
review: Pushkar is almost 12 Km from Ajmer, don’t forget to visit Brahma Temple, Savitri Temple, Old Shiva Temple (Atamteshwar Mahadev) and the Ghats of Pushkar.

title: worth the visit
review: Pushkar was surprisingly nice, the lake is clean and lovely with lovely city views. we were there during the Shiva festival and it was buzzing with life.Watch out for the "priests"who try and get you to commit to donating big $ amounts and guilt you into saying this. It really left a sour flavour in our mouth as we felt we should be left to decide how much we would donate and not be hassled into large amounts through guilt.. spoiled the visit to the lake for us...BEWARE

title: Divine
review: Well as history says, it is a place for offerings to the dead one of the family for their peace and after life. It s also the only Indian temple of Lord Brahma beside the lake.

title: Amazing place to visit during festivities
review: The place is vibrant with music, chanting, rituals, holy and not so holy people. I met incredible person every day, everyone is extremely friendly.  And the sunsets in the lake are just breathtaking

title: Yatra dham
review: If you are in puskar you can visit here for one time..

title: Religious importance
review: Unless you are travelling for religious reasons this is not really worth the effort of getting here.

title: Kartik Purnima Amazes
review: The lake is wonderful and best of all no photography in or near the bathing ghats. The priests were very helpful in organising the required offerings and managing the darshan. Wonderful experience.

title: AMAZING
review: Great lake, atmosphere and just beautiful ambience.  I love it and as I am a photographer, it was a great distraction from the outskirts of the country

title: Important Hindu holy place
review: The importance of this place is because of the very few brahma temples all over the world. The lake is large and surprisingly very clean. The premises of the lake are well maintained.

title: Very nice and clean lake
review: This lake is hindu holy place, it is nice place. What i didn´t like here was so many hindu priests trying to do Puja with me (of course for money) and other people trying to sel flowers, which you can throw to the lake, and so on.

title: Nice lake, but surounded by scammers
review: The Pushkar lake is a really nice lake, really peaceful, and worth the view. The only problem is the crazy amount of scammers, who try to give you flowers to throw in the lake for respect, "for free" and after ask you for money. We'd been told about it so never done it, but when you refuse politely they can become very agressive, that's what happened with us with a group of guys which left us feeling on edge and not safe. The city should do something about it, but for what we read the bribes are better than security and the police are on the side of the scammers.

title: Touts
review: A lovely place with amazing scenery and views, it's a shame about the touts. They can spot you a mile off and follow you around so they can give you a blessing. Don't let anyone put flowers in your hand it's stars the whole scam off.

title: Special Place
review: Found a cafe by the lake and listened to a local drummer while watching the sunset. Magical. Beware of touts and shams offering you "blessings" when approaching the lake.

title: to get your self calm down
review: nice place to get sit down & relax.

title: Stale faith!
review: This could have been maintained much better. Don't understand why we Hindus leave no chance to pollute even those water bodies that are considered sacred. Can we instead of immersing flowers etc. contribute to clean it up.

title: Fraud!
review: The lake is beautiful, but there are loads of Brahama's that want to take you to the lake and give you flowers and preform a puja with you. In the end they ask you how much you want to donate to the poor people in Pushkar/the Brahmas ect ect. Don't do this, these are just young boys trying to get as much money as possible from tourists. You can go down to the lake (which is actually really nice), but avoid these people under any circumstances!!!!!

title: The dancing Sadu
review: So match fun by lake at sunset with the music and the dancing Sadu early Jan.

title: Peaceful place
review: Nice and peaceful experience for all those looking to visit a Holy place. Well maintained temples and very good people.

title: Good place to seek your own company
review: I really loved this place. It is one of the cleanest lakes in Rajasthan. The infrastructure around the lake is pretty good as well. I loved sitting along the lake at the ghat at the night time with silence all around.

title: Pushkar lake
review: Place to relax c all those doves flying around monkeys roam around and the story behind the lake all are worth experiencing

title: The annoying Touts
review: A lovely place with amazing scenery. It is just a shame it is ruined by the touts scamming all the local tourist. Best thing to say is we have already been blessed. Some still don't leave and after your "blessing" they expect a donation and get angry if it is not enough and you are being disrespectful.

title: Well maintained but still lacking
review: Pushkar lake is a holy place and the sanctity of it should be maintained. Though well kept, it still requires some some regulations for not allowing people to desecrate it. Lake water should be clean.

title: If In Pushkar
review: This lake is in the centre of the town. It is in reality the drainage  basin of the town of Pushkar. Personally while I understand its importance to the people, it is in real life a small lake. While Pushkar appears to be a popular place for more alternative life styles, it wasn't for us.

title: Increíble place, the city of Bramha, city of light
review: The place is very beautiful at sunset and sunrise, just loved it!! Great spot for thinking, meditating, do yoga in the morning or play drums at sunset! It's a must!! One important thing .. Be aware of the fake priest anb monks eho will take you to make a "puja" at the lake asking you for money later ;-)

title: How does the scam works
review: As long as you avoid the common scam here, it's a lovely place to sit and meditate. Around the evening the area next to the main street becomes packed both with locals and tourists.

title: Pushkar Lake holy to all Hindus dates back to the 4th century BC
review: Located in the heart of the sacred town of of Pushkar near Ajmer in Rajasthan,  Pushkar Lake is a sacred to all Hindus.  Described as the the king of pilgrimage sites related to a water-bodies and linked to the mythology of the creator- Lord Brahma, whose only temple in the World is in Pushkar, the Lake finds mention on coins as early as the 4th century BC.

title: Plunge for a holy dip !
review: There are many temples and ghats on the Jyeshta Pushkar lake. A holy dip here absolves you of your sins as per the legends. There are many pigeons on the ghats which makes some great photographs. The lake is at a walking distance from the Brahma temple.

title: Peaceful even though busy
review: Pushkar Lake is special. It is surrounded by shops and animals and lots of people, but still isn't jam packed and has a lovely vibe. Many people will try to sell you a flower to toss in the lake for a blessing. Personally, I felt blessed without adding to the collection of flowers in the water.

title: peaceful and astonishing views of the city temples
review: one can walk around the entire lake and enjoy many incredible sites of the city of Pushkar.  Very peaceful and allows one to have thoughts about themselves

title: A very religiously important place for Hindus.
review: Though more famous for its Animal/cattle/camel fare where animala are still exchanged in payment, Pushkar remains a sacred 'Last rites' Point for Hindus.

title: good but dont get sucked in by the priest
review: good spot but the people will come after you for large amounts of money to donate to pushkar and pressure you really hard to do so....

title: Great place, beware of Scam
review: First of all, it's a great location, we had stunning rooms at the Pushkar Palace. BUT... Getting toward the end of our 3 week India adventure, we where going used to the way interaction with some pushy shop keepers operate, but we where surprised to see how aggressive the "Brahman" wanted us to "put flower into Lake". Don't get scammed into a face spiritual exercise. Take in this unique place but be aware of the "You put in Lake" offer. One the bright site, buying in the main street was very easy going

title: Get to know the Hindu history!
review: The lake is amazing in itself, however, I would recommend either finding a local guide or doing the research beforehand because the lore behind the creation of the lake and subsequently the surrounding town only adds to the spirituality of this place. Watch out though, got scammed by some holy men here for 1500 rupees.

title: Holy place
review: Holy lake and One of its kind temple. Really worth visiting once. The place has not changed much in last 5 years. Parking is a concern near by but you will enjoy walking though the street

title: Peaceful Pushkar Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is just half a km walk from the Brahma temple. The locals can easily help you locate the place.

title: stay for sunset
review: pushkars holy lake is especially pretty at sunset. Beggars are a bit annoying but its all part of the game!

title: Beautiful view
review: Great view!!...an intesting spot, lots of people around....near the bridge, watch your   belingings and back from the territorial   monkeys!!

title: =Pandit's rip off
review: Stay away from Pandits, even though I had read from the other posters but still got ripped of due to the guilt trip that they feed widows and poor. Got ripped off by Rs5000 as he said that's minimum to feed widows for 2 days only and he took Rs 500 for the prayer. Total rip off.

title: Only Girls Trip
review: This place truly signifies the cultural facade of India where you will find more foreigners around than Indians. Everybody there is looking for the peace and beauty of life and this place definitely provides you with all the solo time and tranquility. Completely safe for solo woman travelers and the people are very friendly. I visited with my girls gang and it was definitely a memorable trip.

title: Calm and peaceful but do not fall for the scamming so called priests
review: The lake at Pushkar was far more interesting than the Brahma temple and it's good to sit there and watch the devotees bathing and doing their prayers on the ghats.

title: Not particularly Clean
review: Not a very big lake...the water is not very clean and does not look very fresh...you won't spend much time here...Although we were warned but no pandits or guides troubled us..

title: Serene Lake with GORGEOUS SUNSETS
review: This Lake is the center of Pushkar, and it is so beautiful, especially with all of the temples sounding off in the morning and in the nights. Magical!

title: Worth a trip to Puskar to experience the Lake and worshippers
review: Walking around the Lake and Holy Bridge highly recommended. Caution don't fall for people offering flowers or spiritual blessings etc. - they are only after your Rupees. I found the easy answer was to say "No religion" and they couldn't debate that and left us alone. Just keep your hands behind your back and not accept the flowers and ignore them and they will go eventually away. If you found this tip helpful please tick the box below - thanks.

title: Too many people pushing for rituals
review: You don't have to buy flowers and other things to perform pooja. It will be better if lake kept clean.

title: Large Lake bordered by Temples all over
review: The Pushkar Lake is a large, serene lake which is bordered by Temples all over. The most famous one is the Brahma Temple, which is the only Brahma Temple in the World !!!!!!

title: Lake is beautiful, but beware of the priests demanding money after performing rites!
review: The beautiful peaceful lake was spoilt by priest aggressively demanding 2000 rupees. It might be for a good cause, but being considered a walking atm instead of a human being spoilt the experience. Beware!!!

title: Horrible scam
review: A student forced himself upon us at the Brahma temple and took us to the lake. So far so good. At the lake our family was split up and we were sat down by brahma "descendants". They hustled each of us for thousands (!) of rupees. Each of them became (verbally) quite aggressive when we didn't want to fall for this scam. What a shame at such a beautiful place.

title: This place is special
review: It is quite humbling to see bus loads of people make their way to this sacred lake to participate in sacred rituals.

title: Beautiful and peaceful outside of camel festival
review: My son enjoyed swimming in the bathing ghats.  A beautiful place to people watch.  Holy city.  Ram Ram.

title: no pictures allowed
review: lovely place especilly when the festival was on. the view is best from one of the roof top resturants (not supposed to take photos from there either)

title: peaceful lake
review: Beautiful lake> many worshippers go to the lake to offer prayers as well as some bathe in the lake> The lake or ghath is surrounded by shops and little buildings. But beware of  some local men acting as priests forcing goods into your hands to offer prayer and then asking for specific amounts of money, but one can rather give donations  of your choice. There are several shops close to the lake with many locals selling leather belt , shoes and clothing and jewellery, and they are rather reasonable with their prices.

title: Stunning
review: An excellent spot to relax and contemplate your Indian voyage.

title: Peaceful  place for méditation
review: Nice to walk around ... Quite ... Peaceful ... Ok to see the ghats life ! Don't Forget to pût out your shoes ! Respect !

title: Beautiful gem in the dusty lands
review: Cool, calm and composed.

title: Amazing place - a nice getaway from hustle bustle of a city
review: A quite town to unwind over the weekend or for 3-4 days. This has some amazing restaurants/eating joints where you can spend the afternoon or evening with good food.  The attraction is a dinner by the lake.

title: holi lake
review: holi lake in pushkar many priests on the lake say keep rose not good and pushkar city very good small market

title: VERY PRETTY AREA OF PUSHKAR
review: After staying in a hotel a way out of town, walking down to the lake through the market was a breath of fresh air.  The views across the lake are stunning with all the white walls of the buildings and hotels.   A nice area to relax and reflect.

title: Beware
review: The lake is beautiful, the people of Pashka are very lovely but be warned the thugs at the lake want r1000 for our good 'karma'. Today the same people threaten to beat me for not playing along with their scam. Be careful heading down to the lake.

title: Stunning
review: This lake is a holly place for the Hindus, there are many exits to the lake! People from other relegions are not allowed to come near the lake! Pictures were taken from distance, but atmosphire was great!!!

title: Great Massage in Pushkar!
review: I would like to thank Deepak for a great massage. I have been doing massage for more than 20 years and I was impressed by Deepak's technique and insight. I can highly recommend Deepak! (Deepak ayurveda massage centre and school of massage - Shri Raghunath Swamy Temple, Laxmi Market,Shop No.52 and 74)

title: Pushkar or "Pushy Kar" Holy Men want your money.
review: Pushkar – the guide was very nice, but the tour had an unpleasant ending –not to do with the guide. We had been warned in travel advisories about the praying with a holy person and the insistence of a lot of money to be donated, but this was very rude. What could have been a spiritual experience turned into a money asking fight. It was very clear they asked us for 1000’s of rupees each person. It was clear they were not happy with our donation even though I personally was happy. A person yelled at my husband, “500 for your wife”. This was in very bad form and I insist you do not take western people to these holy men at all. We want to see the lake and understand the history. It was so beautiful and was completely ruined.

title: the streets are filled with hawkers
review: every guide book warns of the hawkers and they are correct. the many shops are repetitious .

title: Pushkar Lake - Calm and Setene
review: Pushkar Lake is a very holy destination for the religious minded Hindus. The lake is almost fully sorrounded by about more than 100 temples. There are ghats around the lake to facilitate taking a bath. A very peaceful and serene destination.

title: Deepak Ayurveda
review: Deepak is sincere, intuitive, knowledgable .  I came to him sick, weak and tired.  Over one month I had auervedic massages with herbs to strengthen me.  He also gave me good advice about diet and life style.He also relaxed and toned my muscles.

title: Watch out for the corrupt priests
review: An amazing holy place full of magic and wonder. I visited on a photo trip to capture images around the lake and it didn't disappoint. The only downside was the no photography policy of bathing people which was a shame because it's such a beautiful ritual, but I respect their wishes. I wouldn't want to be photographed while I bathe. Priests are full on. If you get asked by someone for flowers don't accept. It's a trick to taking your money. I got stung but once you have the bracelet you won't be get hassled again. Just be prepared for it. Be stern and say NO!

title: Extortion not religion
review: We wished we had read trip advisor first! We were lambs to the slaughter! Out of 3 weeks travelling this was the only bad experience - the so called holy men try to rip you off and guilt trip you into 'donating' thousands of rupees. They helpfully suggested that my friend could use a credit card!! if you go to Pushkar research your visit thoroughly - personally, there are so many other amazing places to go I'd give it a miss. A bit of deprived financial oxygen might kill off the scamming scum floating around the lake.

title: Serene
review: I loved this lake. It is up there with one of my favourite lakes. Serene & peaceful. Lovely for a prayer & contemplation. My tour guide Mukesh Dolya helped with the history behind the lake.

title: Truly Holy  but...
review: ... be careful with those who will invite you to pray on the side of the Lake. They will ask you money. And it's ok. But they won't ask rupees. You have to pay in your currency. Really unfair. Be careful and enjoy the spirit of the place.

title: Serene! Holy!
review: We took a drive from Ajmer to Pushkar. You can take a halt in the mid and get clicked.

title: Conmen all around this lake
review: Beware of so called sadus approaching you. They put flowers in your hand lead you to the waters edge, give you a blessing ask you to name your children and grandchildren, ask you to promise to respect the lake, ask you to promise to respect the area and ask you to promise to give 2,000 rupees to them. I altered it to 5 rupees - just be aware of the conmen all around the lake.

title: beautiful spiritual center crawling with scam artists
review: Pushkar lake is supposed to be a spiritual place but unfortunately it's crawling with people who claim to be Brahman trying to take advantage of you by giving you free flowers and/or trying to insist you give them donations.

title: Awesome!
review: Pushkar is a beautiful lake city famous for the only Brahma temple in the world. The walk to the temple through the street lined with absolutely stunning stuff at mind blowing prices is definitely an attraction for the shoppers.

title: Pushkar lake & Amazing Ayurvedic Massage
review: Have to go to the lake especially at sunset, follow the sounds of the drums where you even learn how to play the rajasthani drums... If you want a relaxing massage ask around at Sunset Point for Deepak Ayurveda.. such a relaxing massage where he will be able to read your energy and tell you things that can help you emotionally/spiritually... highly recommend

title: Beautiful
review: The lake was glorious at all times of the day. Very quiet and peaceful. You will definitely visit the lake when in Pushkar! Sunset is particularly majestic.

title: Excellent massage by the holy lake
review: Highly recommend the special variety of massages given by Deepak of Deepak Ayurveda Massage Centre and School of Massage who speaks English and Spanish. Born into a family of more than three generations of Hindu Masseurs. Deepak can also give Dietary Consultations and makes his own special oils for Wellbeing.

title: Serene, beautiful and colorful
review: I visited Pushkar on a full moon day in January, 2016 and it was an experience of a lifetime. The lake is beautiful and calming. I wish the streets were a little cleaner or that people didn't spit everywhere, but hey, between eating Malpuas and staring at all the shops, one hardly notices the flaws ;)

title: The center of the town
review: The tiny town is based around the periphery of this cute small lake which gets lit up with diyas during evening ceremonies

title: Nice place but bit too far
review: Though the place is very nice with having unique history of having the world's only temple of Lord Brahma but a bit too far from Jaipur.

title: Good place
review: The Pushkar lake is quite big and looks very beautiful. The lake is situated right at the centre in Pushkar. The white buildings/temple around the lake looks very beautiful on a sunny day.

title: When in pushkar, you have to visit the lake
review: Right at the centre of pushkar, this holy lake is the main attraction where pilgrims come to bathe. A peaceful place early mornings and during dusk..

title: Get ready to "donate" money
review: We visited Pushkar for a day which is plenty of time. One stop was the lake after visiting the Brahma Temple where you get the flowers for the lake. We were warned that we would be asked for money which we were prepared for however we were asked separately immediately after receiving the blessing at the lake. Be prepared that if your on a budget that you give separately.

title: Excellent place
review: When we reached the pushkar sarovar it was late evening. Pushkars aarti was going on and there was abeautiful reflection of lights and buildings in the still water. It was an amezing mixture of beauty serenity and holy chanting. On the other side of pushkar there is a beautiful resaurant overlooking the lake. We were getting late so we could not go to the restaurant

title: good to see lake
review: pandas were forcing for pooja and charge heavy amount.and some time misbehave with travellers.avoid pandas

title: Good
review: Spiritual place. People do puja here. We were with a group tour and liked the place. Priest was decent and did group puja

title: Only religious tourism
review: It is badly maintained and managed lake, its beauty nearly lost. Poor chap in hope of getting free of sins they did bathing in that water looks like very unhealthy. It can be a wonderful tourist lake, Ajmer should learn from Udaipur.

title: Visit ghats in other holy waterside towns
review: Considering the noise, crowding and scams at the Pushkar ghats (stairs to the water) visiting ghats in other towns such as Delhi, Varanasi,  Haridwar, Amarkantak, Chitrakuta, Dakshineswar or Rishikesh make better sense.  Absolutely do not accept flowers from men posing as "holy men."  They will demand very large "donations" from each person in your group.

title: Amazing place
review: Pushkar is an amazing place. It has a more relaxed vibe and a great place to spend 2-3 days taking it easy and just exploring the shops,temples and restaurants. It is a small places and quite clean and friendly.

title: Beauty
review: This lake is beautiful and we loved it.

title: Pushkar lake scammers
review: I got sucked in by the supposed holy men at the lake. I was walking with my kids and before I even realised what was happening, this man had pressed flowers into my hand a red mark on my forehead and started was being lead to lake edge. I resisted saying I was Christian and did not believe in Hindu rituals. He was so inistent that it was for everyone. I went along with the ceremony unwillingly. So it ends with him insisting on minimum us$20 donation. I said that donations are voluntary, that I was choosing not to donate and that I only went along with the ceremony because he insisted. He was not happy and used a few words to describe me but we walked away without any trouble.

title: Sunset
review: Peaceful place

title: A lake shrouded in sprituality
review: The Pushkar Lake is called Brahma Sarovar and there is a very famous Brahma temple next to the lake. It is the only Brahma temple in India. The lake is surrounded by markets where you can buy  items such as crafts, readymade clothes, color stones, jewellary etc. The lake offers beautiful view especially during sunrise and sunset.

title: Very big natural lake
review: Pushkar lake is a very big natural lake.

title: Peace like never before.
review: On the Rajasthan trip with 2 of my friends , Pushkar was destination number 5 in our list after Udaipur,Mount Abu,Jodhpur and Ajmer. We were in Pushkar only for few hours but watching sunset sitting at Ghat near Pushkar lake was one of our best experience. Highly recommended.

title: Religious feeling
review: Consider to be pious lake created by brahma.little be careful about people otherwise beauty of pushkar.

title: Excellent Feel!
review: Very nice place for nature lovers! Very calm and airy. The best time of the day to visit would be early morning. Gosh, I wish I'd go there again!

title: Monsoons in Pushkar !!
review: The pushkar lake is the main attraction of the city, and it sure does live up to all the hype ,especially during the monsoons. When the mountains around the lake get covered in clouds. Its a heavenly view. Team that up with small chilled out cafes around the lake,  and you get the perfect setting for a well spent day, just lazing around in the holy city.

title: Beautiful lake
review: The Hindu scriptures describe it as "Tirtha-Raj" – the king of pilgrimage sites related to a water-body and relate it to the mythology of the creator-god Brahma, whose most prominent temple stands in Pushkar.

title: Stunning. Go at sunset
review: Visit at sunset and watch the reflection over the water. It's very interesting to see all the different Ghats that belong to different regional royal families.

title: Holy lake
review: Nice place, a must see. Lots of activities around the Lake but be carefull with people who offer you flowers. You might pay a lot for it.

title: Amazing lake and view
review: This lake is beautiful and I liked it way more than the one of udaipur of the other idian cities. Sunset is nice.

title: Beautiful but watch out for holy man scammers
review: Beautiful lake but we fell victim to the scam mentioned here. This put a bad feel on what is otherwise a beautiful place. I'm not sure why there seems to be no attempt to protect tourists as it will doubtless prevent people recommending Pushkar as a destination.

title: Peace
review: Wished I had stayed longer in Pushkar, sitting around the lake is magnificent, quiet after the chaos of the city tours

title: Serene
review: Beautiful and serene. A nice place to feel calm and get yourself rejuvenated.  I will definetely try and come back.

title: Famous Pilgrimage Place in Rajasthan
review: Pushkar Lake in Pushkar is a sacred lake for the Hindus. Regarded as 'Tirtha Raj ' because of the holy water body and association of Creator of Universe Lord Brahma, whose temple is existing at Pushkar,the only Brahma Temple in India. History of Pushkar Lake and Brahma Temple goes way back in 4th century BC, when such mention was existed on coins. The lake with 52 bathing ghats is worth visiting, where lacs of pilgrims take holy dip in the sacred water of the lake with the believe that all sin will be washed away. Visit Pushkar during Kartik Purnima ( October -November ) when Pushkar Mela is held every year. Camel Fair organised during this time, is biggest in Asia.
