title: Nice enough if you can ignore the holy men/touts
review: The lake looked fairly clean (by India standards). To reach the main ghat, you'll need to walk through a quite touristy road, which is not a big deal. You may even quite enjoy these souvenir stores. Once you near the ghat, there will be quite a few holy men wanting money from you for "services". Do not take anything offered to you. It is not done in good will and a tip is expected. It was annoying having to take off your shoes at the ghat as it was not particularly clean and you'll need to carry your shoes with you.

title: Worth a visit
review: The reviews on trip advisor really put us off Pushkar, but it wasn't anywhere near as bad as it was made out.

title: its a paradise
review: this is main attraction of this holistic place 52 beautiful ghats. the pooja's been done here are mesmerising and very enchanting. its a very peaceful palace...

title: Peaceful place
review: Pushkar is a religious place famous for the lake and the only Brahma temple in the world. Apparently according to the legends a flower fell from Brahma's hand on the earth to form this lake and hence the name. The lake is surrounded by 52 bathing ghats the most important of which are Brahma ghat, gau ghat and a few others. At Brahma ghat there are priests who will help making your offering and prayers and they will a also ask for a donation immediately afterwards. There are lots of touts around and could be avoided. The brahma temple is worth visiting and also the Savitri temple which is on top of a hill, There are lovey shops around the lake and good dhabas serving authentic rajasthani food such as dal bati churma abd bajra rotis.

title: Deepak Ayurveda
review: My time with Deepak was the best part of my trip to Pushkar. Deepak is a real professional, totally appropriate, and gives an incredible massage. I highly recommend that you get the full treatment, which includes an energy reading. He is very intuitive and can tell you what you need to hear about yourself in order to make changes for greater happiness. He gives suggestions and good life advice in a very friendly, humble tone. I learned so much from Deepak and would recommend him to anyone.

title: The holy lake.
review: This place is good for senior citizens. We witnessed many foreigners offering prayers at the lake. It was a good place overall.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: It is a clean place, serene one. The sunset point at Pushkar is really nice. There are many cafes available there where you can sit and relax.  Also along the road to the lake, there are mini outlets which sell Indian handicrafts and dresses mainly for tourists.

title: Caution!! Money making opportunity.
review: We visited the lake and was offered by the tour guide to participate in a prayer ritual done by a priest, and he said you make a donation which is the funding towards meals for the many priest that perform these rituals and stay along the lake.

title: Unkempt.
review: The Pushkar lake,though a very sacred  lake for the Hindus is highly unkempt and very dirty.

title: Spiritual place
review: Pushkar lake is one of the best quiet places for spiritual upliftment. It offer great views and those who come for pilgrimage they can have easy Pooja there. The place is full of foreign tourist and the market nearby thrives on it.

title: Lake view is same as everywhere...nothing special
review: Ghats are less crowded...lake view same as anywhere else....nothing special about the view ...i guess it should be better during the camel fair or festival time when there is more crowd

title: Awesome Chill place
review: Visit the Pushkar lake in the evening or better - head up to savitri temples for one of the most incredible sunsets you'll ever see. The place is chill with backpackers playing instruments. I had a really great time in Pushkar and headed to the lake every evening for sunset and dinner.

title: Nice huge saroval but full of pandits ready to take out money from your pocket in the name of God
review: It's a huge lake but maintenance is just average. The place is full of pandits (priests), who are just sitting there to fool the tourists and take out money from their pockets in the name of their ancestors and God.

title: Very nice lake with buildings surrounding.
review: We were at the lake at the time of a religious holiday and it was really beautiful to see.  The surrounding area was busy and crowded, however, you will be able to walk through the buildings built around the lake to the concrete landing that goes to the edge of the water behind each building and witness the bathing of thousands of beautifully dressed people who have come for the holiday.  The lake is not out in the open as I expected.  You will have to go into the city and walk a short distance to one of the buildings that has access to the lake.  As you walk between shopping stalls to get there you will likely think you are in the wrong place but you are not.  Make sure you take the time to actually go to the lake as it is easy to get distracted by the temple and streets of shopping and food here.

title: good visit
review: well beware the pandas and other people trying to sell stuff like chara for the cows and bird seeds. also you have to take off your shoes is you want to take a walk around the lake and patches are covered with moss and slippery, but the lake is worth a visit and the walk around was loads of fun

title: Beautiful, Serene and Peaceful
review: Pushkar Lake is very beautiful and serene. It's impossible not to contrast itwith Varanasi, the far more famous city situated on a body of water. Pushkar is so much more peaceful. It is worth spending an hour or two just sitting on a ghat or in a cafe in one of the beautiful buildings around the lake.

title: magical, spiritual & mythological Pushkar
review: Pushkar & lake captures the imagination of giant drop of water in a desert.....mythological creation by Lord Brahma with the petal of the flower falling onto earth with an exact location in the lake, & where there is the only temple in India or in the world dedicated to Lord Brahma (one of the holy trinity in Hinduism).

title: An enchanting and spiritual place..
review: Just came back from a weekend trip to Pushkar with my parents and wife.

title: AWESOME VIEW
review: Let's get the bad out the way, it's a 15 minute walk into the town, down quite a rural unlit road. The pool is more of a place that animals go to die, rather than the nice relaxing area you'd dreamed of. It was very noisy too, people shouting and running about etc, not sure if we were just unlucky or if this is a recurring problem. If you can put up with that, read on... The hotel is almost like a castle with a grand entrance and an outside seating area with a good view of the surrounding hills. Lovely food, and a secret stash of the old Kingfisher made me forgive all of the previous misgivings (you have to understand pushkar is a dry religious village so booze is hard to come by). To conclude, don't pay more than £20. It's away from the hustle and bustle which has its obvious benefits as well as costs. But if you're looking for a nice room in Pushkar and don't mind a walk it's for you.

title: Beware of the scam
review: Reading through the reviews, it looks like the Indian visitors had positive experience, but my experience was negative. I initially submitted a review going into details what happened, but TripAdvisor wouldn't publish the review. So if you are not Indians, please be very careful with the priests. They will try to get you to make pricey donation and will separate you from your spouse so they can take as much money as they can. If someone tries to give you flower petals, please avoid them. If you see people wearing white cotton clothing, avoid them.

title: very serene location
review: dont hire a guide and skip the rituals, enjoy the view and history, you can see lot of people taking a dip in this lake.

title: Calm place to enjoy sunset
review: If you are someone who gets peace with just looking at Sunset then this is the place to be. The ghat houses lot of roof top lake view cafe where one can sit, sip and enjoy sun setting down.

title: One of the sacred place for Hindus and only one place having Lord Brahma temple
review: One of the sacred place for Hindus and only one place having Lord Brahma temple on the Earth. one must visit to understand the hindu mythology tale and much more.

title: Pushkar Lake - The Holy Place
review: The scenic lake of Pushkar is situated in a valley about 10 kms from Ajmer. Pushkar Lake is enclosed by hills and desert. Pushkar Lake is one of the most holy place for Hindus. There are about 52 Ghats and 400 temples in Pushkar which are situated on the banks of the Pushkar Lake. According to the Hindu scriptures, the sacred lake of Pushkar is described as "Tirtha Raj” or the king of all pilgrimage sites related to a water body. No pilgrimage is said to be complete unless one takes a holy dip here. And if the ritual is performed on Kartik Purnima, it is thought to be equivalent to performing yagnas for several hundred years.

title: Full of Beauty
review: Photography is prohibited  around this lake  because basically women takes bath here so over all its a beautiful place u must visit here if u r in Pushkar

title: Lake is nice
review: The Pushkar Sarovar is a nice spiritual place to find peace. A must visit lake. It tells the story of Lord Brahma and the story is actually interesting.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Beautiful and relaxing place to chill and whatch the sun set. Thers monkeys runing arround, people meditating and lots of birds flying.

title: Attractive Place
review: We were here during October and there was absolutely no crowd.  This place is simply great due to its holiness.  Instead of undertaking any holy exercise with the help of priest (who normally extract maximum money),  give some alms to old who need assistance desperately.  Shopping is inexpensive around this place.

title: Refreshing place
review: A very nice refreshing place to go visit. A little away, and not much to do there, but still a nice visit.

title: Robbed by the name of religion
review: They forced us to give 'donation' and told us that it's for all our families.

title: Holy Lake
review: Holy Lake. they say that a dip in this lake would clear you of all your sins. so guys this is where u must go right away.

title: Serene surroundings
review: A good sized lake to be visited when going to Brahma temple. The lake has no recreation facilities as one would normally expect around a waterfront. This has religious significance and is very peaceful for the purpose.

title: Not a good experience
review: Like most of the holy places in India, this place is also infested by the "Pandas", who rein all over the place. The place is very unclean and full of beggars.

title: Too hyped abt the aarathi,, its like any other aarathi done in normal temples.. but view in the evening is too good
review: Too hyped abt the aarathi,, its like any other aarathi done in normal temples.. but view in the evening is too good. all the temples outlets (pushkarani) are to the lake and lights and diyas make d magic if u r on time...

title: Nice like but too many scammers around
review: Ordinary lake but take care:

title: Massage at Deepak - a must!
review: If you are looking for a good massage focused on the personal characteristics of your body, go to Manoj Sen (Deepak Sen).

title: The only temple of Lord Brahma
review: Place is suitable for performing puja and rituals. They have now built good platforms for performing various rites and rituals. Puja thalis are available all along. Even parking for own cars and buses is made wide and is in plethora.

title: Do Not Dip Your Feet - Not Clean like the Ganges in Rishikesh
review: In this tiny, holy town, their God is Brahma, the Creator. Most tourists who come here come for religious purpose. That means, yes, the lake. Our guide made us sit in a tiny spot and explained the legend of the lake along with Lord Brahma. Then he mentioned the donation box “several times” and said not mandatory but your donation will feed many hungry children. It worked as all of us reached into our pockets to make our offering. They will give you a receipt if you like.

title: very good lake
review: very good lake at around Lord Brahma mandir. people take bath in this lake for getting salvation & getting mukti from his sins.

title: Photography not allowed
review: beautiful place but degraded by the behavior of local authorities. Foreigners are not allowed to take pictures but their money "do not stink" them. The first thing you see at every entrance is extremely big donation box (written in English !!!). Best solution: Take thick socks because it is necessary to take off shoes and the ghats are very dirty (pigeon excrement). Do not take photos there, but do not give them any money. The photos you can make comfortably later from some of the adjacent roof restaurants, there are a lot of them there.

title: Great experience
review: Feels heavenly to be here. Just beware of the touts promising a homage to ancestors. Just ignore them and stay on.

title: Very nice lake
review: This lake is very nice having 52 gates if you are in pushkar, visit during evening and you really enjoy this lake.

title: A ghat to remember.....
review: This is first religious place which stuck cord with us.Having visited other ghats in other holy places I was not interested as I find them very unappealing with garbage all around,pushy pandas and over crowded as all places in India.We had gone to attend camel fair and visited it only on third day of our stay when we all were tired of camel fair and was I surprised.It was almost the day if holy dip of kartik purnima and still it was not that crowded.There are peaceful corners around the lake where you could sit and just observe and marvel at the faith of people.I always feed education makes you sceptical and such places prove me true......simple people with fee faith come and take holy dip and are at peace with self......we sit and feel bad about pollution of lake afraid to take dip as may catch some infection ......in end we all did dip in water and boy was it cold....in and all very impressed with beauty n faith of place.

title: Must Visit attraction in Pushkar
review: It will be great to time your visit especially during the Camel Fair which lasts about 2 weeks. Great ambience around the lake at that time. Lights, colours and Sound makes a very delightful experience for a tourist and for a photographer. Have a great camera as you will be able click amazing pictures. The lake is surrounded by 52 ghats and offers a serene experience during night and evening.

title: The Morning Prayer
review: The lake has 3 sides access for people. I was there in the Sunrise hour, where you see people performing their prayers and some painting by the lake side. Great time to shoot pictures.

title: Auspicious surroundings
review: Be here for hours and see the busy ghats.it has great scenic view. Its very dirty and thats what all the places at pilgrimages are but never mind and enjoy the lovely atmosphere of all ghats.

title: Beautiful
review: It's a beautiful lake. And I visited when Maha Aarti is organised. It looks much more beautiful at night.

title: Lovely view of the lake
review: The lake it's self was lovely, if you enter by ghats beware of the blessing that you are told will be free, but then you'll be ask for 2000 rupees to bless you family. It's a complete con! I'd advise going round the opposite side as you can sit and enjoy the view with out being hassled.

title: Scenic
review: We visited the lake at night during the Pushkar Fair. It was very atmospheric and we enjoyed our time there.

title: Touristy but Enjoyable
review: I found the Camel Fair to be very touristy but still an enjoyable experience. There were fantastic concerts and cultural events at night and lots of creative activities during the day. My favorite experience was taking a camel out into the desert and sleeping overnight. I would recommend taking a camel with Dharmu - a local camel driver. He is very friendly and speaks English. He loves what he does and cares about his customers' experience. He can be reached at +91-9982304494

title: The lake not that magnificent but religious importance !
review: This was the second time I visited the famous pushkar lake ! Though, the lake is not that magnificent by any means (even if I compare it to the one that in Jaipur be it mansagar lake or sagar) but still it holds religious importance to many in Hindu religion & even one of the main tourist attraction in the "Pushkar" city ! This time we visited Jaipur ghat which is quite calmer as compared to other Ghats ! The lake is not that clean but still gives a quite picturesque view with old buildings, houses & hills behind ! A must visit point if anyone is travelling the religious city !

title: A beautiful place to relax
review: When the sun is shining (as it is most days) the lake is VERY beautiful!  It is at it's best in the early morning when it is at it's brightest and most colourful, and near sunset when it is bathed in a golden light. In the morning you can see many people bathing at the Ghats (steps that are all around the lakes edge.  The only thing that spoils Pushkar are the pushy brahma "priests" who set themselves up at the viewpoints around the lake. They will do their best to force you to do ceremonies that I'd suggest you don't want to do, then want to take huge "donations" that they claim go to the temples. I'd suggest you point blank refuse because you shouldn't encourage them, or put 100 rupees aside in your pocket and before they start, tell them that's all you have. When they've finished with you, they'll tie some coloured "temple" string around your wrist so you won't get hassled anymore.  Climbing the sunrise viewing hill before dawn and the sunset point at night are both well worthwhile.  It is a very pleasant place to spend a few days if you have time.  The many rooftop restaurants afford great lake views when eating.  Don't miss having a fantastic full Ayurvedic massage from Deepak Sen at Hotel V.K. Tourist Palace, on the way to the Sunset Point.  Sensational!

title: holy place pushkar lake holy bath is a must and bramha darshan
review: ghats are like memorises of varanasi ganga ghats

title: Lake with religious story
review: The story behind the lake makes everyone visit it. The lake by itself is not clean anymore to take a dip. We only dipped our ankles in the lake, offered a prayer by ourselves and were away.

title: Culturally significant
review: It's a nice square lake surrounded by 52 ghats.

title: Nice small lake with beautiful sunsets
review: Take a seat at the Lake View Café and just watch the day go by in Pushkar. The ceremonies at the Ghat, the stunning sunsets...

title: A beautiful but dirty lake with a lot of hagglers around it
review: We visited this place at the end of the camel fair so it was very crowded and the water was quite polluted. The view was very good but it was full of people after our pocket. Some guys introduced themselves as priests, they even produced ids supporting their claim and they told us to do a ritual where we leave a flower in the lake while praying for our loved ones. Naively so we took part to that and it was nice. Afterwards we were all pressured for donations and when we reclined, commenting that if they wanted money they should have said so, we got Brahma's curse(!) and a few very bad words in hindi. Bad karma for them, a bad taste in the mouth for us.

title: Go the Arti beware the priests
review: Pushkar is a lovely town and during the camel fair it is a live with camels , horses and cattle ...sellors and buyers great sideshows ...a must to visit if you can

title: Pushkar Lake
review: The lake is something you should see while in Pushkar, but there isn't much too it. Just don't get sucked into a blessing from a priest.

title: Nice
review: The lake is more like a ghat. There are lot Pandits doing Puja and therefore lot of stuff left behind at the ghats. Can be cleaner. The area around the lake is nice. There is a market running all along the banks.

title: Very Avergae
review: Average , but calm place to spend evening with family or yourself.

title: It is a huge lake. Photography is however not allowed during the Pushkar Festival.
review: The restriction on photography during the day say till about 4 pm is justified. But later in the evening it should be allowed.

title: Absolutely beautiful!
review: This is my first visit to India so this kind of scenery is new to me and I was very impressed by it.

title: Pleasant
review: We went to Pushkar late morning and were a little intimated from all of the bad reviews on here. We stopped at Laura's cafe (big purple one you can see from the lake - well worth a visit) to have a quiet coffee and a crepe and check out the lake from afar.

title: Great Lake Pushkar
review: been there in the month of nov 2015 at the time of pushakr fair

title: Beware of the holy men
review: Nothing special hear to see  unless you are a Hindu

title: Peace, Solace !!!
review: if you are someone you loves exploring the tiny streets, find solace at the ghats, like to see and know how people follow their rituals, then it is your place.Seeing the sunrise at the ghats, doing a early morning Parikrama filled me with some great encouraging energy, I never experienced before.

title: A serene spiritual experience
review: We witnessed the Maha Aarti on the first day of Pushkar Festival.

title: Must see...............
review: Best time to see Pushkar lake is at sunset, walking around the Gaths when locals visit the lake...........!!!

title: !!!!!!!!!***Avoid the flower men***!!!!!!!!!
review: Its really nice here, very good sunset too! Just please avoid the men giving you flowers. This is what spoilt the experience for me, they specifically target tourists and they will ask you to place a flower in the water for good karma. Just ignore them as being polite means nothing to them. They will insist until you give in! So annoying! If you was to take a flower from them, they will make you pay money, a lot of money! (Approx: 2,000 Rupee) and if you refuse, they will kick up a huge fuss claiming you are disrespecting India etc etc.

title: Deepak's massages are the best in India!
review: My wife and I have been travelling around India for three months and between us had over 20 massages of varying quality. We met Deepak on the street in Pushkar the other day and assumed he was just another tout trying to get us in to his Ayurvedic centre for another average massage. However, almost immediately we sensed this guy was different, the way he spoke, his sincerity and humanity.

title: Beautiful, but very pushy touts
review: Come within 100 feet of the thing and you will have people trying to sell you flowers. So you say no, and they say "not for you, for the lake," and you still say no, and then they get angry and yell it at you and try to shove them in your hands. Happened again and again. Only place in India where the touts actually yelled at me.

title: A visit to Pushkar Lake at Night
review: It is a very peaceful place. I chose to sit there quietly and admire its beauty. The atmosphere was calm and peaceful with very less people around. Will surely visit it again the next time.

title: GURU BHAHMA.................MUST VISIT IN A LIFE
review: All around seen chanting mantras by brahmins and very nice religious atmoshphere seen here,,,must go in a life...

title: Excellant scenes and views
review: Pushkar lake is very beautiful lake surrounded by temples and hotels.If you belief in God, engage a pandit  near the ghats for puja. This is optional and not necessary in my view. Natural beauti is excellant. It is good to spend some time sitting along the ghats. However, the temple and ghats are a must-see destination.

title: Nice place, like it very much
review: nice holy lake near Bramha temple, photography strictly not allowed over there, but I was surprised to see people are swimming/taking bath when it is restricted. I believe it should be restricted since it will pollute all the water. doing puja of water was good wihtout harming/polluting water.

title: Badly maintained
review: Unless you are on a pilgrimage, don't bother to go. It's quite badly maintained (read dirty, filthy) and you gotta remove your footwear if you want to step anywhere close to the lake. Would take a heavy dose of faith to take a dip in here. Enjoy the Pushkar mela ( if it is on when you visit ), else safely drop it from your itinerary.

title: Beware scammers
review: The lake itself is quite beautiful, however be warned, it is a hotbed for scammers. Upon entering the lake me and my two friends were ushered into a Hindu ritual. For fear of offending a culture we did not know we politely sat and listened to the history of the lake, and engaged in a spiritual ceremony. At the end of the ceremony we were asked to donate money to feed hungry families, when we offered to place this money in the anonymous charity boxes the men became disgruntled. Confused and threatened I gave 400 rupees, only to be met with more aggressive requests for my money, asking me to hand in my Australian dollars as well as rupee. The same treatment was given to my travelling companions, who were more forceful in their refusal than I, although they still gave 200 and 300 rupee respectively. It was incredibly uncomfortable and disheartening to have been the victim of such an insensitive crime.

title: Beautiful view, sunset, drumming & chanting
review: I had a beautiful sunset time sitting in Lake view cafe and enjoying sounds and view. Other place to see sunset is Sunset Cafe. I guess there is many others but I couldn't fix more to 4 days. You should walk around the lake, no shoes, no photographing, respectfully dressed during daytime. You get different view of lake from a mountain, access from behind the bus station. Life happens around the lake in  Pushkar .

title: Lake admist mountains
review: It's a beautiful place with a lot of history. The lake is surrounded on all sides by mountains and gives a sacred feeling to just sit on the steps and gaze at the ghats and set the pigeons taking flight or a seer bathing and hear some distant  sounds of holy songs.. The priests perform a pooja for couples to pay reverence to the holy lake and blessing for marital bliss. But be wary of some priests who may ask u to shell out money in the name of religion. After a visit to the Brahma temple, have lunch at the rajasthani  local dhabba serving hot and fresh local veg food with a tall glass of lassi.

title: best view from lake view cafe...
review: if you want to avoid the locals or the masses...just order something at lake view...& enjoy the ghats from the rooftop with ur coffee & the snacks.

title: pretty little lake
review: pretty little lake right in old town. To get close, you had to remove your shoes. It is a holy lake. There ae also a lot of monkeys around.

title: Sacred Huge Lake
review: The taxis are parked at the side of the lake and touts start convincing you from this point.Better not to heed their words and walk forward.There are so many ghats around this huge lake.If you are only visiting the ghats or to see the lake, then go any one of the ghats.Put your foot wares before going down the ghat.Remember to guard your foot wares, as there is no locker room and other people may stole your things.Another interesting thing is that all over the ghat there is warning sign displayed that photography is prohibited in the ghat and Rs.500/- shall be fined.But tourists taking photographs freely and no one stops them.

title: Breathtaking
review: What an absolute pleasure and honour to visit this very spiritual lake. Walked around the ghats to watch the devotees. Remember to remove your shoes when near the lake and photography of the bathers is forbidden. Spent a good few hours at a lakeside cafe just soaking up the vibes. Wonderful.

title: Deepak ayurveda massage centre and school massage
review: I tried massages here many times and really like the service Deepak gives. He is friendly with his customers and gives different types of massages at a fair rate. If you feel like having a good relaxing massage i recommend this place.

title: Water Calms the mind
review: Need a moment to yourself or simply want to escape from the town the lake always provides the space to unwind and take that moment.

title: Sublime experience at the sacred lake
review: My guide Monu did a good job and got me to meet a priest Koshal who did a fabulous job of completing sacred rituals at the lake before starting with the temples darshan...

title: A must site to visit for Pushkar
review: You can walk throughout the lake via any ghat from the main market road. If visit at late evening, it will be peaceful.

title: Very Interesting Place!
review: If you are visiting India for culture and spirituality, this is the place to be.  Loud, colorful, busy, real.

title: Very beautiful lake at the teerth palace pushkar
review: Very beautiful lake at the teerth palace pushkar sitting area are very comfortable at ghat and water is clear and many peopding doing puja and deepdan at the pushkar lake side and i see many people take hily dip at the pushkar lake.

title: Pushkar Lake visit
review: A beautiful and peaceful experience where a guide provided information and background how each temple came to be built there.

title: Came for camel fair at Pushkar
review: Once here at the Camel Fair we toured around and stopped here to see the Holy lake , excellent place to visit and can recommend a visit here

title: Beautifu Vast Lake
review: Travelling to this place has been a bit different experience as I travelled from Jaipur solo, went in a public transport(bus) and it took 4 hours to reach there,one has to cross few colorful stalls to reach the world famous Brahma temple, You will find many guides who apart from guiding you through the temple and the lake will  also update you with the historic stories about the place, At the lake you would find enough place to sit and soak in the tranquility of the place, flight of the pigeons and devotees offering their prayers and taking holy dip.

title: Pushkar Tuk Tuk Driver
review: If you require a driver to take you to any of the sights in Pushkar, as well as markets for groceries, or even a sunset tour to Aloo Baba's to see the peacocks: Please use the wonderful Mr. Satu.

title: Beautiful lake with an interesting story
review: This was my first visit to Pushkar and as I was told the lake is the main thing to it. The associated story of the lake and how/why this is the only Brahma temple in the world was good to know :-)

title: Dirty Lake
review: It is most shameful to see dirt around the lake. All entry points to lake are very narrow and dirty. The district administration should take care of the lake.

title: Visit of pushkar fair
review: Holly dip in divine lake in Kartik purnima and what else you need....... Lots of pilgrimage, colors of India, religious emotions of pilgrimage,  by taking dip in holly Lake purify our souls.....

title: Good View
review: Location of the sarovar is quite good. I wish it could have been a bit more clean. It looks beautiful in the evening and during the Aarti.

title: Breathtaking!
review: Grab a seat at any of the rooftop cafes along the road leading up to the main temple and soak in the amazing view. You could spend hours just gazing at this beautiful lake. The tranquility that this vista affords is unparalleled.

title: Culturally unique
review: The lake is  unique from a cultural perspective.  You could visit the "sunset point" on the lake during evening. It's not a natural wonder. You'll have to take off your shoes near the water.

title: beware of scam by priests
review: beware of scam by priests

title: People Contaminating The Water In Name Of Religion
review: the beauty is been worsened by the humans on the pretext of taking bath in the lake and contaminating the water and releasing bad waters in the lake..

title: Holy Place with an Amazing Sunset View in Ajmer
review: 52 Ghats in Pushkar. Amazing experience to visit this place. The water in pushkar lake is dirty because people doing rituals in it. The lake view from any of the pushkar ghat is amazing.

title: "Holy Lake"
review: This is very holy lake but people makes dirty this holy lake,crowded at kartik month,lot of devotee comes there to take pushkar snan.

title: Interesting Hindu ceremony
review: Enjoy a walking tour of the holy city of the God, Brahma; visit the holy Pushkar Lake and the famous 8th century Brahma Temple dedicated to Lord Brahma the creator of the universe and the only Bull temple in the world. Experience a special Pooja ceremony at a Ghat with a Hindu priest on the banks of Pushkar Lake. Beautiful site at night with the light. Nice shopping area near by village.

title: Serene view and very quiet feel!
review: The Pushkar lake is in the middle of city and very nearby from Brahma temple as well as the Pushkar shopping street. It was a pleasant visit and darshan of this sarovar which filled us up with a peaceful feeling..

title: Worst experience in India!
review: It makes me so sad to even have to write this. I am so sure Pushkar could be a beautiful experience but two so  called "priests" robbed me and my friend of that. We tried to ignore them but they latched themselves onto us and when it became apparent we would not be giving them any money they used the excuse that I laughed (at something that had nothing to do with them) to become incredibly abusive and ordered us from the lake. Even when it was clear we were leaving they still followed us shouting abuse. Then they tried to involve our driver and when he wouldn't back them they openly slandered him. I wish I had been better at avoiding them to begin with- they basically came up to me as I got out of the car and handed me a flower. These men are not holy men at all but touts waiting to exploit tourists. It just made the whole place ugly for us and the only bad experience I have had in India over four visits. I still feel really sad about it.

title: Can be slippery.. Be careful
review: Parts of the lake are deceptive and can be slippery. Good to take one cautious step at a time. Also visit when there are others around and can pull you out of danger if required. Some of the ghats to visit also are gau ghat, julelal ghat, varaha ghat.. these are sometimes quieter and cleaner than the pushkar lake.

title: Surreal experience
review: The Pushkar Lake was fascinating for me as the location of Gajendra Moksham, one of the oldest episodes in Hindu mythology.  It completely exceeded expectations as for a public place in a pilgrim town, it was reasonably well kept, convenient to access and very quite in the couple of mornings we visited.  I would strongly recommend a walk around the lake.

title: Important Hindu Holy place
review: This lake has importance in Hindu mythology and once a visit. Beware of touts who ask you to perform this n that pooja. Lake is surrounded by the houses all along. Stairs may be slippery, so take care

title: Atmospheric
review: Arrived after sunset and lake was lit up by nearby buildings. Wonderful chanting and lots of pilgrims. A good place to absorb local culture.

title: I take Holy Dip.
review: The Lake size is very big and sunset from the Holy Pushkar lake very stunning very colorful shop and nice music run by pushkar temple authority and evening time Deep Dan at Pushkar Lake the view of Deep dan is very awesome.

title: Peaceful setting
review: A wonderful place to sit along the ghats and enjoy the serene atmosphere. Truly beautiful to watch the sunset over the lake.

title: Holy Temple with stepped tank
review: Arrived after a 2.5 road trip from Jaipur. Pushkar has the largest and one of the few temples dedicated to Lord Brahma. A guide is recommended for sight-seeing. The guide will also recommend a pandit to you near the ghats for puja. This is optional and not necessary in my view. We had to be firm on the amount we wanted to donate from the very beginning as during the puja, the pandit's persist in recommending a larger amount to be donated. It is good to spend some time sitting along the ghats and taking in the diving atmosphere. Not much quality shopping at this location. Mostly rip-off's. However, the temple and ghats are a must-see destination.

title: Worth a visit
review: One of the most important cities for Hinduism. really worth a visit. Lots of locals doing purification ceremonies.

title: The holiest lake in this part of the world
review: this is the lake where god brahma set and did his tapsya. This is considered as the most holy lake in hindu religion.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: We did a boat trip which was very restful at sunset. Very nice just to gaze away the time. Lots of shops

title: Don't go near 'Not busy' ghats
review: With other ghats somewhat busy, I thought to explore out a ghat which ain't busy, only too discover the algae formation on the foot steps of the lake. Dipped one leg inside, n slipped myself into the lake with my 3 yrs old. That was a bummer!!

title: Could be more clean place!
review: Could be more clean so the tourists like to visit this place. They take good amount of money from the visitors in lieu of donations which could be used appropriately.

title: ‪Pushkar Lake‬
review: the lake is very nice and peaceful,

title: holy Lake- Not very clean
review: there are various Ghats on this holy lake and there are many people who want to take a dip in the same for various religious reasons.Brahma Ghat is one of the main ghat and spending time there sitting on the stairs is awesome experience. beware of Pandits asking for the Puja

title: Awesome!
review: The place to be when you visit India. We had a nice walk around the small city and finally we ended up to this magic place: really amazing place, cannot be missed!

title: Lake Pushkar & One and only Brahma Temple
review: Its a holy place. World's only Brahma temple is situated here. 1/2 hrs is more than enough for pushkar visit. If you plan for camel safari then you have to spent more time.

title: Peaceful environment
review: It is a lake with story behind. The lake is clean. Walking around the lake is a good choice during evening. Shoes are not allowed near the staircase of the lake.

title: Pure Magic
review: Like being swept into a different world.  Spiritual vibes wash over the ghats.  Music, incense, saddhus, pigeons, cows and enchanting views from every step.  Watch out for the Pushkar Passport touts, and avoid taking any flowers unless tou wish to be blessed for a "donation"

title: Nice lake
review: Its one of the importance lake in the rajsthan.

title: watch from a distance
review: It's just a pond, and though it's 'holy', full of scammers and bullies there, go figure! From a distance it looks ok, from closer up, not so much...

title: good for chillout
review: lake and ghat are good for chill out you can get live music from people it was nice sun set as well but if no one Hester   you can go other side of lake rely quite

title: Enchanting and uplifting
review: A place to just in the evening and enjoy the cool breeze across the lake is an uplifting experience. Avoid the local so called guides as they are not value for money. A must do while in pushkar.

title: Tranquil getaway
review: A little tranquil getaway from the buzz and noise of the town, the Pushkar Lake is considered one among the holy lakes of India. There is a constant inflow and outflow of devotees and one can sit by the steps in the evening and watch the sun set

title: nice on sunrise and sunset, a photographer's delight
review: This is a nice serene place but can be crowded on festivals as people take holy dip in this lake. You can easily take you car near to this place but have to park on the road with some distance away, this distance will be based on how crowed the place is that day, we managed to get a parking space 200 mtrs away from this lake and it was a normal day.

title: Beautiful and Serene
review: A beautiful, peaceful and serene location. There is a sense of tranquility whenever I visit this place. Love the surroundings and the calmness here.. surely a place to Go to and spend some time alone or with friends :)

title: A good place to watch important in hindu religion
review: A good place to watch once although not very well maintained and need more maintance but good to visit once

title: Nice place
review: The road from Ajmer to Pushkar is beautiful with lots of greenery.

title: Calm
review: This is not my firt time in pushkar and really this year the lake isn't very clean. You must visit the holy lake to feel the great indian atmosphere and see one of the best sunset view on the world, always is a peacefull experience!!!

title: Well Maintaned and Clean Lake
review: The Pushkar Lake in the heart of Pushkar is a holy lake and most of the Hindus coming here for visit to Brahma Temple take a dip in the holy water of Pushkar Lake before going to the temple.

title: calming sunset view
review: This is a nice experience to visit this attraction place. The sunset view is gorgeous, calming, relax. Too bad there is no camera allowed to taking photo around the lake, there is someone warning you if they notice you taking photo but we still make it to snap a few. :D great.

title: Calming, Serene experience
review: Granted we went in the off-season so there were barely any crowds but still, I found the Lake a wonderful expereince. Beautiful, clean (by Indian standards) and calming it was the highlight of our trip. Just sit for awhile on the ghats, watch the sun setting and the fish cavorting around. Guaranteed to lower stress!

title: Deepak massage is excellent !
review: I promised Deepak to leave a comment since he was very kind. I found him on tripadvisor also. Me and my wife had a good massage there at the same time, loved it.

title: Nice lake
review: The lake is nice, and the ghats are beautiful, but be aware of holy men giving you flowers, because you will end up having to pay for them.

title: Very nice and interesting lake
review: Very nice and interesting lake. Sotounded by the town. Many ghats go down to the lake, enable the Peaple approach the water during reliegouse ceremonies.

title: Wow - Nice place
review: As stared earlier, Pushkar is one of my favorite short trips out of Delhi. Lake had lots of water which makes it look even better. unfortunately the pests selling religious services are still there.Place needs a clean up.

title: Lake is interesting, don't pay too much
review: The lake is a fantastic experience, with all the worshippers bathing at the sides. We had the ceremony at the side of the lake each with the red paint on the forehead and rice etc. That was very unusual and something you should do. HOWEVER, they will then ask you for a lot of money. Well, not really ask, demand. Stand your ground, I paid 1500 rupees (half their asking price) which was probably still too much. Even though they say it goes to charity and to feed the homeless people you can't help but feel that it is a bit of a tourist trap.

title: Don't miss early mornings on the ghats.
review: Beware of Brahmins offering  to bless you and all your friends and family.  Payment is expected.  But, it's  a wonderful experience if you don't mind the expected payment.

title: Awful place full of criminals
review: Not only the lake looked dirty and the area surrounding it smelled poop and trash, but the people who allegedly run that place are a bunch of orthodox Hindus, or simply put ,criminals. Once we entered the lake, one of them came and asked us to remove our shoes , we did so he followed us telling us about the lake we politely asked him to leave us alone. we just walked a little bit further the second person came asking us not to go that area as people there throw ashes, but there were many other people ( mainly foreigners) standing there just watching then he stupidly said, yes you can go if you wish I just wanted to inform. what was that??? a reason to start an unwanted conversation! We sat somewhere, the third person came handing us flowers and asking us in an authoritative way to throw them in the lake and make a wish. Now we had no patience left any more, we just stood up to leave the place when the fourth person run behind us to ask us about our caste and who knows what else he was blubbering. .. we were shocked and left immediately.

title: Pushers visit
review: Its a holy pilgrim place must be visited once being an indian.there is a special attraction is Lord brahma temple very rare temple in India.taking  holy dip in pushkar  lake  and  visiting Lord brahma temple is soul purification.the lake is naturally formed.

title: Unique for offer Puja to Lord Brahma
review: Unique place for offer puja to Lord Brahma, because there is no any place of Brahma Temple as you can offer puja for Brahma. Best part of this Lake is it surround by city itself but the water and it's locality view are very good.

title: Amazing sunset view
review: Amazing place to visit at the time of sunset with all the background music played by the local musicians.

title: hell on a moped
review: if you want to feel like an extra in the movie Zohan then come to Pushkar, otherwise dont waste your time #toomuchmuseli

title: Not the 'lake' that you expect it to be
review: This is a temple pond/temple tank , not a lake that you would expect it to be. Dirty surroundings ,dirty water and  poorly maintained . Visit this place only if you're on a pilgrimage, else don't bother wasting your time.

title: Brahma Temple, Pushkar Lake
review: Brahma Temple is often overlooked when going to Pushkar Lae, The holiest of Hindu temples in India. The lake is fantastic to experience when we were there for Lord Krishna's birthday but the temple was fantastic to see with hundreds of disciples there worshipping

title: Scam trap
review: People consider this as the main toursit attraction. However, its less of a lake and more of a pond, and its a huge scam trap. The nearby mountains are so much better than this

title: Its ok
review: Its ok, don't be expecting too much especially if you've been to Udaipur! Just beware of the pushy flower guys trying to scam you. I'm sure if you have any common sense you will be ok here

title: Only place on earth for the creator - The Brahma
review: Pushkar - Pushp (Flower)+Kar (Hand) as suggests the name is the only place on earth for the the Creator God named Brahma. Beautiful place surrounded by more than 500 gates and temples. It's the same place where every year most popular Pushkar Mela is organised which is attended by people across the world from almost every faith. The place also has the only Brahma temple. If you are a Hindu and believe in Pitradaan, you will find a priest do the Pooja for you for all your ancestors. It is said, you are lucky in your lifetime to visit this place at least once. So must go.

title: Best place in the world..
review: I suppose this is the best place in the world... Very peaceful city and very religious.. I will definitely tell my friends to come Pushkar at least once in the lifetime.

title: Worship Place for religion lovers
review: Pushkar is the place of lord Brahma and its famous for the temple and pond near the temple. Its one of the important place in travel itinerary of any one visiting Rajasthan. You can buy traditional items near the temple.

title: Holy Lake - not a tourist destination
review: With its sacred ghats and many Hindus using the lake for religious purposes, Pushkar Lake feels largely off-bounds for tourists. No photos, no shoes, no smoking - which is all as it should be, to respect their religious beliefs in a sacred space. Some dodgy brahmins and touts trying to exploit the situation and bully tourists. Pushkar is lovely - I unless you're particularly interested and comfortable in learning more about ghats and how they relate to Hindu beliefs - from a purely touristic perspective it's give or take...

title: Nice from a distance
review: The lake is beautiful to look at when on a rooftop restaurant and has a lot going on around it. The lake itself is very dirty and nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Nothing great
review: The lake is a major tourist attraction of Pushkar.However, there is nothing awestriking about this lake . It is a regular place which being a popular destination of the area is dirty and requires maintainence. However, if you are visiting it, you may like to attend the evening aarti .

title: Not recommended
review: The lake is in poor state and is very filthy. If one is visiting the famous Brahma Temple then a visit to Pushkar is recommended otherwise, one should not add Pushkar lake in his/her itinerary.

title: Nice lake
review: Nice lake, very holy to the residents but nothing really too special. Fish in the water but dirty around the ghats.

title: Nice lake
review: The view of pushkar lake is very nice and peaceful. Behind view of mountains. Nice view of sun set in evening from the lake courner.

title: Go in the early mornings
review: A peaceful place where you can sit in the early mornings and watch the swans and the fish. Just avoid the pandas who will be after your wallet.

title: Divine Place
review: The lake is grand, and very beautiful. We really felt connected and could let go off our worldly worries for a while.

title: suggest to go in the early morning
review: Silent and peaceful; my hotel was near the lake and hence could able to visit in the morning. accordingly i suggest to go in the early morning

title: hi all,  pushkar is a small town. you can easily hire bike and go for pushkar ride. it is a very small place. It can be
review: hi all,

title: Beautiful and Holy lake
review: Pushkar Lake is considered to be a sacred lake for the Hindus. It is the king of all pilgrimage sites. And this is related to Brahma. The world's only Brahma temple is here in Pushkar.

title: Unique!
review: Unique and beautiful.Loved the Aarti. Beware of the corrupt Pandits. Suggest you do your won Pooja and dont fall into their clutches.

title: "hindu holy lake"
review: i have been to pushkar couple of times.everytime i go there i feel realy a deep peace in my mind &soul beside the lake.i also took bath in lake.its a nice way to see devotee of hindues.the brahmins which make pooja sometime piss me of specially when they force you to make pooja.

title: A big water body. nothing much to see
review: Serene and peaceful. Not much to see around just an enclosed water body. there are two approach roads to this place, suggest to take a longer one as it reaches right in front of the temple entrance.

title: for peace lovers
review: you will not find anything grand but the aura near the lake itself is different and peaceful. you will find small restaurants near by from where you can have light snacks overlooking the lake. the best time to visit is in the evening around sunset, when you can listen to far away aartis in the temples and small group of people playing the traditional Indian drums. the overall experience makes you feel divine. the place is full of Israelis and their restaurants. you can also shop some interesting souvenirs on the way back. all in all a very good experience and a must visit place.

title: nice place for relax!
review: This place is very nice , for who want walk , do pooja ( worship for god ) and meditations, i like very much , i stop close to the lake and thinking about life ....  its good place to get peace and get cool mind ... but there is only one bad thing... some indians offer some flowers to tourist and want some rupies ... they actually cheating ... and have many kids asking for money also.... they dont need money.. their parents tell them to beg for money... how i know this? my fiance is indian , and told me many things... this is only the bad thing happening over there.. be carefull when visit .... dont follow anyone , dont let anyone follow you and cheat you... be smart. I been there twice i would be lik to visit again for sure! next to lake theres many restaurant and comerce also very nice!

title: keep your boundaries!
review: nice lake, special  atmosphere, and i would say worth visiting. but as a western tourist be aware of the so called "Brahmins of the lake" - who will agrasivaly try to get you to "respect the tradition" and have a little ceremony on the bank of the lake, for a nice donation of course. say NO or walk away.

title: Underwhelmed!!
review: For a very long time I had planned to visit Pushkar. Having heard that this was the only place with a Brahma Temple..

title: Beautiful Holy Lake.. .
review: I will definitely love to come here again and again.

title: Beautiful area
review: This is a very beautiful lake with amazing architecture surrounding it. Be aware that it is a religious area, so be aware that you need to remove your shoes when you get close. Someone will address you if you don't. They also offer you flowers to throw in the lake, it's considered a blessing. If you don't feel comfortable doing that, they can be pretty forceful, so just know they will try to insist.

title: Nice feeling
review: Was a nice serene place , good time to be there during sunset, performed a puja with the help of our guide, overall a nice experience

title: Holy Place
review: It is a holy place but is not much of a treat on the rainy day when we visited. It said that worshiping while taking a bath in the holy waters can wash away the sins of your own and also of your family members. As it was raining on our day of visit the place turned very muddy and slippery so we did not enjoy this part of the trip very much.

title: Sacred Lake
review: It is considered as one of the most sacred lake in Hindu mythology. The lake is situated on the edge of the desert and surrounded by hills on three sides, is separated from Ajmer by ‘Nag Pahar’ - the snake mountain. It is believed that Kalidas-the 4th century sanskrit poet and playright, chose the setting for his masterpiece Abhigyanam.

title: Sacred Beautiful Lake
review: Pushkar Lake also called as Pushkar Raj is pristine and beautiful. Surrounded by the town of Pushkar, the lake is considered one of the holiest lakes in Hinduism.Take a walk along the ghats of the lake during sunset. The sound of hymns and prayers fil the quiet lake and the cool breeze blowing across you takes you to another level of mystic happiness. Do feed the  cows on the way.

title: Serene & Holy Place
review: This serene lake is considered a holy place and has several ghats, each with a different name and a mythological tale behind it. You need to remove your shoes if you go beyond a certain point. The place wasn't too crowded when we visited and the level of cleanliness,though nothing great, was  reasonable

title: Beautiful lake in the middle of holy city Pushkar
review: Nice and quiet lake - Really beautiful sunset view.

title: Great atmosphere
review: This lake is truly enchanting. Don't trust anyone who wants to offer you a flower or a bracelet they're just seeking a donation

title: Very nice
review: It is a religous lake, it is nice to get closer and see what they do. Remeber you dont go and start taking pictures, be respectful.

title: Must visit in Pushkar
review: The lake is clean and serene. It's even more beautiful at the night time.The lake is of religious significance and has ancient stories attached to it. It's a belief among Hindus that a bath in this lake is equivalent to years of tapasya. There are 52 ghats surrounding the lake some of which are declared  as 'Monuments of National Importance'. The marketplace nearby has lot of varieties and colorful souvenirs to offer. Try the kulhad lassi near the brahma ghat.

title: Needs updating
review: The pushkar lake has lost it charm now as a sacred lake since it is is being surrounded all over the place with so called pandey and other sort of people which has resulted that the ghats of the lake have also lost it charm and heritage.

title: Holy lake Pushkar
review: this place is hardly 18 Km from Ajmer Station; the route from Ajmer to Pushkar take you through hills and is very picturesque. it will be wise to take a guide at Pushkar or else you may end up visiting only the Brahma temple and missing this holy lake altogether.  the lake has a very interesting story which guide will tell you in detail.

title: Peace on earth
review: It was awesome and spritually awakening experience. Drums beating just before arti and loud and soothing matras went deep into .provided such peace and awesome lightness of soul

title: Tradional city to stay for a day or two max
review: Visited during Holi festivals with friends and seen many foreigners came during that time. Half of the Pushkar was full of foreigners, most of them smoking and having drugs.

title: Must see
review: We visited the pushkar lake at around noon time. The lake is vast and beautiful. The place is also very peaceful, maybe because when we visited there were very few people around. The road leading to the lake has restaurants where we had our lunch before returning to the hotel. The pushkar lake truly has a soothing effect on you. I've visited it both the times I went to pushkar.

title: Visit only if you are very religious
review: Visit here if you are really into the whole religious stuff. Not a very great place. It was quite dirty when I had visited. The temple was good though. The markets around were quite colorful.

title: Deepak ayurveda massage centre and School of Massage
review: Deepak provided a first class massage experience throughout my stay. He successfully treated some nasty insect bites with his special oils. He is gentle, calm and relaxing. I have continued to return to Deepak because of his traditional approaches in this modern world so that I will be ready to return refreshed to the modern world I work in.

title: quiet
review: early morning or late evening time the lake is just perfect to meditate, but careful for puja don't give to much it's a prayer and should be free!! just donation!!!

title: Religious
review: Visit only if you are religious ...... Like all other religious places ..... Same .... But best part is they are not for money making . Only if you wish   to donate .....

title: Not recommended
review: Just another attraction. Not very tidy and not lively as well. The condition is very bad as the local authority is probably not taking care.

title: Holy place
review: It's a special and holy place for Indian people. Nice to visit. Beware of the people trying to sell things to you. Lot's of unfriendly people who are just after your money...like in so many places in India

title: Relaxing, nice views
review: The views are beautiful and there is a lot to see. You can relax here for an hour or so and there's plenty of bars overlooking the lake.

title: Beware
review: Pushkar is an interesting and overpriced town.  There is a toll onthe road to get into town.  Definitely out to get the tourists - beware of "the friendly  people near the temple and the lake" it is all about getting lots of money from you, and I mean thousands of $ not rupees.  They make you chant and agree to "donate" at the top of the stairs and then you are taking to the payment booth.  If I had my time over I would give Pushkar a miss unless you are there for spiritual reasons.

title: Beautiful
review: We reached this place towards late afternoon in a cold December after a long journey from Mount Abu to Pushkar. But the moment we reach Pushkar Lake in front of Brahma the breathtaking beauty and calmness of the place takes breath out of us. Very nice place to visit you can just spend quite time looking into the lake. Also have nice restaurants around for food.

title: Pilgrimage Lake
review: Its a pilgrimage place for Hindus. Its on the way to Brahma temple and you can see it on the left side through the gaps between the shops. I will not call it a clean place.

title: The Sacred Pond
review: Most sacred after the Ganges, the Pushkar Sarovar is said to be the birthplace of Lord Brahmaa ((Creator of the Universe). The renowned Brahmaa Temple, the Ranganatha Temple, the Tapovana Ashramas are very popular even among foreigners.   The Hindu Pilgrimage is never complete without a Holi dip in the Pushkar Sarovar. Good hotels and resorts available at reasonable rates. The picturesque view of hills is superb.

title: Yeh man
review: A nice place altough it has a strange feeling to it one get a deep sense of well being when in this town and around the lake. Take time to just clutch out and smell the smells and hear the soinds. Whatever they may be and feel them. As a westerner it took me quite a while to get a deep feel for the placea and loed it when I got it eventually.

title: Serene and beautiful
review: The lake is beautiful and it has some beautiful fishes as well. There are well maintained ghats where one can take bath if he/she wishes to. The lake has a serene surrounding with hills in the background.

title: Shanti Shanti
review: This is a beautiful holy lake and it's wonderful to sit on the that's especially at sunset. Beware men who offer you flower petals to drop in the lake, it is a scam to lighten your wallet of hundreds of rupees to pay respect to the lake. No Indians do it, they do their own thing.

title: Beautiful Pushkar
review: Pushkar Lake was so beautiful the people were very kind and helphul

title: Religious site
review: Pushkar is one of the holiest places in Hinduism since it's believed that Lord Brahma himself came and created the lake.   It is also the only place  where there is a Lord Brahma temple.

title: Take a trip back in time.....
review: Pushkar Lake is still filled with old monuments, temples, thriving bazaar and is also a very holy lake.

title: Beautiful view of the sunset...great music
review: Pushkar lake on the other side of the side...not the temple side...is a very different experience in the city altogether. There is a small café selling coffee and other eatables, some local musicians come together to recreate a truly Rajasthani experience during the sunset and it is a great experience where people are just relaxing by the lake and listening to the music whilst enjoying the beautiful sunset.

title: Hindu Mecca
review: We took the public bus from Ajmer to Pushkar. When entering the town i had never yet been greeted by so many Temples and places of worship such as in Pushkar. A very short walk off the narrow shop and cafe lined main street will bring you to the lake. What a sight ! This is a picture that you see in a travel magazine. A calm lake with the reflection of the surrounding buildings - like a mirror image and people performing their holy bathing rituals and prayers. Sadly no photography is allowed, but i saw the notice only after I had captured on camera all I needed. Try visiting in the morning when it is not that crowed or later in the day if you want to see a frenzy of activity at the lake. Also do not forget to explore the rest of the town as it has numerous temples and places of worship and quaint shops selling souvenier items and clothing. The food is inexpensive and delicious. however beware of scams and pickpockets otherwise it is very safe. You have not been to Ajmer if you have not visited Pushkar.

title: Last night after Pushkar Camel Fair
review: The Pushkar Camel Fair is about a week every year in October/November. The Mela ground is full with people, a little bit outside in the desert a lot of camels everywhere. It has it daily program. But in the night it is quit. Except one night. Thousands of pilgrims are going in the holy Pushkar Lake having their bath. You can walk there and watch the ceremony, it's not a problem, but without shoes. All the ghats are full with people. If you have a room in downtown you will wake up by the noise in the night.

title: Too dry
review: Don't plan to visit here in the dry season.  I imagine much better after monsoons come.  Again, due to length of trip from Jaipur just too far to be worthwhile to me.

title: Holy Lake with powerful history
review: We visited this Hindu holy site consisting of picturesque spring-fed naturally formed lake surrounded by 52 ghats representing the weeks of the year. The lake is always full of water even during drought which is a regular occurrence in Rajasthan. Hindus perform puja here as one of the 3 holy sites and is considered by many that it gives them peace and salvation. We found many non-Hindus also doing the Pujas and taking a dip in the Pushkar Lake. Queen Mary has a ghat named after her since she performed puja here to get a child. You need a guide to get the full history behind this historic holy site.

title: Tuk tuk driver  Pushkar
review: On my recent visit to pushkar I was fortunate enough to come across the wonder Satu the best and most honest tuk tuk driver .... Even if I had not called him he seemed to always appear  just when I needed him .... If you are in pushkar and in need of local transport give him a call 919414666961 he is fabulous !

title: Excellent  ayurveda massage and diagnosis after that!
review: Excellent experience! My wife and I were a little skeptical when  Deepak approached as we passed his place because it is India. But everything changed after he told us something about our character after he only touched a few points in our palms. All right things! We then arrange an appointment and massage itself. Massage was very pleasant and thorough, and afterwards we even sat down with he and he has expanded the diagnosis of body and character for us and proposed to us  the simple everyday things that we should change so that our body can be more balanced. The price was very good, and the whole communication is very pleasant because Deepak has great energy. We recommend to everyone. Definitely our best experience in Pushkar!

title: Relaxing few hours in evocative spot
review: We stopped here for an hour or so on our way from Jaipur to Johdpur. Left to wander round the town ourselves we did not feel hassled at all and made our way to the Holy Lake where we were able to watch the bathers and prayers. The couple we were with even took part in a prayer with flowers and coconut. Okay this was probably touristy but it was not a hard sell and they enjoyed it. As we didn't stay long cannot comment on whether there is sufficient to do if staying overnight outside of the holy seasons

title: Holy Lake one like to visit ! Friendly Environment!
review: Pushkar lake is nice to see and walk on ghats, seeing lake. But please remain aware of Priests outside there, they want you to spend unnecessary, they force you to pay large sums of money for your good by the GOD. Pray with ur heart and stay blessed!

title: Very nice lake
review: Visited this place in December'14. Very clean lake. One can take a holy dip in this lake. Can also offer puja. The ambience of this lake is very good. A must see for all the visitors to Pushkar.

title: A BLESSING TO BEHOLD!
review: Pushkar is a very special place.  Like a mini-Veranassi, Pushkar is a peaceful pilgrim town of lakes and temples.  There is the "Brahma" temple, the only one in the world dedicated to Brahma, so spiritual and sacred!  Surrounded by the vibrant and colorful bazaar, the lake, created from the petals that fell from the divine hands of Brahma, is a place visited by devout Hindus to wash away their sins, thereby earnig themselves a place in heaven.  Pushkar is heaven on earth!

title: take a dip
review: Nice place to take a dip but beware of people trying to dupe you for offerings, Once they know your are tourists,

title: Not so good
review: The place is not maintained at all in spite of all having religious and mythological importance. Once you enter the , no. Of guides will offer you there help. We hired one of them. He told us the story behind lake and all. But the whole of the lake is very poorely maintained. They get so much to donations still. I didn't like going there. We were forced to make heavy donations and the pandits too charged heavily for 5 mins thing.

title: Holy name but The forgotten nature
review: This once picturesque lake has fallen on hard times - at times this reportedly gets filled by municipality by pumping water ! It is very dirty and polluted due to fact that most people here come and offer the ritualistic puja and offerings, adding flowers ,coconuts and washing their clothes with soap after taking the dip in holy water- mostly near the and around Brahma people .it is a pity that once beautiful lake has now become polluted due to flowing the sewage in the lake .

title: Nice lake with religious significance.
review: This is a nice lake with religious significance. We also did a small puja here from a local pundit. However, be aware of pundits and poojari's as most of the time they are more interested to get more money out of you.

title: Find a rooftop to enjoy the view
review: The lake is nice and relatively quiet. My advise would be, don't stand next to the lake because often people will try to sell you sacrifices to offer to the lake (don't do this and don't pay anything!!)

title: Holy lake
review: It is a very holy lake in Rajasthan and has the only Lord Brahma Temple in India.  It is a very beautiful lake and is visited my many foreign tourists during the Pushkar mela.

title: Holy Sarovar
review: Very nice and Holy Sarovar , but for all the Pujaris doing loudly all types of puja, all your devotion gets distracted, . One of the five holy Sarovars you must visit once.

title: Holy lake
review: Beautiful to do a Pooja, walk around, watch out for the so called holy men trying to give you holy flower petals demanding huge donations. You need to walk bare feet, carry your shoes with you.

title: more hassle then payback in Pushkar
review: I expected the sweet ease of a small town in Pushkar but the hassles were non-stop.  the town feels tapped out by hippy tourists and crooked touts, not a nice visit at all.  Varanasi is more interesting for the same level of hassle.

title: Beautiful Holi Lake
review: Pushkar lake is the 2nd main attraction of the Pushkar town after Bramha's Temple.

title: Very Calm and peaceful lake!!!
review: Pushkar itself is very peaceful place and lake side sitting during early morning and evening sunset is very charming. Need to maintain and develop in a better way with tree plantation and giving natural feel.

title: Holy Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is one of the best holy lake of India, if you are touring in Rajasthan then you must have to visit this lake, evening you can have best time at ghats with your friends.

title: Holy Lake with full of devotion
review: One of the holy lake where you feel your soul is full of devotion... Local priest are very cunning and will tend you to donate a hefty sum.... but think twice.... even your taxi driver will get commission .... so better fix lump-sum "dakshina" before appointing any priest and donate to the authorized trust only..

title: around the lake...
review: I stayed in Pushkar for 2 weeks and everyday I went to the lake to see the «priests» perform puja (prayers), or just to walk around. It is beautiful any time of day...

title: Nice lake and ghats
review: Pushkar lake is nice to see and walk on the ghats, but beware of the "priests" who will attempt to force you to pay large sums of money for a prayer ceremony that you didn't want. If you go through with it don't hand over more than 100Rs regardless of the complaining they do.

title: Brahma Temple
review: Only temple of Brahma in the world located at Pushkar lake makes this religious place a must visit. Shops and restaurants surrounded.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: Very beautiful lake.

title: Main Attraction
review: If you are at Pushkar, you cannot avoid visiting the lake. This is the central feature of this very small temple town.

title: Beautiful & stunning
review: One of my favourite experiences from my entire India trip. Having recently lost an important person from my life, my guide arranged for a prayer ceremony that was incredibly touching and lifting. Did not feel any pressure whatsoever to donate and sat watching the sunset for quite some time. A beautiful spot that I will remember for a lifetime.

title: Stunning
review: The ale and floating palace are amazing and I hope they do try and save it as it's currently sinking. I suggest going around sunset as the light is amazing and gat for photos. I suggest getting a driver who can drop you off and let you concentrate on the lake.

title: Holistic Place...Purely Divine
review: Pushkar lake is central attraction of Pushkar. Big and holistic place. Good place to meditate and reflect.

title: Tranquil
review: When you reach Pushkar from Ajmer, the main water body in this small desert town is the Pushkar lake. Built in front of the Brahma temple, this lake has been the place of worship for devotees and local priests who tend to do the rituals before entering the main temple.

title: a world of dreams
review: the people the washed blue surrouundings flowers floating on the waters.pink sunsets the sounds of holy bells at sunset.warmth the vibrations of life...........nothing to dislike.......

title: Too religious !! Beauty of the lake is taken away !
review: Pushkar lake is nice and decent but becoz of its religious importance and pilgrims from everywhere . the lake has become really dirty and crowded place.

title: Beautiful sunsets, don't look too close!
review: I visited the lake back in 2004 and loved it!  Since then I'm sorry to say it has not improved.  On my recent visit I found this holy place to be neglected and dirty. Such a shame as it really is a very special place. This can still be experienced while during 'puja' at dawn or sunset!

title: Incessant sound of recorded chantings!
review: What could be a beautiful place is spoiled by loud speakers chiming out recorded chanting on a continual loop, making it near to impossible to sleep! Check carefully your accommodation positioning and that it's not located near one of these loudspeakers! The spirituality here is lost! It has become overly touristic in my opinion, not helped by hustlers trying to get more money off of the tourist for this and that..everywhere here it is baksheesh!

title: Watch out for fraudsters!
review: Pushkar Lake was a truly lovely experience and beautiful sunset over the lake. We were fortunate enough to have been on a night of a festival celebration so got to watch the locals perform their rituals. The only negative thing I would say about it and it really did sour both our experience of it and Pushkar, was both being scammed separately by people claiming to be part of the holy celebrations and conned us both out of money. Whilst I have encountered this in India so far, I didn't expect a holy place and its traditions to be taken advantage of so much by its own locals, all for a quick buck! Pushkar though, is definitely worth a visit. It is a special place.

title: Beautiful experience but be on guard
review: We were fortunate to arrive on a Khali punja day and were greeted by a temple guide each, who sat with us and gave us blessings. Then i was told that I had to pay  twenty pounds for each member  of my family (who weren't even there), which would have made £100 and to donate that each month otherwise I wouldn't receive the blessings. I don't believe in this, but others might. So just be warned. It would have been a beautiful experience, but this side marred it a bit. I of course did give a good size donation, but not as much as they had asked for as I believe it should come from the heart and not from being persuaded through guilt put upon you. Stunning and special place though.

title: Peaceful Place
review: It was a nice moment of peace and calm specially during the sunset!! One of a memorable experiences.

title: Sacred Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is a sacred lake, feels divine coming here but I belong to a city which is called city of lakes and where lakes are so very well maintained that we can be proud of. Pushkar is also known for its lake but not been maintained as required.

title: Pushkar visit in Purushottam month
review: Pushkar is usually known for the great pushkar mela held in nov/dec. What is lesser known is the importance of visiting pushkar and having a holy dip and performing puja on the banks of pushkar lake during Purushottam month. This is the 13th month in an otherwise 12 month hindu calendar and this occurs once every 3 years. I had been there on 19th july (purushottam mass is from 17th june 15 to 16th july 15). Take a dip in the lake at "Brahma Muhurat" which is between 3.50AM to 5.30AM and then perform "Rajaopachar puja". Please note to engage a good pandit (thankfully I got a very good one) as the ritual needs to be known and it takes an hour to hour and half. The sunrise sight during the pooja is the most holy experience and one which is superb. You can see the day break from behind the hills which is spell binding. After the puja visit the brahma temple next door, then the underground shiva temple which is there from the time of brahma's puja here. Finally visit to the Ranganath swami temple which is 3-4 km within the city is a must to complete the spirutual journey in Pushkar

title: Inner peace
review: Very soothing experience. You will feel inner peace after coming here. Pooja is a bit costly. But for once in a life time.. U get a lot if ashirwad.. Take a guide for rs50.

title: Skip this one
review: Looks like its flooded by cheap guides who will talk for just 5-10 minutes about the place. Okay on cleaniness

title: Beautiful and amazing
review: It was lovely to wonder around the ghats, the market, the temples and enjoy this quiet yet vibrant atmosphere, observing the people, the colours and the sun shining on the water.  Good place to meditate and reflect.

title: Great place, poor for tourism
review: Felt like a great place has been tarnished by a tourism scam, avoid anything to do with donating flowers to the temple and the lake. Our tour guide seemed nice at first, but ultimately me and two friends were lead into a scam, involving donating the most you could afford at that present time or even insisting transferring money by card. Please walk away if you feel bullied into donating, we unfortunately did not at the time. If I am completely honest there was nothing religious about daylight robbery.

title: Nice Calm Place to just sit and be at peace
review: Nice Calm Place to just sit and be at peace with yourself. This place has many ghats aswell which and very old and have a history associated with each. If one is too interested hire a guide who can run you thru the place well in a day.

title: Peaceful
review: Good energy, and you can feel the peoples devotion adding to it. Look out for scammers by one of the ghats who are talking bout donations for blessing you - not all are scammers though so dont be too quick to judge :). Enjoy!

title: A blessing is never for free
review: Just to reiterate the previous comments, do not get blessed at the lake. My friend and I were split up by the Brahmin priests and they blessed us and our families and this went on for about five minutes. They then asked us for about 4000 rupees as donation and there friends came over to harass us for the money, almost grabbing our purses from us. When we refused to give anymore of a donation they got very angry and rude.

title: Timeless lake.
