review: They say there are plenty of fishes in the sea..Here you actually get to see what plenty of fishes actually mean. Lake is beautifully maintained and is cleaner as compare to the last time I visited.The city is built around the lake so walking distance from the Bhruma temple and market. It give a different peaceful experience.There are many good different cuisine eateries around the lake in the market.

title: Clean and Serene
review: Once you pass all touts and pandit's trying to convince you to do a pooja for 100 bucks, we found Pushker late to be very clean with serene surroundings. There were very few folks around so it was quiet peaceful and with no touts to disturb at ghat, we thoroughly enjoyed our 30 minutes stay there.

title: The most peaceful place in earth
review: You can just sit there to watch the sunrise, the bells and singing from temples takes you to another world... A quiet place to relax, surrounded by mountains and temples! You feel the peace, the holly, the world stops when you are there! Could stay there for hours without even realizing that time still exist... You can also see bats, it's fascinating to see big bats flying over the lake after the sunset!

title: Beautiful But be careful
review: Its a beautiful lake & view however one need to be careful about the priests who forces you to perform worship according to them against money... really they may turn bitter experience of such a beautiful city.

title: Calm and Tranquil Place
review: The lake is beautiful and the sunset is magnificent. I saw black monkeys with long tails and they were so amusing to watch. The walk was so relaxing with so many nice people just strolling by. Just remember to not talk to the people who come up to you and say they are a priest and that you should worship here....they really just want your money! But I still insist, you will love the lake

title: beutiful
review: this lake is surrounded by civilization is very beautiful. if you want to enjoy here then stay for a night.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: It's a square acreage of water ( if you are lucky and you are there during the monsoon, otherwise it might well be parched), not a great deal more unless you are Hindu when it takes on an entirely larger scale of importance.  I love Pushkar and visit it often, but not for its lake ( although Pushkar wouldn't exist etc etc).

title: Beautiful Location
review: I like the natural beauty of the lake , it's so beautiful and silent place. Most of the people come in the evening to spend quality time with there friends and family..

title: yeah, pushkar is pushy
review: we already heard some scam in this lake, but I did not expect to run into one on my first step down the stairs. A hindrance rush to us trying to give a free flower for something we did not care, so we declined, but the guy was very persistence. I had to say, no thank you, like 5 times, then he gave up and yelled we shall not move on, trespass, and whatnot. So we took some photos and just walked to another entrance that a hindrance was not present to get inside. Not that I care, but I hope the city do something about these men as it destroys tourism.

title: Must visit if coming to Ajmer
review: Must visit if coming to Ajmer .if you are having less time skip ajmer and spend some quite time in pushkar.it will.give time to you discover yourself your family.just visit the town enjoy the food walk.along the river.enjoynthe sunset.

title: Reservoir wash
review: Hot days, time for a wash! This is the first concrete lake I've seen and looks more like a reservoir than lake. There are many ghats surrounding the lake and people to pray and worship as well as wash.

title: Best place to explore self
review: When i reached this place i realised , i am in a different world, basically i came to a conclusion that this is a mini india within india. Beautiful, serene, peaceful, holy, enchanting mantras all around the beautiful ghat, hippies all around, cozy cafes with beautiful interiors and ambience, the place where you can look forward to stay for months, you would feel like relocating, it makes you crave for more.

title: A day at Pushkar lake and Bazaar Markets.
review: Enjoyed our day at Pushkar strolling through the market and visiting the lake. People generally are friendly and not too pushy. Large Leather bag shop on the entry to market had better quality bags than we saw in shops in Jaipur and surrounds. Bargain hard.

title: Place for religious people
review: It one and only place having temple of God Brahma. Lake water is very muddy and very cold when I visited. People used to bath with this muddy water instead of clean water made available in different water block just before it.

title: A holy place....
review: My overall experience of the place is average, infect below my expectation. The place is worth visiting once....but not sought of a to be repeated destination for me. In short a holy place with unholy people.....

title: visiting brahma mandhir
review: I came to know LORD BRAHMA having only temple ie. here.its a religious place.during puhkar festival time lot of entertinement will be there.

title: Pretty underwhelming...
review: I had an enjoyable stay in Pushkar, but was generally underwhelmed by both the lake and the city (I am not religious, and appreciate this is a holy site...but the whole place felt a bit 'plastic')

title: Clean
review: One of the few ghats which i visited, which are actually clean. The pandits around the area hound you to get some or the puja perform. Get it, ONLY if you want.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: Great place to see sunrise and sunsets. There are two restaraunts near the lae and you can really enjoy with some very good dishes.

title: so its a lake
review: Or large pond!

title: Shameful tourist scam
review: I came here with my indian friend and was instantly separated from him at the door and told to sit alone on the steps to the lake. A few moments later a man appeared claiming to be a priest and told me that he would do the puja for me. I began to resist but he reassured me by telling me as it was all a religious blessing he wouldn't think of asking me for money. Still sceptical he started the blessing by getting me to repeat English sentences that scarcely made sense. Suddenly he was talking about 30,50 or 100 pounds. He told me that it is customary for all visitors to make a donation. I told him I would offer 100 rupees. He started shouting at this, telling me it was shameful I would value mine and my families future happiness for such a small amount of money. I was marched over to the donation box and 500 rupees minimum was demanded. I flat out refused and he yelled at me to leave the lake and not return.

title: A pretty lake surrounded by activity
review: Pushkar is an awesome city. Full of tourists, but also really nice and small with loads to do and see - don't miss it.

title: Pushkar in Rajasthan, India
review: Pushkar is located 168 kilometers from the Jaipur, towards Udaipur. It is one of the holiest city in the Rajasthan for Hindu people.

title: Centrepiece of the town
review: A small lake, but great photography with the buildings spilling towards the water.

title: calm and quite until
review: Its a nice lake surrounding the pushkar old city.foreigners are always seen having a good time.but beware of all those pandit who force u or create circumstances for pooja.we suffered

title: Not a peaceful experience
review: We decided to walk down some quiet steps to see the lake and were immediately told off for showing disrespect. We had no idea what we did wrong - turns out we were meant to go down the next set of steps where you get hassled and people try and take cash off you at every turn. Don't bother.

title: lake..amzeing sunset
review: mazedaar place as one of the famous ,old one gud one must see its the heart of pushkar and sprituality felt there,

title: Beautiful
review: You can't visit Pushkar and miss the lake! It is so beautiful and tranquil - worth hanging around for sunset too :)

title: excellent
review: it is a holy place .i visited this place in 11 feb 2015.the worships and the culture followed strictly.this is the excellent place to visit.

title: Pushkar lake, DEEPAK AYURVEDA
review: He has done an excellent massage. I have felt a fresh condition, relax and energy after that. Also, you can take really truthful recommendations from him after the massage. It's really deep effect!

title: Quite good place to visit at Sunset time
review: Lake is situated in the heart of the town, This place is on the walking distance from Brahma temple. when you pass through from the local market don't miss the Rabadi (Milk made Sweet) and Malpua (Sweet), this is the specialty of Pushkar.

title: Good for a visit
review: Pushkar is a small town and with its name you associate - The Pushkar mela (camel fair), the Pushkar lake and Brahma's temple.

title: Pushkar Lake – A Sacred Lake
review: On the shore of this lake, lies the Pushkar city. The lake has much importance in Hindu mythology.  A person should go to the lake first and then proceed towards Brahma Temple. The lake is quiet and serene and the whole ambience looks beautiful with hills surrounding the lake.

title: A Lake surrounded by significant temples
review: More then the lake, it is the temples around the lake that make is significant and a place to sit and watch the aartis.

title: Interesting Festival
review: While we were there, the Hindu new year was being celebrated.  The dancing and singing went on around the lake well into the night.  Even when the festival wasn't taking place, the lake was a beautiful sight.  I enjoyed sitting in one of the many lakeside cafes to relax and view the rituals that take place in the lake.

title: Amazing...
review: One of the main attractions near Ajmer which one should not miss. It has a beautiful lake and a brahma temple which is the only temple of brahma. Also there is savitri mata temple. This place has great historic importance. Also has a nice shopping area where one can do decent shopping. Camel safari is another great experience. Also pushkar is the place where the movie Karan Arjun was shot. So there are many points where this iconic movie was shot. Overall experience is great. Do visit

title: A Sacred Lake
review: This is a leading attraction of Pushkar. The lake is surrounded by many small-big temples.There are 52 Ghats on the bank of lake and they were once personal Ghats of Maharaja of Rahasthan who performed sacred rituals here. Pitru tarpan is also performed at Pushkar.

title: The Pushkar lake near Brahma Mandir
review: This lake is attached to the Brahma mandir at Pushkar, which itself is an exclusive one and only one of its kind.

title: Destroyed by people trying to con you
review: Nice lake that it very holy.

title: Brahma Temple
review: Pushkar is the Sacred Hindu Place for worshiping and is surrounded by Brahma Temple. It is very important for the Hindus as Brahma temple is situated here.

title: Pushkar- older than history
review: The very name “Rajasthan” brings to mind beautiful images of sandscapes, the endless horizon of golden sands and the splendid tales and legends surrounding this desert land. Jaipur is over 300 kms from the desert, but nevertheless the drive from Jaipur to Pushkar takes you through a sand colored landscape, one that is stunningly beautiful and yet a drab beige color at the same time.

title: Pushkar , Ajmer
review: Pushkar , a small holy city near Ajmer in Rajashthan . The place is surrounded by numerous small temples circling a lake [ called Pushkar ] . A very rare Brahma Temple in a hillock and wonderful Rajashthani food to add it all . Beware of touts and thugs who will try to con you in the name of God just ignore them . Reasonably good hotels with pools are available in  Pushkar .

title: Beautiful holi place.
review: Pushkar Lake is the pilgrims center of Pushkar, created by Brahma. Surrounded by ghats (steps) where the faithful come to make ablutions. Be sure to walk down onto some of the ghats, but be respectful, no shoes, maintain a quiet demeanor and no photos of bathers.

title: The lake
review: This lake is attached to the one and only one Brahma Mandir in the world and has its own significance & beauty.

title: Peaceful
review: The lake is a lovely haven away from all the fakery of the market and hippies that infest this town. You are not allowed to wear shoes when walking around the lake and you'll need to be careful or the fake rituals they'll make you pay for if you accept a flower from the locals.

title: A place to go
review: Walking aroud the lake at the end of the day is magic, you'll meet pigrim, yoga and dancer classrooms, hippies, ...

title: The sacred  lake Pushkar
review: The holiest lake - Great one and scenic - It has multiple entrances ( Called Ghats) which has steps to connect you to the lake - Went  with the family and took early morning  holy Dip there -  what  experience - no words to explain and can only  be experienced - it has few basic   cubical  closures for dress change for ladies ( but these needs more improvement)

title: Big Cheats out here
review: Pl don't sit for any Puja. The place is full of thugs. They will sweet talk you into paying for meals, etc.

title: good but not wellmaintained
review: a very holy place for everyone...its all about the dedication for our ancestors ...i was so much in peace when i went there.......

title: A small lake considered sacred
review: You will find a place at every 20 kms in India which has a story connecting the place to ancient history. You will find a place which will be claimed to be the only place to have temple of x or something like this. Pushkar once was a huge lake but now has been reduced to a small lake. No doubt that it has been considered as sacred for many centuries so ghats are very old but some construction work has been done to make the lake suitable to mass level bathing. People immerse ashes of their beloved ones here. There are a lot of dogs and monkeys so the place has become unclean due to excreta of dogs, monkeys and littering by people. The place gives very good photograph and hippies find the place very interesting. It is a place where West and East meet, the market around lake is witness to it where you will find skirts and modern European dresses like skirts in traditional rajasthani printed clothes. You will hardly find public toilets here, if at all these will not be clean.

title: BEWARE
review: Beware of the scamsters out to make money in the name of god. We were offered flowers to pay tribute to the lake and temples, and out of respect we went towards the lake, one thing led to another and we were being asked for a lot of money after they muttered some hymns. BEWARE!!

title: Large lake of mythological importance
review: The large lake is of mythological importance connected to Lord Brahma. Lord Brahma conducted a big Yagna on the banks of this lake. We had a bath in this lake before worshipping in Lord Brahma temple in Pushkar. It is sorry to see the lake is not maintained and water is not clean. Avoid the pandits on the banks of the lake offering to do Pooja.

title: average
review: Nice place to sit and relax.

title: Ideal time is morning
review: Pushkar is best to be visit during morning. Morning hue gives an wonderful view. Also temples are less crowded that time.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful place, poorly maintained as every entrance they ask for money or seek to do prayer for you.

title: Very less water in the lake is not a pleasing picture
review: Being a religious person, I ought to give it excellent rating but the place has its own discomforts. The water levels are too low. Stray animals like cows, dogs and monkeys have left the steps dirty. Travelers despite being requested numerous times, feed pigeon and fishes which makes it dirtier. And certainly this is not a clean place to have your bath. For women, no special arrangements. But due to its mythological importance, it still is a must visit place. Be ready for a walk to reach the ghats as you wont have parking space for your vehicles nearby.

title: It is Beautiful...
review: This is something very special lake with the beautiful view of bathing Ghats.

title: Holy Lake of Pushkar
review: One of the holy lake of Pushkar. It is surrounded by the Mahals built by the kings and beautiful scenery of the hills on the other side of the lake. Priests perform arthis in morning and evening to the lake which is blissful view.

title: Sacred Pushkar Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is about 14 km (8.7 mi) northwest from Ajmer. It is considered as one of the five sacred lakes in India. It is surrounded by hills on all three sides. It is considered prehistoric because of the 4th century BC Greek and Kushan coins found near the lake. A number of bathing places have been organized around the lake. The road leading to the lake is narrow with a number of shopping places various religious and Rajasthani artifacts can be purchased. Brahma temple is nearby to the lake. Beware of the Brahmin priests who would like to fleece you in the name of religion. Avoid them.

title: Morning Puja at Pushkar, Rajasthan
review: A knowledgeable Pandit can get you through  - traditional puja to tribute to ancestors, and praying to the Pushkar's Brahma sarovar (lake where creation started), and where Brahma and Devi Gayatri did yagna (havan), and general ablution. This is what you get when you visit. I did not want to go for the ablution, but destiny had its own game - my foot slipped on the last step into water (covered with fungi), and I fell onto that step and got half wet. There are many gates - the one considered best is the Savitri one. Must do!!

title: Tranquil and beautiful sunset
review: A must see landmark for the city, its offers a fabulous view of the city with lovely cafes in the vicinity.

title: Dodgy men pray on tourists
review: Be careful here although it is a beautiful, there are groups of dodgy men who will con you to pay for a blessing. I have spoke. To other tourists who say the same has happened to them! The men advise it's for charity but it's clearly not! They will give you flowers take you to the lake and bless you and all the members of your family they then demand money and are abit forceful getting it!

title: Pushkar in three words? A Holy Hole
review: Pushkar has to qualify for the dirtiest place in India to date. Sacred (for Hindus) it may well be, but it's also a paradise for scammers. We were well prepared for the "priests" - just keep your hands in your pockets and ignore them. The main trawl is filled with shops (not run by locals) selling tourist tat and children playing instruments (badly) - can't fault their persistence though.The town is filled with hippies (ageing or otherwise) who, judging by the look of them, come here less for the spiritual atmosphere and more for the opportunity to get trashed for weeks on end. Strangely, in a place where alcohol and drugs are banned, this doesn't seem to pose a problem. Sunset over the lake, seen from the ghats, is ok - if you can Photoshop out the huge telecoms tower. Should you feel the need to settle an argument, head over to the stalls beside the camel fairground and choose from a fine selection of swords, daggers, hunting knives and knuckle dusters. Oh yes, and baseball bats too. Pushkar ? Been there, seen it, and didnt want a tee shirt as a reminder.

title: Sunset Chants
review: Must experience the sunset chants,mixed with the monks' bells,with the view of sunset over the lake, magical.

title: This is for pushkar is famous
review: Pushkar is famous for its holy water and this is the lake you should go beware if you visit this place many brahmins will ask for pooja only for Rs.10/- but will actually ask for Rs.500/- when pooja is finish. Give them only Rs.100/- max

title: Great to see the Evening Prayer(Arti)
review: Our whole family had a privilege and blessings of God Brahma and we were very fortunate to be present for the Arti, the chanting by the priest and singing the devotional prayer made us very emotional, we were very touched to see such thing happening in front of our eyes, it took some 30 minutes for the Arti to finish and then the priest gave rosé petals to every person which was offered to the God and was put in the water of the Pushkar lake. With the Prasad given to every person the Arti god offer.

title: Dirty run down
review: You would feal really disapointed if you had come a long way to see this lake ! When i think of a lake this is not it ! Its a dirty pond surrounded by decrepid concrete buildings , its another place where religion is completley bonkers and taken over , but then thats why people come here ! The town is full of shops selling tourist crap , a very didapointing dirty noisy place !

title: Beautifullll !!
review: A very peaceful place. You walk around it, sit down, look around, just watch people bathing, talking, kids playing. The light is fabulous.

title: Oasis
review: Pushkar is everything you want it to be and more...smal, intimate, good food, abudant accommodation, walk everywhere, peaceful, relaxing, shopping, camels, colour, music,  reat sunsets over the lake, monkeys, holy people, rituals, grret for photography plus interaction with the locals.

title: Interesting place worth seeing
review: We booked a one night stay in Pushkar and also went to visit the lake. I thought it was interesting to see everything thats going on there. We werent really pestered by anyone but we were also warned in advance so we just ignored them. You need to take your shoes off but can carry them with you (dont let anyone tell you otherwise). Pictures are not allowed but quite a few people took pictures with their mobile phones so I wonder how strict that rule really is. Pushkar itsself is a city full narrow streets and tourist shops. It can get a bit boring after a while.

title: A holy place
review: Pushkar is a very popular place to be visited by all Hindus. It has the only Brahma temple in the world. The temple is situated on the lake side and Ghats are well maintained for people to take holy dip..

title: Good Place with nice view
review: This is one of the few places that the small town of pushkar has to offer. Its serene and a must see on your visit to Pushkar.

title: Tourists beware!
review: I was really looking forward to visiting pushkar after hearing and reading great things...I wish I had stayed away! The brahmin priests that accost you right at the entrance to the lake really spoiled this place for us, despite getting away without a large donation. As soon as you enter the lake area they will almost physically drag you off to one side and tell you that you cannot enter the lake without a blessing and that it would be disrespectful not to engage.

title: Magical sacred place
review: Pushkar is a magical place, a wonderful mix of sacred, bustle, noise and colour, all the things you hope for in India.  The holy lake and ghats are stunning and wonderful to visit at any time of the day but sunset is particularly special.

title: Amazing View of Pushkar Lake
review: Beautiful view of the lake on one side and hills on the other side. The amazing and magical ceremony of aarti on the pushkar ghats in the evening.

title: Peaceful and Calm - Politely refuse all touts!
review: A peaceful & calm spot to relax in Pushkar. However the touts do become tiresome at times but after i kindly told them that i am of the Muslim faith they left us in peace and did not bother us besides the religious rites of this place there is not much else at this specific place. I do have to praise the cleanliness of this place as opposed to other religious shrines such as the Islamic dargah located in the nearby town of Ajmer.

title: Great experience tainted by cheats
review: As other people have noted in reviews- priests will try to make you promise to large donations after conducting a ritual to bless your family and deceased loved ones.

title: relaxing
review: Very relaxing in a special atmosphere. Time seems to have its own enjoyable, slow pace. Go there especially at sunset, take your time, relax, enjoy: you will remember!

title: Spiritual Waters
review: I was told the lake can become quite crowded with Hindu pilgrams but it was quiet during our visit. We did not even have to fend off the flower scamers. Made for a peaceful visit.

title: Pretty and quaint Pushkar lake
review: Lovely place to hangout especially in the evening. You can watch the sunset at the sunset point. You are not allowed to wear shoes on the ghats so you have to carry them.

title: Religious Lake (??)
review: The lake has some religious story behind it, not sure of the authenticity.  Seemingly this lake does not dry up at all, even in the hot summers. BUT BEWARE. There are one too many touts waiting to fleece you. They will start by saying that they will be your guide and explain about the lake for FREE.  Well, nothing is free.  They will lead you to a priest who will make you do some prayers and expect donations for a "cause" and these donations stat from Rs, 3000 upwards. DONT FALL FOR THIS TRAP. They will also tell you that there are no donation boxed at the Bhrama Temple, THIS IS NOT TRUE. So, visit the lake, enjoy the beauty and pray to the holy waters without getting yourself trapped with the touts.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: It's iconic and a must see.

title: pushkar lake
review: amazing lake. dedicated to lord brahma. the site is filled with great zeal and visor for the god. the lake has a temple for lord shiva in its midst. great place to visit. but be careful of the pundits and pipes scattered over there. the pundit are cut throat people who will eventually succeed in robbing you of your money in the name of trust and charity.

title: Beware the Brahmin priests!
review: Beautiful lake to look at, but beware the Brahmin priests who alight on you as soon as you go down the steps to the lake. They separate you from whoever you're with, and then use very heavy pressure to get each of you to part with serious money (for blessings for every member of your family!)

title: Don't take the "holy flowers"
review: Pushkar Lake has many ghats and each one has its own feel. The views are great and it is a wonderful way to spend a few hours.

title: Good view
review: Good to see a lake in the desert state of Rajasthan. White houses surrounding the lake give a nice view. Its a lake with a history as old as Hinduism

title: Well worth a visit.
review: Pushkar is a holy place for Hindus, so there's plenty of shops & places to eat there, to cater for the pilgrims that visit, as well as the tourists.

title: Beautiful
review: Such a beautiful, peaceful, spiritual place. Be sure to at least dip your bare feet into the lake. We enjoyed visiting the lake at different times of the day/night...getting up early in the morning and spending time there was magical...followed by a walk around the lake before the sun rose, listening to the beautiful chanting of women doing their morning rounds of prayers.

title: Locals are parasites
review: The lake itself might be good or bad, depending on your spiritual inclination. The rating is for the locals of pushkar who really spoil it for you. This theme is present in all the major attractions in Rajasthan and UP where people follow your car and bug you to the core. The roads in Pushkar are really narrow and the signboards are inadequate. I think it is deliberately inadequate so that the locals can make money. They will even ask you money to tell you directions to the lake. Then there are the fake pandits who say they will do prayer for you etc. I regret going there. I suggest you skip it if you are too religious. Even if your religious, your faith will be tested by the locals.

title: Unique experience
review: Only Temple of Brahmaji in world is situated in Pushkar. If you are in Jaipur plan once to go there.

title: Positive Vibes
review: The Lake Is surrounding with 52 ghats.These feels so amazing when the sound of positive hindu prayer make the atmosphere really holy.

title: Historical Importance
review: It is believed that you should offer prayers to all your ancestors for their well being in heaven. A very clean and nice place. Just perform the puja,

title: Pretty, but...
review: Don't let the guys give you flowers!!! Once you take them they expect a donation and not just a few Rupees, no they wanted 2000-3000R and if you don't give it to them they say you will have bad karma. These kind of people ruin it for all the other nice people from India who mean well and are honest. But then it makes it so hard to trust them.

title: Beware of pundits and fake guides..!
review: As our extended tour to Jaipur i went to Pushkar along with my family and my mother in law. When we reached to pushkar our bus driver introduced us to a person who took us to Brahma temple. After that he took us to pushkar lake where he explained pushkar history and how pushkar lake created by lord brahma. Then he offered us to do 21Rs pooja alongwith pundit and we readily agreed as spending 21Rs was no big deal. Pundit did 10 min pooja and after that played real game , he asked us to give donations to distribute free foods to poor. All starting from Rs2200 and as minimum Rs 500, we all immediately came to know its Trap & we started denying. But my mother in law got into trap and she did Rs 500 donation. Friends these people can do anything for money, they plots trap to catch older ladies so that they can loot them easily.Beware of pundits and their commission Agents while visiting Pushkar lake.

title: Enchanting laker
review: This lake is sacred to Hindus and lots of people bathe in it in the early morning and at times in the late afternoon. To walk around the lake you have to remove the shoes. It is very peaceful and relaxing except for all the guys who try to sell you something or use the "flower scam". Just stroll around and don't pay attention to these guys and you will enjoy it.

title: They only want your money!
review: It has been stated by many previous reviewers, but be aware that the "holy men" who approach you are full of nonsense and only want your money. Just ignore them.

title: Spritual importance esthetically fits to phuskar
review: It's much of importance to spritualness in a person

title: A magical place
review: It is much smaller than one thinks looking at pictures. A truly magical place with cows,pigeons, monkeys and the fish all living in harmony. I did not mind  the puja although  I was not given a choice. The lson light on the lake was magical qnd the old buildings around are unspoilt.

title: Nothing nice
review: Whats the big deal about Puskar? Its a dirty looking lake with no appeal. Too many animals, its like walking around a farm. Lots of little shops with all the same stuff. Daughter found these ok. Could not wait to leave.

title: Pushkar Lake and Camel Fair
review: This is a review of two main attractions in this atmospheric city -- Pushkar.

title: For serene sunsets
review: It is the ideal spot to walk a little down the Jaipur Ghat, soak in the sights and sounds of the place while watching the sun set. It brings so much calm and peace, making stillness so rich.

title: Spiritual
review: A spiritual place to visit. Nice lake with good views. There are several ghats for pujas. The moment you enter the area, you feel divine. However, cleanliness is less, and commercialization is more.

title: Sight good
review: Prepared to be badgered by people who give you flowers to put in the lake and follow you to turn you over to a fake priest for a sham ceremony and then really badgered for money

title: "Lake"
review: Not so much a lake as a concrete reservoir. It significance would be "spiritual" aspect of the temples and ghats surrounding it. Personally, like much of india, it seems to have turned into more of a marketing area than anything spiritual, but i guess its in the eye of the beholder.

title: beautiful, mystical, magical at sunset
review: One of my favourite places in the world, this place condenses all India's mysticism and magic.

title: Very Huge Lack
review: Very huge lack and it is having its own importance for spiritual...

title: DIVINE!
review: beware of pandits, they are very sticky. just stay away from them. and for women taking holy dip there should be proper viel. or covered from one side,.

title: Beautiful, but don't be fooled
review: It is a beautiful lake, could be a very peaceful and spiritual place if there weren't so many people waiting to take your money in the name of holiness!!! Don't take flowers, if asked to do a puja, decline, they want your money. Take your shoes off at the top of the stairs, this is how they will recognise that this is your first time otherwise. Apart from this, it is a beautiful place, I saw old couples, groups of friends and families bathing themselves ritually in the lake. I sat, sketched, and read for half a day without being bothered. Sunsets are a must here.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: Place is amazing, with a wonderful view on the mountains and the city, music on the sunset and local rituals. Like a whole India it is a little bit messy with excrements of cows, monkeys, pigeons and other animals.

title: The happening place in pushkar
review: Its the most happening place in pushkar. You must watch the sunset from there. Is just an amazing view.This lake is also surrounded by huge market and restaurants. One can spend almost a day just roaming here and doing nothing . Just be cautious about the cheaters pretending as priests there.

title: Surreal
review: Thousands, if not millions, of people travel to Pushkar every year to bathe in the holy lake. The entire lake is surrounded by ghats (steps down to the water). There are tons of people in and around the lake, praying, bathing, and scattering loved one's ashes. I would not recommend bathing in it - but it is a bit surreal to experience as we have nothing like it in the US.

title: Romantic at sunset and sunrise
review: I love the Lake but there is a lot of Indian hustlers around .They call themselves Brahmans or priests but they usually are not .They will sidle up to you and offer you a flower and if you take it you will never get rid of them again.They will offer to do pujas at the lake for you..paid by you of course...and they will ask you to take shoes off and boss you around no end.Taking shoes off is required at a certain distance from the lake so it is advisable to wear chappels that you can easily take off or to carry a cloth that allows you to clean your feet afterwards...the most famous point for sunsets is Sunset Point..with a restaurant etc.Do not go there because that is where beggars and hustlers are waiting just for you.It is better to go down to any ghat from the main road...there is one near Lake View Hotel where there is a beautiful drum circle at evening time...and you can sit and enjoy without problems....or else go up to Rajus Garden restaurant and enjoy the view of the lake and the drumming from there...

title: Con Priests!
review: We Had a nasty experience in Pushkar. At the Lake in Pushkar we were somehow deceived in sitting with the priests on the steps of the lake.

title: small and calm
review: A walk around the lake gives a sense of serenity and holiness. Be sure to calmly reject those who would try to force you to do pooja and pay them afterwards. At night, the lights reflect beautifully and the sunset is glowingly reflected on all the white buildings. Go for a walk!

title: Watch out for flower men
review: Go take a walk and snap a few pictures but ignore anyone trying to give you flowers. Its a scam and they get really annoying after a while.

title: The Holy Place
review: This Holy Lake has a very god story attached with. I offered pooja here. I was contacted by a young boy in the hotel itself for guidance to all the places in the Pushkar and he took me to this place and the Pujari there at the lake performed pooja there and asked for the offerings. Beware of the Pandas there who generally follow you for the pooja and forced offerings. I liked staying at the Lake with my kids.

title: Nice visit. Pretty and relaxing.
review: It is nice to just sit around for a few hours and listen to the temple bells. People around are a bit pushy but that is the case for most part of India.

title: Holy cheaters
review: Is not a lake, it is just a dirty ugly pound full of aggressive "Hindu" and "Holy cheaters"... after 5 times in India for a total of almost one year, I found Pushkar one of the worst indian city regarding the stress given to tourists and the amount of cheater, starting for the moment you get inside the city, where you have a sort of tool... they will ask you to pay 20 rupies as a gouverment tax, but is not true. Those 20 rupies are for car parking and car entrance so, unless you are not entering with your own car, is the taxi driver who have to pay for it.... It is a pity, because Pushkar itself is a nice city...

title: Go...but for a short time
review: All the things about the place being bad has been documented. Go...so that you can brag about having seen the temple...much less said about the pushkar mela grounds the better it is. I can't imagine how foriegners stay there....horrible pathetic dirty...GOD...please infuse sense into the local people....

title: Beauitful
review: Really can't describe this in any other word... A must, must visit once the sun sets... Try catching the evening aarti of the temple on the banks - it's really a worthwhile experience!

title: very big lake in area
review: the pushkar lake is said to be the very big lake in that area, lake has many ghats and all surrounding narrow lanes are filled with shops selling different products, lake ghats are very silent and clean

title: Go but careful about pujaris.
review: You will love the vastness of the lake. Lot of holy fishes. Few shots of ramlila (Bollywood movie) was taken here. There are 52 ghats around the lake. But he careful about the aggressive pujaris. Their only motto is to trap you in there words and force you to spend your money in the name of God. Don't accept any offer of puja by them.

title: You'd almost think that they dug the lake to attract tourists
review: The lake is dirty and smelly and you will be hassled endlessly by 'holy men' trying to bless you or cleanse your karma. After this they'll demand upwards of INR1000 for the 'ceremony' claiming that it all goes to charity and the poor. It doesn't. I felt hugely uncomfortable during the whole ordeal and the man who 'blessed' me forcibly sat me down when I tried to leave by leaning on my shoulder. When I expressed my distaste at the way he and his colleague went about their business he told me that I would have very bad karma for the rest of my trip if I didn't pay him (instead I put some money in one of the ghat donation boxes). The next time I got collared I told the man slowly and several times that I had no money to pay him. He continued to bless me and then asked for money. Free blessings all round. Pushkar is great, the lake is to be avoided.

title: Holy lake
review: beware of local priests who will force you to give huge donations by blackmailing you religiously & emotionally.inspite of thousand temples all around no one place is worthbtaking a dip because of polluted water & proper place for prayers.stray dogs & cows roam around freely.disappointed by lack of muncipal facilities.

title: Filthy, disgusting and uninteresting
review: This is not a lake !! It is more like a small stagnant reservoir, with filthy ghats around it and annoying men pushing you to buy rose petals for a blessing in this  fetid  water. The ghats and walk way are covered in cow, dog and pigeon faeces, which you must walk in as no shoes are allowed in this area.

title: heart breaking
review: i will suggest everyone who travells to Pushkar 'NOT TO' pay a single rupee to the pandits or anyone. The pandits and the tour guides are all linked and works on commision. These pandits will make you feel so embarassed that you will land up paying ..particularly when you are travelling with kids.

title: Just fine
review: I found the lake average. Since I was there in Nov, and winters were setting in, I did not go for a holy dip. I just walked around a bit and washed my face.

title: World's only lord Brahma temple
review: World's only lord Brahma temple is by the side of the lake. The lake is not very big but beautiful. We  had reached there early morning so got a serene view of sunrise also. At that time there was no rush of visitors. So we enjoyed the site very well. One can offer puja by the lake and may also have a holy dip in the lake.

title: A Must Sunset
review: Every religious destination has pros and cons. This location is the same. Your eyes are glued to Sunset and the shorts you want, but then you realize that you are being constantly observed by the pandits to get some money in the name of blessing or pooja. DO NOT get emotional with their talk and pay any money. During Sunset , try taking a very quiet corner and remove your camers. Some Pandits are nice when you click their photos they wont ask the amount. But be careful many do ask for pictures.

title: Look out
review: Very pushy priests who demanded money. Took us down to the lake, asked about members of our family and wanted money for each person we mentioned.

title: Feels like it's put on for tourists
review: We enjoyed our time in Pushkar, however were surprised how touristy it was.  Being so small, the Main Street is lined with tourist stalls, and there are many touts and people/children harassing you everywhere you go.  It really does get tiring.  No one asks where you are from because they genuinely care!

title: The touts ruined it!
review: The touts and priests (I doubt they really are priests) were so pushy that it took away from any feeling of a holy place. The lake is small and not that pretty. Sorry to be so negative, but compared to so many other beautiful, serene places in India, I'm sorry I wasted my time.

title: Devotional
review: The lake is said to be natural from lacs of years.

title: Unfulfilling Experience
review: The surrounding streets are loaded with touts and tourists. The call to prayer loudspeakers were cranked way loud just ten feet up and painful to pass.  The lake was like a cess pool surrounded by cement.  I was forced to donate, pray and sit on the filthy cement just to see the lake.  With so many moving experiences available in Ragasthan, no need to see this tourist maze.

title: Not for me...
review: We weren't as accosted as maybe some others. But I'd like to think I've been around the block enough not to get conned into buying flowers, or worse, leaving my Italian leather shows out for anyone to take.  So, yeah, one teenage boy grabbed my arm when I told him my shoes would be fine in my bag.  That wasn't fun.  And then walking into water that a small boy was in the process of peeing in was also a little of a joy kill.  But this comes with this territory. Captured some good photos of people who actually wanted their picture taken. Ha.  Okay.  Oh.  Walking in town, we picked up these fresh falafal and potato dumplings. Amazeballs.  He's the guy who makes the big stacked tomato sandwich.  See my photos. haha.

title: Nice and Peaceful place
review: i visit pushkar lake during my trip at pushkar nice neat and clean big lake but the priest around the lake was very rude behave of the local priest is not good. but beauty of the lake is awesome.

title: Give this place a miss
review: This is a interesting place and the lake and temples are worth seeing but touts and so called holy men who aggressively hassle you all the time to give you a so called blessing ruined the experience, do not let them push petals into your hand all they are after is money.  I was glad we were only there for a day and you can definitely see all you need to see in an afternoon we were glad to retreat back to our hotel where they had a very nice roof terrace.  This was the low point of a very enjoyable trip to India and in retrospect I would have chosen an extra day at Ranthanbore national park rather than come here.

title: Worth seeing the sacred lake
review: Delightful centerpiece to Pushkar. It can be glimpsed from various points along the main shopping street. But best of all viewed from the Sun-Set Cafe, which is rather tucked away but perfectly situated for chiling out on the view.

title: Located near to the Brahma temple
review: Place has a religious importance with it for Hindus.Lord Brahma according to Hindu mythology performed Yagna here.

title: Aggressive "holy men" destroy this experience
review: My wife and I stepped out of our car and were immediately set upon by two "holy men" who wanted to bless us. We came to India to see its sights, people's, and religions so we didn't protest to hard against their taking us down the steps to the lake. This was a big mistake. The "ritual" first separated us and then had us chanting that we would give them money. By the end they were nearly grabbing money out of my wife's purse and demanding that I give them a thousand rupees. When I refused they became more aggressive. This experience was by far our worst in India.

title: Stay away!!!
review: It is a summary of all that is  wrong in India.

title: What a scam!
review: We were very happy to see one of the most important sites of Hindu pilgrimage, so we hired a tourist guide... His English was very poor, but he managed to take us to Pushkar lake. He connected us with this people (sorry, their qualifications escape my memory) who separated us and took us to a ghat (the steps that lead to the water). We were individually taken to "pray" a bunch of words that made no sense.

title: Relaxing Place
review: Good and quiet place, go and visit all around the lake, enjoy the sunset and also having restaurant/hotel in front then can have tea/coffee and relax for some hours. Good place for having some peace

title: Go at sunset
review: Nice to see locals in their environment, with the things that are important to them.

title: I would skip it
review: If you are travelling through Rajasthan without too much time I suggest to skip this place. I could not find any charm or whatsoever in it. Yes there are temples you can see but there are more interesting and impressive ones around. For me the stop over was kind if disappointing.

title: Holy place
review: A holy place and carried significant importance for Hindus. Do not succumb to people who would approach you saying that they would perform a pooja for your benefits. They would charge a huge amount post that. So avoid. But good to spend some time near the lake. Water is not clean. Good to have rose lassi and other road side eatables. Also a good place for roadside shopping.

title: Holy Lake, Awesome views no matter what time
review: In Pushkar everything is around this lake. Its a holy place for HIndus, a place of religious importance. It has 52 Ghats in total. Views are awesome no matter whether its sunrise, day time or evenings.

title: A big day out
review: I took a day trip from Jaipur to Lake Pushkar. It was interesting but hardly worth the 5.5 hour round trip (well to me any way). It was interesting to see a few westerners wandering around there in flowing linen garb apparently looking for some spiritial enlightenment although they did not seem very joyous. When I got to the lake I was hassled by people insisting they offer blessings on my behalf. As it was a once off experience I decided to go with it to test my luck. After immersing my feet in the lake, chanting the names of my wife, my children, their spouses and grand children, throwing flower petals into the water, an ochre dot on my forehead, for 200 rup (the asking price started at 1000 rup !!) my whole family was blessed with longevity and even my dear departed parents got a mention. Bargain if it works !!!.

title: Want to see Brahma Temple visit Puskar
review: A Holy place for Hindus and only place where you can see Lord Brahma Temple.  The lake is a little walk away from the Temple and the view at Pushkar Lake very attractive.  My wife and daughters wanted to visit this place very particular as it is near to Jaipupr city and we booked a taxi for Pushkar for INR 2500.  We started morning 9 am and returned back jaipur in the evening 7pm.  A must see place for all Hindus.  .....Krishna Duvvuri

title: Holy!!
review: It is said to be the bath of this lake is very sacred. People come here for various puja's. We visited in the morning time climate was very pleasant. Felt peaceful.

title: Parking at pushkar temple- beware of touts
review: I visited pushkar lake and temple along with my friends on 07 dec. we drove to this place in a car. After paying the initial toll/parking at the entry of place, a person on a bike approached our car and offered to help us reach the parking place near to temple for Rs.50. We did not show much interest and proceeded ahead. After following the instructions to reach temple, we ended up reaching the narrow lanes leading to temple and the locals informed us to go back and advised us to take the help of this person to park our vehicle. We had no other option but to bargain with this person for a lesser amount and he finally took us to the parking place. This is again not the official parking place provided by Govt. I would suggest everyone to follow the below instructions to park their vehicles. After paying the initial toll, reach the small junction where you will find 'Gayathri Kendra ' on your right. Take a left from there and follow the road for about 1 km. Enroute you will cross the bridge. After reaching the business establishment, you can park your vehicle

title: If you visit Pushkar you must experience this holy lake.
review: Walking (without shoes) the entire loop around this holy lake-- with its countless temples--is best done early or late in the day.  It takes about an hour and a half or more.  Bathers, pilgrims and bird-life are abundant.  This experience is at the heart of a trip to the holy city of Pushkar.

title: Pushkar Mela...
review: The Pushkar Mela just got over a week back. We really had a good time and I thought I should write a few lines so some of you wishing to go can really make the most of your visit.

title: Lake
review: Beautiful to see from a far. You have to take your shoes up to walk along the ghats. Watch out for touts claiming to be "holy men" who will perform prayers with you then demand money.

title: Bad experience
review: I visit pushkar19 nov2014 in brahma temple picture shown in website is different as shown temple is not maintained and pushkar lake are in very bad condition is not clean

title: A  meaningful retreat
review: We enjoyed mingling with the  pilgrims and getting a special "Pushkar "passport  e.i a special blessing from a Jaipur Brahmin as well as listening to the early and late services.

title: Good but very crowded and avoid the touts
review: Pushkar is really worth the stop- apart from the Lake, the stunning temples, the good restaurants and then there is the Camel Fair...this makes for a stunning location. The craft markets are excellent but this is a crowded place and lots of local Indian tourists and its well on the back-packer route too. So you can expect some heavy pressure from guides but just resist and say no....

title: Good
review: I would like to thanks you to arrange my trip on such short notice and make it memorable. My daughter has enjoyed unforgettable moments and have not seen her so happy too.

title: Relious place of worship
review: It's important to highlight that the Lake is a place of worship for Hindus so treat it as much.  Take a walk around the inside of the Lake so u should put ur shoes in a bag as some ghatts r stricter than others and people get upset to see ur shoes in the actual Ghatt area.

title: The holy lake...
review: This is a lake which has its mention even in mahabaratha….The lake is reasonably maintained in indian standards.

title: Sacred Lake spoiled by rip off Brahmins
review: I loved the peace and serenity in Pushkar and was honored to be asked to participate in a Hindu blessing by the lake. My partner and I were separated and blessed individually. All fantastic but then the hard donation pressure came on demanding Euros or US dollars. When I refused the peaceful Brahmin became very aggressive and I was terrified. I gave a small donation and was abused. They are attracting bad karma, both my partner and I felt violated. I loved watching the rituals but this really spoiled Pushkar for us both

title: The rudest people in India
review: We visited the lake during the Camel Mela.  Found the so called holy men the rudest people I have come across in India and they are not at all interested in showing you the holy water - all they want is cash from foreign tourists.  The tried getting cash for our shoes, told us to make a donation, wanted cash for giving us flowers and then one of them slapped my friends daughter when they saw she had a camera - apparently not allowed in the "holy place".  The sign was tiny and incorrectly spelt - they had been so busy trying to fleece us we missed it and they forgot to say anything about the camera until we were on the steps!!!   The lake is dirty and the holy men are clearly selling the "viewing" of the bathing ghats as a tourist attraction and not the holy experience it should be.  No positive energy from this place.

title: clean and clear lake
review: clean and clear lake with around 52 ghats all over the pushkar city..morning sunrise from a near by temple and sunset view from the lake is nice experience.

title: Lovely spiritual spot.
review: We could watch the lake from our hotel - Hotel Radhika Palace. Peaceful holy lake for pilgrims to bath. Amazing time during the Camel Fair. Loved this beautiful town.

title: Good view and place to relax
review: the lake is surrounded by many small temples. the lake water is famous for its divine quality. people worship the lake. it is nice place to relax in the evening.must visit.

title: visit early morning/evening for great views. stay clear of touts/guides and holy priest !!
review: The lake is quite serene. It looks really nice when you visit this place in evening or morning.

title: Beware the Bramins!
review: A slightly seedy lake. Were "captured" by the Hindu priests who prayed for us and then attempted to relieve us of our hard earned by telling us how much money others gave them for the "poor". Soon gave us away when our puny offerings were seen!

title: Spiritual!
review: Well during my recent visit on Holy Pushkar lake, I felt very spiritual as I step down with a local Brahmin friend who conducts prayers for people coming from long distance places as this Pushkar sarovar is very energized, it is believed to be sin removal for the individual and his family, it also helps us in getting to higher points of religious belief as it helps us in getting free from religious bondage. It is surrounded by many ghats where devotees come and take hokey dip for themselves and for there families. During certain Hindu Auspicious days devotees come from far of places to get blessed, take a dip in the lake before they proceed to the worship of lord " Brahma ",

title: Calm and beautiful
review: You can locate the lake easily once in Pushkar. Ignore anyone who approaches you for any unsolicited help. You would need to remove your shoes at a distance from the lake and then go near it. You must spend some time just sitting on the steps and taking in the view. There are numerous temple dotting the lake. You must also try to find some time to do a full Parikrama of the lake. Just being there gives you a lot of peace and you can feel the holiness.

title: Lake by Night - Very Beautiful
review: Visited the Lake at late night around 11 pm during the Pushkar Fair, the lake was completely quiet and we could hardly see someone there. The Lake had all the reflections of the lights and the moon. It has around 50-52 ghats for the purpose of bathing and other Hindu rituals. The lake is surrounded by the Aravalli Hills and gives a great view in the night or early morning.

title: Beware of Free Rose Petals
review: I was here during the Camel Festival. Just walking around you are accosted by locals giving you rose petals. Beware, it is the first step towards the lake for a real Indian Puja. This is a ceremony where shoes will be removed, walking down steps and sitting not necessarily where it's clean or dry. One on one you repeat multiply words about health, money and work for all your family and most important the man you're speaking to. This is where the money comes in. It's very important to be very generous with your money to this man and his family. Prices start high and you may be shamed into giving more. I have a problem with this kind hard sell. It feels uncomfortable. I don't like anything that involves walking around a strange land barefoot. Even the locals say they are amazed at the fraud. Steer clear of rose petals. The lake the first night of the festival has candles all around it. Lovely to walk down and see from a distance. Keep your shoes on.

title: looks nice but the priests ruin it
review: The lake is OK but a little polluted. We saw a lovely candle ceremony there and would like to have seen more but the priests make it too unplesant. They offer a blessing which you repeat in Hindi. The words you repeat include a promise to make a large "donation" to them which is agressively pursued after the "blessing."

title: Scenic place
review: Its a scenic place and best time is morning time, to catch the sunrise and evening time for the Aarti

title: A religious place...don't accept anything 'free'
review: The moment you reach into the area of Pushkar lake, you would be approached by end number of people, some even offering free service, but be careful.

title: Holy site
review: It was a big pilgrimage time so quite spiritual. Thousands of people come there yearly at the same time as the camel festival

title: avoid the fraudulent touts
review: Do not be taken in by the so-called Brahmin priests who offer you flowers to throw into the lake and then demand thousands of rupees for the privilege. Repeat the word 'NO' to them as many times as it takes for them to understand that you will not be conned.

title: water (Pushkar)
review: pushkar is known for this lake for its mythologyical value. so take time out  and visit this place enjoy its history. Do visit the only Brahma temple in the Country.

title: Pushkar Lake and Pushkar Fair
review: I don't think one should go out of their way to visit this site. First of all there are many sly guys on the look out for tourists with whom they could swindle, including the priests.  Please be aware of all purchase pricing because it can vary drastically. Priests will approach you and offer to do a prayer or ceremony to honor your ancestors or to encourage good fortune upon you or your family.  With each name you give the price goes up (although they claim it to be a donation) and before you know it you will be asked to pay 2000 rupees instead of the 15 you originally thought.  For a very important religious site the lake water is very dirty and the surrounding area is dirty.  The Fair itself is chaotic with many people surrounding you and which could be intimidating for some. Although the history of India is incredible and spectacular it is very sad indeed to see the place here so poorly maintained

title: 52 Ghats!
review: Absolutely serene...little dirty with all the offerings made but still the place holds good...the shops around the same are cost effective....Generally this place is visited before the Bramha temple.

title: Serenity
review: The center of Pushkar town - the lake is surrounded by temples. A nice place to visit in the evenings as a tourist. It is quiet, calm and offers a nice view.

title: Rip Off Lake
review: The experience was great for me, apart from one thing. If you are not Indian the so called Pandits will perform a puja for you and then ask you to bless their family by giving them 1000 rupees and then they will try to get you to donate 2000 - 10000 more by saying some rubbish about the food costing 1000 per person per day. Give 100 rupees and ignore everything else that they say to you. Do not be drawn in by the rubbish that they are spouting. I wouldn't mind so much if I was convinced that the money was going to charity like they say it does, but if I was a betting man I would bet that it goes straight into their pockets. Experience is great as long as you think before you hand over any money at all and bear in mind that 1000 rupees is roughly a days wage.

title: Beware of Pushkar's conmen
review: Personally I would give Pushkar a miss. Aggressive temple ‘guides’ use the worst sort of manipulation and spiritual baloney attempting to get Westerners to give them money - an irritating scam. The supplier of our 10-minute tour of the Brahma temple wanted £40.

title: Beware of scam
review: Dear all,

title: Very nice old lake
review: Pushkar lake is very sacred and very old. A 3 hour drive from Jaipur, it is located near the ancient Brahma temple. The submerged lingam and birds hovering around the island temple in the middle are very good to see.

title: Poorly Maintained
review: Like all religious places and sacred rivers, the Pushkar lake is in urgent need of attention. I would say this was the biggest disappointment during our visit to Pushkar. I had completely different expectations from this place.

title: Divine In It's Serenity
review: The ghats at Pushkar are one of the things you need to cross of your list on your visit to this town.

title: The good and bad around the pushkar lake
review: The best thing is to see the Sunrise there,I woke up early and above the lake the view was very beautiful.The colourful dresses are very attractive.You can find Camels here and there.

title: good place to visit
review: pushkar is known for this lake for its mythologyical value. so go and visit this place enjoy its history.

title: Lovely, but beware of the guides
review: The lake is beautiful. But the guides will force you to buy flowers to put in the lake, which is a shame considering it pollutes the water. Our guide and the people around got extremely offensive when we refused, saying we did not understand the religious implications! It is sad that a lovely place is exploited like this in the name of religion.

title: Just ghastly
review: We had a driver for our 3 week trip but he couldn't save us from the scammers, rip off merchants , thugs, liars and bullies. On entering the town we had petals pushed into our palms. Then we were herded to a "holy man", my husband and I were split up then we were "prayed" over. All within 15 mins. They tried to get 2 "donations" from us but I had finally woken up & got very irate. Much cajoling, bullying and threatening behaviour ensued but we held steadfast & eventually they gave up. It was a really distressing & irritating experience. Just spoiled the trip to that town. I will never go back. Too many other beautiful places in India with lovely people to enjoy.

title: Last time in Pushkar
review: I've been to Pushkar many times over the last 20 years and have no desire to go back after my recent visit. The very narrow main streets are closed off to cars with market stalls/shops on either side of the road. It used to be very peaceful wandering around but now motorbikes come flying through at full speed which is dangerous and disconcerting. Some shops sell good quality Indian products, whilst a lot of shops sell a lot of touristy crap.

title: required cleanness...
review: Here I am requesting to Pushkar Municipal, Local People & Tourist please keep clean lake....

title: thiefs and liars
review: personally if I ever receive petals in my hand again I will throw them down and spit on them. not religious at all and the people in white who claim to be are scammers and disgusting people  why they are allowed in such a beautiful society like the one in pushkar I don't know.

title: Holy Lake
review: A Lake with lot of ghats for worshipers, we entered from Sunset Cafe side, you get lot of locals asking you to feed food to cows.

title: Beware - don't take anything offered for "free"
review: It's such a shame that this holy place is littered with aggressive hagglers. In saying that, we really enjoyed our time there. Always haggle back, don't take the prices (unless they are fixed, like at restaurants) straight away. For example, one guy tried to charge me 5000 rupees for the exact same thing I bought for 150 rupees just down the road. Deepak Ayurveda gave us a good massage, and Keshav Palace Hotel accom is a great spot to get away from the heaving pollution and constant beeping. The food is cheaper than Agra, and you can find gorgeous ladies' silk tops for 50 rupees. Look around before you buy and try at least three different shops before you get the feel for value. Great meditation by donation in the inner temple in the centre. Lots do to. Go to the camel safari agent called "Kalu" - he has a 'money change' shop, but runs the best and cheapest safari's on camels where you can even get a genuine home cooked meal experience and even stay the night at his family house in a gorgeous hut out in their back yard. Lovely place, just be careful.

title: Poorly maintained
review: This lake is only meant for religious activity. Apart from that it serves no other purpose. It is a very small lake and not very clean either. You can see people taking religious bath.

title: good place
review: Liked the evening Aarti. The market surrounding the lake is also very good, lively and colourful. The lake area is also maintained well.

title: where god is not worshiped
review: The lake is about 10 kilometers from Ajmer in Rajasthan, India. This is a rare place in india where god is not worshiped but the chastity of lake is important

title: good holy lake at Ajmer District
review: I like this holy lake, Calm area at pushkar ghat ,good spiritual ghat area at pushkar lake . Fantastic view of beautiful birds , and fishes at lake , enjoying moment bathed at holy lake.

title: super lake in the Pushkar
review: fantastic view and holy Water in lake. Bathing in pushkar lake is fantastic experience. Many pilgrim is deep in the pushkar lake for avoid bed curse.

title: Holy city
review: The holy men who were not holy not really much to dislike about this place lots of nice people , and old is gold , but same same is different

title: Very interesting
review: A relatively small lake surrounded by buildings and Ghats. Surprisingly the water did not seem to be as polluted as the Ganges but perhaps we were there on a good day. Quite scenic and worth a photo shoot, a fairly short visit.

title: Tranquil man made lake
review: If you visit early in the morning, this man made lake is a picture of tranquility, no pandits to bother you. Only a few monkeys and a couple of German Shephard dogs! The lake is surrounded by temples and "ghats". Avoid getting involved with the "daan" practice which involves paying the pandit a sum of money for washing your sins. There are a few decent cafea and restaurants near by. Sunsets are something of a legend. Dont miss.

title: It's a miniature haridwar
review: Beware of thugs.

title: Hmmmm
review: nothing much to do except seeing the view... unless you are a follower of the same religion so you can practice the rituals. if not and it happens that there are some Pilgrims doing the rituals you can watch them on the lake

title: can sit for hours !
review: Super place, you can enjoy your sunrise and sunset here. The sunset is amazing , sun going down , mantra chanting from all the temples around the lake , mountains , local people with their musical instruments , kids dressed up in local God like outfits , cheap accessory sellers etc. It is kind of a small fair going if it is the right month of travel. I can sit here for hours with a lemon drink !

title: Pushkar - city is know because of lord brahma.
review: Pushkar has many temples. Most of the temples are not very old because many temples were destroyed during Muslim conquests in the area.[1] Subsequently, the destroyed temples were rebuilt. The most famous among all is the Brahma Temple built during the 14th century CE.

title: Pushkar
review: This lake is of importance to the followers of Hindu religion. The lake is not maintained well ,however on can visit the one and only one Brahma temple. The surrounding of the lake is a good place for shopping.Also there are food stall where one can taste the local food.

title: Waste of time
review: Pushkar is one of the most polluted and filthy towns in India. There really isn't much to see at the lake and you have to avoid the fake holy men and people trying to sell you random things! A lady tried to sell us grass to feed her cows... Insane! If you're on your way from Jaipur to Jodhpur by road, just avoid Pushkar.

title: Spiritual
review: Wish Indians were more conscious of their heritage and adhere to the rules. Everyone solicits so be firm in your no. Went around the lake and spent the evening there. Felt at peace in some of the less crowded ghats. Do shop around the streets and get goods that are cheaper then Jaipur or jodhpur

title: It's just a lake....
review: We were encouraged to take a stroll along the lake....but the whole atmosphere is just disappointing.   Too many touts, pushing flowers on you, harassing you.....we walked very quickly to the lake, took some photos and left just as quick.

title: Good day trip from Ajmer
review: We went to Pushkar as a day trip from Ajmer. It was a nice day out and the lake and surrounding ghats were nice to wander around. There are a lot of people trying to sell you things but if you politely decline they didn't push.

title: Spritual High !
review: Only abode or temple of Lord Bramha, Pushkar has one of the unique mystical and spiritual value. Unlike Ajmer Town, Pushkar, which is around 11 kms, on a slightly hilly road, is a neater and cleaner hamlet. You would find make-shift guides near the toll entrance around one hundred rupee, whee they will take you both to the lake as well as temple. It is worth, especially if one is running short on time. Ghats are clean and water is also decent, as compared to many other holy places in North India. If you do not want to get surrounded by Priests. Even there is a separate window / office for the donation, which may be used if you feel like.

title: Simply beautiful.......
review: Such a special place to watch the sunset and relax in the evening. Monkeys make it a tropical experience. Be careful they don't steal your dinner, though!

title: Its just ok
review: The Brahma temple is a good visit and food in local market is also good but the lake should be maintained its not as clean as it looks in picture I hope government can do something for preservation

title: Holy lake but full of scammers
review: The holy lake can only be holy if there were no scammers. Be firm and say no when asked to donate money to the so called priests.

title: wonderful
review: My Pushkar visit was just to relax with my family. The place is full of amazing beauty.  6am to 6pm it is holi place but 6pm to 6am is a destination for foreigners and modern Indians, full of street food, shopping, music. U will love to visit this place again and again. Avail Hotel package for comfortable local visits.

title: Needs cleaning
review: The pushkar lake is an attraction , must visit .. but the people try to push you to take stuffs and its completely commercialized.

title: Guided tour of Pushkar city
review: We took this tour with an indian guide - SHARMA-  (50 years old) living in pushkar since over 60 years.

title: Center point of attraction in Pushkar
review: This lake is the center point of attraction in Pushkar. All settlement in pushkar is around this lake. I don't recommend taking bath or dip in this lake, as water is not clean. But, several people does that, saying it's holy water.

title: Holy lake
review: the lake view is amazing, you can take holy dip in any of the ghat, prefer to take near by mandir . Don't listen for anyone who ask for offerings , mantra,,etc. just have a holy dip go to temple , its just 5 mins walk from here.

title: Magnificent experience
review: Just breathe the air of India and with its marvelous sunset you can just appreciate the sound lights and colors of this land.

title: One of the most auhentic flavour of Indian Culture
review: This is one of the most famous and important attractions of Pushkar. It gives a very authentic taste of Indian culture. However make sure before going that the lake is full of water (always in Monsoons). I visited Pushkar in June and it had very less water due to which i could not take the real feel of the place. :-(

title: brahma lake
review: nice pilgrimage place to be visited , its surrounded by a market & there are 52 ghats inside the lake area.

title: Dip in the lake for life time
review: Brahma forms the great Hindu trilogy of Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva, each symbolising the lifecycle of birth, preservation and destruction. Brahma the creator is depicted as of four bearded heads and four hands each holding a book of Vedas (knowledge). His vehicle is the swan and his consort is Savitri. According to the legend Pushkar means a pond created by flower, was formed when Brahma dropped a lotus flower on the earth to determine a place for his yagna, a holy sacrifice. The story goes that Brahma wanted to perform the yagna at the most auspicious time but his consort Savitri whose presence at the yagna was vital for its performance kept him waiting. Irritated by this Brahma married Gayatri, a milkmaid and installed her instead. Savitri on seeing someone else in her place was infuriated and cursed Brahma that he would be forgotten by people on earth and never worshiped. She relented on pleas from other Gods that he could only be worshiped in Pushkar, hence there are no Brahma Temples elsewhere.

title: A must see in Pushkar
review: Iconic lake in the centre of Pushkar, a walk along the ghats is a must do in Pushkar. There are some good photo opportunities particularly at sunset. Watch out for the priests harassing you though on the ghats. In the evening you may see a religious ceremony too.

title: Nice, not so crowded
review: Its an mythological lake center of pushkar. Maintained. Less crowded ghats are awesome surrounded by temples. Bell chimes and chants can be from all around.

title: Used to be much better - Now it just looks good in Photos
review: It used to be a beautiful lake, but its getting crowded and dirtier now. By itself the lake is still pretty nice, with its beautiful backdrops and tiny presence, but the deadly trinity of 1. Lack of Cleanliness, 2. Over Crowding and 3. Relentless Sales Pitching by all locals seems to be effecting people's experience in a bad, bad way. Unless measures are taken to address all three, Rajasthan might see one of it's great spots become a place people might tend to avoid unless there's no other choice.

title: fascinating
review: Walk around the lake and take advantage of Sunset Cafe for evening ambience-map available from the tourist office on the east end of the main street.

title: beautiful place
review: the lake and the market nearby, worth a visit...

title: lake with 52 ghats
review: Its a mix of scenic beauty and historic monument. Walking on stairs of ghat during sunset is a pleasure.

title: Heavily Dirty
review: I was carrying a nice image of pushkar lake in my memories from my childhood when i had visited this place. I was disappointed to see it again, its been made so very dirty that one would not feel like getting down into it (it is supposed to be offering holy dip). The area near jaipur ghat can still be called ok. Go to this ghat if you want to have a look in peace, all other ghats are crowded.  There are good cafes also available on this ghat.

title: Spectacular, Earthy, Divine
review: We never thought our decision made in fluke to stay a night in Pushkar will be so fruitful, what not to love about this place.. very small place with narrow lanes, desi food stalls selling videshi stuff, falafels, hummus, burritos, quessadilla, pasta, burgers, pizza and not to miss the rabdi maal pua and kullad wala doodh. Everything about this place is so earthy, visit the rooftop restaurants to enjoy the night view of this beautiful place. Pushkar is famous for the only Brahma temple in the world so a visit to temple should also be on the list. We were surprised to see so many foreigners there, they stay for months in pushkar to enjoy the serenity of the place. The hotels are cheap bcus locals have modified their homes into hotels which are as cheap as Rs.200/-

title: Pushkar Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is a holy place but the lake itself is not as beautiful as the lake in udaipur or Jaipur. The market streets were really nice though and the people very friendly and gentle. We went with a guide to a temple and enjoyed seeing the monkeys playing in the trees.  It iis a totally vegetarian town and a no alcohol zone. We were only there for one day which we spent mostly in the market streets.  I did very much enjoy looking at the view of the lake from our hotel...Pushkar Palace. My husband had a hair cut and massage from a street barber, which he loved and we loved watching it. There are lots of western hippies there. I did really enjoy Pushkar as it is different but Jaipur is fantastic.

title: Pushkar
review: Spent a very pleasant evening by Pushkar Lake when en route from Delhi to Jaipur.Took a bus from Ajmer to get there. It was worth the side trip watching the sun set, sitting and listening to the chanting from the temples on the far side of lake shore. There weren't the throngs and endless  car horns that you get elsewhere in India which made it relaxing and really welcome.  .

title: Magical with a sense of calm
review: The best place to see the sun rise. Disappointed some people did not respect the Hindu customs at the lake. Scattering rose petals after a Hindu blessing was memorable

title: Unfortunate
review: Pushkar lake with its 52 ghats is AMAZING! It's just a HUGE shame that their are people claiming to be saadhus or holy men trying to bless you and take your money, on my first walk down I was approached by a man and I thought because it was a holy place people would not try to scam you like they do everywhere else! After he "blessed" me and asked me for a 500 rupee donation I told him No and that I would put the money in the donation box he said no and called on his friend who was dressed in a white robe. I got up and left and walked around to the other side where I was approached by a few more. Also be aware of the men that randomly give you flowers on the street saying it's for luck, they are trying to take you don't to the lake to scam you, I thought it was a nice gesture until he started following me and told me to come put it in the lake when I refused he asked for his flower back! I was so upset and disappointed that people would do this at such a holy place. Do not let these people ruin your experience though it is very beautiful.

title: Spiritual moment
review: As other reviewers mentioned, it is nice but beware of the brahma priest trap. Do the whole ceremonial but do not feel obliged to give more than 200/400 rupees for donation.
