They will pull a long face and say that if you prayed for 4 members of your family you will have to pay a minimum of 4x500 rupees,... Don't pay attention and just give what your heart says to give. I guess the ceremonial is worth it.

title: Beautiful place-Beware of scams.
review: The lake is a true landscape of India, especially during the sunset, I really enjoyed to spend some time there. In the morning in the middle of the street you'll have many people offering a loto flower to trow in the lake, as an ancient indy ritual of worshipping, they then will bring you to an exact point of the lake where you'll meet the brahmin and he'll teach you the ancient indu pray for your family at the price of 1k rupees for each person of your family you want to protect, I ended up with the fair price of 9k for this no sense plus an offer (no less than 1k to the brahmin's family), I gave 1k to the brahmin just to get rid of him, although he wasn't happy at all, such an unpleasant situation especially in that beautiful and holy place, shame!

title: Nice to watch the sunset
review: In a short trip to Pushkar, it was great to sit on a rooftop overlooking the lake and watch the sunset, and the streams of bats flying out over the lake out of the old watertower.

title: Visit Brahma Temple and Market
review: what a place to visit in Rajasthan.

title: Disappointing, full of touts.
review: We were excited to visit Pushkar and see the lake but it was ruined for us by the horrible touts there. They will do anything to scam money from you and they had us leaving Pushkar with a bitter taste in our mouths.

title: Very pretty
review: Definetly the highlight of Pushkar, we visited the lake at sunset and it was filled with ambience and charm.Truly beautiful.

title: Pious
review: It is pious and the shops around are worth visiting.i spent the whole day in the market.Also the aarti is great.

title: Disappointing....
review: Arrived Mid-June, the town itself is beautiful and you can spend hours wandering the streets, however the beauty of the lake is let down by the touts, some of whom can be quite overbearing. We only spent a few minutes there because of this despite our best efforts to turn them away. However, it was very hot when we went there and perhaps in cooler months it may be a more pleasant experience.

title: Lake is Nice
review: The lake is nice and we spent at least an hour there, but the real reason we went to Pushkar was for the camel fair (which I believe is the largest in the world). What an amazing event -- the sights, the smells, and the sounds. It is a huge event mainly to buy and sell camels, to show off camels, and to race camels. There are lots of food and merchandise vendors. What a time we had!

title: A Spiritual Body of Water
review: This is a  tank with bathing ghats around it. It is a religious place with significance to Hinduism.

title: Take holi bath for remove your sin
review: big lake for swimming . we enjoyed swim a lot

title: "wow place"
review: nice place to hangout.. me and my friends enjyed alot with yummy stalls food. great taste .i was a long time i dindt had this type of food and plaace was just perct,.

title: Must see in Pushkar
review: A must see in Pushkar where you can enjoy evening on the side of this huge lake...A peaceful place to spend time...please beware of local pandits,they will try to get money out of your pockets...

title: CALM, SERENE AND BEAUTIFUL
review: The calmness of the water and the lovely view was worth the visit. The holy Pushkar lake is a must visit for all visiting Pushkar / Ajmer.

title: If you have been in varanasi you can skip this city/lake
review: I have been in varanasi, similar holy city with the bathing ghats and a river; and compared to that i have to give this lake a bad rating.

title: Hot Air Balloon Ride
review: The hot air balloon ride is a great way to have a vision of the fair size and its beautiful area where farmers manicure the land with various agricultural activities. I rode twice, one first was in 2010, and recent one was in Nov 2013.  On both occasion, I have experienced dissatisfaction from the services provided. The first time in 2010, the balloon landed in 40 minutes which it supposed to be longer, the second time, I noticed those who rode with me paid only $ 75 and I paid $ 245. The explanation I got from the company was those paid less were booked by a travel agency who

title: Warning for tourists
review: Its a smal lake and whererver you go people want to sell you flowers or whatever. And you are not allowed to take any pictures at all. We left after 5 minutes.

title: Beautiful Lake with Beautiful View
review: One feels relaxed after coming here. Sitting on the stairs of the lake and enjoying the view is great. One of the best holy place in Rajasthan

title: beautiful lake
review: Beautiful, you can enjoy sun set on the lake side at evening time. you can see lot of Hindu people take holy deep.

title: Stinking puddle and aggressive behaviour
review: Water was very low in the lake (10-20 cm). It was stinking.

title: Extortion Racket
review: Tourists please be aware of the so called Brahmin priests/touts who work in organised gangs to harass tourists for money.  They make rules as they unravel their bullyboy strategies.  Please avoid the place.  It is just a lake where many local Hindus come to bathe and pray.

title: Loot as usual on religious place
review: Loot as usual on religious place, Some one will start to follow u on bike, then he will tell you that give me Rs. 50 only and i will show you around, will fix up a Pundit for you & than pundit will also charge some meager amount, The catch is that while performing pooja, the pandit will start to perform pooja for the departed relatives, near & dear, and then he will tell you too choose Prasad for Cows, Humans, Dog etc, which starts from 1100 Rs. & u will be told that it is sanstha which will give u a receipt for the same and they will distributing the Prasad / Langar as per you choice.

title: Decent lake
review: Not a well maintained lake. As is the norm loot happens here as in any other religious place.  One has to be aware of pandas and not fall into their trap. Go have a view of lake and come back without hiring any local for puja as they are out to rob you.

title: Some secrets of Pushkar Lake...
review: Not many know that Pushkar is one of the oldest cities in Asia, it has been mentioned in history books which are like 1500-2000 year old. The city was even destroyed twice in last 1000 years and is one of the most calm cities in India.

title: Magical place spoilt by a minority
review: According Hindu scriptures, Brahma saw a demon trying to kill his children and harassing people. He killed the demon with a lotus-flower.  During the fight lotus petals fell on the ground at three places and springs emerged creating three lakes. When Brahma came down to the earth, he named the place where the flower (pushpa) fell from his hand (kar) as Pushkar.  Taking swim in the holy lake assures salvation from all sins and it is now one of the five holiest centres of pilgrimage for Hindus.

title: Cleanest religious desination
review: The Pushkar lake is so well maintained and kept so clean which is so unusual in any religious places in India. It has enough water and every corner is so neat and clean. I was impressed to see every night all the ghats are washed and cleaned by the locals. No one is allowed in to dip their feet or wear a shoe near the area.

title: Pick your Priest well
review: There are a LOT of dodgy preists, so seek advice.  a good one will make a real difference to your visit and perception of this place.

title: nice view at sunset
review: The sunset over the lake from the steps is nice but to go down to the lake edge you will need to remove your shoes.  You are hasselled to receive a blessing of which they then ask for money in return.  Better to sit in one of the nearby restaurants and have a drink to watch the sunset in peace.  There is a group of men playing instruments but they even come by after asking for a donation for their entertainment.

title: sacred lake
review: i was surprised by how clean the lake was (you may expect everything in India). it's pretty well maintained together with surrounding ghats. all times of day are good to have a stroll around the lake. you may find some restauranst with a view as well. respect the sacred place and remove your shoes on ghats and beheve accordingly.

title: Interesting
review: You can get to the lake through any of the numerous ghats and walk all the way round.There are many Devotees and pilgrims,so it is shoes off,no photos and lots of respect. It is very pretty to see Pushkar from the lake.

title: An nusual sight
review: Pushkar Lake is a must do for Hindu pilgrims and we saw many during our short stay in Pushkar. The lake is surrounded by cement steps so there is water access in almost every location around the lake. There were many touts trying to give us flowers to place in the lake. We chose not to take them up on their offer. It is a very sacred place and should be looked upon as such.

title: Clean Sacred Lake
review: This lake is very clean and sacred lake. Do take a holy dip. Surrounded by temples all around the lake

title: Sadly dissapointing.
review: Big let down..dirty & not worth seeing except during the the Camel Festival. Pushy touts &  really dirty.

title: A mixture of serenity and chaos
review: This was one of the highlights of our trip to India. Pushkar is small but busy. The streets all converge around the lake and wherever you are in Pushkar you are not far from it.  We spent many happy hours having coffee watching the world go by. To do this you need to head to the bottom right of the lake to a place called the sunset cafe. It isn't hard to find, just ask any local. They have the most amazing German cakes there and delicious vegetarian food. Meat is not allowed in Pushkar.

title: serene
review: quite well kept and at this time of the year it was not too noisy

title: best relaxing lake..
review: Heard about, when reached we are very happy as the view is so wonderful and its the best time for sunset.

title: Great place to visit
review: This is a holy lake and visitors must be aware that you may have to remove shoes in certain areas around the lake

title: Priest Hole
review: WIshed I had read some of the reviews before visiting Pushkar lake (by car en route from Jaipur to Udaipur). We are reasonably seasoned travellers (4 visits to India) and well accustomed to saying no in a less polite manner than we would ideally like, but the visit to the lakeside at Pushkar is frankly more hassle than it's worth, at least in our experience.

title: Wonderful place to visit but use common sense and just say no
review: This is quite an experience and an incredible sight around the lake.  We took off our shoes and walked along the ghats from one to another.  Don't be put off or scared by the guys who try to tell you that you cannot go without a guide or whatever.  If you want to visit one ghat - leave your shoes and go down.  When you come back you will be expected to 'tip' the shoe minder (I think ten or twenty rupees is enough).  Or, just take your shoes off and carry them - we saw Indians doing this so it is probably ok - and walk along form one to another.

title: Lovely location
review: After a long journey it was good to stretch our legs with a walk around the lake. Disliked having to pay a local priest for a blessing.

title: Preserve your 'Prana' - just keep walking
review: I've just visited the 'lake' and yes, it's a lovely, spiritual place.  My best advice for any westerner that travels to India is simply this :  Always remember, that you are no obligation to anyone to hand over your hard earned money.  India is full of scams and 'tricks'.  If someone wants your attention - "Just keep walking", say nothing - and do not give any indication of engaging in any sort of conversation.  After 3 months of solid travel in India, my sunglasses, earphones and the 'I'm ignoring you' type attitude worked wonders, especially as a solo female traveller.  Save your energy, don't respond, don't engage with anyone (most young males wanting your attention) and keep walking - they give up pretty promptly. Do visit the Lake at sunset and just keep to yourself.  Any engagement of any sort of conversation with anyone is likely heading for some kind of trouble i.e. extracting money from your pockets.  Remain confident and stay in control by - saying absolutely nothing! It works!  Enjoy Mother India.

title: Unforgettable experience : Palpable Spirituality !!!
review: Awesomme place.the lake holds high regard in believers of Hinduism;it is the only place in World where Lord Brahma gets worshiped,not even in Brahma temple of Pushkar!!!many people take holy dip in the lake ,believed to have healing powers !!! the priests around the lake wont loot you if you show some sort of resistance unlike other holy places in India ,but still u better be careful !! i just felt like sitting in the steps of the lake and spend the whole day,its soo peaceful and serene.there are 56 ghats in total around the lake.i dont know how,but Pushkar had some magical effect on me ; worth very bit of it , Love you Pushkar !!!

title: Best seen at sunset
review: Shoes off and a fee if you go directly to the lake. Alternatively, head for the cafe (no alcohol) on the east side at sunset. Some brave souls even take a dip in the lake.

title: Great Experience
review: The lake is a really great place to go an experience a part of Indian culture which is very unique. I do agree that you can come across individuals who do try and pressure you for donations to take part, although I took part and was happy to give a little to experience something very unique and was not pressured overly much to donate more than a few rupees, which is nothing in the grand scheme of things. It is a very serene place which is wonderful to experience and naturally a must on a trip to Pushkar.

title: Beautiful & yet disappointing
review: While it is interesting to hear the legend of the Brahma temple, the lake disappoints. Despite the best efforts of the management, it continues to be filthy. The management has made two separate ponds-one for submerging the ashes of the departed, and the other for making flower offerings. There are also posters at various paces guiding on this. In spite of this, people continue to put the ashes and flowers in the main lake. Adding to this is the prevalence of pigeons, dogs and cows. Their excrements mark the Ghats, making walking there a pain. I saw the cleaning crew removing cow dung with bare hands.

title: Walk carefully!
review: When you enter the lake are local will try to give you flowers saying it's a free offering. Ignore them as they will later ask for money. The ghats (stairs leading down to lake) have cows roaming on them and occasionaly you will have difficulties avoiding stepping in dung or cow piss. Ignore this as well, as this is part of the India experience. When you find a free clean spot sit down and watch the religious people. The spectacle is interesting and you will see Indians bathing naked, doing pujas or just socializing. Photography is teoretically prohibited but you might be able to sneak a few pictures. If you're there for more than a few minutes chances are 'holy men' will approach you and try to get money out of you by performing religious services in your name. These you cannot afford to simply ignore but most will get the point and leave you alone after one or two firm refusals. In my opinion going to the lake is an experience not to be missed if you are in Pushkar though not necessarily a pleasant one.

title: With a little common sense, an interesting place. Ditto the surrounding town
review: If you use a little basic common sense to deal with touts and sellers a walk through the town itself can be quite interesting--more so than most Rajisthani towns for sure. You can get a fairly good sense of what a trading and pilgrimage centre was like in earlier days.

title: peaceful
review: Views of the lake and discreet walking round it via temple steps was wonderful.  Just beware priests being friendly and then demanding a lot of money!

title: Pushkar
review: Lake views were spectacular ..... picture postcard stuff!

title: Be careful
review: This maybe a very holy place but the people here are up to scam you all the way. Be very careful what you agree to, where you leave your shoes etc etc. What should have been a pleasant experience is totally spoilt by scams

title: an organised swindle
review: Beware of street petal-givers who will direct you to the Lakeside and pretend that you have to throw them there; after a short sitdown near the water and a religious conference, it is all directed at one aim: make you donate as much as you can. As soon as you say you won't give, they leave you.

title: Great town but terrorized by motorcyclists all day long
review: What a fantastic little place this COULD be of they would close off the tiny streets from all the young guys trying to look cool riding recklessly, swerving around the walkers, cows, vendors, etc. I'm pretty mellow about India traffic but this is super annoying and dangerous.

title: Beautiful.
review: Don't worry too much about scams, you can just say no and don't feel bad about it. I always give a few rupees to people who play but i didn't have any problems with priests.

title: The only Brahma Temple
review: Pushkar should be a busier place than it actually is. Its quite peaceful. As said in a earlier review just say no if priests are trying to goad into some pooja you normally wouldnt do. A calming experience.

title: not so sacred lake
review: Bit disappointed with the lake. For it to be a very holy site it was poorly kept, very dirty and had no feeling of being sacred as say compared to Varanasi.

title: Beautifull Sunset views and many holy shrines...
review: A walk along the ghats is possible if you are prepared to take your shoes of or stay 40 feet away from the lake.The views of the different ghats and surrounding architecture are spectacular.But also it is necessary to have respect and understanding for the Hindu devotees who come here on pilgrimage and do not want to be disturbed.Do not accept any flower offering or puja offers from so-called priests.,,,find a quiet place to sit and enjoy.Try and find the ghat where the dried out corpse of a crocodile is exhibited.They used to infest the lake many many years ago and even eat people .

title: "amazing sunset view....."
review: it is lovely to see the sunset.......by seating there and talking, walking along with your family....it is just beautiful..... :)

title: Take your time
review: As you walk into the market street, you will be picked up by a 'student' who will steer you down the nearest lane and steps to the lake, where you'll be railroaded into an expensive 'puja'.  Nothing wrong with going through a blessing, and paying a decent donation, but better at a time of your own choosing, at any of the other 'ghats' that are really easy to find as you walk along.  So just say a polite no until you feel relaxed in your own time.  I was still wearing my coloured thread around my wrist a month after I got home.

title: Krishna School of Music
review: Teacher was late, rude, and cut the lesson short after 45 minutes. He fooled around with his smartphone throughout the lesson and left for 10 minutes in the middle. Very disappointing. I've been a teacher throughout my life and he's a terrible teacher.

title: Typical Indian religious pond
review: The place is good for landscape and street photography, for the photographers. But for others it's no different from any other pilgrimage spot, with money hungry pundits hovering over your heads like vultures, to shell out moolah for some non-sense they do with the dirty water.

title: Peaceful
review: We were a little hesitant about the lake having read many of the reviews about scams. However we spoke to the guy at the tourist office who gave us very clear advice about where to go, do's and don'ts and a helpful free map.

title: pressured to donate money
review: I had been warned about going down to the river to perform the puja due to requests for a donation. However I wanted to join in the culture so I went down. I was pressured to give more than I wished. I was happy to partake in the culture and was respectful but in return I was made to feel uncomfortable. This should not be the case at a place of worship it should be down to the individual what they wish to give. I was not refusing to give anything so my wishes should have been respected.

title: A lake with a difference.
review: Pushkar lake holds a very holy significance in Hindu mythology. Be it a connection with departed souls or an amalgam of all rajas of Rajasthan for a common cause, the lake is special. It has the only Brahama temple in the world on its elevated bank. The pundits near the lake spin yarns to fool gullible tourists with concoction-ed stories and fulfill their existence.  however, scientifically, I felt that the lake must have been created by a meteor ages ago. It is perfectly circular with high banks raised probably by its huge impact. The water has a strange hue and maybe mineral rich.It is a good spot to see something different and listen to stories made out of heightened human imagination. good place for shopping trinkets and camel skin bags too. Overall, worth a visit if you are going to Ajmer. Maybe your ancestors will be delighted to see you there...(pun intended)

title: Very Refreshing Lakes
review: We liked sitting beside the Lake on the banks / Stairs and Enjoy the Weather and the View of the Hills in The Backdrop.

title: Amazing
review: Well worth a visit, its just beautiful, at any time of the day, its really wonderful here especially during holidays and festivals as the atmosphere is so nice.

title: Nice to visit and walk around
review: Obviously the holy lake is central to a visit to Pushkar.  It was cleaner than I expected and surrounded by ghats and many small temples.  We'd heard about pushy priests but didn't really have  a problem.  We did make an offering to get our "ribbons" and he asked first for 1000 inr but was happy with 100.  Lovely to walk around  the lake as a circuit and stop for a tea on the way.

title: Pushkar Camel Fair
review: At long last I was able to experience the Pushkar Camel Fair this past November and what a memorable experience it was. An astonishing 30,000 camels & horses  converge on the tiny desert town of Pushkar, in India's state of Rajasthan, for this event. It's a fascinating and peculiar sight, and a great opportunity to witness an old traditional style Indian festival.

title: The sounds of chants and atmosphere is spritual
review: I have been to Pushkar twice and let me tell you there is something heavenly about this place. Visit this lake during the sunset. The view is breath taking and the atmosphere is filled with the sounds of holy chants. A must do if you are in pushkar

title: One of the cleanest lake
review: Pushkar lake is one of the cleanest lake where you can even see the bed of the lake from above. This lake have a beautifull scenerio. One must see this lake if visiting Pushkar.

title: Sharma's temple and country tour around Pushkar Lake
review: We stayed in Pushkar for 2 nights at Seventh Heaven hotel (which was terrific), and went on two tours with Sharma, who was highly recommended by Seventh Heaven. The temple tour, 3 hours long, took in the lake itself, some history about Pushkar, an orientation to Hinduism, and a visit to the Brahma temple. Sharma and his family have lived in Pushkar for generations, and his perspectives were really interesting. His English is not great, so some people may have trouble understanding him, but it was fine for us. The next day Sharma took us into the rural area and hills outside Pushkar - another 3 hour walk - and we fed a troop of monkeys in the hills. The pace of the tour was slow and relaxed, and we stopped often as Sharma chatted with friends and neighbours. Not your usual tour, but highly recommended as an orientation to this pilgrimage town.

title: Nice lake...with hill view.
review: Pushkar lake is kind of must visit place in pushkar. This Pushkar Lake or Pushkar Sarovar is believed to be created by hindu god brahma.

title: Took part in prayer ceremony
review: We were lucky in our visit to Pushkar Lake as we were on a G Adventures tour and our tour guide organised a prayer ceremony at the Lake. He explained its religious significance and why it has become a pilgrimage destination.

title: Evening Aarti at Pushkar Lake
review: The 400 km car drive from Gurgaon to Pushkar wasn't too difficult despite numerous under construction over-bridges. The RTDC huts which we booked online were quite basic but neat. Very conveniently located - just 20 minutes by walk which we covered late afternoon. On way were many Havelis (houses) showing the opulence, and overtly artistic taste of their owners. The bonus was the evening aarti on the banks of the Pushkar Lake, which was formed when a lotus flower (pushp in Hindi) fell from the heavens (Brahma's hands) at this site. We did a special family puja to seek blessings of Brahma and Gayatri (goddess), who themselves did a couples yagya at the lake, and also offered to our ancestors. From the lake it takes only 10 minutes to Brahma  (one of the divine trinity of the Hindu gods) Temple through a colorful street where shops are full of artifacts, stoles, scarfs and clothes. There are vendors selling fresh pastries, tea, and even Gulkand (sweetened rose petals, eaten as a mouth freshner). Also, savor authentic Rajasthani food (very spicy) with fresh rotis (bread) made on earthen pots. A truly amazing journey across history.

title: brahma temple
review: Happy to visit religious pushkar lake and Brahma temple (only temple in worid). There is filteration plant in the lake but water and ghat should be more clean.Pushkar is  very pieceful city with lot of foreigners includining isreale, uk and more. I dnt know why there is lot of white poeple than indians. If any one know pls. tell me.

title: Beautiful!
review: I loved the lake and everything about the city. The fake Brahmins were a bit annoying - try to push them away without offending them. Otherwise, a great serene experience and one I am glad I had.

title: Ultimate Pilgrimage
review: Pushkar lake is very Holy to Hindu faithfuls. The lake is rather well maintained in recent times. Pushkar town still maintains the small town image with naroow streets with shops spilling on to the roads. Of course one can sight many western tourists seeking Moksha here...

title: Peaceful and quiet
review: We went to Pushkar to escape from the chaos in other cities in India. Because the center of Pushkar is car free, it is really quiet and peaceful.

title: Peaceful
review: We loved Pushkar and the lake was part of its beauty!Beware of the touts at the first ghats,they will try to sell you flowers and ribbons and they can get really aggresive.

title: Dirty pond
review: If this is where Brahma dropped his lotus, it's definitely expired from the litter and rubbish in the water.  How can they call it a sacred lake and then defile it so much?

title: Bramha Temple, Best place to relax, rejuvenate
review: Should visit at least once, as it has Bramha temple, 52 ghats, Savitri temple and nice market. We took RSTC local bus to reach Pushkar, almost 30 mins and 12 Rs to get in there. Walk down to temple, you can find so many ghats and temples. Do visit them, market is more intended for foreign visitors, but still it has traditional Rajsthan fever. Don't buy so much from there.

title: Good place to relax.
review: This place is a really good place to relax. We reached here at around 9.30 in the morning. Was really peaceful. We sat down at the main Brahma ghat and put our feet in the water. There were some touts trying to sell you flowers, but when we said no, they were polite enough and went back.

title: Holy water
review: I liked the peace and quite of the lake as well as the piligrims bath. I did not like the fact that when one does a worship or puja the priests do not make it clear who much money to give them.

title: Simpaly amazing
review: This I believe is not very popular but excellent place to visit in Rajasthan. A small town with population of around 30K and 400 temples. Pushkar is known for the animal fare and only temple of Lord Bramha in the world. There is an interesting story behind the formation and lake and why there is only one Bramha temple in world. Just being at the lake is as good as meditation.

title: Pity it's not looked after better
review: A potentially beautiful lake which has been spoilt by pollution. Also watch out for the fake 'priests' who have one goal; to get your money. Don't trust them, they can be incredibly pushy.

title: Spiritual
review: Since it is Brahma's only teerth, worth going..

title: Don't fall for the Brahman trick.
review: It's anthropologically interesting to see how a 'Brahman caste member' intimidates you into giving. I don't care about money and wanted to get rid of his presence so I donated. If you're interested in this experience, go for it, but be ready to be intimidated and have a plan B if you want out.

title: "Sleepy little town as a perfect getaway....."
review: I would recommend Pushkar, the ancient Hindu town which is around 18 kms from Ajmer (well connected by rail, road) in Rajasthan. A small lake with encircling temples and ghats. The only 'Brahma Temple' in the world is here (Open 8 am - 1.30 pm & 3.00 pm - 9 pm). The most famous cattle fair is also held in Pushkar in November every year.

title: waaaoooow
review: excellent peacefull place in pushkar.

title: Very beautyful views but beware of cheaters !
review: Take care: although Pushkar is a very holy town for Hindus there are the most cheaters we met during our whole trip. Even the "priests" who guide you to the lake to explain the mythology of the place will cheat you ! Don't give any money ! If you want to donate insist to put the money in the donation boxes !

title: Beware of Touts
review: The Pushkar lake is a nice place to visit but beware of touts. You will find lots of people calling themselves Brahmin who would help you in completing the rituals, however don`t fell in the trap as their sole motive is to extract as much money from you as possible. You can yourself go to the lake and enjoy the beauty

title: beautiful
review: I think it met be a beautiful lake with religious importance. I "think" so because it was very foggy the morning I went there so that I couldn't see much. The water tasted sweet. To escape the touts and guides, I let the taxi driver (Madan Lal from Panicker Travels in Delhi, a crook himself, as I came to know later) arrange for a guide and said I would pay no more than Rs 100 for taking me to 3/4 temples. The man left me after saying a few words at the ghat, saying I could go to those temples on my own! The place is full of cheats, and their mafia-like attitude to get themselves organised and force you to take their services is quite scary. Something has to be done to check these people and the pandas or slowly no one would go to these places at all.

title: Pushkar camel fair
review: Amazing experience to be in Pushkar during the camel fair!

title: lacks the spiritual energy
review: the over agressive touts and holy men who just want money from you just get to me, and in a small city like Pushkar where the only source of real income is through tourists, they are really really aggressive. Ruins the experience even for a local like me... by local I mean Indian

title: Oasis
review: Nice enough lake, but right around the Pushkar Camel Festival it gets crazy with people trying to get money out of you to put a flower in the lake for good luck

title: Good place to walk
review: Beautiful and peaceful looking over the lake from the hotel. Market very touristy but good for a break from the crazy traffic. Unfortunately we did not visit duRing the camel fair

title: Nothing like the pictures...
review: The town surrounds the lake but it was dirty with a lot of rubbish along the ghats. Of course it is an important part of Indian religion, but being western, it didn't hold any appeal for me.

title: Pushkar-Paradise Lost
review: Having visited Pushkar three years ago to find the lake dry, it was with much anticipation I returned there.  While Pushkar is a holy place it is suffering from new problems.  The Pujas at the lake are now amplified to the point of disturbing whatever peace you might gain.  Additionally, the town is now overrun with motos racing through the narrow streets beeping all the while.  I saw a Saddhu get knocked down and feared for my own safety every time I walked through the streets.  I spoke with several merchants urging them to act to reduce the danger and noise.  Most agreed but felt they could do nothing about it.  My advice is to skip Pushkar until they get this under control

title: Serene lake surround by shifty stooges!
review: I found the lake to be lovely. It is unique as it is surrounded by ghats where you can watch the pilgrims bathe and make their sacrifices. However, this is also the disappointing part. There is nowhere that you can just sit and relax by the lake. Nowhere to have a picnic and take in some rays. The other problem is the "holy men" who try to rip tourists off by doing some faux puja. One man attempted to swindle me out of $10 for each of my family members. I then told him that I would put some money in the donation box and he said that I couldn't do that. This whole experience, similar to others that have been outlined on this forum, left a sour taste in my mouth. Hopefully, some tourism official gets this practise to stop because this will lead to tourists diverting away from Pushkar as the lake is the main attraction here.

title: Be Careful
review: The beauty of the lake was diminished by the scamming men who offer to help you say a blessing at the lake then they begin to tell you all the reasons you should give money on a spiritual level ..I'd doesn't matter how much you offer it is not enough .A bit sad .So if any one offers to help you just refuse politely but firmly .

title: A quaint little place with a old well known temple
review: I was blessed to visit the Brahma temple in Pushkar. As per Indian mythology this is the only Bramha temple in the world. The triology of Brahma (Creator), Vishnu (Preserver) and Shiva (destroyer) are the most important in Indian mythology. My imagination of the temple was it will be very grand and big. I was a bit surprised that the temple is quite small and a bit rundown. I was lucky to be at the temple for the evening aarti. The surroundings have a lot of smaller temples and even smaller handicraft and traditional clothing shops. The view of the Pushkar lake is awesome. Considering the attraction that it is, the local government can make this place much better. It is not well organized. Also from Oct until March a lot of European tourists frequent the place.

title: Watch out for the flower scam
review: We were warned before we got to Pushkar about the flower scam, so when offered flowers 4 times we refused to touch or take them and never got scammed.

title: beautiful
review: i liked everything.

title: Golden Triangle Tour With Pushkar Package
review: As i belong to Delhi, and i am a tourism student. I have studied a lot about the Golden Triangle Circuit and the Pushkar city.

title: Calm and nice
review: I went to Pushkar from Jaipur. After visiting the Brahma temple, I came to the famous Pushkar lake. It is a very beautiful lake where you can sit and relax. And I had one of the best lunch from near the Brahma temple. The food was very very tasty.

title: Nice Lake - Shame about the 'False Holy Men'
review: The lake is nice and peaceful - and a walk around the ghats is well worth it ... BUT ... prepare to be plagued by a host of would be 'Holy Men' who are really just after cash for improving your Karma ... I found my Karma much less clam as a result of their pestering.

title: Badly maintained & dirty
review: A visit to the famed lake is a must if you are in Pushkar. The approach to the lake is through the market. Given the religious significance of the place, it was shocking to see how poorly it was maintained.

title: Very serene
review: In the evening you could walk arround the lake and if you are lucky you might witness a musical performance.

title: what a deception
review: Walking towards the lake and you start to see a very depressive site. It is dirty, not maintained and above all, those nasty priests pesting you for doing a puja out there ... That lake needs a serious clean up, starting with the self-claimed, pushy priests that make you feel very uncomfortable. What a disappointment. I have no desire whatsoever to go back to Pushkar.

title: Dirty
review: Sunset was wonderful. Wish the authorities cleaned the ghats and also the lake especially keeping in mind the hindu religious value the place holds. What are the hindu organisations doing ? Can they not enter into a PPP model and set up water cleaning pumps or clean the ghats on daily basis ?

title: Nice sunset mood around sunset cafe
review: Try to get a seat on the terrace of the sunset cafe and enjoy the sunset with a cold lassi or a hot tea. We also had some travellers playing music to celebrate the sunset. Even better then!

title: Pushkar a holy town of Rajasthan
review: Pushkar is a holy town in Rajasthan, 13 KM away from Ajmer. Easiest way to reach Pushkar is to hire a Taxi or board a Bus from Ajmer. There are many Hotels, Resorts and Dharmshalas where one can stay depending on their budget. One can visit Pushkar any time, but the best period to visit Pushkar is from October to March specially in the holy month of Kartik after Deepawali.. Besides being holy place, it's main attraction is The Pushkar Animal Fair which is held 5 days after Deepawali and runs up to Kartik Poornima.

title: Holy Place
review: Pushkar is around 15-20 kms from Ajmer. This is one of the Holy places in Rajasthan. The lake is not very clean. The water is also not clear. But its a nice place for a day outing. You can see lot of foreigners there.

title: Disappointing location....
review: Pushkar's maze of narrow streets are worth a look. The city is clearly oriented toward tourists. Be warned of accepting any flowers by local and religious men seemingly offering them in a welcoming manner. Especially down by the lake. Acceptance incurs money- but they won't inform you of this prior. I refused (I was pre warned) resulting in a demeanor change of the other party. Comically the local (and his friend standing a few paces behind him observing) became agitated and tried to dominate me by demanding to know why you don't want to drop his religious flowers in his religious lake. Just be cautious of this... However it was quite amusing...

title: Just another Indian lake
review: The people and culture is more interesting in Pushkar than the lake it self. The quality of the product in the shops is very bad.

title: Pretty, but don't bath in it!
review: Worth a visit if you are interested in Pushkar history.

title: Worst experience in India
review: Be very very wary of the unscrupulous so called religious men whose sole purpose is to extract as much money as possible out of every tourist. They start off being extremely friendly and wish to explain the significance of the lake and their religion. They then proceed to ask you to pray for your loved ones by repeating some words they recite. Upon completing this they ask you to throw some flowers into the lake. They then proceed to pressure the unsuspecting tourist into donating unrealistic amounts of money and when smaller amounts are offered they become very aggressive. I visited this place with my daughter and one of her friends and were harrassed by these guys all the way back to our car where they expected to receive more money. When they realised we were not going to give in they formed a human chain across the road to try and block us from leaving. Fortunately our driver knew what to do and simply drove at them and they scattered out of the way. This whole experience which was supposed to be spiritual and enlightening simply showed the greed and level people will go to to procure money. An absolutely disgusting experience.

title: Pushkar
review: Whilst in Ajmer, one must visit Pushkar(known as Teerth Raj meaning the Raja of all Teerth places)Visit the only Brahma temple in the world,various Ghats. If fond of eating then try the Malpuas at shops opp Gau Ghat, kachori/samosa at the shop 100 mts before entrance to Brahma temple.

title: Recommended for religious people & devotees
review: "Witness the holy pilgrim place, its colour, lake, temples, ghats and magical fairs, hosted at time to time." - Quote about "Tirth Raj Pushkar" by Sachin Kumar Gupta

title: Review of Pushkar Lake Ajmer
review: I with my family visited Pushkar Lake on 7/10/2013. I have heard about this lake too much but highly depressed to see its poor condition. The water of lake was too much dirty and full of garbage and we hesitated to take a touch of it. But due to religious point of view we touched  it and came back to see Lord Brahma temple. I will not like to see it again.

title: Beware of Panditjis!
review: King of all Pilgrimage in India but need to be careful about the so called guides and pandits here. right from the toll gate they will start chasing you and also fight with each other in the process. I was wondering why are they fighting for a small guide fee!! Realized later. The temple is the only Brahma temple in India (heard now there are others in India too) and one cannot perform puja in the temple. The real place to worship is the Lake and Panditji will perform the Puja ritual in front of the lake. But we need to be careful during the puja. These Pandits during the Puja will somehow make you agree for a donation of minimum Rs 1100 or multiples thereof before you even realize and then force you to pay. A major percent (or the whoe it!) of that goes to the Driver, the Guide and to others...all in the name of pilgrimage!!

title: If you like water
review: I am an absolute fan of water, i need a waterfall, huge swimming pool, lake river sea ocean nayhting wherever i go. this was no exception. i loved it because i love water. give it apass if you dont

title: i love this place...
review: its a holy lake and i love water spots. the best of the lake view is sun set we enjoyed there with friends who we met at the spot ..

title: nice lake from a distance
review: the lake is best appreciated in my opinion from the "sunse", very nice view especially with sunset

title: Peace of Soul*
review: You may remember your Grand Parents and their Parents to transfer them peace and regard from Bank of this Sarovar of Lord Brahma!! Its not Clean but in Evening 7 PM when lights on and Worship going on all around lake we feel likes Heaven and Peace of Soul............ Feeling are important here nothing else, see faces of Piligrams all Around and Feel their Feeling!!

title: Few words for Pushkar Lake
review: Very nice lake, views of surrounding lake is beautiful. Brahma temple beside this lake is very neat & clean. I liked  this place.

title: The Creator's abode
review: With the only temple in the world for Bramha ( the Creator of the universe in Hindu Mythology)...Pushkar is a must visit for it's peaceful environs...the ghats are clean(compared to many others I have seen) and the place is safe ( we were a group of women only).

title: Be aware of the cheating priests
review: My experience of that lake was not the best. Be careful, there are so many "priests" who want to do a ceremony with you, but finally they want only your money! If you don't want to pay what they want they get really aggressive! And they are not content with 100 Rupees. Luckily I could convince them that I don't have much money left (good to keep your big money separate...) and I walked away.

title: Not a place for tourists, never again
review: We went there today with a local guide. What a mistake. Never again. For religious people for whom this place is meaningful I am sure this place IS worth visiting, but for those of us who are just learning about Indian culture and religions this place is a no-go unless you are very assertive.  Then again if you are not assertive but you at least put your donation into the box then you can feel you donated to a good cause. Still, the visit left us feeling distaste towards the whole place and our memories of Pushar are negative. The priests are supposed to be role-models of some sort, but here it seems they exist solely to force people to give money and they do it in the most disgusting ways.

title: Beautiful and peaceful
review: The lake really comes alive in the morning and the evenings when people are making their pujas and there's chanting and bells ringing from all the temples.  What I didn't understand was all the signs about photographs not being allowed when there seemed to be cameras clicking all over the place.  People were even setting up tripods to get the exact photo they wanted!

title: Dirty
review: Very dirty, i wish if it was clean and some place to sit. The benches near the lake very very less in number. The locals had created a mess in all the areas of the lake

title: Tranquility ruined by more con-men!
review: The lake is truly a remarkable place of peace and calm, especially as the sun is setting and the Hindu mantra can be heard from across the lake. The ONE thing that ruins this beautiful oasis is the CON-MEN who claim to be priests.

title: Pushkar lake will enchant you
review: Magnificent experience.. just breathe the air of india and with its marvelous sunset you can just appreciate the sound lights and colours of this land.

title: Holy city
review: Heavenly place. Great to visit the only Brahma temple in the world. Had the opportunity to be present at the evening Aarti both at the lake and the temple. Divine experience. Of course, the priests try to emotionally blackmail you, and though we try to resist, we do end up paying a lot of money. The flavour of roses in the air is everywhere and gives you a divine feeling.

title: Relaxed place to be
review: Nice place to be, very relaxed and once you've been there you always long back. Several different hotels along the lake side with direct access to the water (if there is water in the lake).

title: Magnetic
review: I kept being drawn back to the lake no matter where I walked in Pushkar - magic

title: So beautiful at sunrise.
review: Worth getting up for.  It is also a little quieter at this time.  Still, be careful if you want to take photos.  This is a very spiritual place and there are definitly places around the lake where they take a very dim view of visitors snapping away.  However we found that in the early morning, they were more accepting, as long as we were courteous and considerate and did not take pictures of people bathing or going about their spiritual time.

title: Nice place to spend time there
review: You can travel around the lake, but you should be wary of all kinds of people trying to sell you overpriced holy flowers. You can feed the pigeons there. Very nice attraction to spend two hours.

title: A lake with good views of a distant temple
review: Not much to see really.  Watch out for the locals giving you flowers and then expecting to be paid for showing you the lake.

title: Beware the 'priests'
review: We were warned before we went to Pushkar about the 'priests' that bless you in the hold lake before then demanding money for the privilege. As such, we steered clear of this experience and went down to the lake on our own. Obviously this area holds more significance for others than for ourselves so others so I cannot really say much more.

title: it is a holy lake
review: the best part is the Sun set at lake side ,it is very cool and calm.you can sit and feel very relaxed.it gives you very positive feeling..and the bad part is some times people make you fool for making money in the name of God.that badthing

title: As blue as it gets
review: Putting aside the religious importance of this place, the lake is beautiful and surrounded by equally good looking old blue "muths". Too many monkeys around so be ware. Water is not very clean so avoid taking dip unless you are there for religious purpose. Avoid getting involved with local priests!!!

title: Nice but not clean
review: looks like nobody is bothered for the cleaning of the lake....there was garbage all around the lake and was smelling badly.

title: nice pilgrim palace but not clean
review: I came in pushkar with some client last year ,

title: Good
review: Only temple dedicated to Lord Bramha. Not so great! the place around the temple is a market place. The temple is open till 9.00 PM. There is Aarti before the temple is closed.

title: Serenity
review: Beautiful lake setting.  Quiet and serene, lined with the soft tones of weathered Pushkar buildings.  Although we came at twilight, there were still musicians on the ghats, bathing in the lake.  Overall, a lovely place in the evening.

title: panaroic view ...
review: beautiful sunset view....also its fun to feed the pigeons sitting on your hand....also the place has spiritual aura which can be felt sitting on the lake shore....

title: guided tour
review: Mr Sharma's tour of Pushkar was one of the highlights of our India tour. We are a family with 5 teenagers all of whom loved the tour. Mr. Sharma explained about the history of Pushkar, the relligious and cultural importance of the place, traditions, the Hindi beliefs about the place as we toured the area walking. His English is perfect, he is a very interesting and sweet man. We loved every minute of our 3 hours with him. Pushkar became very meaningful for us as a result of the tour. Mr. Sharma is a native to Pushkar- a 10th generation Brahmin so when he allowed the kids to dip in the lake (girls with clothes on of course) they were thrilled. Highly recommend this experience!

title: Great Pilgrimage
review: Only temple of Brahma in the world, where Lord brahma is worshipped. The lake is where the puja is done, look  for pandit and fix up rate well in advance ie total package. Bargaining is too much, emotional black mail by pandits are done to empty your pocket. Other than that the lake is neat and clean you can take a holy dip and watch natural beauty around it. Great place to visit.

title: Nice place
review: This is a peaceful part of Pushkar and very different from the commercial area around with many aggressive sales people

title: love pushakr lake
review: this is the most good place in pushakr to sit quite in the night.i love pushakar everyone once to sit in lake with your clean mind its great

title: Interesting to watch the people
review: I had been warned about the 'pushy priests' but I had no hassle I was there at 9 am I had a good walk round several ghats and watched services being performed, children being washed and teenagers splashing about.

title: PUSHKAR TEMPLE
review: This is the one of the two places in India,where Lord brahmaji's temple is there.It is a heritage site and more than many centuries old.In the lake you may take a holy dip and then can proceed for Darshana of Lord Brahmaji.As per hindu religion some of the pujas are performed here, which may give you lot of mental peace.You will  be aksed to donate to the temple through a trust, you may do so at your sweet will, but it is not a must, so take care.Photography is prohibited when people are taking holy dip on big hindu calender days.

title: The Lost Glory
review: I remembered the days when pond at Pushkar was one of most beautiful pond, surrounded by ancient temples and some palaces but in last decade it has lost its charm . this is accompanied by lot of construction  from Ajmer to Pushkar.  In fact one can see temples had made their personnel water pool at their ghats. I hope soon pond will get more water, all boundaries of pool will assimilate will become home for lotus... ...

title: Another Hindu Mythological Marvel!
review: About a two hours drive from Jaipur you land amidst a couple hundred temples surrounding the Holy Lake of Pushkar. Get a guide for about INR 50 who takes you around telling the legend / folklore about how it all happened. I strongly suggest you stay away from the Brahmins on the ghats who will sweet talk you into making bizzare donations with the idea of satisfying the souls of your loved ones. Impressive to see a huge lake in a place like Rajasthan. Not a very great experience though!

title: worth a quick look
review: Visually, the lake itself is no big deal besides being its history, but if you stay there for a while you can see a beautiful landscape, people coming and going and devotees with their prayers. Pushkar is not a beautiful city at all, but it has a great value to the hindus, because there's the only Brahma temple in India (not the only but the most important one)

title: osmm place
review: it is an osmm place wid some religious places,it has the worlds one n only brahma temple.the serial diya aur bati hum is shooted there.u have to take a bath in the pushkar lake before visiting the brahma temple.PLEASE DO NOT ENTERTAIN PRIESTS(PANDITS N PUJARIS)AS THEY R CHEATERS N JUST RECITE HYMNS DAT DO NOT MEAN ANYTHING N IN THE END THEY TRY TO TAKE 1000 RS  FRM U.

title: Peace and serinity
review: Pushkar is well known for the Pushkar mela , very rarely about the lake and the 24 ghats .... one can sit here , meditate , chant mantras , or even do yoga and trust me it will definitely not make u look funny ... worth a visit and worth every moment of your time

title: Not impress
review: I liked the views of the architecture surrounding the lake but it is not clean at all. Dislike the wild driving around...not clean.

title: Robbers everywhere
review: Please dont visit Pushkar ever. You will be robbed one way or the other. Be it hotels, restaurants, temples or the guides. Everyone is involved in a scam. Terrible experience.

title: Could have been great...
review: ... if we did not have a man all the time talking to us about the donation we would have to pay. Was not that we did not wanted to, but just sitting at the lakem enjoying the sunset and the athmosphere was not possible because of the man. I you want to enjoy the lake, just be rude and send them away. Did not dare when I was there, would surely do it there was a next time.

title: Nice view but....!!!!
review: We came to Pushkar from Jaipur with a driver and a guide who helped us finding our way through the city, however, when we tried to see the lake, we entered through one of the temples where we immediately got surrounded by some servants over there ready for the usual tourists traps (karma...donations...helping the poor...etc) then suggesting a crazy donation!! Being nice and expecting this already, I paid 1,000 rupees with a good heart hoping it will go to those who need it. My friend decided to pay 100 rupees only but just got chased all the way to the car by those "servants" who wanted more...and the tone just started to get worse when they knew he is not willing to pay more!!! This is not something any tourist would appreciate and I suggest you should totally avoid!!

title: Holy lake....
review: there are 52 ghats around the pushkar lake. Ghats are nicely built but poorly maintained. Sit near the ghat early morning or evening to watch sunset and hear mantra chanting sound and ducks. Water in the lake is dirty as lots of people perform pooja and take dip in holy lake.

title: Tee total and veggy
review: Pushkar is a Holy Town which is wrapped around the lake. This is where the locals come to cleanse their bodies and minds. It's probably ok for a day visit as once you've walked through that's it. There's the option of a camel trip into the desert if you're into that type of thing. We did take part in a cookery lesson which was first class.(Check out Bahar Cooking review).

title: Very Beautiful - a heaven in earth
review: Pushkar Lake  is outstanding. Sitting nearby and listening to holy music and watching pilgrims is a very different experience.

title: Total waste of time
review: People (tourists) supposedly come here to see the lake and the ghats. Now I don't blame the Hindues wanting to pilgrimage here since it's part of their faith. But there is nothing exciting about this place from the perspective of a person not of hindu faith. What makes it even worse are the extremely unpleasant and aggresive Brahmas (priests of some kind) by the lake that first makes you recite all kinds of religious b.......t about your family, food and fortune.Then at the end ties together your future happiness with the amount of donation you are willing to pay. The brahma started out by wanting 1000 rupees from me and was very aggresive when I declined. I eventually ended up paying 150 rupees which was about 150 rupees too much. I really really regret that the brahmas pushy and aggressive attitude managed to pressure me into doing something I felt was wrong and unfair. Today my friend and I laugh at the experience. But really it's the worst place in India. Stay away! Spend time and money elsewhere!

title: High Pressure Salesmen
review: The most noticeable thing about this place isn’t worship or religion or beauty; it’s the “priests” trying to get money out of the tourists.  We found it offensive that we got unwanted religion and prayers thrust upon us here, and then were expected to pay for doing things we didn’t want to do.

title: See this lake & hear the legend
review: The view of the lake from ghats is typical & some cleanup on the ghats would help. The Aravali mountain range as seen from ghats is scenic.

title: Don't bother ! It's a complete waste of time
review: I had heard a lot about Pushkar and have always wanted to go. However as soon as we reached the centre and got out of our car, we were approached by this so called community service personnel who wouldn't leave us. Although we told him that we wanted to be left in peace, he kept following us around. The area surrounding the lake is a dump and we just kept getting hassled by vendors, saadhus or saints and these self appointed guides. Did not feel safe at all and to be frank the place not only smells but is filthy and it seems it hasn't been cleaned or the roads swept in years ! Avoid !

title: Nothing special, but a nice walk getting there
review: The lake is pretty enough and the surrounds are clean but nothing special. However, walking nearby is interesting with many small shops and cafes - most very standard but some with artsy or interesting products and decor.

title: Krishna School of Music
review: If you like music, you want to learn music from India (classical, vocal, tabla, sitar, and other drums) don't miss in Pushkar the Krishna School of MUsic, located in Old Reng Ji Temple. I have had tabla lessons with the master in charge of the School, and I can guarantee that one hour of class is like making months of progress. He is very pedagogic, very calm and at the same time has the sensitivity to understand your rythm of learning. Highly recommended!!! Teachers name Vini Davda.

title: Not easy for a tourist to get involved.
review: Pushkar lake is called Lake Sambhar by the locals. We arrived early at the lake with cameras in hand only to be told that we were not allowed to take pictures. We got ourselves to a peaceful spot far from the people bathing and watched the sun come up over the Ratnagiri Hills, very pretty. This holy lake is a special place for Hindus and one could feel the tranquility and the quietness until a busload of tourists arrived where we had been and spoilt the mood. Not a lot to see at the lake but the shopping road running a block back is a great place to shop without too much pressure from the shopkeepers.

title: This is a magical lake.
review: This is one of the most magical places in India. Despite being such a huge tourist destination, attracting both local and foreign tourists, Pushkar remains someting unique and timeless. Of course, you'll come across some nasty and arrogant shop-keepers, such as Shri Krishna - Old Silver + Gems - who sells totally over-priced old prints (right in the middle of the shopping strip, near the intersection, when you head down to Sunset Cafe). So, just ignore those nasty, rude and over-priced shops, head down to the lake, breathe in and enjoy the magic of this unique place.

title: An amazing sunset experience!
review: We came during the daytime and immediately got pulled into a blessing with the whole-shabang (flowers tossed, chanting, etc.). They pushed for a donation, which was uncomfortable but also funny ("Some people give $100, some give $200). We gave them 50r, and walked away.

title: holy place but aware of pandas
review: holy place to visit but water is not so clean & beaware of pandits who performs puja about the charges

title: Not serene for us
review: One can understand devout people being unhappy about bus loads of uncouth foreign tourists being loud and intrusive, however....

title: Beware the "Brahman" scam!
review: The lake itself is very beautiful and serene but really be careful about the scam artists! There will be men who will guide you along the way to a certain ghat and give you flowers to hold in your hand for the "ceremony". Once you get to the lake, a man will tell you he is a Brahman and guide you through some phony prayer for luck etc. and then claim all his profits go towards feeding the local people. DO NOT PAY THEM.

title: No footwear near lake
review: A very good place to have a morning walk. No footwear is allowed anywhere near the lake. you can carry your footwear in your hands and walk.

title: the flower near the lake
review: we were with our driver,he is hindu,when we were going to visit the lake and the temple in pushkar the driver told us if anybody try to give you a flower do not accept it becuase he has seen one man accept the flower then lost the memory for short period then they asked him to give all of his money as well his documents,

title: A sacred lake
review: We were in this place in November 2012. The lake is quite famous as it's one of the sacred lakes aorund India. The only things that I want to say to the tourists is to be careful at some scammers hanging around there. Some will tell you that you need to buy a red-and-yellow bracelet as a "pass", it's not true as the visit of the lake is free; somebody else will give you "free of charge flowers" to be put in the lake, but the priest that will survey you putting the flowers in the lake will ask you for some money for that; some others will ask you to buy rice for poor people, but the charge for that rice could be very-very-very high. Be careful while there, and enjoy your visit at the ghats.

title: Beware of the hustle
review: This is a gimmick to shake down tourists by befriending you and talking up the religious ritual by one of the resident supposed holy-men.  You get a plate of flowers, etc. and repeat the words of their blessing rite, then they strong-arm you into making a large donation, and won't take "no" for an answer.  Avoid the lake!

title: Serene
review: A real sense of peacefulness and you can easily see the "holy" places surroung this lake! A place to make all your wishes come true!

title: Early morning visit
review: We visited the lake at sunrise because my husband is an avid photographer. Unfortunately one is not allowed to take photographs and even if one is seen carrying a camera you are harassed. Large numbers of fake holy men wanting to take you to the water for a donation are also a bit of a problem. However, all is not bad. We walked around the lake away from the bathing and praying ghats and were able to enjoy lovely views of the town and the serenity of the lake. Well worth a visit and early morning probably the best time as the area is clean and not too busy.

title: DIRTY GHATS,PESKY GUIDES AND PRIESTS
review: have been here twice but nothing seemed to have changed,the place is nice sans the religious compulsions forced on you by the guides and priests.

title: Just don't speak to anyone
review: The area is spoiled by people trying to get every penny they can get out of tourists. Just walk past them all and ignore everyone and have a look at the lake. We got some nice photos. To be honest, it's probably best to stay on one of the rooftop restaurants, away from the hassle and have a nice view of the lake.

title: Just ignore the touts / people who pretend to be priests
review: Basically this lake would be a nice spot, and is one of the holiest places of Hinduism...

title: It was OK
review: On the day that we went, it was sunny and it wasn't crowded. Also, we got lucky and wasn't harassed by any fake sadhus. I think there was one ceremony going on, like two people were bathing in the lake and some people were just walking around the lake. We were taking pictures then finally saw a sign that no pics allowed. We felt stupid and quickly put our camera away. The lake was kind of small. It's more like a pond. I didn't see an entry or exit for the water so it seems like it's just a dead body of water. Considering this is suppose to be the spot where Brahman dropped the lotus, it wasn't as spiritual as I thought it would be. We sat there for a while trying to soak up the sun and what was going on around. For me, the most interesting thing, maybe because I'm an animal lover, were the cows sunbathing.

title: Holy Lake - Special from Air
review: Hot Air Ballooning over Holy Lake @ Pushkar was a highlight.  Sadly, ballooning over the lake may no longer be allowed.   Visit during the Camel Festival for a wonderful experience.

title: beautiful lake, lots of ghats
review: The town is centered around the lake which is relatively large and very pretty. It has lots of ghats so it is easy to get to the lake. There are many hotels and restaurants overlooking the lake.

title: This place is a blight on Inida
review: Like everyone else who has ever been ripped off here I was totally pissed off at the hypocrisy of this place. It is supposedly a very spiritual and holy place when all it really is, is a well organised scam. The place itself is a slum on a filthy lake, with an old (maybe sacred) temple that was covered in crap. My advice don't go here there is nothing worthing putting yourself through it and definitely avoid the cesspool called the lake and its charlatan priests.

title: I had a great time by ignoring anyone who tried to take me away!
review: I had a great time by ignoring anyone who tried to take me away! No shorter title possible. Whenever I see 'terrible' reviews I check them and see why--everyone got hassled by people and ripped off. Just don't talk to them or go with them. End of bad part. I didn't even get talked too that much--after they saw me saying no they left me alone.

title: DIVINE PLACE
review: There is something truly divine about this lake.We offered prayers to our ancestors as is the ritual here.A priest explained to us the significance of the place in Hindu mythology.All the various ghats built over centuries are amazing.Just be a little careful of these priests though.They can swindle you at the drop of a hat!One can go to the other side of the lake,sit on the steps and take in beautiful sunset all to the beat of a Nagari.

title: Ajmer and Pushkar - Best place to get away for weekend from delhi
review: This was one of the best trips from Delhi, Pushkar is also called "chota Israel" , people are very friendly. Go for camel safari and watch the sunset.

title: Great
review: Very historic, pristine water, nice settlement at the bank, be careful with the guides and the puja and sponsorship asked for.

title: Rip Off
review: A day guide took us to the lake for a so-called spiritual experience.  A local told us we could pray with him and receive the blessings of the lake.  He went through his rehearsed speech, even including what he said was "holy items".   Afterwards he told us we could receive even more blessings by donating to the poor, even showing us pictures of where the money had helped people.  It was a scam, we soon found out.  We complained to our tour company who reimbursed us after our return home.   The whole experience left a bitter taste.  I learned early in the trip that  corruption runs amok in India.

title: Interesting and Pretty Religious Pilgrammage Lake
review: Nice views around the lake and various interesting Ghats.  You can also eat in a Cafe overlooking lake.  Or, if you choose to bath in the lake, you cleanse your soul.

title: Pushkar a small and beautiful town
review: Pushkar is name of lake and town. It is 416 Km from Delhi, train route and time for travel takes 7 hours. It is 13 Km. from Ajmer.This is only place where Brahma, the creater god's temple is

title: Spiritual...
review: Pushkar lake and town alone ,are reason enough to pull you to Rajasthan.The lake is surrounded by 52 temples and Ghats( read bank) in a semi circular formation.On one side of the lake stand a steep hillock with a small temple right on the top.In the evenings it is a treat to experience the aarti/prayers.....especially during the renowned Pushkar Came Fair when the Temple formation around the lake is lit up and glowing like a necklace.This lake is spiritually endowed and acquires prominence in Hindu Rites and beliefs in afterlife.Adjacent to the lake is the only Brahma temple in the world( Brahma...the creator in Hindu belief).Moreover the lake and temples surrounding it are highlighted by the market that has evolved over the years.From artefacts to Designer but affordable garments ..everything including cafes and food stalls are attractive....for the simplicity.No alcohol in the town of Pushkar.Visit this place during the annual camel fair in November.

title: A holy lake, and very pretty at sunrise
review: Hire a guide to explain the lake and you'll learn all about its significance to Hindus. Your guide will also ensure you don't walk in the wrong place in shoes, and will be able to explain the various ghats around the lake.

title: Nice Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is big attraction to visit, It is always full with people and nice view from there. Tourist offer prayers and priests are nice not so much demanding. In few $ they feel happy to perform puja. Nice to visit in evening and morning. People all over world visit to Pushkar.

title: Gorgeous and tranquil centerpiece in this desert Gem of Pushkar!
review: I highly recommend Pushkar to anyone traveling to north India and Rajhasthan, and Pushkar Lake is a beautiful centerpiece in this flower in the desert. The whole lake is surrounded by temples, and its a pilgrimage walking around it. Catching the sunset by the bathing ghat at Sunset Cafe is a highlight. Pushkar is amazing!

title: Worth seeing - pity about the filthy approaches
review: This is the main Brahma pilgimage site in India and I had never heard of it. The lake and bathing ghats are interesting and historic. Unfortunately we rode camels from our accomodation to get ther accross the camel fair grounds - ugh! Filthy gutters full of smelly muck, dead animals, piles of rubbish. if there is one thing India needs it is a decent garbage service.

title: Beware of thugs
review: Sarovar has religious and sentimental value and its very calm. Bramha temple nearby is also very good. One piece of advise would be that beware of self proclaimed pujaris or "pandas" or guides who claim to help you for doing religious rituals. Pay what you wish to trust and not what they ask.

title: Worth a visit
review: Very religious place, hang onto your money as extortionate rates requested for "blessings".

title: Beautiful oasis.
review: Pushkar Lake is where the local people go to pray/bathe (I'm not too sure what, but they're not just having a wash!)

title: Good, but beware!
review: It is quite nice just to sit by the lake and watch people take baths and feeding doves.

title: Lovely Place
review: Pushkar sarovar is clean, beautiful and serene The buildings/temples around it give a feeling of being in ancient times. There are lots of people who will follow you and ask to do pooja on the ghats (religious hindu prayers) but I was with a guide so I was not bothered much.

title: One among Pancha Sarovar
review: Have a bath with Sankalpa. Do pooja to sarovar. Those who do not have Parents, Perform Tarpan & Pindapradan  which is  necessary for the departed. If this is to be done, take required information of the previous generations. The pandits at the sarovar are ok in these rituals.  But the amount of demand for donation to their trust is unreasonable.  However after going there  we cant resist ourselves from these rituals because of their demand.

title: If I could give it less than 1 I would
review: A total rip off..Such hypocrates telling how great the religion tradition..they really put you in the moment with beautiful ceremonies...AND THEN THEY HIT YOU WITH THEIR UNREASONABLE DONATION ..6000 INR....GET OUT OF MY FACE!!!

title: Don't Bother Visiting Pushkar
review: We took in Pushkar en-route from Jodhpur to Jaipur and it cost us an extra Rp.500 to do so.  We should not have bothered.  It is a prime tourist trap.  OK it may have the only temple to Bramah in India but the aggression of the 'flower sellers' by the lake is appalling.  They 'give away' flowers so that you might 'show respect' and if you do not cough up the cash you are accused of not 'showing respect'.  I resisted their approaches by shortly after had to step between one scammer and my wife to protect her from his unwelcome attentions.  Unfortunately no police officers in evidence to protect tourists.

title: A lovely place to hangout on a roof top!
review: The town is a little like Camden market selling the usual mix of tie dye, bhang, shawls,  baggy trousers and other paraphernalia aimed at people who come here to find themselves.

title: Holy Dip!!
review: We didnt take the dip (were mainly visiting the place like a tourist and were not on a pligrimage), like all temple towns, you would be pestered by a lot of "priests or pandas".

title: youve done this youve done all
review: They say Pushkar is the king of all Tirath (spiritual journey) and if you have done this you have done all of them. must visit the Brahma temple next door.

title: Quiet but needs maintenance
review: Quiet lake with lots of birds, but very dirty, due to religious importance people come to this place but forget that things like plastic bags, wastages etc are not to be thrown in to the lake, it really needs lot of cleaning

title: The sacred water
review: It's a beautiful trip along the market, along the lake. But watch out for the "priests"  "offering" flowers. You might end up with paying a LOT of money! Kindly refuse saying "namastê" and moving on....

title: a place of religious importance to Hindus
review: Hindus consider a dip into this lake to be very auspicious.

title: Fake priests think of us as ATM machines!
review: Me and my partner where walking towards the lake and some random Indian greets us, telling us about his stay in the US and other chit chat leaving us with some rose peddles. "Make a wish at the lake, bye!"

title: don't accept anything..
review: Beautiful place, just be very careful as local men will be desperately trying to give you flowers or fruit to use as part of a ceremony down at the lake. They will lead you to the waters edge, do some chanting then they ask for/aggressively demand money as part of the ritual. It can be a bit scary if you don't give enough money so I would simply avoid the process all together by politely refusing all offers of flower petals, fruit, bracelets, marks on your forehead etc.

title: pushkar lake early in the morning
review: visit this place early morning like we did. the peace and the beauty was amazing. there were many pigeons on the Badri Ghat which enhanced the beauty.

title: So what?
review: Go to Varanasi if you want to see a pilgrimage site. Not much going on here except countless shops selling tourist junk. You can pay to step out on some private ghat, but there's not much going on.

title: So many ghats
review: The ghats around the lake are so original and serene, it's nice to sit and watch, listening to the drums, bells and songs. "Far" away from the tourist scene.

title: Serene and almost spiritual
review: Beware of the priests who try to rip you off every time you step in. Dont be aggressive when fending them off but be polite and firm.

title: Visit to Pushkar Lake, Rajasthan
review: Just a word of warning for those non-Hindu tourists intending to visit the beautiful, Sacred Lake in Pushkar - the religious leaders who greet you and take you through the 'ceremony' at the side of the lake are also interested in squeezing you for as much money as they can - and we may be talking hundreds if not thousands of dollars/euros if you are that gullible. Instead the advice to the average tourist would be to offer a few hundred rupees for the experience.

title: touts every where.......at holy place
review: Pushkar Lake,warning for tourists intending to visit the beautiful, Sacred Lake in Pushkar - the priests who greet you at the side of the lake are also interested in money beware of them as they act very cleverly no need to pay extra money

title: a divine experience
review: its truly a 'must-do' experience if you are close to jaipur. Its about 2 hrs from jaipur and the whole city is surrounded by the lake. mind you, no alcohol and non-veg in the city limits, but once you're there - you really dont feel like it, as the serenity takes over

title: Just another lake
review: The lake is surrounded by ghats all around, with guides pestering you to perform puja on the lake. It's upto you to decide whether you want to do it or not.

title: fantastic tours
review: nice place to visit it is wonderful site specially with diwakar tours and travels jaipur it was a great experince i love to visit again and again.

title: Holy Pushkar!
review: There is a sign up someplace saying 'Welcome to Holy Pushkar' but that greeting became an exclamation for us after we arrived in Pushkar .. a holy con-man tries to force a flower into your hand in exchange for thousands of rupees, Holy Pushkar!

title: Religious hindu place
review: Its an imp religious for the hindus as it has the only brahma temple in the whole world so it has got a lot of importance . The temple in itself is a simple structure with no arquitectural value only religious value. Then there is the lake which is also considered as sacred, but here u have to beware of the touts n pandits . Everone is part of the mafia which works there . The pandit does an an emotional plus spiritual blackmail to donate money to the trust they have created over there .the pandit who performed the pooja for me tried to convince me to pay $1400/-  for 7 day food for the poor n when i said i didnot hv that money in cash they even offered to receive in credit card that amt . If you happen go there just take your darshan at the temple visit the lake dont get carried by the fraud pandits  dont trust in anything they say

title: Cleanliness
review: Cleanliness of the lake and its Ghats is required.  some more facilities like changing room for females.

title: Terrible Experience
