review: My experience visiting the lake was not great or special. The entire time I had to power walk to avoid the begging children or shop owners grabbing you to come into their stalls. My advice is to try to blend in as much as possible. Do not look or act like a tourist!

title: High pressure demands for donations
review: The Pushkar Lake area is rather scenic, surrounded by small houses in a small village. There were prilgrams bathing at the lake, and it seemed like a nice environment to meditate for a moment. However, upon arrival we were met by self-proclaimed "priests" who started a pooja on us even though we didn't ask for one. We were then told to donate 2,000 rupees for each family member for whom the priests had prayed for good luck, for a total of 10,000 rupees. The whole exercise did not seem very priestly but focused on getting donations in a high pressure manner. The prayer was short and the conversation quickly centered on extracting donations. We didn't comply with their request and utimately escaped with donations of 100 rupees each, which I think is more than sufficient for hassels that we did not seek. The experience turned an otherwise meditative visit to a scenic lake into a unpleasant battle.

title: Adds flavor to your trip
review: Religion and gypsy style go hand in hand.A must visit if you are in Ajmer.....The ghats are brilliant.

title: Terrible time at Pushkar lake
review: Please try to remember all the info you read about the scams. Walk to the lake by yourself - you do not need a guide or someone to say prayers for you - do puja for you - unless of course that is your thing. We were escorted to the lake, prayers and blessings given for our families and then asked for donations supposedly for their charity and then they argued with the amount we offered! I refused to budge - telling them this was bad karma, ie throwing their rhetoric back in their faces. I received a receipt but I still don't know how legit this all is. All in all - not a nice experience. I wanted to see the lake, watch the people without disrupting or being disrespectful as it is such a holy site.

title: Smelly, poorly maintained lake
review: Liked - the history and the tradition of the place, sanctity

title: scam!
review: We had a random blessing which siting by the lake and experiencing the rich culural and religious history was actually quite a fun experience...they then wanted 30,000 ruppees for it!! they got angry when we only offered 2000. The way it was done by sperating our group and pushing and being decietfull about what they were going to ask for was shameful- single worst experience we ha in India! Do the Brahma temple but skip the lake.

title: Peace and serenity
review: Cleanliness required,silence and birds chirping and sunset.can sit and just relax,good place for meditation,lot f foreigners around.Water should be kept clean,throwing of garlands and flowers should be banned

title: Plagues of Honda Heroes and stroppy youths
review: Pushkar is not the place I experienced a decade or so ago. Unfortunately it now seems to be over-run with youths with too much time and money who have lost their 'way'. They speed wrecklessly through the narrow lanes, horns blaring and scattering people. This apparent lack of respect for others seems very sad and is a disincentive for this traveller's return. I also understand that the antisocial behaviours are manifesting in acts of violence - I hope the town's elders are able to front up to this problem and will sort it.

title: No photos here please!
review: The bathing Ghats are to be seen but beware the 'touts' who want you to do a 'puja' (prayer) and then wear a thin red material band on your wrist. It appears to be that they're doing you a favour but it comes at a price!

title: Incredible India
review: The satiating hunger of your travel buds can take a respite if you choose a destination in Rajasthan , India. It gets all the way better if the place is Pushkar during the Animal Fair, probably world's largest animal fair around the world. The noise, the colors and the magic with people smiling and tourists clicking their way off works wonders. Don't forget to get a treat of Camel Safari  and if adventurous type spend a buck or two and take a horse ride all by yourself. The night temperatures can get a bit nasty during this time so it is advisable to be dressed accordingly. Also serve your sweet tooth in the market of pushkar with MAL PUA specialty there, along with the traditional dance and offcourse if you are a spiritual kind then BRAHMA temple the one and only one is present.

title: Beware of Priests pressuring you for donation
review: We had the same experience of priests pressuring you into a into a lavish donation after performing a pooja with you.  We were taken to the donation office where I offered a couple of hundred rupees, and were told no, we owe them 6000 rupees.   When I yelled out to my tour guide, the priest said that the tour guide could not be involved in this.  This really upset my wife,and myself as well.   The tour guide stated that we should be able to donate whatever amount we wanted - 100 to 200 rupees was more than reasonable.  Go to the other side of the lake from where the poojas are performed to soak in the beauty.

title: Simply amazing
review: Beautiful ancient (and not so long ago cleaned up) lake surrounded by 52 Ghats with white washed buidlings on top. Could sit there for hours, feel the vibes and watch people doing their ritual washings. Generally very peaceful, but beware of touts.

title: Pushkar lake
review: It is of religious importance.person took me to the lake for Rs 20/- then I was asked to have a plate of flowers , coconut etc for Rs 11/- then one pandit conducted Puja without my asking and I paid Rs 51/- which he accepted without complaints. Then I was asked to donate at the booth . When I offered Rs 101/- they said if I pay more then 201/- I will get receipt. I took back my Rs 101/- which then I donated in Lord Brahma temple but they returned the money without complaint.

title: dont know what to think of it
review: during the day it is pretty lifeless, only on the western ghats there is a buzz of activity. people are washing and bathing at the brahma ghat, but little else. it gets interesting in the morning and evening

title: A very spiritual place!
review: We went walking around the lake and the whole place gave off an amazing vibe. The place was very spiritual and seeing the locals bathing in the Ghats just added to such a special place.

title: Beautiful place, with negative aspects but best massage of my life
review: I have contradictorily memories of Pushkar. My first experience was also with a "priest" who caught me right at my first steps into town. Then I felt quite bothered by the offensive salespeople at the bazar. But then in the evening as I sat at the lake and listened to the drums, played on the other side, I felt the magic of this place. I also was quite impressed by all the camels at the fair.

title: Quiet Pushkar
review: We didn't find the lake itself to be really special, but it does give Pushkar a little bit of a romantic and relaxing atmosphere, especially at night with lights and fireworks. The ghats are nothing compared to the other holy cities, and the water is polluted. We visited Pushkar during the camel fair, when it was crowded and the touts possibly even more annoying than normal. Still it had cool relaxed vibe and it was nice to spend a few days there. The Camel Fair is amazing, a mustsee if you're anywhere near.

title: Be aware it is a scam
review: When we arrived in Pushkar we were offered flowers to make an offering at Pushkar lake. When you go there they will ask for a 10 RS donation and they will give you a plate with a coconut husk and flowers. then Brahmin  priest will escort you down to the lake. if you are a couple or you are with friends they will separate you. They tell you Karma cannot be mixed so you have to sit alone.

title: spiritual
review: Great to people watch as the sun goes down, music, cows, dancing,very entertaining, a time to reflect, and be in touch with India. ,

title: 52 Sacred Ghats
review: Pushkas Lake is a holy, sacred place to Hindus and devout Hindus will make at least one pilgrimage to the lake in their lifetime. And even a visitor gets a sense that the place is special. The only caution is that you may be "invited" to join in a "holy blessing" by a Brahman "priest" in which he will hand you some roses (to be tossed into the lake at one point in the "ceremony"), mumble some words in Hindi and then TELL you that you have to give money, which he will bless. Of course, he will. He will even suggest, after telling you to follow your heart, to give at least Rs 500. So, this is basically another scam. You can enjoy Pushkar and the lake without falling for this stuff. Just stay aware, becuase they have a way of roping you into such stuff before you even know what is going on.

title: Beautiful Views but ONLY if you're passing by
review: We stopped here on the way to Ajmer, beautiful scenery of the lake and the city. Worth a visit for the scenery ONLY if you're passing by, you can ask your driver to stop by but don't go out of your way. The Lake has a history with a story related to the Mughal Emperor who built this place.

title: Just special
review: The view, especially in the evening twilight is just gorgeous. Taking pictures of bathing pilgrims is strictly prohibited, please respect these rules

title: Very disappointing
review: Looked to us like a giant square swimming pool! Hassled by the guys that want to give you the blessing treatment, and then demanding a lot of money from you. If you refuse their blessings in the first place they get very aggressive to the point of screaming at you to leave!

title: Worth a quick look
review: Don't take the flowers, take your shoes off, have a quick look, find the crocodile (ask for the MUGGER MATCH) and someone will take you to see it. Apparently one of the Mugal emperors put it in there to munch up the Hindus. Then take yourself on a WAY nicer walk out of the town up the mountain and stop in for a nice cup of herbal tea with a magic pinch of Ayurvedic stuff in (doesn't make you high, it's just tea). The tea chap is lovely, can't remember his name, but his stall is half way to the mountain on the left. Can't miss it.

title: good to see.
review: Unfortunately being a well known holy place also makes it a massive tourist trap! There are scammers all around the lake. there is also alot of cow pats and you cannot wear shoes so take socks! It is quite grubby, but it is symbolic and many come here and i respect that.

title: average lake und annoying people
review: You really have to whatch out all the time, that you dont get ripped of by all those religious guys, who want to bless you and wish you good luck for redicolous amounts of money. its quite hard to enjoy the lakeview without those peolple

title: tour to Rajasthan, Pushkar lake, camel safari, local market & old aunti at temple gate
review: Tour to Rajasthan, Pushkar lake, camel safari, local market & old aunti at temple gate - As our blood circulate in our whole body, My travel thoughts run in my mind. We was 2 for Rajasthan package tour, as we reached Pushkar. First we went to local temple, we was at pushkar lake more than 2 hours, we hired a camel for camel safari. It was memorable trip to Rajasthan. I don't know why but I have seen in my life that a good driver will narrate you so many value worth stories about tourist places & must see place. We always take care of driver part, as you know that we hired a car from Delhi by book car in delhi dot com and we told to Ms. Chanchal that we need a experienced driver for Rajasthan package tour. She ensured us for a good trip and she fulfilled. Thanks to Ms. Chanchal for making our trip memorable.

title: sacred lake
review: big beautiful lake with white buildlings all around, sacred to Brahma,its the centre of the town prayers are offered  and blessings bestowed constantly,At sunset you can sit in the ghats[big stone steps]and wonder at the light

title: Spiritual and calm
review: Visited early (9.30) in the morning and the area around the lake was peaceful and quiet. We were hardly bothered by priests, and the people praying near the ghat, made our visit a spiritual experience. Enjoyed it very much.

title: My biggest disappointment in India.
review: I had really been looking forward to visiting Pushkar but was so let down. Besides being in great hotel the visit to the lake was the worst experience to date. Even after explaining to the so called 'holy man' that I just wanted to sit quietly he kept on harassing me. Eventually he started getting rude and telling me that I had no respect and he was going to give me bad karma. When I told him that he should also respect people he got angry and told me that I had to leave.

title: good to see it.
review: Many guides available here at Rs 100.

title: no photos please
review: the lake was not at all clean and it was a horrendous experience as the local men were literally shouing their hearts out to follow some sort of rules which were not even properly written there like no photos, remove shoes ..etc. You can get peace if you are lucky

title: A must visit for the pious
review: The Lake is beautiful if you can ignore the mess around and in it. A dip in the lake refresh you (brrrr - water was cold even at around 12 in the noon). The worst part is the pandits (priests) pestering you. Other than this issue the lake is a calm and serene place to enjoy followed by a visit to the adjacent Bramha Temple. A must go in the list of every traveler at least once and also considering the fact that this is supposed to be the place where the only temple dedicated to Brahma is located. Nearby locations are good for shopping.

title: Spiritual?
review: The truth is we went to Pushkar thinking it would be a very spiritual place. Effectively to the Hindu holy places are filled, but when they see you're not Indian traders and priests, merchants, crowd the place. If you're not careful, you seek to get money from you (so be careful whenthey put flowers in your hand). Pray for your family and the more people names, plus they charge. Anyway, I think you have to live the experience, but be careful, because abuse of foreigners.

title: This is a place where you can see how Hindu's practice their religion
review: Interesting place to see, lovely to be there at sunset. It is worthwhile giving a (small) donation yourself and experience a ceremony with a priest

title: Messy
review: A mofussil town around a lake.. broken roads, stinking overflowing drains, greedy priests and petty shopkeepers.. cow dung and litter everywhere.... I can go on and on, but that would be pointless. The area where the annual fair is held was even worse.. with an unimpressive gate, a broken pathway and rubbish strewn all over the premises. Is this the Pushkar that foreigners drool about? Heck.. it assailed my senses so badly that I beat a hasty retreat within hours of my arrival in this famous place. No.. I did not have the gumption to climb up a steep hill to the Savitri Temple, nor did I have the courage to take a bath in the muddy waters of the lake, which was all but flooded, due to the heavy rains in September 2012.

title: Nice to look but dirty still... but it's holy water//
review: Could be cleaner, especially people would like to bath in the holy water - be careful of your accepting flower from strangers - you must pay for them!

title: energetic lake
review: try to sleep in a lake view location enabeling to see the sunset.

title: Holy Lake
review: Pushkar Lake is in the town of Pushkar, Ajmer, Rajasthan, India. It is a sacred lake of the Hindus. It is Known as ' Adi Tirtha', or the "original sacred water-body", or "Tirtha-Raj".  A dip in the sacred lake is believed to cleanse sins and cure skin diseases. There are  many bathing ghats (a series of steps leading to the lake), where pilgrims  in large numbers  take a sacred bath, especially around Kartik Poornima (October–November) when the Pushkar Fair is held.

title: Worth seeing but beware!!
review: Take the clockwise 'spiritual walk' around the ghats and choose carefully which ghat you decide to get closer to the river at.  Do not accept flowers from random strangers - you are not obliged to make an offering at the water if you dont want to and you certainly arent obliged to pay any guides or priests.  Respect the actual rules that are in place - no shoes near water and no photography and you'll be fine.  Its a nice place once you get past all the aggressive touts.

title: pushkar Lake & Temple tour
review: very good Lake in the pushkar ,only one tample of Brahma in the pushkar ,this tample near ajmer district of rajasthan india ,pushkar fair in november is main attraction of pushkar ,when villagers comes for cattle fair & many tourist like to come in this lake for glimpse of this village in lake when the panes of glass flashed as thay caught the sun ,also sun set point in other site near pushkar palace,i recommend to my friends

title: Full of something exciting
review: Just go to the place & don't listen to anyone who intends to help you. To get the value for your buck, walk with very little money. simply walk upto the lake, offer prayers on your own(unless you have grand plans that could easily ensure you are down by couple of grands without you getting to know). there are loads of people willing to help you to help you ensure that you & all ancestors attain peace! (one can try if you are keen, I wasn't)

title: Such a spiritual place for me, can be quiet or busy depending on time of day
review: No matter what time of day you visit this place there is plenty to see, women washing, flocks of pigeons, a loan cow, people praying. The that's are set around the lake and you can walk down and along them, remember to remove shoes as it is a sacred lake. Read up about lord Brahma and Gayatriand Savitri to get some background before going. I have had a Pushkar puja which I paid 1000 rupees for, many would say I was ripped off but at the end of the day it's helping someone and I was happy to have blessing and do prayer. It's  a really pretty site if you like India, the desert, prayer, being off the beaten track. If you like absolute comfort, being near big cities this place may disappoint but for me it is lovely, maybe avoid during camel fair unless you particularly want to see that.

title: One to just look at...
review: Get to one of the cafes on the shore and watch the sun go down. Just stare at the lack, the motion of the water and animals, the people coming out for the same thing, or just for the walk. Let your drink fill you, let the warmth wash over you and just sit back and be content

title: Must visit Lake -  the Brahm snan
review: You should visit in hindi month of Kartik (in shukl pakshya) just after Diwali and befor Ganga snan.

title: the place where my soul is alive
review: for me, this lake is one of the most beautiful places i saw. its not only the like itsself, its the atmosphere in early morning and sunset times. i have a special, favorite place, a little ghat, where i can stay hours and hours, just being full satisfied with what i see and hear. The main ghats i just visited for "Hindu New Year", but they are full with priets, who almost force you to make puja and pay - so this part of the lake you can leave out. just go on the opposite part of the lake and enjoy it all....

title: Scenic and Fascinating
review: Beautiful lake, scenic and gives n aura of peacefulness despite being near the main road. Watch out for the people trying to sell you flowers for  a 'holy passport' but enjoy admiring hinduism at it's best, with pilgrims bathing and temples chanting all around.

title: Stunning
review: An absolutely beautiful lake. Look out for the fake priests around town, though, who give you a flower and guide you to the lake, telling you there's a "festival" on, then try to extort money out of you. If you want to donate, find official, non-pushy channels to donate through.

title: Lake is average
review: The lake dis not have much water and we were hassled by priests who wanted to perform Puja. There were people bathing in the water, which was pretty dirty. It is highly missable.

title: Does not live up to the hype
review: This is a decent lake with lots of bathing Ghats; didn’t look anything special to us, however, this historic sacred lake is found to be mentioned in scripts and coins as far back as the 4th century BC. There are plenty of priests who bugs you to describe the history and legend of the lake and offer various kinds of pujas, of course with the intention of extracting money from you.

title: Dirty and a lot of priests that want you to spend money on buying flowers and the ribbon around your hand!
review: Dirty and a lot of priests that want you to spend money on buying flowers and the ribbon around your hand! They told us that if you already have a ribbon they dont disturb you, because they think you have already paid some of their colleagues. But there are hotel owners (like Sun and Moon) that can put you a ribbon for a donation (i gave 20Rs only) and thus the priests will not disturb you. Supposingly the donation goes to poor children...because you write your name on a notebook that says HELP CHILDREN ....hahahahh! No matter what, you can avoid the aggressivity of the priests.

title: Pushkar lake
review: Beautifully atmospheric lake and ghats, especially at sunrise and sunset. Can be very busy and noisy during the Mela when hundreds of people visit the ghats for puja. The music and drumming goes on most of the night during the festival.

title: Ghats in desert setting
review: Lovely place - cleaner Ghats than Varanasi!!! Small square shape is pleasant though limited as to where you can take photos. Quiet in April, pleasant but NOT as photogenic again - as Varanasi. Nice to see and speak with locals. SEVERAL 'con-men' trying to get western women to 'float a flower on the ghats'.. for a money sting

title: Worth a visit - but don't get ripped off
review: The Brahmin temple is worth a visit and the lake is too. The Karma ceremony performed by the Sadir is an excuse to have you part with your money - I would skip this as I didn't feel particularly good about being asked for frst $50, then $20 in order that the Karma would work

title: I feel purified
review: I went down the ghats (take out your shoes!!!) and I realized the truly calm and tranquillity of the place...difficult to find in the rest of Rajasthan. You can walk around to the other side and feel the holiness of this unique place. Visit Brahma Temple. Also You can make pooja leaving a flower floats on the lake and express your desire...it works!

title: MOST OSPICIOUS LAKE FOR HINDUS
review: The Lotus fell from the hand of God Brahma and the water came out from the land which was name as Pushkar.

title: Beware of scams
review: I suggest having a guide along. There are several "priests" along they way that are happy to pray with you and then set the price.

title: holly place
review: quiet and nice place, the only thing we did not like the people around the lake, called  brahman. They asked for the donation - that is ok but they insist to tell the exact amount of money and type of currency . I could not agree with that.

title: Only for Pilgrims
review: No attraction for tourists as its over crowded. We enjoyed only because of good stay experience.

title: Spiritual and calming. A delight to sit in the roof top restaurants and let the peace of Pushkar wash over you.
review: The atmosphere in Pushkar is so delightful the people friendly and the views are stunning. The Bazaar's are like an Aladdin's Cave. The Restaurant's particularly Sixth Sense at Inn Seventh Heaven are a joy. The food is amazing and the staff so kind and helpful.

title: beware of guides
review: the guides available charge you very little but will lead you to the priests who would perform puja for you and demand a high amount...so please ask with the priests/ guide about details beforehand.................................................

title: serene
review: the lake is beautifull when there are less people around.. mainly afternoons... when you van just sit and enjoy

title: Calm, Peaceful and Tranquil
review: I recently visited Pushkar and was so happy to be there. The lake looks so divine at the sunset that you would want to live there forever or at least want that moment to freeze for some more time. Take a walk along the main market street. Good food and average stay is cheap in Pushkar. At first I wondered why the town was crowded by foreigners, but by the end of my stay I knew the reason. ;)

title: don't get sucked in by the money for blessings
review: the water in the lake is also used for toileting.....maybe best to allow the kind locals to wash outer garments and reserve underwear for your own efforts whilst showering

title: Amazing crowds beyond imagination
review: Me and my friend went to the Pushcar Camelfair and had a really amazing time, but the crowds are fascinatingly large. Off course we went to the lake and the Brahma temple. We had a guide with us which was good. It keeps the other guides and hustlers away. But beware, the guys are not too friendly with their hands in the big crowds...

title: Good scenery
review: clear water and good scenery. It's a the center of the town, lots foreigner visiting this city.

title: Beware of pandits at the lakeside.
review: It an ancient natural lake, but now with temples surrounding it, it has a look of an artificial lake. And you are not allowed to walk on its shores with shoes. So without your footware, you can barely spend more than a few mins at a spot.

title: Mantra at the Pushkar lake
review: Liked the spiritual atmosphere around the lake.

title: peaceful, sunset point
review: Its beautiful to see the sunset at the pushkar lake, there's lot of peace.. you can sit by the lake & cherish the moment... get some beautiful pictures clicked. Saw lot of foreign tourists enjoying their sips at the Hotel Sunset iNn.. .just opposite the lake..

title: Amazing experience
review: Probably one of the most exciting experience I had in India was visiting this lake-you could feel the spirituality. It was also really busy yet atmospheric

title: ok types
review: people of Pushkar are not traveler friendly! the priests (self proclaimed preachers of religion) are very irritating. They would not let you enjoy the view! Rajashthan has better lakes to visit, which are quiet and calm.

title: Yogi heaven
review: More of a pond than a lake it has some vaguely interesting ghats (not uncommon) but more interesting for people watching than anything else. Great mix of ageing hippies and young 'travellers' drinking naughty lassies and spinning sticks. lots of beggars as well (it's a religious town)

title: Amazing place
review: It is a great place where to spend the day and observe people coming to pray and bathe there.

title: Holy place
review: Beware of the purohit/pandas. They will squeeze money from you.

title: Unpriestly Priests
review: Beware of offers of flowers when you are entering the lake area-this is purely to single you out as a new arrival.

title: wonderful walk
review: take the 'spiritual walk' around the ghats, you'll take in all the sights, temples and wildlife. Beware of the pushy priests, you don't have to make a Pushkar Puja so be firm! There are signs everywhere asking tourists not to take photos. This does not mean you cannot take any photos, just strictly no photos of the bathers.

title: Let Your Spirit Soar
review: Walk around Pushkar Lake, recalling that all 800 million living Indian Hindus are commanded to come at least once during their lives. Reflect on what a blessing this is. Walk into a temple (removing your shoes) or wander the ghats. Receive a blessing from a Brahmin priest. Gape at the beauty, at the birds; feel the spirit. Breathe

title: Mindfulness, Bliss and Beyond
review: This place has too much appeal and spiritual importance. You can feel all that by taking a single walk along the Ghats.  Total peace and calmness on the banks of the such a holy lake.

title: A very serene space
review: We found Pushkar to be a very spiritual town and loved the ambience of peace and tranquility.

title: Second most holy Hindu pilgramage site in India
review: There is non stop activity in the bazaar and the ghats....a kaaidascope of sounds and colors  very interesting

title: watch out for dodgy priests!!!
review: the lake is beautiful to look at, enjoy if you can make it there without being set upon by "priests" who lure you into making blessings and offerings to shiva and brahma. the bring you through a whole "spiritual" jargon exercise, then litterally try and extort money from you, well over €100!! im speaking from experience here and luckily managed to get away without being ripped off, if you wanna make a donation in pushkar there are lots of reputable places to do so , not into the pockets of these dodgy priests.  just say NO!!!! ruined the whole experience and surroundings for me!!

title: Beware the Brahmins
review: The town of Pushkar is small with great street shopping.  Once you are at the Lake, beware of the Brahmin or "holy men."  We were steered to them and separated from the local people and from each other once they realized we were foreigners.  They put very high pressure on us to make a substantial donation to their charity after praying with us at water's edge.  They even told my friends to go to an ATM and get money out.  They insisted Americans have money and all visitors donate.  It was very uncomfortable.  Just beware and plan what you are going to give.  Guide books suggest 100 rupees.  They wanted 10,000 rupees which is ridiculous.  Better yet, do not accept their blessings or go with them down to the lake.

title: Beware of pushy priests!
review: Other reviews have said it all and I wish we'd known before we visitied! These priests will force you to sit down and do like a little prayer thing and then tell you that if you have family, to ensure their happiness you must pay 500IR, 1000iR, 2000IR and will actually argue with you if you don't donate the amount they specify! Appalling. But it is a colourful place when the whether is good and makes for some wonderful photos.

title: Small but mighty
review: Hard to believe this poor stagnant puddle has such mystical appeal, but some people will bathe or swim in anything that they believe will help or cure their shortcomings.  The ghats are a testimonial to man's belief in striving towards a better self.

title: A Lake with a Purpose
review: Not just your ordinary lake, this body of water is alive with pilgrims all year round. After recent cleaning by the government, it might even be safe to bathe in, although the separate bathing ghats are a better option. Shoes stay off for the most part, but you might want to slip them on for the dirtier areas. Make sure to see the Gandhi Ghat on the northwest corner where some of Mahatma's ashes were spread.

title: peaceful
review: unlike the ghats in vanarasi where touts pester you non stop all the time, here you can simply sit by the lake and relax. read a book, meditation,  play some music, snap pictures of sunset, these are some of the things i observed people doing. i just sat here and reading a book for hours.

title: Holy Lake
review: Although it was not so clean but considering the spiritual importance of this holy lake we did lots of Mantra reciting on its banks and many got good spiritual divine experiences also there.

title: Stay Away from Pushkar!
review: We spent one month touring central India and Rajasrhan and this was the only place that we felt we were huckstered.  First, as described in the below posts, you get ceaselessly hassled by "Brahmin priests"to  do a Hindu  prayer ceremony at a ghat (steps) on the lake  and  hustled to make a donation of 10,000 rupees ( about $200!), and they will argue with you to donate more.  Truly a terrible experience.   The main market street in town sells junk, probably made in China.  The lake is beautiful, the town is actually clean (it used to be quite dirty we hear).  Our hotel was the only one we stayed in where the staff was frozen and unfriendly and the place uncleanly (dusty under the beds, bathroom mirror not cleaned, pigeon feathers and excrement all over the grounds).  The town was quite noisy at night as well.  We were glad we did not go to Pushkar first because it would have made us suspicious of India.  Instead, we found it to be beautiful, wonderful, and the people to be warm and welcoming,

title: Pushkar is wonderful, if you are careful!
review: I read all the advice before traveling, and was a bit nervous about visiting, however it is a fantastic place and not to be missed! Trip advisor recommended going to "jaipur Ghat" and that is so sensible.There is a brilliant clean cafe there;appropriately named"sunset hotel" where you can sit and relax.We entered the lake just opposite and carried our shoes on a lap around the entire lake; (at water level)completely un-interrupted by anyone. I think once you are in you are in, so to speak.It is only entering via the other ghats there are problems.At some you have to deposit your shoes and make donations.Exiting via other ghats seems OK, just drop a coin in the box. We went on a very quiet Monday, I guess it is probably different during festivals.

title: Not so pretty
review: The lake itself is not too awesome, a little dirty but hey, its India. The surrounding views are amazing, so thats the best part. Plus if you stay in a hotel with a view of the lake, there is a mist that hovers over it at sunrise....very mystical and cool!

title: too many people
review: its the best one enjoys it form a distance and not go too close to it also there are people all around who are trying to make u free of your sins and basically just give you some sort of holy thread or flower and if you take it then you will have to pay them money.

title: quiet place
review: Pushkar Lake is a quiet place of meditation.

title: amazing spectacle
review: This is something that has to be seen to be believed. It is quite awe inspiring to be at a place that has such significance fo so many people and to see the ghats. The only shame is the commercialism that has gathered around it.

title: Poor upkeep
review: There were hardly any Indians visiting Pushkar lake and many other nationals could be seen around Pushkar. Very surprising to find so many non-Indians in a place which has religious connotation, and slightly remote to visit. The upkeep of the Pushkar Sarovar and surroundings is very poor. Could do with better maintenance and cleanliness of the area. Pushkar market was very attractive and clean. Must see along with the only Brahma Temple in the world.

title: Place is good. Pujaris/Pandits try to cheat. Roads are bad. Be careful.
review: The lake has a lot of history and a nice place to visit if you are in Rajasthan. The drive is amazing through the hills if you are coming from the South.

title: The Pushkar Paradise
review: Oh i just loved Pushkar, its a small town with a peacefull life , everything is slow and calm, no traffic, relaxed faces , and a slow life,It was quite sunny in pushkar and we could see a lot of firangiis enjoying their stay. Pushkar lake is nice place to vsiit , u may get sweet talked by the pandits to perform the pitra puja , of your elders who are still alive ,,,lol.

title: Wonderful peaceful place - there is some great athmosphere when you are around
review: loved everything except we have to remove the shoes !

title: Crowded...
review: The entrances to the Lake are crowded and nowhere to find when and why  various religious ceremonies are taking place!

title: We felt ripped off
review: We were immediately set upon, our family split up into groups, and each of us urged to give USD$50.  What was supposed to be a spiritual event felt unpleasant and pushy.  When we refused to give a lot of money, they got nasty.  We fled the lake and never went back to the water's edge again.  All this way and we went down once.  Such a shame.

title: The lake is nice but watch out for the 'priest' touts
review: Sit and view the lake but don't let the 'priests' on the Brahma Ghat give you the hard sell to make an large donation.  Choose one of the other ghats if you want peace and quiet.

title: nice place
review: Many ghats and many people but nice place to sit there and stop for a while!

title: Awesome experience
review: An awesome experience - like a mini Varanasi, only much much less intense, which allows for some spiritual introspection. DON'T take pictures of people bathing, especially those who aren't fully clothed - it's just a matter of respect. DO go there at sunset, or on a full moon, or even better, during a lunar eclipse!!

title: Flies.
review: We visited this town and lake with a guide who was very good.However we found the town dirty and smelly. The Brahma temple was full of flies. The lake was also dirty and I was disappointed with the town.

title: Aarti at the ghats of Pushkar lake
review: This is a magical experience, if you are in Pushkar during the annual fair, spend an afternoon watching the religious aarti ceremony by the lake, the chanting, the oil lamps and the colorful crowds make this a magical experience. Photography is allowed, shoes are not.

title: all the worshipping and religious activities go on around it
review: It is interesting enough just to sit and watch the people worshipping.

title: Tranquil and Serene
review: Pushkar Lake exhubes  tranquility and peacefulness.

title: Brahma only place for worship
review: Brahma only place for worship so fulfill all your wishes.

title: Beware of Thug Pundits !
review: The lake is must visit but beware of thug pundits as they gonna rob you for donations and pujas.if you wish to make donation. just pay over the counter and get a proper slip of it. To pandits say no, if you want puja confirm the price before (200 rs. to 500 rs. enough).

title: Beware of the guides
review: When you visit the lake , Just remember NEVER to accept the services of the guides.They will agree to be your guide for just 20rs but they will make you pay more by obligating you to pay to the priest who helps you do the puja in the lake.No backpacks or bags allowed inside the temple.

title: Worth the walk.
review: Looking at the temples and speaking with the locals was great.  Even mixing with those who didn't share a language was fun.  Lots of touts during the fair, but no reason to avoid it only for them.

title: priest do prayers for u on lake
review: make sure u get receipt for yr donation. Brahma temple nice.

title: A real taste of India
review: A must see. Be prepared for Brahmins asking for money for blessings - but it's all part of the experience and the guy was so charming it was a pleasure. Watch out for henna tattooists - if you don't want your hand covered in dye and being expected to pay for the privelege pull it away fast

title: Pushy "Priest"
review: Our guide took us to the Brahma temple and then down to the lake.  It was in the evening so it was dark and there was a power outage so it was even darker.  A flashlight would have been good.  The lake area was still beautiful to see even at night.  The guide was telling us about the lake when a "priest" (I will use the term "priest" but I have no idea who he was) came over and asked if I wanted some kind of prayer.  I had no idea what he was even taking about so I said no.  Then he tried to guilt me into doing whatever it was saying how could I not pray for my family and friends.  Again I said no and he still kept going.  There were two other people in our group but he just kept asking me and didn't even ask the other two.  It was a little annoying since I clearly wasn't interested.  After this I remembered reading something about this in the guide book and was glad I declined since if I had accepted I would have then been pressured for money.

title: An amazing mela!
review: Luckily, I happened to visit Pushkar during the grand kartik mela which begins 5 days before the full moon day of the hindu Kartika month that usually coincide with November. I have never seen a mela of this magnitude; it is perhaps the grandest of all animal fairs held in India with app 1000 quality studs and 3000 camels in addition to the high breed buffaloes, cows, goats and donkeys/mules. The sale of handicraft is also a very good attraction in this mela.

title: disappointed
review: now there is this lake which is nothing great . supposed to be a mythologically important place but somehow i did not get the religious vibes which i had expected . the aura is not there . came back disappointed .

title: average
review: No impressive, especially not more impressive then we have seen in several places in India. Please make sure not to book by A1 Tours & travel as this is rip and aggressive travel agency.

title: Fun to see a different world-beware of Temple touts.
review: It's a small lake. Beware of the hustling men at one temple that sit with you, say they don't want' money, and just want to give you a blessing. They have you recite blessings after them, they ask about each of your relatives and bless them, then at the end of the practiced spiel ask for $40-200 US, It's a hard sell you can avoid at the start. I did give 500 rupees to get him away, and that was too much. I don't know what if any is his commission, but he mad sure that when I paid, he was there to be seen!

title: Don't miss it at sunset
review: Being at the lake at sunset was definitely a cultural experience. We were able to see the bathing ritual and the candle ritual. It was a high point of our visit.

title: colourful trip
review: Do's

title: Pushkar - Serene and calm
review: I have not been there during the cattle fair (as you could have made out looking at the title itself). I was only on a day trip and found the place calm in stark contrast to Ajmer city which is bustling with activity. Pushkar is about 45 mins bus ride away from Ajmer city. And I must say the ride is not too bad. Road is a bit winding but still enjoyable. Once you reach Pushkar, you start seeing the Rajasthan sand around a bit. Brahma temple and Pushkar lake are obvioulsly two big attractions. It is not too big a place and bazaar is again a mix of handloom  and scents or various kinds. We took a walk around the place and settled for an hour on one of the ghats at the lake.

title: Pushkar Lake
review: Its really nice to walk to the other side of the lake, away from the markets.

title: Very unpleasant experience
review: I did not have the feeling that it is a holy place. People were very rude to us. There are also maaaany cheaters who want you to make a donation for your family, but I am pretty sure that they don't know what DONATION means....

title: a pond of spiritualism
review: Pushkar is famous not only amng indians but foreigners as well. Monsoons have made the hilly surroundings more green and nascent. The pond is having water and all around the lake, you find pigeons having a feast on grains, thrown by devotees. If u r a good photographer, u cn click some fascinating snaps. Avoid priests who may mislead you. The local boys too can prove dangerous if given too much leverage. Enjoy all temples as they have a lot of information on indian system of worship.

title: A must to see when in Pushkar
review: sunset hour is the best....and it is safe area for tourists to be.

title: Very Spiritual
review: It is really an awesome feeling visiting the place, and enjoying the atmosphere. The only disappointment we had was the lake was dry because they were going to clean the lake. But the calmness and silence the city has is wonderful.

title: the holy city delivers
review: There is a certain aura about Pushkar that you can't deny. Something you have to experience. Tip: come after 5.30pm and see the pujas at the ghats.

title: Great View
review: Such a quiet place to sit and talk, though it is not like that during Pushkar Fair.

title: Religious Festival
review: We walked along the parade route and enjoyed the colorfully decorated vehicles, the band and the people throwing flowers. The old town is interesting as was the religious bathing that took place at the lake.

title: Little Varanasi
review: If you have been to Varanasi watching the ghat, this is another smaller version of it. It was a nice walk around the lake and do a little shopping around there. Pushkar is a city in the state of Rajasthan in India. There are many good restaurants serving good western food and beverages. The prices are also reasonable especially when you wish to buy indian clothings like blouse and pants. Overall, the lake offers scenic view and a nice quiet environment for some good readings too. This place is a better place to stay than the nearby Ajmer which is more expensive. The room per night costs as cheap as 100 rupees.

title: Very interesting holy lake, lots of photographic temples and shrines
review: Pushkar has a very photogenic lake surrounded by the small city's daily activity.  There are numerous hindu shrines and small temples that line the lake as well, offering access the the water and public bathing area, where we saw numerous Indians on pilgrimage, washing and bathing in the lake.

title: SHOCKING EXPERIENCE
review: Pushkar lake is famous lake in Rajasthan, India and is famous the world over. Pushkar mela is held there. The lake is pond of filth and it is stinking so much and u can not even stand there for 5 minutes

title: It has an odd surreal atmosphere.
review: You are somewhat off the well-beaten tourist trail and because of that you can see more traditionally what the common life style and surrounding area has to offer. It is easy to walk down to the ghats which surround the lake. I put my feet in - it's a little cleaner than you might think. Little restaurants offer more traditional local fare. Main market street is selling the standard wares. Brahma temple closes at times for service - so if you are there for only a few hours check the schedule. Interesting experience.

title: Watch out for the blessing !
review: There are many men around the lake that will try to extort money for blessings .....Best advice if they are too friendly and warm to invite you to be blessed .....BEWARE !

title: Disappointing...
review: Pushkar Lake is a significant religious place for Hindus and lots of people visit the lake for this reason.  The lake itself is not very picturesque, it is placed in the centre of town and unfortunately you cannot walk around it.  We visited in April when the water levels were quite low and there was development work being carried out. We had been warned about the pushy priests, so were prepared, but still managed to get sucked in. Whatever donation you offer it won't be good enough and they are not grateful.  I wouldn't recommend visiting this place for tourism.  Our stay at Seventh Heaven did make up it though!

title: Pushkar Tour in a Hot Air Balloon Flight
review: Pushkar, nestled in the rustic terrain of Rajasthan comes alive every year in the month of October-November when the biggest cattle fair of the world hits the town. Tourists from various corners of the world come to Pushkar only to enjoy this Rajasthani vibrancy. Along with various exuberant activities, hot air ballooning is one feature that makes Pushkar Fair even more attractive.

title: Beware of Panda's
review: Good place to visit but please beware of the Panda's who insist to do puja & try to befool you.

title: a visit to the Gurudwara (Sikh temple) restored my faith in humanity
review: Pushkar: I visited my first Sikh Gurudwara, 10.16.09.  And it restored my faith in humanity.  Unlike the morning's visit to a Sufi mosque at Ajmer, where I was greeted by many there present (for Friday prayers) with of overt hostility, and an aborted evening visit to an old run down Hindu temple in Pushkar where a man inside screamed wildly, like he was being beaten, when he saw me, and an old woman shouted "NO FOREIGNERS!" at me, the officiant at the Sikh temple welcomed me, and after performing the needful rites for others who came in (Sikhs), he took a moment to explain the beautiful precepts of his faith.

title: Picturesque
review: Loved the place booming with usual Rajasthani feel and colours. The place holds high value in mythological stories . You should avoid the people who ask you to offer prayers because they will start from 30 rs and will ask to donate 2100 or 5100 which is a sheer waste of time and will actually piss you off .

title: Unrwal
review: The Pushkar Lake is a beautiful area, when the sunset goes down there is a lot to see and do. Really beautiful experience

title: Peaceful place!
review: Beautiful and peaceful place!

title: Good Excursion
review: Although crowded, but its one of the few placed to visit in Pushkar. The location is good and the views are decent to look at.

title: Nice vibes
review: Spent the sunsets by the lake, the vibe is to good to be missed. Go to the sunset point and enjoy the atmosphere.

title: Hindu History
review: Very happy to have visited this lake with our tour group. We visited early evening and it was nice and peaceful. Not many people at all. We had a good guide.

title: Magic
review: When you walk round the lake you have to be barefoot. From every angle the are looks different so it is good to tour round on the edge of the waters. Stop at one end for sunset, ambiance and young people practicing their street arts equally local people playing music etc ambiance.

title: It’s a polluted retention pond where foreigners are routinely harassed
review: Let’s see. Holy place? I think not. Looking for someone to try to sell you a pin, an offering, take your photo, touch you without your permission? This is just what you’re looking for. My shoes were stolen within 60 seconds that it took me to look inside a temple that didn’t have anything in it. Young boys would ask for money and would try to grab my bag if I said no to them. ‘Priests’ put their hands on me. Young foreigners strut around in short shorts and tank tops.

title: still beautiful
review: I am coming here for 30 years. The lake and the village around are still beautiful, if sitting on one of the many ghats. The water is dirty, the ghats are dirty, since we have to walk barefoot I would appreciate some cleaning.

title: Holy place
review: Before going for prayer at Brahma Temple one prefer to take bath in Pushkar lake and offer pooja . Pandit’s are available at Ghats.

title: Picturesque

You should avoid the people who ask you to offer prayers because they will start from 30 rs and will ask to donate 2100 or 5100 which is a sheer waste of time and will actually piss you off .

review: When you walk round the lake you have to be barefoot. From every angle the are looks different so it is good to tour round on the edge of the waters. Stop at one end for sunset, ambiance and young people practicing their street arts equally local people playing music etc ambiance.

title: Peaceful place!
review: Beautiful and peaceful place!

title: Nice vibes
review: Spent the sunsets by the lake, the vibe is to good to be missed. Go to the sunset point and enjoy the atmosphere.

title: Hindu History
review: Very happy to have visited this lake with our tour group. We visited early evening and it was nice and peaceful. Not many people at all. We had a good guide.

title: It’s a polluted retention pond where foreigners are routinely harassed
review: Let’s see. Holy place? I think not. Looking for someone to try to sell you a pin, an offering, take your photo, touch you without your permission? This is just what you’re looking for. My shoes were stolen within 60 seconds that it took me to look inside a temple that didn’t have anything in it. Young boys would ask for money and would try to grab my bag if I said no to them. ‘Priests’ put their hands on me. Young foreigners strut around in short shorts and tank tops.

title: Magic
review: When you walk round the lake you have to be barefoot. From every angle the are looks different so it is good to tour round on the edge of the waters. Stop at one end for sunset, ambiance and young people practicing their street arts equally local people playing music etc ambiance.

title: still beautiful
review: I am coming here for 30 years. The lake and the village around are still beautiful, if sitting on one of the many ghats. The water is dirty, the ghats are dirty, since we have to walk barefoot I would appreciate some cleaning.

title: Holy place
review: Before going for prayer at Brahma Temple one prefer to take bath in Pushkar lake and offer pooja . Pandit’s are available at Ghats.

title: Picturesque
review: Loved the place booming with usual Rajasthani feel and colours. The place holds high value in mythological stories . You should avoid the people who ask you to offer prayers because they will start from 30 rs and will ask to donate 2100 or 5100 which is a sheer waste of time and will actually piss you off .

review: The Pushkar Lake is a beautiful area, when the sunset goes down there is a lot to see and do. Really beautiful experience

title: Nice vibes
review: Spent the sunsets by the lake, the vibe is to good to be missed. Go to the sunset point and enjoy the atmosphere.

title: It’s a polluted retention pond where foreigners are routinely harassed
review: Let’s see. Holy place? I think not. Looking for someone to try to sell you a pin, an offering, take your photo, touch you without your permission? This is just what you’re looking for. My shoes were stolen within 60 seconds that it took me to look inside a temple that didn’t have anything in it. Young boys would ask for money and would try to grab my bag if I said no to them. ‘Priests’ put their hands on me. Young foreigners strut around in short shorts and tank tops.

title: Hindu History
review: Very happy to have visited this lake with our tour group. We visited early evening and it was nice and peaceful. Not many people at all. We had a good guide.

title: Magic
review: When you walk round the lake you have to be barefoot. From every angle the are looks different so it is good to tour round on the edge of the waters. Stop at one end for sunset, ambiance and young people practicing their street arts equally local people playing music etc ambiance.

title: Unrwal
review: The Pushkar Lake is a beautiful area, when the sunset goes down there is a lot to see and do. Really beautiful experience

title: Picturesque
review: Loved the place booming with usual Rajasthani feel and colours. The place holds high value in mythological stories . You should avoid the people who ask you to offer prayers because they will start from 30 rs and will ask to donate 2100 or 5100 which is a sheer waste of time and will actually piss you off .

title: still beautiful
review: I am coming here for 30 years. The lake and the village around are still beautiful, if sitting on one of the many ghats. The water is dirty, the ghats are dirty, since we have to walk barefoot I would appreciate some cleaning.

title: Holy place
review: Before going for prayer at Brahma Temple one prefer to take bath in Pushkar lake and offer pooja . Pandit’s are available at Ghats.

title: Good Excursion
review: Although crowded, but its one of the few placed to visit in Pushkar. The location is good and the views are decent to look at.

My shoes were stolen within 60 seconds that it took me to look inside a temple that didn’t have anything in it. Young boys would ask for money and would try to grab my bag if I said no to them. ‘Priests’ put their hands on me. Young foreigners strut around in short shorts and tank tops.

title: Good Excursion
review: Although crowded, but its one of the few placed to visit in Pushkar. The location is good and the views are decent to look at.

title: Hindu History
review: Very happy to have visited this lake with our tour group. We visited early evening and it was nice and peaceful. Not many people at all. We had a good guide.

title: Peaceful place!
review: Beautiful and peaceful place!

title: Magic
review: When you walk round the lake you have to be barefoot. From every angle the are looks different so it is good to tour round on the edge of the waters. Stop at one end for sunset, ambiance and young people practicing their street arts equally local people playing music etc ambiance.

title: still beautiful
review: I am coming here for 30 years. The lake and the village around are still beautiful, if sitting on one of the many ghats. The water is dirty, the ghats are dirty, since we have to walk barefoot I would appreciate some cleaning.

title: Holy place
review: Before going for prayer at Brahma Temple one prefer to take bath in Pushkar lake and offer pooja . Pandit’s are available at Ghats.

title: Picturesque
review: Loved the place booming with usual Rajasthani feel and colours. The place holds high value in mythological stories . You should avoid the people who ask you to offer prayers because they will start from 30 rs and will ask to donate 2100 or 5100 which is a sheer waste of time and will actually piss you off .

title: Unrwal
review: The Pushkar Lake is a beautiful area, when the sunset goes down there is a lot to see and do. Really beautiful experience

review: Very happy to have visited this lake with our tour group. We visited early evening and it was nice and peaceful. Not many people at all. We had a good guide.

title: It’s a polluted retention pond where foreigners are routinely harassed
review: Let’s see. Holy place? I think not. Looking for someone to try to sell you a pin, an offering, take your photo, touch you without your permission? This is just what you’re looking for. My shoes were stolen within 60 seconds that it took me to look inside a temple that didn’t have anything in it. Young boys would ask for money and would try to grab my bag if I said no to them. ‘Priests’ put their hands on me. Young foreigners strut around in short shorts and tank tops.

title: still beautiful
review: I am coming here for 30 years. The lake and the village around are still beautiful, if sitting on one of the many ghats. The water is dirty, the ghats are dirty, since we have to walk barefoot I would appreciate some cleaning.

title: Magic
review: When you walk round the lake you have to be barefoot. From every angle the are looks different so it is good to tour round on the edge of the waters. Stop at one end for sunset, ambiance and young people practicing their street arts equally local people playing music etc ambiance.

title: Holy place
review: Before going for prayer at Brahma Temple one prefer to take bath in Pushkar lake and offer pooja . Pandit’s are available at Ghats.

title: Picturesque
review: Loved the place booming with usual Rajasthani feel and colours. The place holds high value in mythological stories . You should avoid the people who ask you to offer prayers because they will start from 30 rs and will ask to donate 2100 or 5100 which is a sheer waste of time and will actually piss you off .

title: Good Excursion
review: Although crowded, but its one of the few placed to visit in Pushkar. The location is good and the views are decent to look at.

title: Unrwal
review: The Pushkar Lake is a beautiful area, when the sunset goes down there is a lot to see and do. Really beautiful experience
